Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Ken211
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in April. It is in a good location, with the metro right outside the front of the hotel. We had room 618 which is at the back of the hotel. Rooms were a good size, and very clean as was the good size bathroom. The only downside was no tea and coffee facilities in the room. We only eat breakfast at the hotel, but it was very good with a fair choice of hot and cold dishes. All the staff at the hotel that we encountered were very polite and helpful. Hotel is about a 10 minute walk from La Rambla and about 20 minutes from the port/beaches. Not many decent restaurants near the hotel, but within a 10/15 minute walk there are plenty around the main square and in La Rambla. Would definitely recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great central location - only downside is the noise”
Reviews.Author: the_travelling_mouse
Reviews.Content: We (there were three of us) stayed in a corner room on the third floor of the hotel for a long weekend in Barcelona. The room was fantastic - spacious, immaculately clean, comfortable and modern with a large bathroom with plenty of complimentary toiletries. The only couple of minor negatives were that the hotel is on a busy street and therefore the room was noisy - even at night and especially early in the morning with car horns beeping, sirens blaring etc. It was loud enough to wake me up a few times during the night and meant it was impossible to have the windows open. The other negative stems from this - the air conditioning was set at a minimum of 25 degrees which was much too warm. We contacted Reception about this and they turned it out - to 19 degrees but it was a bit annoying that you couldn't just control the temperature yourself. Other than that we couldn't fault the hotel - staff were extremely helpful and polite, the small swimming pool and rooftop deckchairs were lovely, the location was great and it was good value for money. We didn't have the breakfast as you are spoilt for choice in the city centre so preferred to choose something ourselves later in the morning. I would highly recommend getting picnic lunches/breakfasts/snacks from the market near La Ramblas - great value and delicious. The only other thing is that I think there were probably nicer areas to stay in - it was fine but a couple of the streets near the hotel were a bit rough with some dodgy looking characters hanging about. We never had any bother from anyone, but I think the area round Rambla de Catalunya is probably nicer (though no doubt more expensive!).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JueD
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the beginning of February 2012, we had two double rooms on the fifth floor (508 and 509) these are at the front of the hotel, the hotel is on a main road and it can get quite noisy but this wasn’t enough to stop us from sleeping, what did was the noise from other hotel guests coming back to their rooms and not having any respect for others that maybe sleeping. The rooms are just as they look in the hotel pictures, bathroom had bath with shower, safe is provided free of charge (you just enter your own number), there is a fridge which has both alcoholic and soft drinks (sorry forgot to look at the prices), TV has lots of channels (but only a couple were English, but I wouldn’t consider this a issue as we weren’t there to watch TV) there is no kettle (but I do believe that the hotel will happily provide you with cups and spoons), our booking also included breakfast and there was so much choice (cheese, ham, bread, Danishes, fruit, yoghurts, cereals plus bacon, sausages, eggs (although these weren’t very hot) but made great bacon rolls. The reception staff speak very good English and were very helpful and informative. I can’t wait to return to this hotel in the summer and try out the pool on the roof, which also has view of the city. The hotel is about a 5-10 minute walk to the beach and about 20 minutes walk to La Rambles, the tourist buses are also only about a 5-10 minute walk away, you have a choice of two different companies but they have roughly the same route, 1 day pass is 24 Euros, 2 days is 30 Euros. These buses are a must to even get a small chance of seeing everything around Barcelona. Unfortunately the cable cart was not working but there are buses that take you up to the castle, taxi’s are everywhere and are very good for getting from one place to another, quite quickly the way they drive. We got a taxi from the hotel back to the airport which cost about 27 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel great location. Fantastic place”
Reviews.Author: IJHStockport
Reviews.Content: Very good stay over 3 nights. Great location within walking distance of the city centre, la rambla, the harbour and beaches, however hotel located on main road. Not noisy though with windows closed. Friendly staff. Nice, clean, modern room and bathroom, with air conditioning and black-out curtains. However, no tea / coffee in the room. No mirror close to plug sockets when using hair straighteners, etc. Had a look at the breakfast, but sausage and bacon was covered in far too much oil and the bacon was very fatty throughout. Barcelona is a fantastic place, although the food and drink is expensive in most places. When out, particularly on la rambla, always ask to see the drinks price list as we paid 37 Euro for a 500ml beer and two 500ml bottles of wine!!

Reviews.Title: “Best deal in Barcelona and 5 mins to La Rambla!”
Reviews.Author: mah0519
Reviews.Content: We booked through Hotwire and were treated very nicely. We had a room on the 8th floor that looked out to the mountains. The room was extremely clean, acceptable size by European standards and had a large well appointed bathroom. Breakfast was good but a little pricey. Location was phenomenal. Never needed to use the metro as we walked to La Rambla and took the HOHO bus from there. We rented a car for 2 days and they were very helpful with acommodating our one night of overnight parking. Free wifi!!! The staff was wonderful, everyone was always willing to help and they gave great dinner suggestions - good food and affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Dale M
Reviews.Content: The Barcelona Universal is CLEAN, has a very helpful and informed staff, is centrally located -easy walking distance to the Gothic Center of Barcelona, the bathrooms are large enough and the shower is excellent. The air in the room was excellent and the price was right. In addition, I left my walking stick in the room . I contacted the hotel and they saw to it that my caned was mailed to my home in the U.S.A.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Khristophoros
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a group of friends in April, booked a triple room& a double room, prices were decent. We were greeted well& staff were helpful throughout& gave us a map as we checked in. I stayed in the triple room on the 6th floor& although it had windows, it wasn’t looking onto the streets or such, rather it was onto a central column in the centre of the building, but this wasn’t a problem as I had read about street side rooms being loud& I can understand those peoples reviews as outside it was pretty busy. The room was large, beds comfortable& I got great nights sleep all week. The double room my other friends had was on the 2nd floor& had its own patio out back which was great. It was warm when we visited the city& the patio was shaded out the back letting us keep cool. There is also free WiFi all over the hotel. We checked out the pool up on the roof but its not heated so is pretty cold!, but we relaxed for a while up there 1 day, its got awesome views aswell from up there!. As most reviews say, there is a Metro stop (Para-lel) right outside the main door to the hotel& can get you anywhere in city. An excellent note on this is that the metro was on the same line that the RENFE Airport train from Barcelona Airport to Sants Station stopped at, therefore it is easy to get from Airport to Hotel in around 30-40mins (depending on train times) with 1 change. There are many little cafes, restaurants& fast food outlets near the hotel. We had breakfast once& was pretty good, not a massive choice, but by no means scarce. La Rambla is 10min walk away& its worth while walking up this street as it’s full of stalls& shops. There is also an excellent Tourist Information booth towards the top of the street, you will notice the red ‘i’ sign. One thing I would mention that maybe on peoples minds is there was no in room iron, or kettle/tea making facilities. The hotel staff allowed us to keep our bags etc in the hotel on the last day also as we had a late flight at no charge. I would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good 4 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ragz_mln
Reviews.Content: Just a small walk away from La Ramblas, it is located at a very decent place. Despite being a vegetarian, I could find good food nearby. Metro is just outside the hotel, taking us to all parts of the town. The staff is very decent, and they gave me all the information I asked them. The rooms are very good, and spacious according to European standards.Free wifi. The soaps and other accessories provided in the room/bath were of good quality. All the above, when compared to the price we paid for this Hotel- just do not make me give it anything less than a 5* rating. Good job guys! P.S.: Just hope you dont increase your prices after looking at the positive reviews that you are getting! ;)

Reviews.Title: “To be recommended”
Reviews.Author: Traveller1reading
Reviews.Content: Booked into this hotel for a city break. Room very clean and well appointed, there were windows in room they were not facing outside but into a central space (you got fresh air but no traffic noise.) Lots of complimentary bathroom requirements. Staff in the hotel were extremely helpful, friendly and informative, went out of their way to accommodate you, all spoke good English. A bit of a walk to Las Ramblas etc but right next to the Metro. Nearby cafe/restaurants meant we didn't have to go far for a meal. Pool was tiny but very clean, small gym available and stunning views from the roof. We did not sample the dining room, the bar was small but adequate and attentive staff. Would happily recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Well located and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: SandDCambridge
Reviews.Content: My visit to this hotel was was a couple of friends at the start of March '12. We visited Barcelona mainly for a football weekend and wanted to find some accommodation on are reasonable budget. The Barcelona Universal offered a triple room which was ideal for three (well proportioned) men. The room was clean and all three beds were comfortable and spacious enough. The décor is modern and the only criticism I would have is that there wasn't a window in our room. Not a big problem as we weren't really there during the day but if we had stayed longer than the three nights it would have bothered me more. The staff are really friendly and a couple spoke really good English. In terms of the location is was no more than 5 minutes to Las Ramblas and the entrance to the underground was quite literally just outside the door. I wouldnt hesitate to recommend it to others and would stay there again on my next visit to a fantastic city.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Comfortable & Good Value.”
Reviews.Author: Alison S
Reviews.Content: We found the Universal to be a very well positioned hotel for out trip to Barcelona. There is a metro station right outside the door which is so handy for transfers from the airport. It took about 10mins 'stroll' to La Rambla. So, it's close enough without being in the centre of all the chaos of La Rambla. The room we had was average in size and decor, nothing to write home about, but it was clean and despite overlooking the main street, it was quiet enough at night. We were on a room only basis - we just prefer it that way - so we can't comment on breakfast. If you have the time, in between all the sights and sounds of Barcelona, there is a small roof top pool and a good view of the city. Would we stay here again...quite possibily. Nothing about the hotel put us off going back there.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: HeatherMirfield
Reviews.Content: Just come back from staying at the Universal in Barcelona and cannot fault the hotel. The room was spacious and immaculately clean. The complimentary bathroom accessories are a nice touch and the beds are really comfy. We didn't eat in the hotel as you can get breakfast etc. at the street cafes just outside. It is a five minute walk to las Ramblas but we didn't mind that as it would be very noisy staying any closer. The staff were very friendly and helpful and we checked in just after 12 noon although it says from 3.00 pm. Would recommend this hotel - we had our 10 year old daughter with us and it is good for families, couples etc.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant hotel, excellant staff.”
Reviews.Author: rony1984
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I had originally planned a trip to the Universal Hotel in March but were unable to travel. We were able to rebook our flights for Easter weekend but on checking the hotels website the rooms were more expensive than the weekend we had originally booked for. After emailing the hotel to explain our circumstances they were very accommodating and honoured the rate that we had agreed for our initial trip. This was fantastic as it cost quite a bit to get the flights changed and would not have been feasible to pay more for the hotel. On arriving at the hotel we were amazed at how close it was to the metro station, literally right outside the door. The hotel itself is very modern inside, clean, cool and professional. Our room was very well laid out and the little touches such as a shaving kit and dental kit showed that a lot of thought went into the service provided. The rooftop pool was amazing and the view from the roof is just something else, we could have spent a day up there quite easily. We didn't eat in the hotel as we wanted to experience authentic Barcelona food so cannot comment on the food but we had a few drinks in the bar each night before going out and it is 5 star. One thing that summed up the Universal Hotel was when I approached reception as I was having trouble printing tickets that I had pre booked for the Camp Nou Experience (no need to pre book as they have to be printed out at cash machines that don't work. Just buy tickets at the stadium itself). The man at reception let me log onto my emails to print out the confirmation, he even phoned up the ticket providers to try and sort things out. In the end we were able to get tickets at the stadium using the email confirmation and it just shows that the staff really do go the extra mile. I would really recommend this hotel for anyone travelling to Barcelona as it is great value and anyone that stays will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel that you must consider”
Reviews.Author: anmushy
Reviews.Content: Just returned today from a weekend break here. Booked it after looking at reviews on here and got a really good B&B rate with Travel Republic. Location is excellent, metro right outside and 10 min walk to Las Rambla. Rooms are good size, plenty of wardrobe space, no tea and coffee making though. Bathrooms spacious kitted out in marble and with a small selection of toiletries. The hotel and rooms are modern in design, clean and well cared for. Reception staff very efficient and helpful. Breakfast very good. Hotel bar is quite small (in the lobby) and a few times the barman wasn't there so there was a bit of a wait to get served - we gave up on one occasion. I had requested a room that was quiet and on a high floor but we were put on the third floor on the front of the hotel - as soon as we got to the room I phoned down to ask to move as I knew there was no way I could sleep with such a loud road so close, I phoned down to reception straight away and they moved us to the rear of the building within 10 minutes - yes, the view isn't great at the back but it suited us better. All in all, a superb hotel that you must consider for a Barca short break. Can highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel. Will Definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Rebelsasha
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 5 nights in March and found the hotel to be exactly what we had expected after reading all the reviews. The metro stop is just outside the door, which made getting around very easy. We had asked for a higher up room after reading the reviews and it was worth it as we stayed in the 7th floor. We did not eat breakfast in the hotel as the cafes outside were half the price for a huge breakfast which also served us for lunch. The walk to the port goes by very quickly and we really felt we had picked the best area to stay in. We ate in the restaurant on our last night and it was really good. If we had known earlier in the week we would have used it more! The bar downstairs is tiny and not always staffed if quiet but much safer if you are nervous sitting outside at night. The only downside is because of the wooden floors we could hear people walking around in their rooms! We went to Camp Nou for a match and it was only 4 stops and a 10 minute walk on the metro. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, Friendly staff, Expensive Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: greekcypriot2009
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because of its location. The fact that a metro is so very close made me book here. We came from the airport here using the metro so this saved us lots of extras on taxis etc. I remember I booked through a website company which I can’t remember now the name and as always I considered Breakfast in the booking…or at least I thought!! I found it a bit tricky this time, and although the papers before booking showed that breakfast is included, this did not appear on the paper I got but of course this was not a problem with the hotel but the booking company. You see for us it is important that breakfast is included! We had our breakfast the first morning but the second day we were asked to pay. I considered it too pricy and we decided to have breakfast out. No much trouble, instead we enjoyed it even more. In the neighbourhood there are lots and lots of breakfast little shops with a fourth of what the hotel was asking us to pay, and with a descent breakfast and service as well. So this was not a problem at all….only a little disappointing as I was shocked when I found out that ours was not included in the price when we booked. If you notice a big difference in the price when booking with breakfast included, prefer to book just the room. You will save much if you eat your breakfast out especially if the days are sunny and beautiful. We had room #806 overlooking the main road, it was clean and comfy, bed moderately comfortable, and bath clean and descent, but we did not spend much time in as most of the times we were out sight-seeing. The staff was helpful all right. I would gladly return here, although the view from the main road is not the best.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously Consider this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MissyMac78
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 day stay and was really pleased with this hotel. True it is not in the middle of where it is happening, which can be an advantage, less noise and bustle the minute you step out on to the street. However there is a metro right outside the main door, numerous buses and so much within a 10 minute walk ~ check it out on google. Also, the building fascade is nondescript, but step inside and you find a welcoming greeting, friendly and efficient staff. Our room was of adequate size, in good condition and very clean and comfortable, although it did look on to an inside courtyard, which made the room a bit dull and gauging the weather a mild nuisance. We took the the breakfast deal and were so glad ~ wide variety and very efficiently run. The pool is really of the 'cool down' variety but I'm sure a welcomed advantage when the weather starts heating up and the sundeck, with super views, is a lovely place for a bit of R & R. All in all the standard of service together with an excellent price far out weighed the more glamorous or trendy hotels set in and around Las Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal stay - amazing staff - would recommend to everyone”
Reviews.Author: ronandmak
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at this hotel from April 4-8. We had a suite and regular room on the 9th floor overlooking their sign and had a huge balcony. The view was fantastic. The rooms were clean and spacious. Their cleaning staff was very efficient and barely noticeable. However, the front desk staff really made our stay amazing. As we had never been to Barcelona, they provided us with recommendations for restaurants, tickets, attractions and even had a large taxi at 5:30 in the morning to take our family to the airport when we left. They were friendly and fully fluent in English. The best part was that they were friendly and took their time to explain things and give directions. Customer service was five star. Thank you so much for making this part of our vacation stress free.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: KarmaKarma
Reviews.Content: Close to La Rambla and good restaurants. Remember to bring your round electrical plugs in addition to converters. The plugs are inset. Hotel provides a lot of amenities however only a small bar of hand soap. If you like to shower with soap instead of using a small bottle of wash, bring your own. Wasn't crazy about their shampoo ( no conditioner provided) so you may want to bring some to. Service is excellent. Breakfast buffet is very good but pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: sian c
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay, very handy for the metro and within good walking distance to the ramblas and Gothic district. The room was very pleasant, well decorated, good lighting, very clean and the bed was large and comfortable. Breakfast was served til 11am which was handy if you wanted a lie in. There was plenty of choice of food. It was my birthday and I was given a bottle of champagne - a very nice touch, thank you. The staff were helpful and friendly. There is a nice little roof terrace with a pool if you want to chill out.

Reviews.Title: “Modern rooms in ok location”
Reviews.Author: SiriHol
Reviews.Content: Got a really good deal on Hotwire for this hotel and stayed three nights. Its location is pretty good. Ten/fifteen minutes walk to Las Ramblas and the harbour, and right by the funicular to the Miro-museum. However, if you like living right in the middle of it all - Universal might be a bit on "the wrong side" of Las Ramblas, and you might want to be looking more in the old town area. The metro stop however is literally ten steps from the entrance - with three-five stops to Placa Catalunya and La Sagrada Familia - so you can easily reach anywhere in a few minutes. The metro in Barcelona is well-labelled, easy to use, and comes highly recommended - a ten-fair card is about 10 euro - very cheap, and takes you anywhere. Big bonus about this hotel is that you can also walk from the airportbus-stop at Urgell street in about ten minutes (or take subway one stop to half the distance). No need for a taxi - the bus is really efficient and convenient. As for the rooms: modern, large, nice and great bathroom. No complaints at all. There is free wifi, and the staff was very helpful with printing boarding-passes. You might want to ask for a room facing outwards - we had one towards the back yard - and it gives little light in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: JoFrack
Reviews.Content: Would certainly recommend this hotel: - Good location for attractions - Right outside Metro stop - Very helpful staff - Rooms good size, modern and very clean - Even opened breakfast an hour early to allow all the marathon runners to eat Great place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay - would recommend!”
Reviews.Author: oddyball
Reviews.Content: So...we had a few initial problems checking in (all these were our own fault i must say!) however on arrival at our room we had found we had been upgraded from what we had booked. The room was clean and tidy and throughout our 5 day stay i was kept this way by the fantastic cleaning staff. Free Wifi was brilliant as we managed to get all our information on where we wanted to go during our trip. The Breakfast was included in our deal and it was good, there was plenty of selection however i am aware that the price is usually between 9-15 euros i wouldnt want to pay that for it. the staff throughout were polite & friendly. the hotel is 10 mins walk from marina/ la rambla and 45 min walk to nou Camp..we did do a lot of walking as we prefer to see the city that way howver we did get a T-10 metro ticket which gets you travel anywhere for 10 journeys each of which last 75mins this INCLUDES to the airport! it cost just short 10 euro. the nearest Metro station is Paralel and is right on the doorstep of the hotel. Fantastic few days we had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joanne891
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel for my 40th birthday with a group of friends and we were not disappointed. The location of this hotel is excellent, easy walking distance to Las Ramblas and other main areas and the metro station right outside is a huge bonus. The metro service is excellent and great for getting around the city. The hotel was very modern and clean and my corner room was an excellent size with great views. We found the food and drinks to be very reasonably priced and the service was excellent. The staff in this hotel were great - very friendly and extremely helpful from the minute we checked in until the minute we left. I would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Vidocq_UK
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in a perfect location for getting anywhere in Barcelona, even as far as Park Guell (bus 24 with station in front of the hotel). The metro station is in front of the hotel and Ramble, place Espania and Port Barcelona are in walking distance. Staff: the reception staff was helpful, the restaurant staff was excellent. Room: the room was clean and spacious. We asked for a room with a “view” at the back so the view was inexistent. The benefit (and the reason for asking for this) was the balcony and the lack of traffic noise. The hotel is on a very busy boulevard. Food: Breakfast is great with plenty of food. The diner menu it’s also great. They have combination of buffet dinner (15 euro) and, if you chose you can have two meat menu options at 19 or 21 euros. The buffet is plentiful including deserts. The quality of the food, both buffet and the meat menu was great. The hotel has a small (very small) pool on the roof and a solarium where you can do sun bathing. The only negatives were the fact that there were no tea-making facility in the room and there were none available upon request either. On the first day the room was not cleaned and at 4PM we had to ring the reception. The room was after that cleaned within the hour. They explained this was caused by a very busy day. To be fair, it didn’t happen after that. Recommended? Definitively Would I go back: for sure

Reviews.Title: “Super Stay”
Reviews.Author: liam5407
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel within walking distance of many of the main attractions. Very helpful and friendly staff, rooms well maintained and very comfortable. Breakfast is a good mix of cooked and continental. Also has a rooftop sun terrace and small pool. Several good restaurants on stretch between hotel and Plaça d'Espana, particularly Pura Brasa and Rias De Vigo There is a metro station almost on the doorstep. I would strongly recommend this hotel. Also used Sun Transfers for pick ups between airport and hotel. They live up to all the excellent reviews, drivers are always on time, friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paul W
Reviews.Content: Good modern hotel in ideal location for Las Ramblas and right beside a metro station so great for exploring the rest of the city. It's on a busy road but then most of Barcelona is pretty busy so its to be expected. Service was polite and efficient but not overly friendly. Food in restaurant was adequate. The room was very modern, large size and impressive with good balcony - I had requested one of the renovated rooms on a high floor. Would definitely consider this hotel again when visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfactory-great area!”
Reviews.Author: TraveLotsnLots
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Barcelona early in the morning by airplane. We decided to take the train because our research told us that even though there were buses that went to city center; there was a strong chance that our large pieces of luggage would be a problem. We followed the signs which lead us to an area with platforms and proceeded to try to figure out the Spanish self serve ticket machine. There was a help/information desk, but because it was so early in the morning, it was closed. By the good graces and kindness of a stranger, we had two tickets for the train at a cost of 6.50 Euro each. Unfortunately, getting back home and looking at the metro, train, and hotel web sites; I’m all confused as to how we managed to get to the hotel. I do know we got off the train at what I thought was Placa Sentri. We bought metro tickets for 1.50 Euro each and headed for the L2 Blue line as directed by others on the train. Turns out, there is a good chance the train tickets possibly included the metro. Anyway, we followed directions for the L2 blue line and found our way getting off at Parallel. We found that once you were in the metro system, like others, they had maps of the metro system and you were able to easily follow. In fact, Barcelona had two advantages-at each platform, there was a L.E.D. sign showing the arrival time of the next metro train, plus where it was headed. Additionally, in each of the cars, in addition to the customary map of the metro system on the wall, there was a follow along type system showing by light were you were along the route and where you were headed. It really helped one unfamiliar with the system to reassure one self if you were on the correct train, and going in the correct direction. Upon arriving at Parallel station, we headed for the exit. A bit of a note about the metro. Although it was inexpensive to take the metro from the train station to the hotel as opposed to a cab; we found ourselves lugging our luggage up and down stairs. Once in a rare moment we would find an elevator, but for the most part, like many other metro systems, there were a lot of stairs to climb or go down. As we exited the metro system, it split left and right with signs showing what street or something or other. Not knowing, we took a guess and headed right. We pulled our luggage up the stairs and came out onto the sidewalk. After asking for directions, we headed north and after about a block or two, we came right to the front door of the hotel. It would seem that had we headed left out of the metro system, we would have ended up on the other side of the street, although in front of the hotel, just opposite from the entrance. Check in was efficient and handled by caring staff that spoke English well. We found our room to be the typical European room with the hard flooring, firm bed, and well stocked bathroom. We had no problems with maintenance issues and found the water pressure for the shower to be adequate and did not run hot/cold. We found the room to be clean and the other parts of the hotel to be clean, modern, and inviting. We walked around looking for places to eat and shop and this is what we found: Upon exiting the hotel, if you turn right and walk up Parallel, you come to a street off to your right. We turned right and walked for about one half block. If you would continue going straight on this street, you would come to the Las Ramblas in about 10-20 minutes depending on your speed of walking. Instead of continuing straight, we crossed the street and found a small grocery store. We headed along the street back to Parallel and upon coming to Parallel, we turned right and continued heading up Parallel. Within a very short distance, we came to a medium sized grocery store. We continued up Parallel until it intersected with a street from the left creating sort of a point of a triangle. We crossed Parallel and continued walking down Parallel until we came to an intersection that allowed us to cross on a light. We then turned left and walked up Parallel until we reached our hotel. That route we took was approximately 20-35 minutes and had about 20-30+ bars and restaurants along the route. We found many of the bars serving their appetizers called tappas, which for the most part were all the same skewered beef or lamb, grilled prawns, and other fish dishes. The majority of the places, (bars and restaurants) had their menus with prices and pictures of the dishes posted outside for you to take your time and study what was available. We found for the most part, the prices didn’t vary much from one place to the other. So for the most part, the area was close to Las Ramblas, the cruise port, and had a lot of restaurants and bars in the area. When picking a hotel to stay at in Barcelona, due to the number of hotels, the task seemed daunting. What I learned was that if you wanted to stay on or very near the Las Ramblas, you should expect a lot of noise from people until the wee hours of the morning. The farther away from the city center, the less expensive your room; but transportation and it’s cost became an issue. We chose this specific hotel because of it’s proximity to Las Ramblas, (close but not too close for noise), the convenience of having a metro stop, and it’s extremely short distance to the cruise port. However, as it turns out, that 3 minute cab ride to the cruise port still cost us 20 Euro. My guess is they show you their kind of hospitality and take advantage of tourists and charge a flat rate regardless of the distance. Not surprisingly, there never was a shortage of cabs in front of the hotel. So, for it’s location, cleanliness, English speaking staff, and amenities; we were well satisfied with our stay and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: monantia
Reviews.Content: A group of us just went to Barcelona for a Barcelona Marathon 2012 and all stayed in Barcelona Universal. The hotel is lovely, modern, renovated, clean with a very friendly with a very helpful service and a nice breakfast. It has a roof terrace with a swimming pool (opening in April) and a sun tanning deck, free wifi in the rooms and free internet access in the lobby. We were very lucky to get a free upgrade and got a beautiful big room on the top floor with a huge roof top terrace with deck chairs, table etc and jets in the bathroom. The hotel is in a perfect location, just where the Marathon route was and 1.5km from the start / finish line. It is close to the metro, a few minutes walk from the beach and Las Ramblas. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maxine W
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a trip with friends in March 2012 and it was an excellent choice. Great location, rooms are clean, staff are very pleasant and helpful, reasonable price. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “nice, modern”
Reviews.Author: JessNY76
Reviews.Content: this hotel was nice and modern. I booked a regular deluxe room with 2 twin beds. Being that this is Europe the rooms were small compared to standard USA hotels but it did its job. Nice closet space and in-room safe came in handy. Bathroom was nice and clean. Location is about a 10-15 min walk to Las Ramblas but the metro is right outside the front of the hotel to all major sites. I personally rented a vespa for the weekend from http://vesping.com/ they are so accomadating and met us where we requested. Prices are good so if you're able to drive one do so, VERY useful when you're going from site to site all day, hop on, hop off. Just a word of advise, it says the Vespa fits 2 however it really is only for one person. Im fairly small so i fit (5"3) on the back but it wasnt super comfortable for the driver. As for the hotel Id def recommend it, nice people in the front booked us restaurant reservations both nights and were on time with the 7am wake up call.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel and location!”
Reviews.Author: Eire R
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in December 2011 with my sister on a trip to Spain. We were very impressed with the hotel and it's facilities along with the amazing sushi restaurant nextdoor! It's a short walk from the tourist attractions and great tapas bars including Quimet & Quimet, cannot miss it! Will definitely stay here again when I go back to Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraK10
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Barcelona Universal. The hotel is in a central location and there is a metro stop steps away from the front entrance. Short walk to Las Ramblas as well. Staff was very helpful. Rooms were bigger than I expected (used to small rooms in Europe) and the bathroom was a good size and clean. (Great water pressure in the showers too!). I would definitely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location with a great staff”
Reviews.Author: MMVNewYork
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Short walk to La Rambla - close but not too close. The location was within walking distance of most places we wanted to see including the Picasso Museum and the Barri Gotic. The rooms were well appointed and very clean. The staff at reception was friendly with great tips on restaurants, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: ABSharma
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel for four nights. In our travels, This hotel was definitely the easiest to get to from the airport. Airport Express to Espanya and Metro to Paral.lel station, which is right outside the Hotel's front door. The check in was easy, conceirge very helpful, went out of their way to make us comfortable and guide us through the local streets. Walked to La Rambla, Picasso Museum, Waterfront. Access to Montjuic is also from the Paral.lel metro station; very convenient to get to the mountain and the Castle. Being on the main street, the outside noise could be bothersome.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and great location”
Reviews.Author: TLaboogie
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel...Located within walking distance of La Rambla and right next to metro. We were able to get everywhere in a short amount of time Very clean and helpful friendly staff. Free Breakfast was basic but it did the job every morning. Rooms were smaller then we were use to but very clean. Most of the other reivews were very help in selecting this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel for getting to know Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: SWcouple
Reviews.Content: This Hotel provides a very good base to discover Barcelona from, very close to Metro and a short 10 minute walk to the Harbour and tourist bus stop. The Hotel is very modern and comfortable. The staff were very good and professional. The staff on the reception were most helpful and knowledgeable. Breakfast was very good and we ate in the resturant one evening, and this meal was superb. The cleanliness of the hotel was beyond question and room service completed an excellent job.

Reviews.Title: “one to book”
Reviews.Author: dawn c
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful, lovely hotel, very clean and modern. The only negative thing I can say about the hotel was that there was no tea and coffee making facilities in the room, so had to order room sevice, which always arrived in about 5 min but you had to pay for it!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Helpful”
Reviews.Author: CB-Flyer
Reviews.Content: This is a nice business-class hotel, very comfortable and with free Internet. The front desk staff were most helpful and even room service wasn't expensive. We have a very enjoyable stay. The cooked breakfast could have been better but the cold was fine.

Reviews.Title: “No Frills, Good Location!”
Reviews.Author: transatlanticgirl19
Reviews.Content: We liked this place mainly because of the location. It was close enough to walk everywhere, yet far enough away from the noise of the rambla. The guys at the front desk were really helpful with directions. We never ate the breakfast because it was too expensive and the market is so close and cheap to just go grab your own. Bath tub was big and allowed for a relaxing evening after a long day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “10/10 - Wow - The best decision you'll make; book this hotel without hesitation”
Reviews.Author: Gazwa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is win win; fantastic location just 10 minutes walk from Las Ramblas and 15 mins to the port (some brilliant fish and tapas restaurants to be had). The rooms and staff are brilliant, couldn't ask for more and could give you any negative points regarding this hotel. Stopped in Barcelona for a short city break - it is stunning and so much to see - so we'll have go back and will definitely book the Barcelona Universal Hotel again. Recommend the city bus tours as they give you a great insight into the city and then you can go adventure those parts that yanked your chain from the tour. Barcelona is simply breathtaking and can't wait to return - hope this review helps and hope you have a great stay ! x

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: sun_worshiper88
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed here in January for 3 nights, we bought this through Expedia and a great price. The hotel is in a fantastic location about 10 minutes walk to Las Rambles. The rooms were comfortable, very clean and mini bar was well packed! We had breakfast in bed one morning which was lovely bought to our room on time and had everything we wanted, fresh juice, coffee, fruit, eggs and bacon. Would definately recommend Barcelona itself is a lovely city with loads to do. Would definately go back to Barcelona and back to Universal and would recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “hotel great”
Reviews.Author: robbo31
Reviews.Content: just got back from 4 days at this hotel really nice and clean we stayed in room 702 corner suite 2 large size double beds nice view of the street bit noisy at night goes on till about 5am fantastic view from level 10 you can see most of the city if you come out of the hotel and turn left the first bar you come to you can get a beer for 1 euro very cheap considering at ra rambla you will pay 5 euro for one beer if any waiter ask if you want a large beer say no or you will get 3 pints in one glass like i did watch out for pickpockets and strange men hanging around on street corners or by the metro entrance its rife the first person we spoke to had been robbed she had her necklace snatched of her neck but apart from this very enjiyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “OK - would stay here again but definitely 3 stars”
Reviews.Author: jamurphy2
Reviews.Content: I'd stay here again but wasn't blown away or anything. I'm not really picky but I think the current 4+ rating overstates how nice the place is. Pros: clean, decent location (near metro), staff very helpful with reservations/recommendations, wifi worked well Cons: small room with no windows, thin walls (very noisy), bed moderately comfortable

Reviews.Title: “A Very Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: LJR_10
Reviews.Content: First of all, I would like to thank the staff at the hotel for their hospitality. My wife and I had a wonderful three days in Barcelona - what a lovely city!!!...the hotel is situated in a very convenient location and is only a ten minute walk to the Las Ramblas area. The views from the rooftop are spectacular. There is a "pool" and gym on the rooftop, as well as sun lounges should you decide to do a spot of sunbathing. We were celebrating my 60th Birthday, and my daughter who was so kind, giving me this trip for my Birthday Present also mentioned this to the hotel.....they gave me an upgrade - a "superior suite"!!!...our stay was an absolute pleasure!....we do intend to visit again in the future, and would definitely stay at Hotel Barcelona Universal again!!

Reviews.Title: “A genuinely good experience”
Reviews.Author: Goose100
Reviews.Content: We emailed the hotel before our stay and everything we requested was done in advance for us top marks for that. The staff greeted us politely and with a welcoming smile the room we requested was not quite ready but coffee was brought to us during our short wait. Room 716 was spotlessly clean, not a bad view for the rear of the hotel, very quiet, comfortable bed with nice quality bed linen and nice fluffy towels changed daily. Maid service excellent as was the breakfast, all staff we found most helpful and willing to give advice towards making our stay in Barcelona a success and safe. On the subject of a safe stay all that has been said before is no doubt true, do be aware of all your personal space around you espessialy on the metro it gets so very busy down there. We chose to carry no bags after arrival and used inside pockets to carry anything we needed, we noticed a number of people in the city loose property to pickpockets working in pairs. Also it must be said we also saw undercover police arrest some of these thieves too! Barcelona is a beautiful city don't let these pickpockets spoil it for you keep your belongings out of sight. We traveled from the airport by Aerobus bus (turn left as you leave the airport the busses are parked there) go to the last stop Plaza Catalunya in the city centre. From there you will be able to see the Metro signs, take the Metro to Paral-lel 3 stops, exit the station by the sign for SAN PAUL this will bring you out literally in front of the hotel. We purchased a pass for the Metro the whole service was so convenient and of great use to us and we found ourselves less footsore. Do the city bus tour well worth it even if it's just to get your bearings and gives you use of discount vouchers for many attractions. Have coffee, drinks, snacks etc off the main drags and not near the Gaudi attractions a road behind its half the price and just as good. The harbour area is lovely to walk around and interesting we enjoyed a visit to the aquarium there and not to far a walk to from the hotel. In a nutshell conveniently situated for transport, varied restaurants, bars places of interest etc a well run clean comfortable hotel, the staff are a credit to the company and are to be complemented, we would certainly like to say thank you to all for the thoughtful care give

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Jayne V
Reviews.Content: Good location to get to Las Ramblas..turn left at front of hotel and about 10 mins walk....Staff were friendly and rooms were nice...had room on 6th floor but the noise from the road outside was very loud,,,ambulances all night with sirens are a bit much....Metro is just outside hotel and easy to use and understand...only downside to hotel is no tea/coffee making facilities in room...found a lovely restaurant Sinatra's in Gothic area...fliers being handed out from staff so try and you will be very impressed...wonderful tapas and friendly staff...don't have a drink on Las Ramblas as way too expensive lots of bars in side streets which are cheaper....went to Montseratt for the day and cheapest way is on train easier to get to train station in Placa Espanya and people there to help also....

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: KathMcC10
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from a three day trip to Barcelona. Had never done a city break before and didn't know what to expect but was not disappointed and would do again. Booked the hotel after much research and it was fantastic. Staff were very helpful and friendly and the hotel had a good atmosphere. Room was clean and spacious with a big comfy bed! Bathroom was big and catered for our every need! Great central location - busy street disturbed sleep the first night but slept like a log the other two nights. Received a warm welcome and would definetely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location with paper thin walls”
Reviews.Author: lifeatseaforme
Reviews.Content: Everything about the property was very nice except the walls were so thin that it was impossible to sleep past 9 am when the housekeepers started cleaning the rooms. However, if you are an early riser, most everything is very nice. Staff were all very helpful, except for the gentleman that checked us in, and the rooftop terrace was a wonderful surprise. The location was a 5-10 minute walk from the Ramblas, and the metro station is right outside the front door.

Reviews.Title: “Good room, good rate”
Reviews.Author: tcc022
Reviews.Content: Well located--metro stop right outside front door and many sites within easy walking distance. Nice rooms--sizable and well-appointed, good baths. Helpful staff. Exercise room and pool also in good shape. Had breakfast once, and it was extensive in its offering.

Reviews.Title: “Good base in central location”
Reviews.Author: Nwyra
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights over February half term and were generally happy with the Hotel. The bed was really comfy and room spacious; busy street but it didn't really bother us. The location is excellent for exploring Barcelona with the Metro just outside. The walks to Las Ramblas were a little dodgy later at night but we found a longer route that was a little more interesting and felt safer at least (haven't stayed in other areas of Barcelona so nothing to compare it to really). We had breakfast in the hotel one morning (not bad and all you can eat) but preferred finding a coffee and pastry on the way to where we were heading that day. Re-reading my review I'm probably only highlighting the negatives. I would stay again and service was excellent throughout.

Reviews.Title: “Location, room, staff and breakfast first rate”
Reviews.Author: sagecrest
Reviews.Content: This four star business class hotel is just steps away from the Paral-lel metro stop and the line connects with many major sights. It's just two stations from Placa d'Espanya where the express bus from the airport stops. Excellent metro system. Buy the T-10 metro card, under 10 euro, at any of the machines in the metro system. That will cut your transit costs to less than 1/2 of buying individual tickets. Also, the T-10 card is shareable, just pass it back to your comrade. It's a ten minute stroll to Las Ramblas on fairly quiet back streets with some color given many small shops and some women waiting for buses...opps no bus stops. Hmmm. I would not walk this same route late at night without two large friends. The hotel is on a major street and the backside view is apartments unless you get a room on about floor seven or above. Clean hotel and modern style works well. When constructed/remodeled the sound proofing sub-contractor must not have finished the job as there is noise...floor to floor and side to side. Staff are excellent in every regard with special recognition for Carlos in reservations....great. The breakfast buffet is delicious and offers healthy foods. The dinner buffet, while fairly basic, is OK. Nearby tapas restaurants are more than worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Terry's 7th Stag Weekend on the trot”
Reviews.Author: Terence S Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th year at this hotel. Excellent Location with the Ramblers and Harbour 10min walk. Metro Outside Hotel Doors. local bars all around hotel to finish night off, All the bars do various types of food. The only down side are the pick pockets, They hang around on the corner next to the Metro, NEVER engage in any conversation with anyone that comes up to you asking questions or the will dip your pockets or snatch at your jewellery. Also keep your wallet very safe and your hand bag across your chest. If you are vigilant then you will have a fantastic time in Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Pleasant Staff”
Reviews.Author: sonofbarney
Reviews.Content: We stayed here late January, it was a surprise birthday weekend for my partner. I booked through Easyjet so I got the hotel at a discounted price but I had problems when I paid through the hotel's online booking system. This was the first time I had encountered this problem and I received an email from the hotel asking me to email them my credit card details - I thought this was very unprofessional not to mention a security risk, this was followed by an array of quite cheeky, bordering on rude, responses from Pablo Perez. It was too late to book anywhere so I had to use my business credit card account to pay the hotel. Nevertheless, on arrival at one in the morning we were pleasantly greeted by the hotel staff who warned us about the pickpockets in Las Ramblas. The Hotel itself is centrally located and handy to walk to most tourist attractions and is next to a metro/underground station. The room was clean and tidy with modern furnishings, however we were woken up at 7am on the Saturday morning by builders on the roof of an adjacent building. I suppose this is to be expected in the center of a large city and it did prompt us to have an early breakfast which was a buffet and not too bad. So in summary, good location, nice room, pleasant staff, do not pay full price as this hotel always seems to have offers on, and avoid paying by credit card!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mary731
Reviews.Content: We travel extensively and found this hotel to be especially lovely. In a perfect spot; a 5 minute walk to Las Ramblas and Port Vell, with the Metro literally outside the door. The hotel is small and beautifully up to date, extremely well maintained and clean. We requested a room in the quieter rear of the hotel, and were delighted with it---it was spacious by European standards, quiet, and had a lovely terrace (no view). The bathroom was quite large with modern fixtures--we loved the powerful showerhead and oversized tub, and towel warmers. Another huge advantage is the complimentary in room internet access (no surcharge), which seems to be a rarity in most hotels.The multilingual staff was friendly and accommodating, and always willing to answer our questions regarding local restaurants and points of interest, even offering the use of an umbrella when needed. The breakfast buffet was a delight--a smorgasbord of hot and cold selections, with the restaurant's hours of operation allowing us to sleep in most mornings. As the hotel is in a residential area, there are many local restaurants which come highly recommended by the hotel staff. We tried several, and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. We have already recommended this hotel to several friends who have Barcelona on their agenda, and we will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Clean / Nice Rooms, Great Location, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: neorunner
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a business trip and to explore the city. This hotel is in a great location for using "el Metro" to get around the city. It is a nice central location to see most of what people come to see in Barcelona. It is close to "La Rambla", where you will find lots of wonderful restaurants. The front desk people are always very helpful for directions or recommendations. There is a sign at the front desk warning about pick pocketers. READ IT. It is in English, and it will help you avoid losing money or vital documents. Whatever you do, don't walk around town with lots of cash or with your travel documents (passport, etc.). Many people complain about the noise from Paral-lel (the street in front of the hotel). If you are a light sleeper, you should request an inside room, not one facing the street. The inside rooms are quiet, but they don't get much light from outside as the windows face a courtyard. You shouldn't be spending much time in your room anyway, so don't worry about it. We stayed here the night of Carnaval, and we couldn't hear anything from the street. Overall this was a great hotel. I would stay here again in a second. One tip though: If you use hand soap to wash your body in the shower, ask for a couple "extra" bars when you check in. They only provide one by default, and they are very small. They don't charge for extras, so just ask when you check in. As I said before, beware of pick pockets. Leave your cash, travel documents, and valuables in the safe. Don't become a victim.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Jo H
Reviews.Content: Fantastic place to stay, really central for all the sights of Barcelona, the staff throughout the hotel provided excellent, friendly and efficient service. The staff on reception deserve a special mention they were so helpful with advice about where to go, restaurants etc. making reservations for us where necessary and checking that places were open. The rooms were lovely, clean and well presented, breakfast was great (although the cooked food not as hot as I would have liked, but the choice of cold foods was excellent). We had a great deal including breakfast and a free bottle of Cava. The bar in the foyer was welcoming and a great place to start the evening with a cocktail and end the night with a nightcap, and here too the service was excellent. I can't praise this place and the staff enough, for a city centre hotel it is spot on. The only thing I would advise anyone visiting Barcelona is to watch out for pick pockets on the public transport and to get a cab to/from the airport it was only 20 euro's to the hotel door and avoided the hassle our friends had on the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: framesdirect
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel twice in November and Febuary and on both occasions the service and standards are the best I have experienced in Barcelona,and I have stayed at quite a few. The location is spot on for exploring this great city.The rooms are of a good size and are cleaned to perfection.The management of this hotel is very good and this shows through to the rest of the staff.Should you need advise on site seeing Francesco and Christian are the guys to ask at reception,on both stays they went beyond the call of duty to help my wife and me. The restaurant staff in the evening are charming and attentive,and as for the guy at breakfast in my opinion should get a medal for running the restaurant so well at this busy time.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a four star hotel. If it's not cheap don't go there.”
Reviews.Author: Gilgo W
Reviews.Content: Staff are very rude once you ask for something...like a bit of hot water for tea. Bathroom had no ventilation and windows don't really open so it was not a comfortable situation. Sound proofing was terrible. At seventy euros it's acceptable at best, anything more than that is a ripoff.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, modern hotel, friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: creamcoffee
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel, good location, near the Metrostation Paral´lel. The staff was very helpful and welcoming. Breakfast was good, quite varied continental. Though I missed some vegetables to top the sandwich, but otherwise fresh fruit and meats, both contemprorary and some local specialities. The overall feel of the interiors in the rooms and facilities of the hotel is modern and fresh. It´s not a first class hotel, but definitely a very good choice for a relatively OK price in the upper segment of standards. There´s only one thing that was a little disturbing - the rooms are quite badly soundproofed. We could hear some very detailed sounds from the neighbours bathrooms. Otherwise than that, we would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone. We had a very nice long weekend in Barcelona, and this hotel made it even better.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: hottinroof
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel way back in September based on previous TA reviews and importantly a really good price for a 4 star hotel. We stayed at the Universal for 5 days as a birthday treat, and were not disappointed with the trip, or the hotel. On arrival we were allocated an excellent 9th floor corner room, (thank you Daniel) with a huge terrace, at the front of the hotel, which afforded good views of Montjuic. The room was superb, tasteful decor, clean, plus a really good size bathroom, and the only niggle was as is the case in many hotel rooms, low lighting, but we had panoramic balcony windows/doors, so this wasn’t an issue. The hotel is on a busy city road, yards from the Paral. Lel metro stop, so as some reviewers have stated, there is traffic noise, but it’s not intrusive; if you do not want any noise don't stay in a city hotel! We found our own way around Barcelona purchasing T10 Metro tickets, so apart from check in and out, we did not bother the reception staff during our stay, but they had provided us with all necessary information. We found all the hotel staff to be very courteous and professional, the doormen always willing to help with cases, taxis etc. Breakfast was the usual buffet fare; juices, fresh fruit, cold cuts, cheeses, hot food, pastries etc, and there were always sufficient, adequate choices. There is a small lobby bar, which also offers bar snacks, meals, we did not encounter any of the previous complaints over bar staffing, and enjoyed excellent service from the barman Josef, who despite being busy, was unstintingly friendly, (and a brave soul, being a Real Madrid supporter in Barcelona) and he was a credit to the hotel. The hotel is in an excellent location, so close to the Metro and Funicular to Montjuic. You can also easily walk to Las Ramblas, Gothic, the Harbour areas and other sites. We were wary of the area based on previous reviews, but did not find this to be an issue when walking around even at night. There are numerous restaurants, cafes, and tapas bars close to the hotel, we tried a couple with mixed results, i.e. the August restaurant, (really good meal and service), and Los Cachitos, (very poor service, tapas), both were yards from the hotel. Overall this four star hotel provided an excellent base for an enjoyable city break, the staff were all courteous and helpful, I would recommend this hotel for Barcelona visits and would stay there again. We stayed at this hotel for slightly more than we recently paid for a 3 star Rome hotel, which was 4km from the city centre so for us the Hotel Barcelona provided excellent value as well as a quality experience.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is near the main street of La Rambla”
Reviews.Author: Iwan89
Reviews.Content: The hotel is near the main street of La Rambla in Barcelona, luckily by the fact that in the immediate vicinity, it's quiet and peaceful. There is free internet without limits. Hotel from the outside does not do impressions, but in the middle is the truth of the beautiful rooms in a modern style, role model, it should look like rooms everywhere, modernity combined with wood accents, super. Support for a mile and a good command of English, you can learn a lot about fun things to see in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very good stay !”
Reviews.Author: EmanuelaSessa
Reviews.Content: We were on room 707 from february 6th to 10th 2012 Position : perfect, 10 steps from subway stop "paral-El" and walking distance from Las Ramblas & Barrio Gotico Room : totally new, beautifull view (I was on 7th floor) maybe just a bit noisy also because we were close to the elevator ... but really not a big problem. Cleaness : perfect. Room was cleaned perfecly and bathroom too. Staff : multi language and always polite. Ready to give suggestion and information of any kind. Services : I can't say anything about breakfast because I never had it (my personal choice). Wireless services for free from the room, tv sat with multi language channels, gym available for guests. Absolutely a perfect mix quality/price !

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel... Short walk to Las Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: LO_SD
Reviews.Content: Nice, 'looks brand new' hotel. The place is super clean and the staff are beyond helpful. You're a short 5-10 minute walk to Las Ramblas or the Port. The hotel warns you about pick-pockets, so as you make your way to the city attractions, just keep an eye out to your surroundings. We'd definitely recommend this hotel. On this trip we went to London, Paris, and Barcelona....by far, this was the best hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Suvi_Hel
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights in January, the room was quite small and dark, with no sunlight coming in. Extreamly unconfortable pillows and the boy workig as a doorman was very rude. However the receptionist and the rest of the staff was very friendly and the breakfast buffet is really good. There is a metrostation directly in front of the hotel and it´s only 10-15min walk from La Rambla, but you do have to walk trough some dodgy areas to get there. I think Universal is a classic 4 star hotel, no reason to go back but not too bad either.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and decent location”
Reviews.Author: AimeeinTX
Reviews.Content: When we got to Barcelona, it was raining and gloomy so it felt a bit sketchy when we pulled up to the Hotel. The hotel is a standard hotel and check in was effortless. It was a bit scary seeing that the sign that warns us that Barcelona was notorious for pick-pocketers. We knew it but it was a bit of an awakening seeing the sign there. The hallways are fairly dark and it takes a bit of time for the automatic sensors to turn on the lights. When we in our room (317), it was like walking into a blast chiller because the air had been turned off. We managed to get the heat up after a while to warm up. Our view faced the back of the hotel to peoples' home that had laundry hanging out. it wasn't exactly scenic. The room is a good size room with plenty of closet space, and I had no complaint for the size of the bathroom either. There were toiletries provided, but they were very strong so it was not something that I could use. The plus is that they had a towel warmer which was great for doing a little bit of laundry and having it dry quickly. All in all we were satisfied with the room and the hotel, but we weren't necessarily blown away by anything there. Also we didn't try the bar or the restaurant on site because it was fairly pricey and there are many many restaurants around. I think that I may stay here again if the deal is great, but other then that I would choose to stay in the Barri Gotic area where there's more shops, restaurants, and entertainment. Tips: -Download the metro app if you have internet access on your phone. -Go to Quimet & Quiment --- So amazing! It is a tiny little place with no sitting so be forewarned. However, you will soon forget you are standing after having the tapas there. -Nice walk to Las Ramblas. The Mercat La Bouqueria was one of my favorite places in Barcelona. Enjoy your trip here! Barcelona is an amazing city.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: Sinead967
Reviews.Content: I had a three night stay in this hotel in January. I was there with my two sisters and the room was very spacious and the three beds all very comfortable, even the double fold out which from experience in other hotels, they can sometimes not be the most comfortable! It is on a very busy road and for a light sleeper like me, I did find it a bit noisy... nothing a pair of ear plugs didn't sort and it didn't bother my two sisters. If I was to be picky about the room, it could do with a couple of more mirrors...there was only one in the main room and I say this only because there were 3 women trying to get ready at the same time! It's a short walk to Las Ramblas, the staff are very friendly and and informative at the front desk. We were very impressed by the bottle of Cava that was sent up to our room shortly after check-in when they realised we were there for my birthday! A very nice touch in customer service and it was very greatly appreciated!! I have recommended this hotel to friends on my return and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “barcelona”
Reviews.Author: fara046
Reviews.Content: it isn't a bad hotel but it is very noisy i think it need to remodeling and change the windowes with soundproof windowes.breakfast was o.k but not very good.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly good hotel”
Reviews.Author: europeancouple2011
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a great spot in Barcelona, exactly above a subway station!!! The price was fair for Barcelona standards, the service was fine and the breakfast had a great variety! However, even though we had asked for a double room (with a double bed), we were given a double room with twin beds (put together).The location may not have been the safiest in town but we didn't feel threatened at any time. We loved the fact that on the reception desk there was a huge warning about pick-pockets! We would recommend it but for our next visit we might choose a less "formal" hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: DaveTrevaskus
Reviews.Content: This hotel is modern, clean, well staffed and in the perfect location for exploring this marvellous city. It's not right on La Rambla, which makes it feel safer and quieter, but you can walk to the popular strip within 10 minutes. Paral-lel Metro Station is right outside and from here you can reach all the major sights that are not within walking distance, and there's also a Metro from Paral-lel to the main train station - Estacio Sants - which is a 15 minute journey from the airport. There is free Wi-Fi, all the staff speak excellent English and the bar is small but well manned and very friendly. We didn't use the restaurant, but it looked fine. Breakfast was 15 euros extra, but we walked to La Rambla to the Amercian Soda Bar, near the Licieu theatre, where they serve excellent breakfast and tapas. My only comment for attention would be there are no English TV channels - but if you're wanting English TV you're wasting your time in Barcelona, you should stay in a Travelodge in Coventry for that. I could also imagine a room with a balcony on the main road not being as quiet as ours.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, staff and location”
Reviews.Author: adirondacksailor
Reviews.Content: Stayed the past three nights at the Barcelona Universal and we were very happy with our stay. The room was a great size, nice decor, comfy bed and pillows, and nice shower. And, the in-room wifi is wifi on steroids. Never had quicker internet connection in any hotel. Totally dependable entire stay, which is important these days. The front desk staff was really good. We were able to check in after our overnight flight at 9am, which is always a big relief (took aerobus to Pl Espana and metro to door of hotel). The restaurant recommendations were spot on, great dinners all three nights. The street noise was bad. The window seal needed fixing. If you pressed against the window handle, the noise was completely muffled. Next time we will take the interior room which had been offered at checkin. And, there will be a next time, as we are returning in the spring and will stay here again. Room, staff, location all fine.

Reviews.Title: “Could do better”
Reviews.Author: KerryAnne
Reviews.Content: From the reviews it gets, we expected to like this hotel a lot more than we did. The location is probably the best thing about it. It's a short stroll from the Ramblas and the Metro is right outside the front door. Liceu is just two stops away. The 24 bus to/from Park Guell is on Parallel too, very handy. On the downside, the hotel faces the busy Parallel thoroughfare and traffic noise can be a bit much even up on the 8th floor, especially ambulances en route to the local hospital. It's hard to settle down for a good night's sleep with so much activity going on outside. The bedrooms are warm, nicely furnished and very clean, the beds and pillows are comfortable but the hotel lets itself down by skimping on the little things like toiletries. There was no shampoo on the first night of our stay and only one small bottle of bath gel and tiny bar of soap was replaced per day even though two of us were sharing the room. It seemed a bit mean. The biggest disappointment was breakfast. Unlike the staff in the lobby, the male waiters were particularly unfriendly and cheerless, not what you want to deal with first thing the morning. The range of cereals was poor (three types) and often taken away early. The hot food selection (only four choices) never varied in the four days we stayed and was greasy, tepid, and unpleasant. The range of pastries was limited too. We have eaten far better breakfasts in unranked B&Bs than we got in the 4* Universal Hotel and my advice to anyone planning a stay is to save your money and eat breakfast out. We were so put off by the quality of the breakfast, we avoided having dinner in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel central location”
Reviews.Author: Suzpea
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, fabulous hot power shower easy adjustable air con, plus central and easy to reach all Barcelona has to offer especially on a quick week end break, the price was far lower than the over priced La Ramblas hotels for an extra few minutes walk that got you to La Rambla, take a left outside the hotel and walk the street with Palau guell rather than a right especially at night. We found plenty of restaurants around the hotel, using the trip advisor app and was not disapponinted with any. Did not eat in the hotel but all staff, were pleasent and helpful at any request. Would recommend to friends wanting a good resonable price hotel near all Barcelona has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: Phil L
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was comfortable, clean, and reasonably priced, and the breakfast buffet was significant. It is right off the metro, and a short walk to Las Ramblas and the harbor. It's perfect for getting anywhere in Barcelona. There are plenty of places to eat in the immediate vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Place, but the area is a bit questionable”
Reviews.Author: scoa
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband have just returned from a weeks stay at the Barcelo Universal Hotel and I must be honest and say that the hotel is very nice and for a price of £81 per night for room only, it was a good price too for a four star hotel. The rooms have wooden floors which usually make rooms feel a bit cold, but this had very nice lighting in the room and so had quite a cosy feel in the evenings. The time that housekeeping arrives is a bit haphazard, as on a few days we returned for a rest about 3pm, before going out in the evening, and the rooms had not been cleaned and then on two occasions, after late nights, we had a lie in to around 11am, and the housekeeper would be knocking to clean the rooms. Oh well may have been due to staff shortages etc. We did not have breakfast, so could not comment. On one occasion during our return to the hotel late at night, we were approached by a very questionable young man, who started to to get very aggesive with us as we ignored him, and he ended up sort of wrapping himself around my husband, in what we thought was an attempt to either pick pocket him, or bring him to the floor. My husband is a large chap and ended up just throwing the bloke off him. I know this is nothing to do with the hotel and I have not marked them down for it, but you need to be wary of the area late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Dave J
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Barca Universal for a weekend took in Footy match, excellent location near to metro, nou camp at end of line no change, but easy to get any where. Hotel is very clean and staff friendly would use again next time and there will be a next time. Cracking trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the price”
Reviews.Author: Peejdj
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights and it was excellent value for the price. The location is fantastic - five minutes from La Rambla and there's an underground station outside. Arrived at about 11am and was able to check straight into the room and the receptionist offered me a map of the area and also warned about being careful to avoid pickpockets. The room (I was on the fourth floor) was a decent size and very clean and with modern decor. Bathroom was spotless and had a powerful shower. No problem with the air conditioning or noise from outside.There's free internet access on two laptops in reception, although they were a bit slow on occasion. The bar service was quick and friendly. I was room only so didn't try breakfast. Pool was closed for the winter but popped up and it looked like it would be an excellent sun trap with views across the city. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Rasasayang
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here beginning December 2011 for 3 nights, B&B. We got a great rate from Booking.com. On arrivel the receptionist was brilliant, very fast check in and then proceeded to ask if we had been to Barcelona before, we hadn't, so he grabbed a full street map and highlighted all the areas of interest, including where is the best places to eat both during the day and in the evening. So much information explained so easily by him. Our room was on the 5th floor, looking out onto apartments, not a particulary nice view but we didn't pay for this hotel to enjoy the view. The room was very spacious, good sized bed, 2 large wardrobes, small seating area, large en suite bathroom with shower gel etc included.The weekend we were there, the weather was perfect, very warm so we didn't use the heating in the room, in fact we stuck the air con on which was very effective. Where we were was very quiet, even though our room was opposite the lifts, it was very quiet. Oh yes, free wi-fi in the room also. There are no tea/coffee making facilities in the room, so take a kettle, we did and it was great, room service supplied us with mugs and spoons and we also asked for a bath robe for my wife, which they delivered promptly. Breakfast was good enough for what we wanted, though the cooked breakfast was not up to much, but lots fresh fruit, cereal, pastries and tea/coffee and fruit juices. The one thing that makes this hotel stand out is the location in respect of being so close to the metro. I mean, you walk out of the Metro station, and the hotel is only 10 short steps away. From Place Catalunya, get on the green line, head for Zona Universitaria end stop. Get off Metro at stop called Paral-lel and head for exit, when you have gone thru the ticket machines head for exit called Sortida Rda. de Sant Pau. Go up the stairs and there is the hotel right in front of you. Perfect. Opposite the hotel are many bus stops too, if you want to go down to the beach, these are perfect as they take you right there, but be careful, make sure you know where you want to get off and try to count the stops, though all the bus stops are also named. Within a 5-10 min walk is a really good supermarket called Consum. Really well stocked for any provisions you may need.
