Directions: turn right outside of hotel, to large crossroads(only about 2 mins) and head up Ronda De Sant pau, the supermarket is about 10 mins up on your left hand side. La Ramblas is within easy reach from the hotel too, takes about 15 mins from the hotel on foot. We were warned about pickpockets, but we didn't have any trouble. There are lots of Police on foot around the area and you do see many police cars too, so we felt safe. As far as getting to the hotel from the airport is concerned, we caught the metro from the airport to the hotel, which was ok but with luggage, its a bit of a nightmare in rush hour, and down there in the metro it gets very hot. For the return journey, we used the Areo Bus from Place Catalunya. It was 5.50Euros each, it stops at two other stops and then goes right to Terminal 2, perfect for our EasyJet flight back home. All in all, a great weekend trip to Barcelona, and the hotel was fab. When we return to Barcelona we will stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for the price.”
Reviews.Author: zootarts
Reviews.Content: Great staff, nice breakfast, large nice rooms, and close to everything at a good price. What more could you want. And its the only Spain hotel that had free fiwi in the rooms - not just the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently situated for Metro”
Reviews.Author: Carrocat
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right next to a metro stop, which makes access to airport and train stations very convenient - if you don't mind all the lugging of luggage up and down stairs. The hotel is safety conscious, with an army of staff manning the doors and reception desk. Breakfast was included with our Expedia deal and it was great to start the day with such a nutritious banquet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, rooms noisy but reception staff very helpful. Bar staff non exsistant!”
Reviews.Author: Shazmcollins
Reviews.Content: I took my boyfriend to Barcelona for his 30th Birthday on 6th Jan 2012 The hotel overall is a pleasant stay the rooms are spacious beds comfy but noise is an issue and seems to be noisy all the time. I did request a room higher up and I was given a room half way up. After paying for a double bed/room and asking for this on booking last august it was actually disappointing to find it was just two small singles pushed together, although the noise from shower toilet above was most annoying! Walk to la rambla is good 15 minutes, be aware of pick pockets in this area! Can from airport to hotel should be no more than €30. We did try and have dinner in hotel early evening but didn't open till 7:30 and on two attempts sat waiting at the bar for service which didn't come so we left and went into la rambla instead. Opium nightclub down by the port is awesome although fairly expensive, we had the best night in barca there. Tour buses are good although green route is much better than orange! Irish bar temple bar was also very good atmosphere. Restaurant 111 on La Rambla was a good choice!

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Weekend Treat”
Reviews.Author: Missoldham
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night trip to this hotel and great City, had an amazing time, hotel reception staff were brilliant, Christian outstanding friendly service, moved us to a larger room with free champagne. If you are a massive breakfast fan then fill your boots and enjoy the hotels selection for 15 euros, we however went to a cafe round the corner to the right (blue and white)and had toastados and coffee for 4 euros. Def. walk into town no need for a taxi. Stayed at front of hotel which was a bit noisy. Would def stay here again, as central to everything. Taxi costs us 27 euros on way in and 35 on way back ?? ENJOY!!! xx

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Glo281
Reviews.Content: Barcelona Universal Hotel was the best! Location was close to Las Ramblas and a metro stop. Staff were so wonderful to my adult daughter and me. We had dinner at the hotel restaurant on our first night there and the buffet looked on the light side but it was plentiful and delicious. My daughter decided to add some salmon and it was such a huge serving it took both of us to finish it. Sangria was very good. Some evenings, we came back for drinks in the hotel bar and they were so good to us, they brought us snacks to go along with our drinks. The desk staff were very helpful with suggestions and printing our confirmations and tickets. They reserved a cab for our return trip to the airport. There was not anything that we asked for that we did not get.with a smile. The room was excellent. Roomy and well equipped and the beds were comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good, modern hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: RJ_70
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights over New Year 2011/12. The hotel is modern, clean and conveniently located with a Metro station just outside the door, within walking distance of La Rambla. The metro station also serves the funicular to Montjuic Park. Plenty of small, neighbourhood restaurants and tapas bars around. The surrounding neighbourhood is quite mixed though, with some rough areas - best to stick to the main streets rather than the smaller alleys, particularly on the way through to La Rambla. Our room was comfortable, but was on the inside of the hotel, so rather than an outside window had a frosted glass window onto a light well, but this made for quiet nights as we weren't disturbed by the traffic on the street outside. The bed was especially comfortable, the bathroom was clean and well equipped and the heating/air conditioning system worked well. The roof terrace has great views over Barcelona, but, despite the info we got on booking, the pool is closed during winter months (our booking said it was open, but unheated). Our only niggle was that the cleaners didn't reach our room until 3-4pm in the afternoon, just as we tended to be returning from a day's sightseeing for a few hours' rest before heading out for dinner. On 2 days we decided we needed a nap more than the room needed a clean so put the 'do not disturb' card on the door. Unfortunately, that just meant that the reception desk phoned the room to check whether we wanted it cleaned so we were disturbed anyway! One morning we had to report a slight leak from the bathroom ceiling, presumably from the room above and this was sorted out before we got back in the afternoon. There was a good range of food for breakfast, including a selection of fresh fruit, and we enjoyed eating in the restaurant a couple of evenings. There's free internet access in the rooms, but via a cable rather than WiFi. We were able to borrow an ethernet cable from reception. The hotel staff were helpful and attentive and the hotel provided a good base from which to explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great city hotel”
Reviews.Author: jersey45
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Barcelona Universal Hotel for three nights on their special package and had an excellent stay. The package booked with the hotel included a bottle of sparkling wine on arrival ,breakfast and late checkout, good value for money. The rooms were very clean and tidy and the beds were comfortable.We were in a room overlooking the main street but we did not find the street noise very bad as the double glazing was adequate. The breakfast was good and staff very friendly, as were all the staff in the hotel We had evening meals in the hotel on a couple of nights and it was good value compared to many restraurants locally.It was a buffet meal and there was plenty of choice. Superb location, would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond our expectations - Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: Aaron H
Reviews.Content: I booked this Hotel as I took my partner to Barcelona for her birthday, we stayed 3 nights and I cannot rate the staff highly enough. They upgraded our room upon arrival upon learning it was a birthday treat. We had champagne delivered to our room for free (thank you so much) The breakfast was very nice, a mix of hot and cold options with tea/coffee/juices etc. Every morning we asked the reception staff for tips and advice on where to visit etc and they were always happy to help and advise. The room was very nice, cleaned to the highest level every day, fresh towels etc. Excellent shower in the room and very comfy beds. We were staying at the back of the hotel on the 8th floor, so had great views over Barcelona. The reception staff recommended a couple restaurants for evening meals during our stay, a tapas place off La Rambla and an Italian, both very nice. If you are looking for a centrally based (10-20 mins walk to most major attractions), comfortable, clean hotel with staff who speak English and are more than happy to help I would highly recommend the Hotel Barcelona Universal. One point to note - the rooms do not have a kettle so if like ourselves you need a nice cup of tea at the end of the day, I would take a travel kettle and a few tea bags (dont forget the adaptor) I looked through dozens of hotels and reviews when booking this short city break as I wanted it to be perfect (being a birthday present)... some reviews have commented on the area around the hotel, the noise, the temperature in the rooms etc... I would like to reassure anyone thinking of booking this hotel, the area is absolutely fine, no worse than any street in any town in the UK. We felt safe walking back to the hotel late into the evening.. our room was at the back of the hotel and was very quiet, we had large windows which we could open, but didnt feel the need as the temperature was perfect. For a short city break, this hotel and its staff are perfect. If like us you are visiting Barcelona to see and appreciate the many amazing sights you will not be disappointed. We crammed in as much as we could, all the Gaudi sights are just spectacular, we would HIGHLY recommend Casa Bitlo, it really is an absolute must, if you are going to see any of Gaudi's works, see this place. Also Museu Picaso is amazing. Barcelona is a beautiful city with so much to do... this hotel is perfect to enable that. A really great hotel, one I would definitely recommend and stay at again if I was returning to Barcelona :)

Reviews.Title: “Great value !”
Reviews.Author: Jajabor1991
Reviews.Content: After a week in southern Spain when we arrived in Hotel Universal on Christmas day, we did not really have high expectations. This hotel totally made our day. While they are not the best looking hotel , they are a great value. For the price you pay, their rooms are well maintained and every room has ample toiletries provided in case you have forgotten some. There was absolutely no view, but we were there to see Barcelona, not stay at the hotel! The front desk was especially helpful. They helped us plan our trips and provided names of restaurants open on christmas day. Location wise, it could not get more perfect. We were walking distance from Las Ramblas and it was perfectly safe to go anywhere you wanted at any time of the day. If you would like to visit Barcelona and find a good clean hotel that is close to Las Ramblas this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: durie
Reviews.Content: Loved Barcelona. Hotel was clean and great views from roof top pool. We had a meal at the hotel but nothing special and a bit overpriced, cheaper to eat out. I would recommend this hotel for location and would love to visit Barcelona again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: alex_sho1986
Reviews.Content: -in the city center -next to the metro station (L3 - the green one) -friendly staff -very, very good breakfast -big rooms, clean bathroom and new furniture -10 minutes of walking until La Rambla

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona Universal Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mandy_price
Reviews.Content: The reception staff were very friendly and helpful. On arrival we were given a room over the hotel entrance and street which was extremely noisy, from the road and also the doors opening and closing. We were offered an internal room which was much quieter, however, it was very hot and stuffy, with no fresh air. There was an occasional unpleasant smell in the room and the soundproofing is not great - you can hear people in the rooms next door and above. The lighting was also too dim in the room, although in the bathroom it was fine. The rooms are well decorated and the shower and bath was good. Breakfast was good and again the staff were welcoming and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: lee2806old
Reviews.Content: easy walking distance from las ramblas (10 mins) ..go left out of the hotel and then left again at the end of the block...beware dont go the other way (right & right again)because you will walk through the red light/druggie area !! rooms nice and clean ,staff nice...

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel, Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: Angelica01uk
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor for a New Years break. I was a bit concerned about the possibility of noise from the road so e-mailed the hotel and requested a room at the back which they obliged. The room was in the corner of the hotel at the back, overlooking some quite rough looking residences but there was absolutely no noise from them. The only noise we experienced was from the room above us. We could hear noises of furniture being dragged, the toilet(!) being used and shower. The sound proofing between the floors really isn't great but wasn't really a problem. Luckily the people above us weren't up all night disturbing us. The room was modern with a huge bed (a bit hard but just my preference). Everything was spotlessly clean. The wifi was OK - intermittent and weak but let us do what we needed (look up restaurants etc.) The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful with excellent English (puts us Brits to shame). The location of the hotel is excellent. It cost around €30 for a taxi from the airport. There is a metro station right outside. I recommend getting a T-10 ticket for the metro - It costs a little over €8 and gives you 10 trips on the metro, bus, trams etc. (each trip can last up to 1hr 15mins). The ticket can be used by multiple people too so you can pass the ticket back to someone else to use. The hotel is about a 5 minute walk from La Rambla down a very dodgy looking street. Wouldn't like to walk down there on my own at night... about 10 minutes from Port Vell. Lots of warnings about pickpockets everywhere including in the hotel. I would recommend using the hotel safe to lock up your valuables instead of carrying them with you in the streets of Barcelona. We found some nice restaurants in the vicinity (thanks to the wifi in the hotel and the trip advisor app on my phone). There are loads of options. The Japanese restaurant next door is OK. There was one which was particularly nice a 2 minute walk away: http://www.tripadvisor.co.uk/Restaurant_Review-g187497-d1850248-Reviews-Restaurante_August-Barcelona_Catalonia.html. I would also recommend getting down to the Olympic Port for nice restaurants on the beach. A bit pricey but nice location. All in all I would definitely recommend this hotel and when I return to Barcelona I wouldn't hesitate in staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a very good location.”
Reviews.Author: MrsSCraig
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. It's got a underground station right outside the hotel door. So it's very easy to get around. The main strip and marina are about a ten minute walk away. Both with lots of places to eat. We requested an early check in which we did not receive. When we got our room it had a terrible view of a shanty looking town. We just kept the curtain closed. The breakfast was not great. Same food everyday, mostly a cold buffet of unknown food. Only one person was serving and therefore had to wait a while for a cup of tea. As part of the package we received a bottle of bubbly. It ended up down the sink :-( As it was undrinkable. It's a good hotel location wise but I had a bad feeling someone had been in our room at the safe while we were out for the evening. Thankfully we had nothing in it. Therefore I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: nicnan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the weekend before Christmas for my partner's 40th. Got a great rate, upgraded to a suite and more complementary Cava than we could drink! Reception staff were fantastic, helped with all our requests and always smiling. Hotel location is great - we walked to most places (take good shoes!). There is a good tapas place and a cool bar behind the hotel, if you're looking for something relaxed. Only thing is that the Wifi didn't work in our room on the top floor, but did in the restaurant and lobby, and there are computer terminals outside the rooms anyway, so it was OK for us. Would definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “Good but could be better......”
Reviews.Author: Jaggybean
Reviews.Content: Ideal location for Las Ramblas, but as for the Hotel, it could have been a bit better.... the staff were great, the rooms were very small, we had paid extra for a larger room, which we were very glad we did as our family that had arrived from France were placed in a room where the bathroom door opened onto the bed!!! you could not walk round the bed without touching the walls.... horrid. however, our room was slightly better but as for value for money.... search else where. breakfast, ok.... but needs looked at the customer service... staff not approachable for a cup and saucer - which should be standard!? and should not need to be asked for on the table... felt as if I had intruded on thier time??

Reviews.Title: “WAY BEYOND my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Sean H
Reviews.Content: I'll just start off by saying that this hotel is one of the best hotels I've ever stayed. For those who are finding a hotel which isn't that expensive with an average pricetag, this hotel suits you dearly! I arrived in Barcelona with my family for an 8 days trip. To be honest, my expectations for this hotel was way lower considering the price but I was utterly wrong. Firstly, it has the best location if you're getting anywhere by train, mostly because the metro station's situated directly outside, not even a 1 min walk away from the main door! Also, every tourist attraction such as La Rambla, Catalunya or even Park Guell takes only 15 minutes AT MOST to get there! Fantastically convenient. Secondly, we were greeted by a staff at the front desk who had the friendliest personality. His service gave us the most comfortable stay throughout our 8 days in Barcelona. Thirdly, and most possibly the highlight, would be the room we were given. Not to mention the acoustic music playing in both our room and the bathroom, it had a small living room plus a cozy-sized bedroom easily able to accommodate a family of 3. I guess 4 wouldn't be a problem as well! If you're looking for any internet services, you can easily find 2 computers readily available a few steps away from the lift. It's that convenient. Finally, if you're the type of traveller who grabs a late dinner after completing all your sightseeing for the day, i guess this hotel suits you the most provided it has 2 supermarkets just a stone's throw away and along the street, you can easily find 5-6 restaurants selling Spanish local delicacies. We were really thankful when we found out those restaurants actually opened till 2am in the morning, and trust me, those restaurants had a fantastic service as well! I guess I haven't touched on any bad points of this hotel because there's absolutely none to begin with! A complete family hotel fantastically suited for your choice and I am really thankful for without it, my trip to Barcelona wouldn't have been that enjoyable as well~

Reviews.Title: “An excellent friendly hotel.”
Reviews.Author: CasperUk
Reviews.Content: This is a fab hotel for visiting Barcelona. rooms are clean ,modern ,spacious with all the facilities you need. Good range of toiletries in the bathroom, excellent water pressure in shower, very little noise from other rooms and comfy beds.The breakfast was excellent with good selection and a lovely bright restaurant. The reception staff were very helpful and were particularly accomodating when, despite being fully booked they allowed us to keep our room later as our daughter was unwell.The location is excellent as it is only a short walk to Las ramblas. I would definitely recommend it. The bar is very reasonably priced but as only a small hotel is not staffed all the time, though the reception staff soon send for someone.

Reviews.Title: “Clean large room, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aniweta
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a few days around Christmas 2011. The rooms are very clean and nice and the hotel is a handy location - a short walk to La Ramblas or the port and there are many eating places nearby. The metro station is right outside. There is a lovely roof terrace and pool. There is wifi but it didnt always work, although there are laptops downstairs in the lobby for guest use and they were often free. We paid (15 euros) for breakfast one morning and it was a very good breakfast with alot of choice. Rooms that face on to the main road at the front of the hotel are rather noisy. Safes in the rooms are very handy so you dont have to carry valuables with the famous Barcelona pickpockets (which we didnt have a problem with but we were very careful.) Most of the time the customer service was good and very helpful. (We did have one instance of disappointing service. Understandably, because of separate bookings, the cleaners must have thought we had checked out of one of two of our rooms and before they realised threw away some sundry belongings and opened the safe and left it open. Nothing was missing from the safe, including cash, but we didnt get the sundry items (toiletries and magazines) back, nor did we get an apology despite raising the issue with the front desk twice. However this was the exception rather than the rule because before that happened we felt the customer service was wonderful - it was such a pity that it happened and let down the whole stay.)

Reviews.Title: “From Singapore”
Reviews.Author: HOKY818
Reviews.Content: The Barcelona Universal Hotel is truly a great hotel. For 2 main reasons - the first being the hotel itself. It is neat and clean and large enough to accommodate even a family of 3! The staff are friendly and very helpful in giving directions and so forth. And there is easy access to internet services just down on the reception level (though the room does not offer). And ther price is decent for a europe hotel (note: Good hostel cost almost as much)... only around Euro60 per person (we have 3 persons, all family members in the room). If you are NOT looking for major facilities like spa in the hotel etc (don't believe there are any but i may be wrong cos i didn't fiind out, and btw, we also didn't use their breakfast so no comment), all the other above reasons are good enough to make this hotel great! ... And the 2nd MOST IMPORTANT reason is the locale. EXCELLENT EXCELLENT EXCELLENT! Regardless of what others might say - trust us on this...the hotel is very conveniently located. Seldom in europe will you have such great location for hotels. The subway is just a few steps away from the hotel, and so are the restaurants (till 2am in the morning!!! And no prob eating there cos no worry for safety or pickpockets as the hotel is like just next door!). No doubt the location is not the most 'upper class'...it is nonetheless the MOST accessible, to everthing and everywhere in fact. By walking - no problem to the main streets like Rambla or Catalunya. And if you take the subway, it is just a few steps away as i said. It is so convenient as it is central to all the major attractions as well as to the train stations to take to the outskirts of Barcelona. As long as you are careful (alert etc), pickpockets will not have any advantage. We came close to 1 or 2, at the stairs of the station outside the hotel. But cos the hotel is so close to the station and there is security just at the entrance 24 hours a day, we merely hopped back to the hotel from the station as if nothing mattered. So, as long as you are careful and alert, no problem at all. It happens in all Europe countries or even Asian countries. Luck also perhaps play a part. So just be careful and you will be fine! But in terms of hotel wise, this is a GREAT HOTEL!!! They even have music and songs in the bathroom!!! Don't miss it when you next visit Barcelona. JohnH from Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel. Shame about the pickpocket”
Reviews.Author: suggs99
Reviews.Content: The Barcelona Universal Hotel is a really lovely hotel,. This was my first time in Barcelona and was excited about it. It seems there is a real pickpocket problem and true to form this was found to be the case within 2 hours of check in at the hotel. In spite of knowing the potential problems and my partner only using a small shoulder bag that was worn across the body, it still went missing during a walk, presumably the strap cut and away they went. Fortunately the handbag contained only mobile pphone and a camera, both, relatively, easy to replace. Back to the Hotel. First impressions, very good. Used the Airport bus from terminal 2 and got off at PL. Espanya, straight 20 minute walk down Av. Paral.lel to the hotel. Check in, straight forward and easy. Room well laid out and all amenities’ to hand. Apart from breakfast, we did not use the hotel for much else, but the breakfast options were comprehensive and of good quality. Service was good, pots of coffee for Breakfast was a good sign, and all people polite and friendly. One minor point, when I mentioned at reception about the theft I was merely pointed to a sign explaining that Barcelona pickpockets are the ‘best in the world’ Gee thanks! The surrounding area, is a little rough, but generally seemed ok. I am sure though that single woman might feel a little wary. The low light of the trip was a drunk woman, deciding that the middle of the street was the ideal place to have a wee! The Rambla is 10/15 minute away and the Rambla del Mar, by the Christopher Columbus monument is about 15 minutes away also. We did walk to Sagrada Famila, not for the faint hearted as it took around 90 minutes each way. It was really worth the walk. In fact we did plenty of walking including along the beach and water areas and to Port Olympic. Plenty of food options around, Starbucks seems to have set up camp here, not such a bad thing, as I love a ‘bucket’ of coffee :-) But all restaurants and cafes we used were very good. Special mentions to Dunnes Irish bar and Princesa 23, good food and lovely evenings. All in all a good trip and successful, except for the blister - lol

Reviews.Title: “great location, outstanding service, spotless rooms”
Reviews.Author: Bluebird217
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a day before our cruise and booked the room 3 months in advance. When we arrived, we found they had upgraded us for free!. They emailed helpful info before we arrived for the tourist buses and it was a personal email from the concierge. I just can't enough about this staff! We had a corner room and although it was raining and we were jet lagged, we really loved the room: nicely decorated room, quiet location and there are computers with desks just down the hall in a private alcove. There's restaurants galore around the hotel and the hop-on hop-off bus is just 5 blocks away. GREAT PLACE!!

Reviews.Title: “Football and Tapas”
Reviews.Author: nickc007
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Europark hotel last year and really thought it was decent. To my surprise Universal is in the same chain at the Europark, except its at the bottom end of La Rambla. Directly outside the hotel is a metro station, this is on the same line as Barcelona Nou Camp. Just follow the crowd! The metro is a great way of getting around and really cheap. Be careful about walking to and from La Rambla at night, the walk is about 10 minutes but you have to go through some bars. Quite a few police around which is nice to see. I don't really go to barcelona now other than to see the football, however this time I went on the cable car, its a bit of the con, just pay one way and then walk back. Taxi from airport to hotel 35 euros, from hotel to airport 21 euros!! You can get a bus from the airport to Espanyol roundabout which is on the same road as the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: BCGlos
Reviews.Content: Great location, friendly staff, fabulous room, great breakfast, we have no complaints at all. We got train from airport to Barcelona Sants, then metro direct to front of hotel, cost €4,45 each. If we return to barcelona, and hopefully we will, we would definitely stay here again hotel very clean and modern. The only thing to note is that there are no tea making facilities in rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Second time at hotel and still very good”
Reviews.Author: nurse2110
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 8 years ago and we were expecting it to be slightly dated, however we wern't! The hotel is very clean and modern and the reception staff very helpful. Location is very good, metro stop outside the hotel and a 10 min walk to the centre of town. A taxi from the airport will cost you approx 32-37 euro's, we took this option getting from the airport but used the areobus on the way back which cost's just 5 euro's, reception will be able to tell you about the bus. The rooms are a good size with a comfy bed, TV, Mini Bar (Stocked), air con, safe, telephone and lot's of toiletries, the only thing it lacks is tea and coffee making facilities, however there are plenty of cafes nearby where you can get a good coffee. The breakfast was ample with a selection of hot foods, cold meats, cheese, bread, rolls, juice, cakes, cereal, fruit and pasteries. Make sure you visit the food market, amazing. We went on the 3rd December and had great weather, sunny and 21 degrees.

Reviews.Title: “great staff, very clean & spacious, good location”
Reviews.Author: talluk
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located, as I was advised a short walk from Las Ramblas…through an ‘interesting’ part of town. However, as we were a group, there was no bother and we enjoyed our stay. The hotel was easily found by the taxi driver, and the receptionists were very helpful. There was a little confusion of the payment, and one of the rooms not being ready, but this was all sorted out smoothly. The rooms were very spacious, extremely clean and for the price, good value. My room was on the first floor overlooking the busy street…however there was no noise heard from the room. A/C worked well. In short, despite a group arriving, there was no problem with check in or out, rooms were clean, spacious, beds very comfortable. Not a 5 star hotel, but not 5 star prices either. I would recommend this as a base for exploring Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: Butti18
Reviews.Content: Good location on top of Metro station Parallel, walking distance to Las Ramblas and a few half decent restaurants outside. Good breakfast included in price, room almost too large. Tip never eat at Ramblas one block away from the strip you find nice restaurants with good food and much cheaper than on Ramblas. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: bill r
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd time we stayed at this hotel and each and every time it has NOT disappointed us. The staff is excellent and our room has been outstanding and very quiet. The location is the best to get to anywhere in the city you may want to visit. The metro is right outside the front door and the hotel is within walking distance to Las Ramblas. I can't say enough about this hotel other then "Try it, you will like it"!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and good location!”
Reviews.Author: Larry1968
Reviews.Content: Good location. Close to La Ramblas and city center. Clean neighbourhood. Large rooms and clean. Front office staff helpful. Fairly new hotel...would estimate 5-10 yrs. Some good large 3 pax rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: Bickest
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Barcelona Universal Hotel one night before our cruise and one night after and the place was great. The rooms were so clean and quiet. The food at the restaurant was great and the staff were so helpful and friendly. The location is a short taxi ride to the cruise terminal and the metro stop is right outside the front door. It is only a 10 minute walk to the Las Ramblas. We will definitely stay here again on our next visit to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: infla
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good part of town and convenient to public transportation to the airport and elsewhere. It is also a good place for a pre or post cruise experience since it is easy to get to the dock as well. The rooms are good size and the bathrooms are exceptional by European standards. Having a towel warmer was particularly enjoyable since we were there during a damp, cool time and the hot shower was terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Nice if noisy”
Reviews.Author: Monika218
Reviews.Content: We had a weekend stay with some friends from Germany. The location is excellent for our tourism purposes and the staff is very friendly, helpful and welcoming. The rooms are decent size and very clean. Total minus point was the rooms were facing main road Avenida Paral-lel and the traffic noise is terrible. The windows do not seem to keep any of it out! Breakfast was ok we didn't eat any other meals. Our german friends felt it was if anything a lower quality 4 stars. Why aren't there any toilet brushes? The staff had no answer for that one. I would go back there anytime, always with a room out the back.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasent Stay will be back!”
Reviews.Author: sandy24Ireland
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights, had a lovely time, hotel is lovley with nice big bathroom and bedroom as well, requested a quite room at the back of the hotel this was not a problem, The food seems to be ok, though we didnt eat at the hotel(* price was exc breaky), less than a minute walk to the metro to take you anywhere you want to go. hotel staff were very friendly (though i think it was depending on who was on at the desk) but if there was a problem i would have complained)! 10 minute walk to the lovely port( at nights its all lit up) and beside the port is Las Ramblas the main street whis is busy but great buzz abotu the place. lovely little sun roof at the top which gives great views at night time, wil deffo be back

Reviews.Title: “Good base of operations but rather one dimensional”
Reviews.Author: Michele_Pope
Reviews.Content: This is a decent hotel in a good location. The room was large, the bathroom incredibly clean and the price just right. It lacks any sort of warmth and charm which made me feel I could look out of my window and see a US Interstate flowing by, as I do on my business trips. The staff who wait in the lobby were a mystery to me as they never helped with our bags. Perhaps they were there to make sure the outside did not come inside. The immediate neighborhood is somewhat gritty but with a short metro ride or walk you could be anywhere to be in Barcelona. My other complaints would be that the room key became de-magnetized daily and it was a pain to have to go back downstairs to get it reset. I also have never in my life used such a poorly working "business center". The Internet connection could not handle two people at once (on both of the computers in the "center"). The frustration at having to wait almost 10 minutes for my airline page to come up so I could print my boarding pass (ha...no printer to be found but that's another paragraph) drove me nuts.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, charmless business hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JZ100
Reviews.Content: No huge complaints, just lacked warmth and charm. Staff a bit attitudy. Would stay if I had to but hotel Jazz was much better for feel and location.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel in great position”
Reviews.Author: corkheadIsleOfWight
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights in November 2011 at this hotel. Situated in Paral-lel (only 5 min down side road from La Ramblas and 5 min from sea). Hotel excellent..helpful staff, new decor, good breakfast. Had bad weather so ate at hotel..14.50 euro for buffet meal (hot and cold food, dessert..usually had soup, salad, pasta and cheesecake). Also bar in lobby for light bites. Got pack from reception for hop on-hop off circular buses..gives you a reduction. Visited Sangrada Familia, Casa Battlo and Palas Guell (latter at Ramblas end of connecting road from Paral-lel)..all wonderful. Can get reductions for entrance fees to many popular sights with circular bus tickets (saved us about £10). Would go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for exploring a great city!”
Reviews.Author: princess92Ireland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights at the start of November and could not fault the hotel the metro is only outside the door! The staff were amazing and very helpful from the moment we walked in the door, even though we arrived a few hours before check in it was no problem to drop our bags and go off to look around. When we arrived back we didn't even have to tell them our names again they had everything ready. It was also no problem getting are boarding passes printed when we were checking out. The room was a great size, very clean and the bed was very comfy. We were on the 8th floor to the front and the noise was not an issue, its no worse than any other city. The bathroom was big with plenty of complementary extras. The breakfast was great with a wide selection of both hot and cold with plenty available as it was constantly being refreshed. As for the rest of the hotel, the roof has great views of the city and the bar is great for a drink in the evening, the barmen were very nice and made sure to ask if we wanted anything else before they closed at night. If you want any information on anywhere the receptionists are great and more than happy to help! As for people saying the area wasn't great at night, we didn't notice anything wrong with it, as long as you walk with a purpose anywhere in Barcelona seemed fine to us! TIP: Take advantage of the metro it's great for getting around, we got a barcelona card and we could recommend it highly enough!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: imf54
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights at the Barcelona Universal Hotel in early November. The hotel is well located, just a 10 minute walk from La Rambla, and the Paral-lel Metro situation is literally outside the front door. The hotel was very clean and quiet, and the rooms are exactly as shown in the photos. The rooms are a little small by North American standard, but comfortable and well equipped. There was even a bidet and a heated towel rack in the bath room. There are inexpensive cafes for breakfast right across the street. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great time for us all.”
Reviews.Author: Peggy L
Reviews.Content: My husband,sis in law and a friend enjoyed staying at this hotel. It was clean and well appointed. Loved the bathroom and all the space we had in the room. It was nice and quiet in our room. Comfy beds and enjoyed having two chairs to sit, talk,and sip wine. Their restaurant looked nice but we did not use it. The restaurant did however let us use wine glasses and a knife to cut bread and cheese.The staff was very helpful. Thanks Fernando:) for your help! They kept our luggage in a safe place so we could start our adventure in Barcelona. The metro was so easy to use and came out right in front of hotel...super convenient. We loved the restaurant right around the corner and went there many times. Great Sangria! Can't wait to come back again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Homebase and Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: genesis73
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 7 days until 11/11/11. My friend and I arrrived in Barcelona at 6am and were thrilled to be able to check into our room at 8am. The front desk were very helpful and gave us our choice of a courtyard room which was quiet and darker or a front room with street views; we opted for the quiet courtyard view. The room had 2 single beds which were seperated by a small table which was perfect for a girls trip. The room was large and very clean with wood lamanent floor and a tile bath. The beds were very comfortable with cozy bedding. Housekeeping did an excellent job with cleaning the rooms using steam cleaning to clean the floors. There is a restaurant on the 1st floor which had a good breakfast spread of hot and cold offerings, juices, and coffee/tea for 15 euros. The staff were all very helpful and friendly and spoke good English. The only downside was the poor internet which often didn't work. The hotel is a short walk to many places with the Metro stop right out front. A great location to get anywhere you want to visit without dealing with heavy tourist traffic. Would certainly recommend to others and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: dupshall
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Barcelona Universal hotel for 6 nights in late September and found it to be quite satisfactory. Perhaps not a hotel we have booked based solo on the reviews from this site Expedia or Booking.com, but as we were there during the city's big festival (La Merce) hotel choice were limited. The registration and checkout was quick and effortless, rooms were very clean and and generally a good size for Europe. The staff was pleasant and helpful and spoke good english. The breakfast buffet did not change while we there and offered limited choices, as such it grew a little stale after six morning, but not something that concerned our group greatly. The hotel is located on a very busy street and is within 10 to 15 minutes walk of La Ramba depending upon the route taken and 20 minutes from Montjuic district. There are a number of tourist restaurants in the area, but most of the better ones are little further away. Even though the hotel is on a busy street and our rooms were facing the street no one seem bother by street noise. All in all our stay at Barcelona Universal was quite pleasant and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, thanks to the lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: DaynaDane
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the first week in October and loved it. Great location, great hotel, and most impressed with ALL of the hotel staff. The guys at the front desk were very nice and helpful. We were set up a few nights with dinner reservations as well as given great suggestions for food and nightlife. Thanks, we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel and in a great location”
Reviews.Author: rickyticky
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading the reviews on trip advisor and it exceeded our expectations. We were on floor 9 and our room was fantastic, very modern and comfortable. Our terms included breakfast which was a very generous selection of hot and cold food and lovely fruit juices. We also had dinner in the hotel one evening, buffet style help yourself to starters and sweets and choose your main course from the menu. This was good value for money the prices ranged from 19 - 23 euros per person for all 3 courses. The hotel reception staff were brilliant and exceptionally helpful, they gave us with all the information we needed to find our way around Barcelona. They provide you with maps and clear directions to all the main tourist attractions. We brought vouchers at the reception for the tourist bus, which reduced the overall price of the tickets. The metro is right outside the hotel and the reception staff advised us of the best value deal for our requirements. We also booked our tickets for the Sagrada Familia Cathedral using the reception computer and printer, this saved us having to join a very long queue when we got there the next day. For pre-printed tickets you go to the box in front of the place selling tickets and just scan the bar code on your print out ticket and go straight in. Whilst at the Sagrada Familia it is also well worth going down into the crypt which is like a type of museum displaying the history of the cathedral.There are many bars and restaurants around the hotel at reasonable prices, and a few supermarkets within 5 mins walk. You can walk to La Ramblas and the Gothic Area in about 10 minutes. The Port Vell is also close by and we walked to the beach one day which took about 30 mins. We would definately recommend this hotel for the service, facilities and very convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate well located good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: drewedmin999
Reviews.Content: Had high expectations of this hotel and they were met. Room was as clean as you could get, bed, a double (2 singles pushed together!) was v v comfortable, air con brilliant, bathroom perfect. Brekkie was nice-good selection of fresh juices, hot and cold meats, cheese, cakes, breads, cereals, all nice and you never felt they were taking short cuts. Booked this on easytobook.com as a mystery 4 star hotel and it was worth the gamble--well located 20 metres from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: EmEs
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel before our cruise and it was a good find. The location is only about 10 minutes from the pier terminal and good walking distance from the water. The room was clean and sleek. There is a small but active bar in the lobby and a great place to meet people. The hotel staff is very helpful, and you cannot go wrong with a stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Denise1003
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three days. The hotel was very clean, service excellent and staff very accommodating, always willing to assist with directions, suggestions for restaurants, etc.The hotel is within 15 minutes walk of La Ramblas and the harbour where the monument to Christopher Columbus is located. A great Flemenco show is also within walking distance. Reservations for the show can be made at check in time. The cafes within minutes of the hotel offered good food at reasonable prices. Also much cheaper to wine and dine here than on La Ramblas. I recommend this hotel to everyone and will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, value, location!”
Reviews.Author: EatonsNeckDen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are staying here for a long weekend and this hotel is perfect. The staff is friendly, the rooms are really nice and clean (not too big, not too small), the location is perfect for us because the metro stop is feet from the hotel entrance, La Rambla is within a 10 minute walk. Would definitely recommend and we would stay here again! The immediate surrounding area is slightly shady, but then again I am not walking around alone. Be aware if you are solo.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience.”
Reviews.Author: agrimac
Reviews.Content: Well appointed hotel only 600 metres from the foot of Las Ramblas, so ideally situated for walkers,with the marinas area close by as well. Very helpful front desk staff, particularly Francisco, for whom nothing was too much trouble. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Really good choice of Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jingsabove
Reviews.Content: After reading Tripadvisor reports we stayed here for 2 nights whilst touring around France & Spain in July. Needed somewhere with car parking space & this Hotel was one of the few in the city that had it's own parking area underneath the Hotel. We also booked directly with the Hotel & it was very easy to do. The Hotel itself is in a really good location with a 15 minute walk to the main Ramblas area, although there are bars & restaurants close to the Hotel too. The guy in Reception who dealt with my booking was lovely. His english was great & he was very efficient & friendly (pity I can't remember his name - he had longish hair & a beard!). The room we were given was massive & really nicely decorated. The bathroom was lovely too & everything was mega clean. We overlooked the street below & although this was a nice feature we found out that late at night it was a very busy street & that the locals don't go to bed until about 4.00am at the weekend! Despite the double glazing we could still hear the laughter & chatter into the early hours & would have probably been better with a rear facing room. The Hotel had a small roof top pool & the views over the city from up there were pretty cool. The breakfast was ideal with a small selection of hot items & a wide selection of cold buffet items available. We paid €324.97 (this includes VAT) for a double room for 2 nights stay & felt it was worth the money. Yes, there are cheaper Hotels around the area, but you get what you pay for! Would definitely recommend this Hotel & would use again if we ever go back to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for a long weekend”
Reviews.Author: HandJDale
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights with our 12 & 15 year old daughters having read the reviews on trip advisor and were not disappointed. Prior to our arrival we emailed the hotel asking for two quiet rooms together at the back of the hotel and our allocated rooms were ideal. The rooftop pool was a little on the cold side (but not surprising for the end of November) but it was lovely to be able to sit outside and read a book by the poolside. The breakfasts were adequate, but not really up to English 4 star standard, although the fresh fruit was delicious. We would have liked some tea/coffee making facilities in our rooms but this was really the only thing we could fault the hotel on - all staff were polite and friendly Abd the place was very clean. It was useful to be able to leave our bags at the hotel on the morning of our departure so we could do some last minute shopping. We found the taxis very reasonable for 4 people travelling together - almost the same cost as the metro (which is bang outside the hotel) Must see/do - Segway tour of Barcelona - fantastic! Sagrada familia - awesome! Flamenco dancing at 'el tablao Carmen - have the tapas menu - fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “I love a beautiful bathroom! lol!”
Reviews.Author: mzbuttons
Reviews.Content: I must say I absolutely loved this hotel. We were here for one night after two weeks of traveling throughout the Eastern Mediterranean. The style of the hotel is just my style; clean lines, modern furniture but nice amenities. I loved the towel warmer and bidet. The shower was roomy; basically I could live in the bathroom. I LOVED it. If I could renovate my bathroom at home it would look like this one. (We girls love our bathrooms) We were on the sixth floor, corner room away from the street. We had not AC noise, no street noise but no view. It was perfect for us. We did not go to the hotel restaurant so I have no review of that. The location of the hotel is great in the sense that you can get to anywhere pretty quickly. We had already spent a day in Barcelona earlier in our two-week holiday and Google Maps was absolutely perfect for getting around on the train. The hotel is close to the train so venture! Las Rambles is also a close walk, though we had enough of Las Rambles by that time. Location aside, I must say the neighborhood is a bit iffy. It’s very easy to accidentally start walking down a street that doesn’t seem safe. My guy is a pretty big guy so I very rarely feel unsafe, but if I had been with my girls I would have been a bit concerned. Also, the café’s around the hotel aren’t great; we ended up yelping and finding a great restaurant not too far, but we never would have found it just walking in the neighborhood. I must also note that we got a deal on the hotel, which could mean I’m a little biased. We purchased it as a part of our flight package (yes, just for one night) and paid $30 for the night. I love a deal! Just to add the staff was great; there are definitely English speakers on staff. The Wi-Fi worked perfectly and was a well-welcomed relief after relying primarily on 3g data for the past two weeks (my phone bill was crazy when I got back). They also loaned us a volt converter for free; which was nice considering it was the only hotel in our two-week stay to do so. I didn't give it five stars because we were only there one night.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: plentysuncream
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights in September with friends , Good location not far from the harbour or the Ramblers , The hotel had a lovely roof top pool with plenty beds and towels provided although Tommy brennan thought all the beds had been reserved by early birds !! too many drinks Tommy me lad , The breakfast was ok and we used plenty of the restaurants nearby

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in marginal neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: HoffersHawaii
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews. The hotel is very modern with nice amenities. We were in a superior room on the 9th floor so we had very spacious accommodations. I did peek into a room on a lower floor and they were much smaller. The breakfast buffet is ok and I would recommend as there aren't a lot of alternatives in the immediate area...one bakery 5 doors away. Based on the people at breakfast, the hotel appears to be favored by European travelers, rather than Americans. For a first time visitor to Barcelona, I would have preferred to be closer to Las Ramblas. The Universal is a good 20 minute walk through not so nice neighborhoods to get to the main restaurant and shopping areas. Bottom line, this a good value hotel if you don't mind walking a bit. There are other hotels in the chain which are more centrally located for tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: meanddan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Universal Hotel before the start of our Med Cruise. The Hotel is walking distance to Las Ramblas and the metro station is less than a 1/2 block from the front door of the hotel. The room was a good size compared to most European Hotel rooms and the Included breakfast was VERY GOOD. We shared a cab to the port with another couple and with tip was $10 euro per couple. We would especially like to THANK Pablo Perez for all the information and for making our stay so special.

Reviews.Title: “A well-appointed hotel in a convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: Wiltsvisitor
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a three night break having read positive reviews by previous guests. We were not disappointed and found the hotel clean, in good decorative order and with spacious rooms and bathrooms. I was in a triple room which did not have a window to the outside but overlooked an internal shaft/courtyard. This did not concern us as there was no street noise and we didn't spend time in the room during the day.The only criticism was that the sofa bed which I slept on was a bit uncomfortable. We enjoyed going up onto the roof and taking in the views of the city. The hotel is almost adjacent to the metro station and we were able to take the funicular railway from there up to Montjuic. The cable car to the castle is located next to the funicular station. Staff on the hotel front desk were helpful and mostly spoke good English. We were able to purchase a pack for the open top bus tour which gave us a slight discount on the full price. On leaving the hotel we asked for a taxi to be booked. However, we were told that taxis were coming along all of the time so it was not necessary to book ahead and staff would help us to hail a taxi. There was no surcharge (as stated by a previous poster) and it cost about 25 Euros to the airport for three of us plus luggage. This was the same of the cost to the hotel. We were warned by reception staff not to eat at the local cafes which are in a row next to the hotel. Unfortunately, we had already been to the Cafe Espanol and been charged for bread we didn't order and 22 Euros per litre of sangria. I can definitely recommend this hotel. As we booked well ahead, it was very good value and we had a very substantial breakfast for half price.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Convenient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: peterctotnes
Reviews.Content: Helpful staff, smart, attractive room, good breakfast and very convenient for Central Barcelona and located beside the Parallel Metro Line station providing easy access to any location in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, fantastic city”
Reviews.Author: EssexBetty64
Reviews.Content: 3 nights in October. Arrived early on the Monday morning and the hotel let us leave our suitcase in a locked room for the day. Went off to explore the city on foot. Strolled down La Rambla and looked around the food market then off down to the Port. Arrived back at the hotel about 3.00 pm. Our hotel room (719) was on an upper floor as I had requested by e-mail the previous week. Left again about 5.00 pm for a stroll before dinner. Initially felt a little unsure of some of the side streets (as I would do in any city) but never saw any trouble - best route from La Rambla is Nou de Rambla. Felt comfortable everywhere we went and there was a large police present. Staff at the hotel were helpful and very polite. Would recommend this hotel. Perfect location. Metro stop outside will take you direct to the Nou camp stop.

Reviews.Title: “Good Home Base - Rated a 4 star don’t quite see how.”
Reviews.Author: celticgirl_PR
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights after we had completed cruise we were booked in for a standard room via Hotwire. English speaking front desk staff for the most part friendly staff. Hotel Barcelona Universal which is under the same chain of "Barcelona Nunez i Navarro Hotels" for being rated a 4 star don’t quite see how. We have stayed at other hotels in the chain with lesser star rating and had a better experience. I will say the rooms were clean, comfortable beds (Though we had two twin beds placed together to make a larger bed and the beds would move apart by the end of the night), however for the price you pay, I would have expected a more luxurious place. Hotel modern but looked worn. Many we are sure want somewhere quiet, comfortable and close to the cruise terminal and thus, choose this hotel. However, it was chaotic at noon check-out, Saturday with people all checking out at the same time. With the way the front desk is situated with a large cement pole and couches it was over whelming. We were able to get a room by 1PM and were given a room on the 8th floor - It is on a busy road and although you could still hear quite a lot of traffic noise at night. The rooms are not sound proof at all, so you will also hear corridor noises very distinctly. It is a short walk away from Port Vell and La Rambla. We didn't use the metro but there is a stop near by. The free wi-fi is fast and if you don't have your laptop with you they have computers you can use at the business center on the 9th floor and two computers in the lobby. If you need to print something you have to ask the front desk staff to use one of their computers. Never ate at the restaurant so cannot comment there. We so many hotels in Barcelona not sure if I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service, beds are low quality”
Reviews.Author: mcvu
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in Oct 2011. Chose the hotel because it was centrally located to everything and we could walk or use the very easy metro system. Other area hotels were sold out and Torre Catalunya was a little too far out. Best features of the hotel are its location and service. No concierge desk, so we relied on the English-fluent front desk staff, who were outstanding, especially Herve. We are a same-sex couple and asked for a "couples bed" (a double instead of two singles pushed together). No hesitations or questions from Herve (perhaps legalizing gay marriage in Spain has sensitized Spaniards to these situations). Checked in late on our first day and only room with a double bed was on the first floor. We worried about the street noise, but Herve suggested we try it and if the noise was really bothersome we could move to another room with two singles towards the back of the building. The noise turned out not to be such a big deal because (1) we are city dwellers and are used to some street noise at all times of the day(suburbanites and light sleepers will be challenged), (2) we were exploring the city for 12 hrs everyday and were so exhausted that we slept through everything. Rooms have music system with a few stations including classical and down tempo (my favorite!). We used the music system everyday - a great way to create ambience in the room. Ample closet space. Clean dark green marble bathroom. Wood floors. Recessed lighting. Flat screen TV and table with 4 chairs for eating or working. In-room fridge with for-purchase snacks, water, juice and alcohol. Breakfast buffet came with room. Good way to save money since Spaniards are not big breakfast eaters and what you'll find outside the hotel is mostly the same thing - jamon with bread, pastries and coffee. Hotel also has a gym, but didnt have time to even check it out. Would stay here again or try another Mavarro/Numyz Group hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: TheWavesUk
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights and because we were out and about all the time we didn't use any hotel facilities except our room. So we can only comment on reception (very friendly and efficient check in and out) and the room - which was spotlessly clean and with comfy king size bed and a good bathroom. It is on a busy road and although we asked for and got a room on a high floor, you could still hear quite a lot of traffic noise at night. It didn't bother me but my wife woke up a few times, nothing that ear plugs or even some cotton wool wouldn't have dampened down to a decent level. Finally, being literally 10 seconds from Parallel Metro station makes it so easy to get anywhere - including no more than an hour from the airport (airport train to Passeig de Gracia, change there for Metro straight to hotel, all simple). Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yorkie2626
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from 3 nights in Barcelona staying at Barcelona Universal. It was a lovely hotel with modern decor and was very clean. The reception staff were always very helpful. The views from the roof are excellent as is the roof top pool. I didn't eat in the hotel so I can't commment on the food. This hotel was excellent value for money. It is a short walk away from Port Vell and La Rambla. We didn't use the metro but there is a stop near by. It felt safe in the evenings and we never strayed very far from the hotel to eat in some of the less touristy restaurants. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Laura B
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the universal couldn't have been anymore perfect. Decor very modern kept immaculate at all times. The staff bent over backwards to help us very friendly and nothing was to much for them to make your stay unable to fault in any way. It's a 5 min walk la rambala 5 min taxi ride to the beach. If I return to Barcelona which I'm sure I will this hotel is where I will be staying no question about it. Would like to thank all the staff for making our stay a comfortable and very memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for city visit!”
Reviews.Author: Raymond B
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in August 2011 and had a great time. Staff very friendly and helpful. For a city centre hotel it was very reasonably priced. Metro Parallel station right outside and within walking distance to the port and Las Ramblas. One thing to note, I booked this hotel through lastminute.com and it turned out after the checking the hotels own website that I could have saved £50 on my stay by booking direct.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel at the right price”
Reviews.Author: chorleyk
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel and were checked in in no time at all. We were given a corner room which was very spacious and tastefully decorated. The bathroom was enormous.The only problem i could find was there was no outside window, The only window we had opened out onto what looked like a small yard where the back of the kitchen and bar was.So we never saw any natural sunlight.The resteraunt was pretty expensive so we ate at small cafes either across the road or down the street.It was about 15 minutes walk to La Rambla down prety seedy back streets unless you walked the long way around.All in all for the price we paid it was an excellent hotel despite the minor gripes.

Reviews.Title: “Fringe area”
Reviews.Author: ltcjdc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at a B&B in the Eixample Dreta district before a cruise, then stayed at the BUH for one night after we returned from the cruise. The BUH was a better value. The rooms are spacious. The breakfast was very generous and much more that what you get at most B&Bs. The staff was very helpful and courteous. The Metro was right outside the door. It was within blocks of Las Ramblas, But...we preferred the Eixample neighborhoods which are more sophisticated and less edgy than the Raval district. Based on value, we would probably stay here when we return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “great choice!”
Reviews.Author: fbarros
Reviews.Content: The hotel loooks like brand new. very nice rooms and indulgences. great location, subway at the door...good service...excellent choice for barcelona´s first visitors!

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona Universal Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bnlusa
Reviews.Content: In September 2011 we stayed at Barcelona Universal Hotel. There were 6 of us ( 3 couples) and everyone said the hotel was a great choice. We booked the hotel room several months in advance of our trip to Barcelona and got a very good price for this hotel, that was rated 4 stars. It is a business hotel located in a central area of town where it was easy to get to anything from there, in what we felt was a very safe area. The room was very nice, beds very comfortable and very clean. We were on the street side of the hotel about 5 stories up and while you could hear a little noise from the outside now and again it was not a problem. There were people out walking on the streets at all hours in this area and we actually felt very safe walking the streets at night in this area. The front desk staff spoke English and were very helpful. We asked them where the locals ate and they gave us a couple of choices and the one we ate at was a very good restaurant, about a 5 to 10 minutes walk from the hotel. The food was very good and reasonably priced. When I asked what was the best or quickest way to get to the Picasso and Chocolate Museum they said take a taxi. They also told us about how much we should pay and warned use about that pick pockets in that area and to watch out for the things we were carrying. We did that and we had no problem. There is no question if we were to go back and needed a hotel we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: HawaiiTraveler5_0
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Barcelona Universal Hotel. It was about a 10 minute walk to La Rambla, but the subway was at the street corner & takes you directly to Plaza Catalunya, at the top of the Rambla, and is the central point in Barcelona. We enjoyed the location because it was more of a local area, but just on the edge of the tourist areas. There were many places to eat nearby, and many small shops to by small items at. There is a small plaza area across the street where the locals come out in the evening & night with their families, and is a great taste of local life. The staff were all excellent & always ready to help. The rooms are modern, well appointed & clean. If you want to be within proximity of the main tourist areas, but not in it, this is the right location.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure why this is so highly ranked on TripAdvisor”
Reviews.Author: MingBG
Reviews.Content: We booked this as it was the highest ranked 3/4 star hotel on TA (13th out of 549 hotels) available on the dates we wanted. The hotel is right on a main drag Av. de Paral.lel. It is not far from the marina, the Ramblas, and the metro is literally outside the door. I guess that is the reason most TA reviewers have said the hotel is well-located, especially for tourists on a cruise. The truth is that the location is a bit dubious however, with a porno club a block away (I don't read Spanish but I guess "porn" is "porn" in Spanish or Catalan, the large naked lady neon sign not withstanding). Kind of like Market Street in San Francisco, where there are many tourists but also nasty types as well. This working class area certainly had none of the upmarket Paseig de Gracia feel here, and I did not feel comfortable walking outside the hotel at night (well ok this applies to much of Barcelona too). My main beef with the hotel was the noise though - over the weekend there was the constant din from the party crowd along the streets (we were on the 7th floor). When we woke up at 6am to leave for the airport there were still plenty of people on the street just ending the night. The rooms are not sound proof at all, so you will also hear corridor noises very distinctly. We paid about €230 a night, and frankly expected better. Would not stay here again. Some pluses: Modern decor, small but adequate gym, efficient service. Large bathroom, I would almost say too large, as I would have prefered that space in the bedroom. Free WiFi, but pretty slow.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel Good location”
Reviews.Author: johnnyboy1944
Reviews.Content: Have just spent three nights here, it is a good standard 4 star hotel with friendly helpful staff, clean and well maintained rooms, nice breakfast and a pool on the roof. We were on the 5th floor facing the street and did not find it noisy at night. The location is ideal for siteseeing. It is opposite a station on the very user friendly metro system and within easy walking distance of the habour and the world famous pedestrian street the Ramblas. We used the red Touristque open top buses to site see, well worth the money at about 35euros for two days. Two places not to miss the Gaudi Sangra Familia (breath taking but get there as early as you can to avoid the queues) and the castle .Very easy to get to from the hotel via the Metro(outside the door) and cable car. V G views

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: Lvngstrng
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very near Las Ramblas. You can walk the entire length of the Ramblas in about 1 hour (back and forth). I think the best thing about this hotel is it's proximity to the metro (literally outside it's doors). There is also a supermarket half a block away where we bought our snacks for the day at decent prices. Parking is tricky. If you plan to rent a car, park outside the hotel and the doorman will guide you to the parking garage. The staff were friendly and the hotel is very clean. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location,location,location!!!”
Reviews.Author: cathi r
Reviews.Content: This hotel was well located! Right on venue Paral.lel....very clean, good breakfast, very helpful staff, and the metro right in front of the hotel! For the money~ this was a great find... I would tell a Barcelona bound traveler, to tour with the touristica buses, they visit all the sites, and you can get on and off at leisure... side trip to Girona and a visit to the Dali museum is a must... the same company (Julia tours) provides a good tour...our trip to Monsterrat was less than hoped for....the line to approach the icon was endless, but the geological sight was very interesting... again on the hotel~ a staff person on the desk got me a ticket to the FC Barcelona vs. AC MIlan soccer game .... great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “We stayed there for ITMA exhibition for 8 nights”
Reviews.Author: aza1974
Reviews.Content: Barcelona universal is quite new decorated rooms..very near to most attractions La Rambla ,port and also subway station is just in front of the hotel .It is only few stops to reach Gran via Fira Barcelona ..Old exhbition center is only walking distance. But be careful to thieves dont talk anybody even good looking.Somebody stole my credit card during buying metro ticket.The guy waas good looking and pretending like just helping a foreigner.In few seconds he had taken the card.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly location in busy City of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: supersailor
Reviews.Content: Reception staff were serious and not very helpful on arrival. Had to find my own way with luggage to lift. No information about the restaurant or facilities of hotel was given. Room was clean but very limited free bathroom selection available. The breakfast was ok, something for all tastes. Restaurant staff were under staffed and had to wait for hot drinks. I ordered eggs and boiled eggs arrived (unsure how they would be cooked!!). A small but adequare gym, very average sunroof swimming pool (depth waist height!) but sunroof was o for a city hotel with clean towels provided. Bedroom did not have slippers or dressing gown. No instructions for the TV, or room service provided.. Adequate safe. Mini bar very limited, bring your own! Outside traffic evident which kept me awake.

Reviews.Title: “Great for exploring Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Bidders01
Reviews.Content: We had 4 nights at the Universal after reading good reviews on Tripadvisor and were not dissappointed. We got a large corner room that had a great view down onto the street. The room was excellent after staying in small rooms in Paris. The hotel is right next to La Rambla and an easy stroll from the marina and beaches etc. Breakfast was good and although the hotel was full it did not seem at all crowded. The rooftop pool was a little small but ample for getting wet. I would stay here again without any hesitation. Make sure you hire a bike to get around Barcelona, definately the best way to see the city.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay”
Reviews.Author: Carey U
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Barcelona Universal on the last stop of our honeymoon and we really did save the best for last. The hotel is beautifully designed and oh so easy to access from public transit. When we arrived they sent us a bottle of Cava to say congratulations and they were helpful and polite our entire stay... they even helped get us into a very HOT restaurant. The room was well-appointed the beds were very comfortable (hard to find in Europe). The rooftop pool was great for late-afternoon lounging as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff, and fair size rooms”
Reviews.Author: Greyo
Reviews.Content: First of all, the hotel is in a great location. It's 10 mins to the harbour, 15mins to the Ramblas and 15mins to the main designer shopping area on the diagonal. The hotel rooms are a decent size and all with fridges (take your own kettle if you're from the UK, we can't function without tea first thing) There isn't much of a bar there but there's loads just on the street outsideand a good one set back from the road if you turn left when you come out of the hotel. If you're coming in on the aerobus, get off at Urgell and walk to the hotel, it's about 15mins but all on one road. Local buses are easy to use and cheap. Barceloneta is a nice place to spend an evening as is the Barra area. Las Ramblas is ok, nice to see but once you've walked it, you'll just cross over as it soon gets tiresome. Some interesting things to see but Barcelona isn't a big city and unless you're into art (Gaudi) you'll do it all in three days or so, have a great time and enjoy the cava

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, planning could be better”
Reviews.Author: KMR003
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May for four nights and while there are some advantages we were disappointed. After the second night we were the only people left in our wing and the other rooms where all being decorated. We were woken up at 7am by the builders and music. We were offered another room but thought the planning could have been a bit better. Also in the hotel bar near reception there was only one person who was also working in the function room so had to wait up to 20 minutes to get a drink. The location is good but was disappointed overall.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic for location and quality of the hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ganzerl
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and loved it so much, we decided to stay another 3 nights instead of trying another hotel. The location is excellent. Carlos was very helpful and always friendly. I couldn't fault the rooms!!

Reviews.Title: “Spot On”
Reviews.Author: J44JPA
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a wonderful location, close to Las Rambles, just 5 minutes walk straight down Sant Pau right into the middle of Las Rambles. The indoor market is a must just to see all the wonderful vibrant colours. We did the open top bus and saw just about everything over two days. We even managed to get onto the beach for a stroll and a half hour sit on the sand. The hotel staff are very polite and accommodating. We were sat on the roof top with a bottle of Cava, and the bar tender fetched over to us 4 plastic glasses. The room we had was at the front of the hotel and although some people found it a bit noisy with traffic, it didn't bother us. We were offered that if it was not suitable we could change rooms the next day, which we didn't. We stayed here for 3 nights and would definitely recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: BERTIER1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel for 3 night short break and really enjoyed it.The hotel is very nice, rooms are very spacious, modern and clean. Good buffet breakfast included with plenty of choice. On the hotel roof the sun terrace and pool were great after a very hot day sightseeing.Las Ramblas and the harbour were both within a 10 minute walk. Highly recommend a great bar just round the corner from hotel on Carrer de Sant Pau called La Confiteria - pint of cold beer 3 euro (you will struggle to find cheaper and more friendly) Take note of pick pocket warnings, hand on wallet in front pocket is not secure enough, they are very clever and will try to distract you any way they can - as I found out !!!! Even with the slight mishap with the pick pockets, we had a brill time, loved Barcelona and would really recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, stylish modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: ellynvb
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Rooms are large and clean with a luxurious bathroom! The desk staff is immeasurably helpful and very friendly. The metro station is right outside, which makes this location very convenient though we often chose to walk to and from Las Ramblas and the old city, which is nearby. I like the location because it was just outside the main tourist area and we were spared the bustle, expense and petty crime associated with that. The hotel offers a pool and health club which we never used, but it was nice to have them available. Our only "complaint" the sifi went out often. But the staff allows you to use their computers so in the end it is a slight inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price.”
Reviews.Author: SBhattacharyya
