Reviews.Content: Excellent location, with a metro station right out the front door, 10 min walk from the Ramblas and the harbour area. The rooms are spacious, which is a rarity in Europe! And the staff are incredibly helpful. They actually go out of their way to caution you about the pickpockets in Barca and help you out with recommendations and bookings and ticket printouts. Really enjoyed my stay there and would surely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Handy for Cruise Port”
Reviews.Author: lochfyne
Reviews.Content: The girl who checked us in wasn't helpful at all. She looked as if we were disturbing her, as if she simply couldn't be bothered doing her job. I had requested a room in a quiet location when I made the reservation, but I don't think she was going to give us one, for, when I asked if the room was in a quiet place, she replied that we had already been allocated a room. I then asked her if we could indeed get a room in a quiet location with no street noise. She then re-did the check-in and came up with an interior room. If I hadn't persevered we would have probably got a room overlooking the busy street. I remarked about the laptops over next to the window but she didn't provide any information, not even the fact that guests had free use of them. I actually thought the laptops belonged to the people using them! I only found out the next morning that they are for all guests to use. So, check-in wasn't exactly the greatest. We ordered room service for dinner - big mistake! The salad was really tasty and fresh, but the pizza was like dried up cardboard, and the serrano sandwich was like plastic. I would not recommend ordering the food. The following morning I met other people at the front desk. They were all very charming and pleasant. So very different from the girl who checked us in. They were also extremely helpful and even explained to me how to type the @ on the Spanish keyboard. There is a beautiful view of Barcelona from the roof. The pool does look kind of small, but I'd think it's adequate, if you want to cool off. There's a small gym as well which looked fine. I chose this hotel based on Tripadvisor's rating. I'm not sure if I'd return or not. The room was really small, but it was very clean as was the bathroom. What attracted me, besides the high ratings, was the proximity to the cruise port. There is a metro station opposite, so you could always use it to see the city, or you could walk. The road next to the hotel was a bit run-down, however. I wouldn't want to be wandering around there at dark.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden treasure...sure to go back!”
Reviews.Author: cjoyn
Reviews.Content: Get a back room where it's quieter. Great location...

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SailorSam2010
Reviews.Content: The Reception staff were all very friendly and helpful and each of them spoke very good English . We arrived at the hotel mid-afternoon and ordered some sandwiches and a pizza. They were awful. Our rooms were very good and were serviced to a very high standard.The breakfasts were superb and the choice of what to have was excellent.Overall, a great place to stay and in a very convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “great value and good location”
Reviews.Author: AudiA5Aruba
Reviews.Content: Booked our trip directly with the hotel manager and got a great deal as a result. Very central location in a modern clean hotel. Roof terrace with pool made for a lovely place to go when the weather got too hot. Only minor negative was that the free wi fi didnt work in our bedroom

Reviews.Title: “Love it”
Reviews.Author: Last_travel_bug
Reviews.Content: Reviews have been good on this hotel, so we decided to try it during our first trip to Spain. Overall I am impress with Barcelona, Spain despite some concerns with regards to pickpockets and thief. Hotel location is excellent with easy access everywhere but the Metro. Despite not knowing the language, this is about the easiest city to move around without getting lost. The Metro system and ease of finding tourist sites are excellent and the people are extremely helpful even though they are not able to speak english. The cops are helpful too. I suspect that they understand and value tourist dollars unlike Paris, France. The rooms are reasonable size and reasonably clean. The front desk have people who speak English and extremely helpful. Security is very good with a watchful eye on people coming in and out of the hotel. Lots of german tourist too. Highly recommended for North American tourist in this city. Even rest rooms at Metro stations are cleaner than most American cities. Only other North American city that is as clean is Washington DC.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: UkFlybird
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and we couldn't have wished for a better hotel or location. The room was a decent size and ours had a huge terrace, there is so much choice at breakfast (hot and cold). There is a lovely pool on the roof which is great after a day of sight seeing. The staff are very friendly and helpful (especially reception!). The number 57 & 157 bus over the road from the hotel take you to the beach/harbour in less than 10 mins. There is also a metro link right outside of the hotel, although Las Rambles is not far at all. I would recommend this hotel for its service, cleanliness and location. A taxi to the airport was 22 euros. Plenty of cafes/bars in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel for Pre/Post-Cruise Stay”
Reviews.Author: vlsatty
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent three nights pre-and post-cruise at the Barcelona Universal Hotel. It is very close to the pier, and within walking distance to many of the tourist sites in Barcelona including the beach, Las Ramblas, Dancing Fountain, etc. The staff are very helpful and friendly. They gave us City maps, helped us purchase hop on/hop off bus tickets, let us check in early, made transportation arrangements for us and made us feel welcome. The rooms are very clean, nice and spacious for two people. The free wifi and internet stations were also an added bonus. The views of the City and the Sagrada Familia from the rooftop pool/lounge is to die for! Would definitely stay here again and highly recommend to anyone traveling to Barcelona! It was a great value for a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with great facilities”
Reviews.Author: Nickwell
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay at the hotel. Our rooms were upgraded which allways helps. Good choice at breakfast. My son has never eaten so much! The rooms were very clean. Nice to have a swimming pool in the centre of Barcelona allthough it can get crowded late afternoon. Bar prices were very reasonable (3 euros for a large glass of wine). The walk to the ramblas or the port took only a few minutes. I thought at first the area was a bit dodgy but we found most of Barcelona to be the same. Just as an extra I wouldn't waste time with buses and metro getting to the hotel. A yellow cab at the airport was 27 euros for four people with luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Great location hotel”
Reviews.Author: Moschi1
Reviews.Content: This is our 3rd of 4 nights and we can't fault this place. The staff have been very helpful re any query. Between English, Italian and the little Spanish I know, have not had any problems. Room was well appointed and comfortable. Rooftop pool is a bonus on a hot afternoon after hours of sightseeing. Overall great location. Pleasant walk to La Ramblas, the tour bus top is only about 10min walk. Great little tapas bars.

Reviews.Title: “Execellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Surinder S
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights as a party of 11 girls!! WE were all really impressed with the Hotel. Rooms were a good size, Very clean. The staff were extremely friendly, helpful and accomadating. Breakfast had good selection of hot and cold foods. Would recommend without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with excellent facilities”
Reviews.Author: Rikke K
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel! We will diffently book it next time we´re going to Barcelona! Large room, nice and clean. Great breakfast buffet! Free quick internet. And a good location near the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Ruana603
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Spotlessly clean and we had a large comfortable room. Staff at reception were very helpful and polite. Location was good as a base because it was a short walk to Port Vell and Las Ramblas and the beach was about 15 minutes on the bus. Nice cafe opposite for breakfast...Dino Pans...and could also pick up a nice baguette and drink (cheap) for later in the day. If this hotel could be transported to a nicer area of Barcelona it would be perfect ! Couldn't find anywhere very nice to sit outside for half an hour when returning at night from a busy day's walking. But all in all would definitely recommend and was without doubt our best stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, modern rooms!”
Reviews.Author: C J
Reviews.Content: Situated in the heart of Barcelona, the Metro station is only a few steps away. Christian and Saskia were extremely helpful and pleasant staff members. The rooms were modern and overall the hotel is new. Pool upstairs is of decent size. Will definitiely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Birthday Break”
Reviews.Author: kari68
Reviews.Content: In Barcelona to celebrate my husband's 50th we had booked four rooms. Overall would agree with comments regarding the good standard within the hotel and helpfulness of staff. (special mention and thanks to David who served us well and looked after our needs at the bar and within the restaurant!) The location was ideal and we walked most places though location of metro just outside was absolutely ideal for hubby's birthday trip to see Barca v Real Madrid! If there were negatives it was that we were in a room with an opaque window which looked into an internal shaft. Would have got a bit stir crazy if staying for an extended period. Also would have liked having tea/coffee facilities in our room. However, would not hesitate in staying again and recommending to others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - great value for money”
Reviews.Author: AVFC1977
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent - good aircon, well furnished, and beds are very comfortable. Rooms are of a good size, as we stayed for a week and remained comfortable. Bathroom also was a good size and had a powerful shower. Staff are helpful without being intrusive (in particular the cleaning staff who did a great job), and you are able to use the internet in the lobby computers for no extra charge. Location ideal for visiting the sights, as a short walk to La Ramblas and the gothic quarter, and just outside a metro station for visiting other parts of the city. Some decent cafes and bars within yards of the hotel too. Only slight negative is that the swimming pool is very small. We would definitely stay here again, as it exceeds normal expectations of a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: bonvoyageSpain
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, with a fairly good location, just next to a subway station. Got upgrated into a junior suite with balcony, due to booking via Easytobook.com amongst other things. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Get around town fast, VERY close to main subway terminal”
Reviews.Author: johntimothyhopkins
Reviews.Content: Really close to the Para Elle subway, many trains leave from here, so you can get anywhere in the city easily. The room was just what you needed, a comfy bed, clean modern bathroom, and a decent window. (Our view wasn't too good, but oh well) The staff was very helpful and nice. They always gave us recommendations for meals and things to do. We will definitely come here again when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Facility”
Reviews.Author: Stivonovich
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, quiet and very secure. The employees are extremely helpful and very professional. The room was larger than we expected and classy in appearance. The only thing I would suggest is that they provide 220-volt to110-volt adapters for the North Americans that arrive not knowing that Europe runs on 220 volts. We could not charge our camera, I-pod and computer batteries while we were there. The pool is small but clean and there is enough area to catch some rays on the roof by the pool. The hotel restaurant is expensive but there are so many options to eat at a reasonable price around the hotel it’s not a problem. You should be aware that the prices posted at the restaurants around the hotel are for inside dining; patio dining is 10% more. We would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid hotel and location!”
Reviews.Author: iciomah
Reviews.Content: Spacious room and bathroom, the subway on your doorstep. No traffic noise of busy road; very friendly receptionists who speak and understande English fluently. One minor thing: the swimming pool on the roof top is so small that actual swimming is not possible. We had our rest in our fantastic airconditioned room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and good value!”
Reviews.Author: Koltrip
Reviews.Content: This hotel have an excellent location and good value. Try to ask for the upper floors. Less noisy. Service is good, clean and nice rooms. The roof terrace is very good for som relax.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: Deborah_Heis_01
Reviews.Content: We highly recommend that Barcelona Universal Hotel. It is very conveniently located in walking distance of many attractions. The hotel is accurately rated as 4 star - it is clean, modern and new. The triple rooms are an excellent feature that set the hotel apart from most others in Barcelona. We had our teenage daughter with us and the triple room set-up was perfect. There is a sliding door between the single bed and the king bed for privacy. Breakfast is complimentary when you stay a minimum of 2 or 3 nights and was excellent with hot and cold buffet offerings, very fresh and abundant. Our room did not have a window, which was a bit of a drawback, but more than offset by the convenience of the additional twin bed in the room.

Reviews.Title: “what wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: trudy c
Reviews.Content: just stayed 1 night prior to joining cruise ship and what a pleasent clean hotel. triple room was great size with very comfy beds.Bathroom was super clean. Only gripe was no view as window looked straight onto wall but as only there for night didn't mind. Hotel staff so helpful and very kindly let us leave our bags after our cruise as we had long time till return flight to uk. would highly reccommend to all.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay here. Great for seeing the ramblas and beaches.”
Reviews.Author: paulmason131
Reviews.Content: We had a great 2 nights here in Barcelona. This hotel is perfect for seeing the beaches and walking the mile + ramblas (pardon my spelling). No complaints about the size of the room or the staff. We didn't spend that much time in the room as we were always out and about in the city. The one thing that is not so great is that the room could be a bit noisy with the windows open. We were there in June, so we slept with the windows closed and the air conditioning on high. I think we would return to this hotel because of the location and the staff if we ever have the opportunity to return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: stephen t
Reviews.Content: I booked a long weekend trip for my wife and I and decided this hotel would be the best choice because of its location and the many positve reviews. The rooms are a good size and clean the bed is very comfortable. The only negative about the hotel is that I requested a "quite" room ie one away from the front of the very busy main road. When booking in I again sought reasurrance that the room would be a quite one to which the receptionist shrugged his shoulders. When we got to our room it was as I feared facing the main road. I know I could have complained but we were there for a short stay and could not be bothered with the hassel of moving to another room aside from that I feel that asking twice should have been enough. So nice hotel but if you are a light sleeper please insist on a room away from the noise of the traffic and people hanging around street restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TLindey
Reviews.Content: Don't hesitate to stay here. Great location! Very nice rooms, good breakfast (if you stay 2 nights you can get the breakfast included).

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: erialcrobo
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel. Exceptionally clean with a modern, minimalistic decor. We had a large triple room and the beds were very comfortable. We all agreed that the air con could have been a bit stronger but maybe this was just in our room. The pool area was lovely but was very busy during our stay, especially in late afternoon and you may have to wait to get a bed. Staff were fine, not as freindly as what I have read in past reveiws. Bathroom was a good size with a powerful, hot shower. The location was fine although some of the side streets that you have to walk down to and from the hotel are a bit dodgey. There is a great little place opposite the hotel that we liked to have breakfast in called 'Dino'- it is behind some trees and very cheap with freshly baked croissants etc. Metro is right outside hotel door. Please do not do what I did and book flights to Barcelon Girona- it is miles away from Barcelona. Book Reus instead!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!! a brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: happyholidays094
Reviews.Content: My sister and i have just returned from a 4 day break to the barcelona universal. The hotel is excellent and ideally placed for sightseeing and beaches etc. We got the 46 bus from airport and then the metro two stops to hotel. It was 1.45 on both bus and train so far cheaper than getting the airport bus. The hotel is about 10 mins walk from Las Ramblas and the port is at the bottom of the road. We did get the bus to the beach which took about 20 mins but we walked back so bus not really needed. The weather was fantastic which helped make this a most enjoyable mini break.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Dmb63
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a triple and double room for our holiday. It was excellent value as I booked well ahead and included breakfast. The holiday was off to an great start as I had requested rooms close together and had a positive reply that neighbouring rooms had been allocated when I emailed just days before leaving. The receptionists were very welcoming and we were able to check into one room earlier than the stated check in time with no bother. The triple room was large enough for four adults with two single beds pushed together as a double and a double sofa bed. It was very spacious, but had no actual windows so was a little dark. However it did have a nice ambience. The double room was really nice. The hotel was well placed. The underground station Parallel was right outside the door, so it was very easy to get to the main sights. La Ramblas and the port and beach were an easy walk. The fitness centre had 2 running machines, 2 cycles and some weights. It was open from 8am to 8pm. As it was not air-conditioned, it was too hot to exercise for long.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and Personalized Service - Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jeff76543
Reviews.Content: My 2 grown daughters, wife and I stayed in two rooms at the Barcelona Universal Hotel from July 29-August 1. It was a wonderful stay. The hotel staff assisted us with hotel and non-hotel matters: from recommendations for great restaurants and the best way to use the subway, to changing my daughters' room (within 5 minutes!) when one of my daughters said the mattress was too soft for her taste and to arranging a late check-out. Our rooms were very clean and inviting. The hotel offered excellent value for the rate which we paid. In recent years, I can't remember having a better hotel experience. The only recommendation for improvement that I would make is the result of me being a vegetarian. The buffet breakfast (which was included in our rate) had an excellent range of meats (which I don't eat), but had very little in the way of salads or fresh vegetables. There was some cheese, fresh fruit and yogurt, but only tomatoes (no lettuce, cucumbers or salads as such). I would enthusiastically recommend this hotel to friends (even vegetarians) and will choose it again if/when we return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, not best location.”
Reviews.Author: SoBeachPalms
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice. We had a triple room, which was spacious, and had a sliding door between the entry room with the single bed and the queen bed in the back part of the room. The room only has 1 mirror, which is in the bathroom. This is difficult when 3 people are trying to get ready to go out for the day or evening. The lighting is not good at all. Other than the above, the hotel is very clean and modern. The staff is helpful and nice. Everyone spoke English. After doing some sightseeing and talking to other tourists, we realized that the area around Plaza Catalunya is much better for shopping, eating, and walking around than where we were. We would stay there next time. Las Ramblas was not a favorite of mine. The food available there is all the same: pizza, or tapas or paella. It's difficult to find any other food in Barcelona or Madrid. We did find 1 restaurant in Las Ramblas where we enjoyed the food: American Soda (yes, odd name). It's not American food AT ALL. We had chicken paella, and ordered extra side dishes of Pollo Campesino, gambas (breaded, fried shrimp), and added that to the paella, so that everyone in our group was able to get more than rice. You'll find that the paellas everywhere don't have much meat or seafood, it's mostly rice. HUGE TIP that we got from a hotel guest when we were at the front desk asking about La Sagrada Familia. Get your tickets online and print them out at the hotel. We did that and then went to the cathedral, and saw the HUGE line to buy tickets to get in. We were able to go around the line, to the window where you check-in if you already have a ticket. That was a great relief! Also, don't forget to check-in online for your departure flight. When we got to the Barcelona airport for our flight home, the line was very long to check-in at US Airways. The line for those of us already checked-in online was short and quick.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay - recommended value spot”
Reviews.Author: tommytravelstheworld
Reviews.Content: Certainly a 4-5 star recommended hotel for the value price. For a top 10-15 rated Trip Advisor spot on a list of 300 or so in Barcelona, you get a great deal for the reasonable price. We found the neighborhood to be just fine, not sure what the last comment is referring to. Every city in the world has some sketchy back streets, but you typically know that ahead of time and DON'T GO there. Go buy a travel book and do your homework. The hotel is a short walk to the water front, the Las Ramblas area, and everything else you need. A few stores down is a liquor store with waters, beers, and basic groceries to stock your room. Across the street to the north is Las Cochitas, the best breakfast/lunch spot in the area. All the hotel employees eat there and we know why. We ate breakfast there all three mornings, great food, and very fair pricing. The room was very clean, nicer than expected. Putting the two small beds together creates a huge King bed that was amazingly comfortable. Bathroom was very nice. Nice flat screen TV with some English speaking channels like BBC and CNN. Lobby is clean and nice, internet area, porters let you put your bags in a holding room if your room is not ready, or you are checking out and need a place to put them before your flight or cruise. Overall a great experience, I would stay here again if in Barcelona in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Blue364
Reviews.Content: Just finished a 3 night post cruise trip at this hotel. We booked two superior rooms and one was upgraded to a suite at no extra charge. We arrived very early (10am) and were immediately given access to one room. All staff were extremely friendly, helpful and efficient. Good facilities and excellent buffet breakfast (included in our rate) Great location for access to metro and main sites although the immediate surrounding area propbably isn't the best in Barcelona but we always felt safe even walking around at night with our children. Would definitely recomend this hotel - excellent value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great standard of hotel - loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Lollyw1
Reviews.Content: Location: Fab...five mins walk to Las Ramblas (expensive!) and a few reasonably priced food places if you turn left out of the door and go straight. Cost 30 euros to get from airport, 20 to get back! Cleanliness: Good standard in room and public spaces Amenities: Pool - small but there nonetheless!! managed to get loungers and fresh towels Breakfast: coffee, streaky bacon, scrambled egg, mushrooms, toast, croissants, cereal, fruit, cheese, ham, juices. buffet style. was nice actually! Room facilities: You get the standard hairdryer and soap but also a shaving kit, shoe shine, toothbrush, sponge, shampoo etc in case you've forgotten anything. FREE SAFE which was a bonus! Mini bar - far too expensive but there if needed! TV with BBC world and that's it...but who needs TV in Barca?! Radio channels for background noise when you're sprucing up were fine! Staff: SOOOO helpful and lovely! Esp on reception desk. Great standard of English. Absolutely great hotel...I would not hesitate to stay again! Barcelona itself: The open top bus is a must. There's 3 routes but the red was def the best. Cost £28 euros i think for two consecutive days on either routes - reception will give you discounts. There are so many beautiful buildings and sights that you couldn't not go on one!! Las Ramblas: very busy and full of pick pockets - get a money strap - yes I was too cool for one too but better than feeling on edge all the time! Very expensive - drinks about 5/6 euros a pint. Some lovely food places and some good paella but expensive! about 15 euros on las ramblas. We, being early thirties, went on the organised pub crawls at 15 euros...great value as we were two ladies on our own and it helped us find a few good bars and some Brits to chat to in the evenings BUT not for the faint hearted as the second night we went on one, it was crazy and perhaps a bit much for us aging girlies! NB if you smoke, cigarettes are £40 for 200 in Barca Airport :S Cigarettes in Barca are not available in normal 'Supermercats' you have to go to the tabacconists which aren't open as late. Hope this helps and have a lovely time...we did :)

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Braziliantraveler7
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. We stayed in a triple room, which is very spacious, with quite a large bathroom, nice TV and extremely clean. Our rate included breakfast, which was very good, with all sorts of cakes, ham, breads and juice. The hotel is well-located in walking distance from Las Ramblas and near the Turistic Bus stop. The staff is extremely helpful and nice. I would definetely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rachel34
Reviews.Content: We stayed here mid July 2011 for 2 nights after a cruise and would highly recommend it to anyone who is looking for a comfortable, clean hotel in a good location in Barcelona. Its only 5 minutes walk from La Rambles and the staff in the hotel are excellent. The reception staff were more than helpful and informative!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Staff outstanding”
Reviews.Author: southlanarksire
Reviews.Content: Forgot to write review at time of visit but completing the review 9 months later when I rembered must show how satisfied I was with our visit. We went to celebrate my son's birthday which included taking in a Barcelona FC game. The staff took delivery of our tickets and got them to us ASAP and then took the volunteered to provide directions and advice on attending the match. I saw the staff research a number of queries for guests, numbers of restaurants, location of a church for a particular faith and so forth, they really were so obliging. The hotel is modern, well located (even supermarkets within 150 metres that were open late into the evening), clean and has a nice terraced area and pool on top. Breakfast is good and worth taking. I stayed in a double room for two nights which was very nice before we received a free and unsolicited upgrade to a penthouse when some of our party left to return home, again this underlines the diligence of the staff who took the opportunity to promote the hotel to its fullest to us. I certainly wont be looking to stay anywhere else when I return to Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations, fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Staffs7
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel because of the excellent feedback on trip advisor and we were not disappointed. Hotel staff could not have been more helpful, very warm welcome on arrival and took the time to show us the map and the sights of interest. We arrived at noon and we were fully aware our room may not have been ready as check-in is 3pm, however the concierge stored our luggage and important documents in a locked room and safe. Our room was lovely and exceptionally clean and a chilled bottle of cava waiting for us, which was a very nice gesture and went down well! Took advantage of the hotel pool on the roof, although was small was adequate to cool off, plenty of sunbeds and San Miguel on draught! It provided some excellent views of the city. Breakfast was very good, plenty of variety, from cooked to pastries. We spent 3 nights at the hotel and found the location to be perfect (right next to a tube station), The tube is an excellent way to get around the city and much cleaner/cooler than London underground! Barcelona had everything from history(Gaudi) to sporting venues(Nou Camp, Olympic Village), great shopping and lovely beaches. Bars and restaurants were lovely and enjoyed some great tapas. Would go again tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: “Good location close to Metro”
Reviews.Author: Masha0429
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at this hotel in March for a week and we really liked it. Newly remodeled with super nice bathrooms and friendly staff. The room was not as small as some of the others I had seen in Europe. We had no view. The window looked out into a courtyard and another building's laundry hanging on the balconies. But we didn't spend much time in the room so it didn't matter. I paid a little more for the room to include breakfast buffet which had a nice variety of food and beverages. There is a metro station literally outside the hotel entrance - convenient to get anywhere and everywhere in the city. But if you prefer to walk, like I do, the hotel is also just blocks away from some of the main city attractions. All in all, I would recommend this hotel for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Efficient service at Universal!”
Reviews.Author: Andsun
Reviews.Content: A good hotel located on the street Para'lel. We arrived by car and we were able to park in front for 10 min for check in. The check in took 5 min and we placed our luggage in the room. The front desk was very friendly, helpful and very efficient! Free WiFi and a nice breakfast included. Nice roof terrace with swimming pool and great views! Location - to get to La Rambla at night we walked in the multi cultural area of BCN, we didn't dare to walk these streets at night (we tried to walk down La Rambla and take right at the end and walk up Para'lel but we were attacked by hookers). The bed - our bed was, under the sheet, coverd with a plastic cover. I see the hygenic aspect, but it was quit uncomfortable and noisy!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: Nic0le22
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for 2 weeks in July 2011 and it was amazing! We were upgraded to a suite on the 9th floor. The room was quite big (for European standards) and we had a huge terrace that wrapped around the outskirts of the hotel room. We had a king size bed, nice big, and well kept bathroom, TV and internet just outside our room. The service was great, the staff were nice and helpful and the house keeping did a great job at keeping our room clean and always had new towels. We were about a 7 minute walk to La Ramblas and 25 mins to the beach which was an ideal location for us. I definitely recommend anyone to stay in this hotel, whether you are with your spouse, friends or family, it was a great spot and we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Gem hotel in barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Mikeyeung
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our 10 month infant The staff was wonderful! Location was only five mins away from las rambles Room was spacious and clean Also big bonus for us because of our kid was that it was three minutes walk from a grocery store Definitely will stay again. Staff was wonderful

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, well located”
Reviews.Author: terry_terry2
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel, the staff were terrific, the location was spot on, the rooms were wonderful and the hotel was spotlessly clean. We would definate;y stay here again and recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay and will be back again.”
Reviews.Author: EllieVirginia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I with our one year old son stayed at Hotel Barcelona Universal for a week. I contacted the hotel by email few days before our trip since it was our 10th anniversary and first trip with our little boy. I received immediate reply to my email by one of the Hotel Managers, Pablo Perez who responded to all my requests and concerns. The hotel location was perfect for walking to the Barri Gothic and the Ramblas. There are two metro stations outside the hotel. The rooms were modern and clean, beds were comfortable and sheets were VERY clean. We even used the roof top pool that was great and relaxing. People working at the reception were all polite and helpful. My sincere gratitude to Pablo Perez who accommodated all of our needs and requests and made our stay at Barcelona Universal a wonderful experience. We are looking forward to go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: jenksoccer21
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose this hotel based off of Trip Advisor reviews. The location was perfect for walking to the Barri Gothic and the Ramblas for sightseeing and dining. Our room was comfortable, air conditioned, clean, and had a fridge. There was a fitness center (which I was too busy to use) and a pool on the roof (again too busy), but we did go up there & there were people who seemed to be enjoying the sun and water. We were located right across from the metro, but didn't even need to use it b/c you could walk everywhere from the hotel. We only needed to use the metro to get to and from the airport. The only problem with the hotel was that the wi-fi in the room was slow to nonexistent. It would kick you off every couple of minutes, and we wasted a lot of time trying to look up recommendations and locations for places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “no need to look any further this is the hotel to be seen in”
Reviews.Author: Hammers66_11
Reviews.Content: stayed here for a 4 night break with a friend for my birthday. On arrival room was'nt ready as we were early but hotel hung onto our bags while we went on walk about. Hotel is situated on outskirts of hustle and bustle just a nice distance to walk to either La Ramblas or the Port area. There is a metro outside hotel although we only used this once as it was so easy to walk from the hotel. I suggest the open top bus ride "Bus Turistic" we spent one day travelling about on it with very good commentary without getting off then the next day hopped on and off at the places that were of interest to us well worth the money. Also went to El De Tablao Carmen for a flamenco night which we thoroughly enjoyed and is well worth a visit. Getting back to the hotel it was very clean and the staff were very friendly and helped with any questions we had for them. It does put us to shame that they had very good english and we could'nt speak a word of spanish. The breakfast was very good also with a selection for everyones tastes. All in all a very good stay and a hotel I would certainly stay at again if I was ever lucky to afford another trip to Barcelona. Well done to all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: NZsandras
Reviews.Content: Yes we stayed here before a cruise and it was so good to be able walk around and see the sights on a Sunday cause many places are shut other areas. Good English speaking staff being very helpful. Nice facilities and little supermarket close to buy water,breaky goodies etc

Reviews.Title: “The trip that never happened”
Reviews.Author: VyVy60
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were going to stay at Barcelona Universal for 4 days in August this year. This was a non ref. deal. My wife died suddenly in early July, I was in contact with Pablo at the hotel to see if I could get a refund. There was NO problem getting the refund in full. He was a true gentelman in my time of need. If I ever go to Barcelona, I will stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great pre-cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: aug2386
Reviews.Content: Good as advertised. Convenient location and helpful staff. Rooms decent sized and clean.

Reviews.Title: “We'll definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: daveandjulia007
Reviews.Content: We cannot fault our stay at the Barcelona Universal Hotel. Check in was smooth and easy with everyone on reception being very polite and helpful. We had emailed the hotel prior to our stay requesting a room on a high floor to the rear of the property. Whilst we realised that our request couldn't be guaranteed we were extremely pleased to note that they had printed off our email and had allocated us a room on the 8th floor with wonderful big windows from which we had fantastic views. The room itself was bright and airy and spotlessly clean. Compared to other city hotels we have stayed in the room was also a generous size. And the free safe was a bonus. Location was excellent being right outside the metro. And only a short stroll to Las Ramblas. The receptionist recommended a local bar where we sat and people watched and felt totally comfortable and safe. The breakfasts gave us everything we needed to start us off for the day and as we booked with the hotel direct, the breakfasts were free. We stayed 3 nights but that wasn't long enough so we'll be heading back to Barcelona and definitely staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, central Position and accommodating staff”
Reviews.Author: IcecoldPinacolada
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, good position. 10 min walk to la ramblas. Staff excellent, really helpful, nothing too much trouble and speak excellent English. Rooms spotless and very modern. Will be going back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff. A good base for Barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: historymanBristol
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right next to the Para-lel metro so is a great place from which to explore Barcelona. The Montjuic funicular runs from there too. Rooms are reasonably spacious, clean and well-equipped and breakfast well worth paying for. Great views from the roof and a small pool up there too. Shame the roof was closed in the evening (after 8 pm) as I could've got some great photos from there. Only slight gripe is that the stairs are difficult to find and don't appear to end up in reception!! The 2 lifts were always quite busy and we were on a lower floor. Would certainly return - free WIFI too!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for Weekend In Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: mccue
Reviews.Content: Rooms were great, beds and pillows very good. We arrived unknowingly on Soltice day so Firework going off every where but still had a great sleep. Service at Foyer good and information good. Bar on roof & "Dip" pool + seating for about 20 people but ideal for an hour after a hot day. Only four drinks on offer at roof bar and Mojitos on tap but we just get on with it. Ramblas 5 minute walk. street cafe outside hotel sell full breakfast for 7 euros, this includes juice and coffee so very good deal. Definatly use this hotel if we go back for location, price, room. Metro outside (yellow line) will take you to beach for the day in about 15 minutes. Nou Camp or Cathedral same 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable with a Good Central Location”
Reviews.Author: DCG
Reviews.Content: This is a clean and comfortable hotel in a very good central location. I was given the choice of a room with a view or a 'quiet' room at the back of the hotel. I chose the latter as the concierge informed me that the main street at the front of the hotel could get noisy at night over the weekend. The room I had was clean and comfortable but there was no real window which gave it a slight feeling of being like a cell in Guantanamo Bay! The only window was totally opaque - opened only a fraction - and looked straight onto a wall about 4 feet away. Impossible to see anything. The room itself was very small but everything was clean, neat and tidy and it had all the basics you need for a business stay. I found the staff pretty pleasant and helpful with one exception. As my flight was not till after 20:00 on my day of departure, I called reception and asked if there was any chance of a check-out time later than the standard 12:00. I got a very curt 'No!' That was it - 'No!' The public areas of the hotel were clean and pleasant and in general I would recommend it for a business trip but not for a vacation or a stay of any more than two or three nights.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel and will certainly be back.”
Reviews.Author: KristinMF
Reviews.Content: I was traveling in Barcelona with my teenage son and we stayed for 5 nights at this hotel. It was very clean, very well appointed and very safe. I loved the hotel and the neighborhood. The staff was wonderfully helpful and accomodating right down to the dining room waiter who practiced Spanish with us, gracefully correcting and prompting us. There was ample storage and a good safe with easy directions. The breakfast buffet is worth the cost for sheer variety of foods offered and because with all the walking you'll do, a good breakfast is highly recommended. The rooftop terrace has awesome views but the pool is more for soaking than swimming -- but the bar access to the pool makes up for that. The neighborhood has lots of bars, cafes, theaters and is just a short walk (5 min) to La Rambla or the waterfront. Subway right outside the front door can get you anywhere in the city - and it's very easy to figure out, very clean and safe. I can't wait to return to Barcelona and to stay at Hotel Universal!!

Reviews.Title: “What a fabulous find!”
Reviews.Author: Klh174
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Barcelona Universal for two nights prior to our cruise, and had booked a prepaid room several months ahead. This is always a risk when you've never been to a city before, but it turned out to be a great hotel full of wonderful surprises. First, we arrived from the airport at around 11 AM. The outside was rather non-descript, and so were were unexpectedly surprised and pleased by the hotel's lobby when we walked through the double doors. It was clean, modern and well staffed (many spoke English). Although they were unable to immediately accommodate us (the normal checkin is 2 PM), they stored our luggage in a locked room, and encouraged us to use the pool locker room to freshen up. We took a tour of the hotel's public areas, and strolled around the city for a few hours. When we returned at 1 PM our room was ready. What a room! Based on a previous review, we had requested a quiet room away from the street side. The front desk clerk said he was sure that we would like our quiet room. We've heard that before, but it was never a truer statement. Located on the 9th floor, it was essentially a suite, with a living/dining area, large bedroom area with four large closets, and a bathroom with a huge whirlpool tub, hand-held shower, heated towel racks, sink, toilet and bidet. As if that were not enough, when we pulled aside the curtain in the living area to see what view we had, we discovered our own private deck, with a grand view of the city including (in the distance) the waterfront and the Sagrada Familia. The hotel offers free Wifi, including the computers with which to access it. We'd seen that in the lobby, and were pleased to find that additional computers also were available just a few steps away from our door. The hotel is located about 3 blocks east of Las Rambles, and has easy access to the metro system. We found it convenient and an easy walk to restaurants and the Columbus monument. The staff could not have been more helpful or accommodating. Thank you, Hotel Barcelona Universal, for starting our vacation out on a high note.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Sandcastle043
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel on a city break to Barcelona and loved it. The location of the hotel is brilliant and there is a metro stop directly outside the hotel. It is situated behind La Ramblas and is an ideal base to explore the city from. It is on a main road so there is some traffic noise but we did not find this a problem as the windows block out most of the noise. The staff were always happy to help and very polite and friendly. The rooms are clean, towels are changed each day and the decor is clean and tidy. The breakfast is good and offers a variety (cereal, breads, bacon, cheese, cold meats, fruit ect). There is a hotel bar where you can also have food and there are PC's connected to the internet which are free for guests to use which we found very handy for looking up the opening times of tourist attractions. I will visit this hotel again when I return to Barcelona as I have no complaints about it. On your arrival you will need to pay a deposit of 50 euros until the end of your stay. There is a poool but it is not very big.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: kariefriedman
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights before going on a cruise.The front desk staff was very polite and helpful. While on a main road, the street noise was minimal. The location was very convenient - metro stop was directly in front of the hotel, a few blocks down to the port, La Rambla, and Plaza Espana. The room was decent sized, bed was comfortable, and the AC worked well. If it Barcelona again, we would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay.”
Reviews.Author: kcanuck
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one night in May and 2 nights in June following a Med cruise and we were delighted with our stay. Being centrally located makes the hotel a very good focal point as Barcelona is easy to walk around. The hotels location is also an ideal stay pre cruise.A taxi from the hotel to the cruise ship was only 12 euros excluding tip. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The hotel is very clean and modern and also has free internet. The breakfast was very good with a good variety along with fresh fruit. We had an excellent supper in the hotel restaurant on our final night in Barcelona,and recommend it. If in the future we return to Barcelona then we would most certainly stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a great location - we would definately stay again - the triple room is ace!”
Reviews.Author: LolaLeno79
Reviews.Content: This hotel is brilliant. The staff are friendly and helpful. The room was spotlessly clean and everything you could possibly need was available. The location is superb, as its not on the noisy, touristy Ramblas, but it is only a 10 min walk away. The streets between are filled with cafes and shops and we found it to feel very safe. One thing I would like to mention is the triple room as we booked it but I really wanted to know if it was going to be what we wanted. I have included some pics with my review because I would have loved to be able to reassure myself before we went. The room was absolutely perfect. My brother and I took my mum for a city break for her birthday. The triple room has a main area with two very comfortable single beds (I would say slightly larger than your average single) which I shared with my mum, and a smaller area with one more single bed. All the beds are the same size (I was worried one might be like a camp bed, but that was not the case at all). The most brilliant thing is that there is a wooden sliding door/screen which completely closes off the single bed area for privacy. Overall this hotel is brilliant and so are the staff who work there. A special thanks to Daniel who was such a lovely friendly person when we arrived at reception.

Reviews.Title: “no problems here”
Reviews.Author: privers78
Reviews.Content: the good: hotel right next to train station 10 mins walk to la rambla clean rooms with good storage and air conditioning works breakfast is simple but includes everything required hotel is modern and well equipped other comments: the area is not the the best but being next to the train station makes this a non issue friendliness of staff is just a pass at reception no tissues in the room was very odd would recommend staying in the this hotel don't recomment the hop on/hop off bus. too crowded and easier to get the train watch out for pick pockets on la rambla - they are everywhere recommend a stadium tour or barcelona fc

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, great staff beautiful city.”
Reviews.Author: JLay23
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights here and have to say it was one of the best hotels I've stayed in. The room was great and avaiable to us before the 3pm check in. Spotlessly clean. The roof top pool is fantastic, what a gem to have in the middle of a city. We had the breakfast included which was really tasty, good variety and the coffee was awesome. I will one hundred percent stay here again next time I come to Barcelona which by the way is the most beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have stayed in. Thank you!”
Reviews.Author: Katiestirling20
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel for two nights before my friends wedding. As three girls travelling it was important for us to feel safe and to have a great location. We could not have chosen a better hotel. Right outside the metro, easy walk to Las Ramblas. We walked to Sagrada Familia and the old part of the city no problem. We found the staff at the hotel extremely helpful and friendly, the maids were always smiling and said good morning. Breakfast was superb given other city hotels I have stayed in, thought there was a good selection of food and the scrambled egg was really yummy!!! We stayed in a triple room on the 7th floor and it was massive, yes the window was frosted but it did open!! Loved the pool, and the solarium area, so relaxing and well kept. The bar prices were average price but quite cheap compared with the rest of Barcelona really (which has got very expensive!!) We had some lovely food (would recommend Los Caracolas ) Overall, excellent, I will be booking again soon! :) :) :) Many Thanks for a brilliant stay.x

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great 3.5”
Reviews.Author: mannes
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located, staff were very friendly, the room was modern and well equipped but the hotel (and it may just be Barcelona) was expensive for what we got. Also they had plastic on the bed between the sheets which made the bed hot and you felt every movement. We had some issues with the plumbing in the bathroom but that may have been a one off and staff were helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice.”
Reviews.Author: waterbabyStaffs
Reviews.Content: Thanks to trip advisers we chose this hotel for our visit to Barcelona and it proved to be everything that was said. The location is good for the centre of the city and is a short walk to most of the areas of interest, the metro is right outside the front entrance and is on a main route. The area itself is rather grubby and mixed but we did not feel uncomfortable or threatened in anyway. The hotel is a business hotel mainly so if you want Carlos the barman to be in a group hug phot and be waving you off, this is not the place for you. The staff are extremely helpfull, professional and efficient. The room we had was on the second floor with a terrace with sun-loungers, tables and chairs (the view wasn't great, but it didn't matter). It was a spacious room and bathroom with everything you could need. The airconditioning was quiet and there is a safe.. The roof top solarium is lovely especially after a day sightseeing, there is a small bar to get drinks and order snacks, the pool is more of a plunge pool and there are showers, fresh towels and sun shades. There are changing rooms there if you have a late flight. We don't like breakfast so we chose to eat out at the local cafe for bun and coffee in the mornings.I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms, excellent service, great location”
Reviews.Author: altorreno
Reviews.Content: The front desk was very helpful and polite. Our room was huge(in comparison to other Euro hotels). We were close to the metro, and walking distance to La Rambla. I would book there again (and I hope I'm able to visit Barcelona again in the future!).

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Heidiannehall
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for a week and loved it, The hotel is in a great location and it is only a 10 minute walk from the harbour, the ramblas and the barri gotic and with the metro station right outside everything is within easy reach. The pool and sun area are lovely with great views and is a great place to relax after a days sight seeing. As it was my birthday while we were there, the hotel had arranged for a room on a high floor so we had a great view and they also arranged a bottle of bubbly for our room, I would definately recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice pre-cruise”
Reviews.Author: KsW_MD
Reviews.Content: Surveyed many options for a night in BCN prior to cruise. Hotel Universal is downtown but not noisy. Ambience excellent. Front desk staff helpful. English/Canadian friendly :) Rooms modern, everything in good working order. Beds comfortable. First-rate breakfast buffet. We booked online and paid upfront which rate included breakfast; however, we would have had no refund if we had cancelled. Altogether, a good rate approx 110EU double incl buffet breakfast., WiFi included. Had a tapas meal at a nearby restaurant to catch the Catalan flavors. Streets appeared safe for walking around 8 -10pm. We took the airport bus downtown Plaza Espana (excellent service, no luggage problems) and cab from there saving about 10 - 15 EU on cab fare. If you are travelling light you can get the Metro from Pl Espana to a stop virtually in front of the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No sight of the sky...”
Reviews.Author: Calle47
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night. The room was quite ok, but but the only small frosted window was facing a deep narrow shaft that on the top - several floors above ours - was covered by another frosted glass. Be very shure that you do not get one of these rooms. There are several...Impossible to know if the sun shines or if it is raining. Otherwise the hotel is centrally situated and has resonable standard... On the bottom of our shaft the hotel kitchen was situated - extreemly noicy as long as the staff there was working - and the sound was ecoing.....

Reviews.Title: “Nicely Located”
Reviews.Author: schoens1
Reviews.Content: The double room we had here was just a room, a little sparse, a little tight, but perfectly serviceable and not overly expensive. Although the hotel is not near the Ramblas, it's a pretty easy walk - and the metro stop is literally right outside the door, if you're not up to the walk. Although Barcelona is a busy city, our room overlooked the street and was very quiet. The breakfast buffet was very good and included in the price of the room.

Reviews.Title: “You wont be disappointed if you stay here”
Reviews.Author: eatandrun33
Reviews.Content: Would definitely recommend this hotel. The staff were all extremely professional, helpful, friendly and happy to advise or make recommendations. We were able to check in to our room early, and without notice, upon our arrival at 10am. The rooms and ensuites are modern and spotless. The bedsheets crisp clean and white...perfect. Yes the beds are 2 single matresses pushed together but I didn't notice until I commented how massive and comfortable the bed was and my partner pointed it out. I wish I could have taken the pillows home with me. The mini bar was typically expensive. Flat sceen TV, desk, safe, lounge chair, large wardrobe, airconditioning and opening window. Fantastic (and again spotless) bath/shower with great water pressure. Bright overhead lighting perfect for tweezers! (No full length mirrors in rooms.) Stayed on 2nd floor in corner room and wasn't bothered by traffic noise with window shut and a/c on. Buffet breakfast was (very salty) scrambled eggs, excellent bacon, tapas stuff (3 x hot), cold meats and cheese, bread, croissants, cakes, yoghurt, cereal, fruit, juices...all very fresh and acceptable in a nice setting. Roof area is a great spot to getaway and have an afternoon drink...fabulous view which is pretty much as good as you'll get anywhere in Barcelona. Pool wasn't huge but still a bonus. There is a bar on the rooftop plus a small but clean, modern adequate gym and a "solarium" which is a relaxing lounging area. The location of this hotel is as good as any. No more than 5-7 minutes walk to La Ramblas. 10 minutes walk to the marina. Metro at the door. I had read that the hotel was in a notorious area. Walking to and from day and night and catching the metro, we felt very safe but obviously kept our wits about us at all times - common sense prevails! The hotel bar is ok for a night cap and the bar across the road is a fantastic little local (picture attached). There is a supermarket nearby which stocks everything you could need. On the last day of our stay we happily left all our bags in the safety of the hotel luggage room for the entire day, returning throughout the day to use facilities and add to our luggage with last minute shopping. Negatives of the hotel are....there are no tea/coffee facilities in bedroom. Was also a little shocked that a few of bottles of water weren't supplied in room, not even upon arrival. (Since you can't drink the tap water, it pays to visit the shop upon arrival for a large bottle to keep in your room.) Thanks BUH, we very much enjoyed our stay and your hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: aznevon
Reviews.Content: We ended up with this hotel after bidding on Hotwire for a 4+ star hotel in the Las Ramblas area of Barcelona. I believe we were able to get it for a bid of $120 ($~140 after taxes/fees) for 1 night. The price was only slightly lower than what was being offered on the hotel's website, but we were fine with it. We arrived at the hotel after disembarking our cruise ship around 9am. Check-in was usually around 3pm so they did not have any rooms available for us but offered to store our luggage in a locked room. We stayed in the lobby to take advantage of the free wi-fi and to figure out our plans for the day and after about 30 minutes, we were notified that our room was ready. We got a room on the first floor (1 level above street level) facing the main street. The room was very clean but small. The bed linens were crisp and clean with fluffy pillows, but the bed was no larger than a full size bed. We didn't really take advantage of the room's amenities (TV, mini fridge, etc) because we were out and about in Barcelona and had to check out of the hotel at 4:30am the next morning to catch our flight. The street is quite noisy and lively...even into 3am so if you have trouble sleeping with noise, request a higher floor that doesn't face the street. Here are a few other noteworthy things about the hotel: - they offer discounted tickets for the "hop on, hop off bus" that takes you all around Barcelona; normally they are 23 EU if purchased on the bus, but were 21 EU when purchased from the hotel - the free wi-fi was accessible from the lobby and rooms and had a strong signal; the speed of the internet was faster than other hotel wi-fi's that I've experienced - the hotel reception staff is very friendly and helped us schedule 2 taxis for pick up at 4:30am - it takes about 8-10 minutes to walk to Las Ramblas; I almost got pick-pocketed while on Las Ramblas when by brother caught someone reaching into my half unzipped bag so because of this, we didn't want to risk walking back to the hotel late at night in narrow alleys so we were back in the hotel soon after sunset at 9:30pm If we ever go back to Barcelona, we'd probably try to get a room right on Las Ramblas street, but would go back to this hotel if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable, would return.....”
Reviews.Author: RickCLightwater
Reviews.Content: Had a 3 day visit to Barcelona, staying at the Universal, there were 4 of us, my wife, my daughter and her boyfriend. The hotel overall was excellent, clean, well appointed rooms. Staff were very helpful and attentive. Location of the hotel is excellent, right outside the Paral-lel metro station and easy walking distance to Ramblas and Port. Had the evening buffet dinner on our first night, this was very good will a good choice of cold plates, and hot options, as well a desserts. The jug of sangria went down well with wife and daughter... My only minor moans were: 1. Buffet breakfast was good, with a fair choice of items, however if you leave taking breakfast until later, eg 10.00 - (served until 11.00) there was a lack of good items, such as croissants and rolls 2. Hotel has a small bar, we used it a couple of times, with very good service, but on 1 evening, different barman, ordered 4 cocktails, 1 Mojito, 2 Pina Colados and 1 Sidecar, - after about 10 minutes, the Mojito turned up, and a small bottle of coke. After another 10 minutes the Pina Colados turned up, without any pineapple juice or coconut milk?, The Sidecar never appeared! The bar was not busy, only us and 3 other people. I did not make an issue of this, just paid, and went down the road to another bar... Overall, excellent stay

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Does what it says on the tin !!”
Reviews.Author: UkZob
Reviews.Content: Ok, just spent a 5 day city break in Barcelona with my wife. We stayed at the Barcelona Universal hotel which is situated on Avda Paral.lel. First things first, the hotel was dead easy to find from the airport. We simply got the airport train to Sants Estacio and changed to the undergound on the L3 green line and got off at Paral.lel station. You take the exit Avda Rue de Sant Pau exit and the hotel is literally right in front of you. By the way be careful on the underground as someone tried (unsuccessfully) to lift my wallet while I was getting on the underground train. The L3 green line will take you to all the popular sites such as Place Catalunya and La Rambla. The hotel is classes as 4* and as long as you are not from New York it will meet your approval. We stayed on a room only basis in a standard room and for which the price was fantastic (booked through Hotels.com). There are plenty of cafes just outside the hotel selling good breakfasts at reasonable prices. The room has 2 large single beds pushed together, A/C, a safe (free of charge), a fridge, a TV with some English speaking channels, bathroom with shower, hairdryer and enough wardrobe space for 2 people. The room and bathroom were spotlessly clean. The window unfortunately opened up onto an interior quadragle, so no view but at the price we paid it was fine as all we did was sleep and get cleaned up. The hotel has a roof top pool which is clean but very very very small, do not be taken in by the hotel photos it is miniscule, 3 large adults would fill the pool. The hotel staff were fantastic and were very helpful. If I had one complaint it is this; on our last day we ate breakfast in the hotel as we needed to be out fairly early to get our flight. The breakfast is buffet style and has a lot of decent things to eat but I had the cooked breakfast and it contained way too much salt so watch out. Would I stay here again; yes without hesitation. Would I recommend it; for value and location and quality (except the cooked breakfast) yes without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “First class service... and cleaner than my own home. Free WiFi!”
Reviews.Author: ESQEGD
Reviews.Content: I went online to find a hotel in Barcelona for a few days before and after a cruise. The reviews for The Barcelona Universal were very positive, so I chose it. I arrived from Florida, after spending all day and night traveling, at 9am local time. I decided to go ahead to the hotel to see if they would at least hold my bags until check in time. The desk clerk said he could hold my luggage, but suggested that I go ahead and check in. They had rooms available and I went right in. The room was bright, clean, and comfortable. Make sure you include breakfast with your room. They have a wonderful breakfast buffet, but the best part of breakfast is a pot of hot coffee with a pot of warm milk. Heaven. I will definitely stay there again. I loved this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect city hotel in Fabulous Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Tiffanypurple
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights at the end of May whilst on a shopping break with my Mum to Barcelona. The hotel really didn't disappoint. It was very easy to find and was outside a Metro station so perfect access for the rest of the city. The hotel is located 10 minutes walk from La Ramblas and although we were told El Raval could be a little edgy at night, we didn't encounter any problems getting to and from our hotel. The staff were very friendly throughout our stay and we were very impressed with the cleanliness and layout of our room. The beds were comfortable and the free wi-fi was a bonus. The terrace on the top floor is a real selling point as it was a great place to relax in the heat of the day. The only negative comments I have is that we ordered breakfast one day and it wasn't very nice and very overpriced. Also watch out as when we got a cab from outside the airport it was only 30 euros but when we asked the hotel to call us one for a return journey, the cab driver tried to charge is 65 euros - it was exactly the same difference. We only have 30 euros with him so he had to settle for that but just beware as the hotel had assured us that a taxi would be no more than 30 euros. Overall this didn't affect our view of the hotel and I would definitely recommend it and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: austeraop5
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located only a short walk to 'La Rambla' and most of the other main Barcelona attractions, with a Metro station right outside. The hotel is clean and modern with helpful, friendly staff. The rooftop Pool and Solarium are lovely. The only thing we could fault - and it didn't bother me being a fella - is the fact that there is not a full length mirror in the bedroom. We would recommend staying there if you're visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: VersysKing
Reviews.Content: spent a couple of nights here and staff where excellent and friendly.only quibbles where no coffee available in the bar and its 10-15 mins to the Ramblas but unfortunatly we seems to pass the the area with prostitutes in it every time.Not that was anything to worry about but could have been a bit closer to busier area.Rooms are excellent and all very clean, breakfast was nice as well plenty of choice.Pool just a dip pool really and no bar on rooftop terrace.other top tip is go on the open top bus tours as good value and a great way to sea the sights and save your legs get tickets from reception

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, great service, close to the underground and sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: thomsonambra
Reviews.Content: loved it, would definately go back. its very close to the underground , which is very easy and cheap to use. 10 mins walk to las ramblas. 10 mins walk to the column. 15 min walk to see the magic fountain. the rooms are a good size, very clean, comfy beds. breakfast wasnt included so didnt try that. free use of the laptops in the lobby..

Reviews.Title: “Book this hotel with complete confidence you will love it.”
Reviews.Author: annegaul
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel post cruise in April after doing a transatlantic on RCCL ending in Barcelona. The hotel was walking distance to the Ramblas. Very clean with a very nice room. The staff was very helpful. We were able to take a bus from here to the airport. We will stay again, and not bother to look anywhere else. Book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rooftop Splendour”
Reviews.Author: thebear59
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for four nights on our recent business trip. This location was excellent as we walked to La Rambla famous popular street within 10 minutes. On another day we walked to the port and walked along the shoreline to the beach area. The rooftop pool is a nice touch after a working day to lounge before the sun sets and enjoy a beverage. Within three minutes walking from the hotel is a grocery store selling wine/beer etc. Front desk will tell you where to go, I believe it was called open cor. The only complaint of the room we had was that it faced a courtyard which was illuminated which didn't make the room too dark. The walls aren't soundproof as you can hear anyone using the washroom flushing/showering. This is typical of the older smaller hotels in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, bright clean rooms, good breakfast and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Toffeethecat
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed three nights, both having been to Barcelona before. Hotel is bright and clean, with friendly very helpful staff, breakfast is unlimited self-service both hot and cold choices. We had a room on the fourth floor, I was concerned to start with as it was located close to the lifts, but the sound proofing was excellent we had no problems. Bathroom clean and fresh towels provided every day. We ate dinner in the hotel restaurant on one occasion after a tiring day doing a lot of walking. Whilst it lacks any real Barcelona charm, the food was of a very good standard and plentiful, and the house wine was surprisingly good, service was excellent and both food and wine were reasonably priced. I would recommend this hotel to friends and relatives, and I would definitely stay here again. I have previously stayed in the Catalunya Plaza hotel, which is a very sweet boutique style hotel, but the service and helpful attitude of the staff at the Universal was of a much higher standard.

Reviews.Title: “Would Return”
Reviews.Author: Grey-Hat
Reviews.Content: I guess the first thing to say is that I would have no problem returning to this hotel, that's usually a good sign. The hotel itself doesn't have any great character and the bar in the lobby was usually empty but the rooms are just fine: - Relatively modern - Twin beds pushed together - Safe (no charge) - Flatscreen TV - Bath with shower that had good pressure! - Mini-bar - Clean - Good aircon - Free Wi-Fi (good reception) The service was very good and the staff were helpful and friendly. The breakfast had a good choice of cold food and a smaller selection of hot (scrambled egg, sausage etc), on the whole breakfast was good. The hotel is located about a 10 - 15 minute walk from the La Rambla. There's not much going on around the hotel and I guess from a location perspective it's not the best but no major issues. The tube/metro is literally outside and if you are on one of the lower floors you may feel the vibrations from the trains (although it never bothered me). The road outside is quite noisy so another good reason to get a room on the higher floors (I think there are 9 floors in use), no major issue. We also managed to get a room with late checkout (4pm) which was bonus as we had a late flight. If you are looking for somewhere nice and romantic or with fantastic views/character then perhaps look elsewhere. If you just want somewhere that's relatively close to the La Rambla/waterfront with good amenities, friendly staff and good service whilst you do all the normal tourist stuff then the hotel will fit the bill perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sumotartan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here beginning of May and I highly recommend it.. Had a standard room, was advertised as a double, but this translates to twin beds ina lot of Spanish hotels. This was fine although trying moving to the middle and you'll slip through the gap! :-) Hotel price was reasonable, and our price included breakfast which was fairly substantial and sorted you for most of the day. The buffet was very varied, toast, scrambled eggs, cereals, cold meats, cheese, fruits, yoghurts and juices. If i had any complaints (extremely minor), the toast sometimes needed about three gos in the toaster, but on the last day they seemed to have adjusted the machine, and also even it would be nice if the juice jugs sat on ice. Like I say very minor. Room was fairly sized, clean and loads of room for storage. Room also had a safe which I recommend using. Bathroom was more than adequate, large sized , toilet, bath shower combo, bidet and large wash basin area, which is great, particularly when you have a partner like mine who takes over the sink space on most holidays! Room enough for two. Not an issue for us but our room didn't really have a view, we had a frosted window which only opened out into the centre not to the outside. It never bothered me as we were rarely in and views from my room don;t really bother me. If you're a natural light fan be warned there isn't any in certain rooms. Quite thick drapes which is great but has its downfall when you think its still night and its actually 930am! :-) Pool was small but ideal and perfect on rooftop - sadly never had time to use it. Location is where this hotel excels, right next to, literally falling into the metro station; Parallel on the L3 line. When you get off metro, take the Rda Sant Pau exit to be in front of the hotel. Also recommend buying a T10 tube ticket (7.80e) bargain at the price and covers zone 1 which encompasses all the major sites. The hotel is also located to many local bars (not touristy ones) and a number of restaurants literally next door. For some small tapas Los Cachitos round the corner is really nice. Because its on Avenue Parallel , there are so many shops and supermarkets if you want to pick up anything for your room. Staff were also great (contrary to other reviews) when we dealt with them and our checkin at 1030 at night was efficient and quick and they gave us maps and a guide book. It took us 30min from the airport, which incl the bus to Placa Espanya(5.1 or 5.3e one way), and then a 3 stop metro ride (easy as pie). Way back we just took a 4 stop ride to Sants Estacio and caught the airport train (3 E) - as easy as arrival I did read in other reviews that there are 'unsavoury' types hanging around in the area or near the hotel....ummm no more so than most big cities and to be honest we were never bothered or approached and really wasn't an issue. In fact one of the cafes nearby seemed to be popular for food and coffees by the local police so no issues really. I can say that in 4 days I never felt in danger etc. Basically just act as you would in your own home town and obviously after midnight or when its dark just be as cautious as you would at home. Because its a busy area, there are always loads of people around so I wouldn't worry. Also people say be aware of pickpockets, again this is my 4th trip to Barca, and I've never had any trouble in that dept either - touch wood. I know it happens as it has happened to friends but again act as you would at home and just take precautions like sealed/zipped pockets etc Overall highly recommend this hotel and free wifi internet was extra bonus

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with a good price.”
Reviews.Author: cMcJ10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Barcelona for 4 days/3 nights. The hotel is 4 stars and definitely strives to exemplify that as soon as you walk in. Still, it doesn't seem that nice. It is a basic hotel that would have more of a 3 star rating. The rooms are large compared to European standards but a large room does not equal a higher rating in my opinion. The staff was friendly enough but some were a little too "snobby" in speaking with guests. Also, I requested a printer to print our boarding passes and unfortunately they did not have one available to the guests. Luckily they were obliging enough to allow me to use their work computers. Still, they made it clear it really wasn't for guest use and I needed to hurry up. The buffet breakfast was basic. Nothing 4 star in terms of food. We previously were at a 3 star hotel in Malaga and received the same type of buffet breakfast. The one major issue with our stay was that our room was facing the street. Unfortunately, this 4 star hotel never invested in double paned windows or something because we could here every little noise from the street and we were on the 3rd floor. Overall, we got a good deal to have a large room in a some what decent location in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: nyc12388
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a solid 2 star, but certainly nowhere near the raves on this site and others. Positives-The hotel is clean, the staff is friendly, the temperature control works well and the metro stops right in front. Negatives-It is not located in the best part of town; during the day it is loud and lacks charm and at night it is somewhat sketchy. The room choices are either facing the loud major thoroughfare in front or the quiet view of staring across the alley into an apartment building in the back. Inside the room the king size bed was actually two doubles pushed (but not strapped) together; I rolled over during the night and fell between the beds sitcom style. And although I prefer a firm bed, I was surprised by how hard both of them were. All said and done the hotel is not that bad but do not be misled by the reviews on this site, the quality is on par with your average Courtyard by Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SunHat16
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend this hotel. We had one of the Skyline Suites and a room for three on the ninth floor. Both were very well presented and clean with good a/c and equipment (TVs, hairdryers, bathroom sundries etc.). There were also two PCs with access to the internet available on the ninth floor. There is a good range for breakfast including cereals, fruits, yogurts, cakes, cheese, ham, breads, pastries and a small selection of cooked breakfast items (eggs, bacon, mini sausages etc.).
