Breakfast was served until 11am, good if you've had a late night before! The staff were excellent, friendly and helpful with excellent English. The pool area is quite small and was very busy when we were there so we made use of our Skyline Suite balcony for sun-bathing although there were other areas on the roof and the top floor balconies with sun-loungers. Location-wise you don't fall out of the hotel onto an interesting site but La Rambla really is just a 5 minute walk away (if you walk the right way!). The marina is about 10 minutes away and the Paral'lel underground station is right outside. The only thing to be aware of is that some of the rooms don't have windows with views. Our room-for-three had a window but it was frosted because its view was just into a kind of enclosed inner ‘courtyard’. The only view was other rooms’ windows that did the same thing. I think this was only a problem on the higher floors which had communal balconies around the top of the building. The lower floors had rooms on the outside of the building so I expect their windows have views outside. Not really related to the hotel but a fantastic find not far away is the Italian restaurant La Bella Napoli about 5 - 10 minutes walk from the hotel on Carrer de Margarit. We turned up without a reservation and were very lucky to get a table - five minutes after we arrived, the place was packed and rightly so - the service and food was fantastic. Just brush up on your Spanish / Italian before you go as they are the only languages on the menu.

Reviews.Title: “True Value - Worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: HCHanning
Reviews.Content: The old adage goes; you get what you pay for. In all things this is mostly true - however there are a few rare exceptions out there and Hotel Barcelona Universal is one of them. Hotel Barcelona Universal is one of these rare cases where you get so much more than what you pay for - you get true value for each penny spent. I cannot even begin to list how impressed I was with what this hotel provided. We felt truly cared for; and while this is commonplace at hotels such as the Waldorf in New York, the d'Angleterre in Copenhagen, the Mamonia in Marrakesh it was not what I expected from a fairly cheap hotel picked by more or less chance on a vague recommendation from a friend. The Hotel is located a few minutes walk from the Rambla. A few minutes walk from the Port Vell and the Rambla del Mar, and a mere second away from the closest subway. A walk to place Catalunya takes about 10 mins at a slow pace looking at the shops in the backalleys and is quite a charming experience. The Barcelona Universal gives you the opportunity to experience life in Barcelona by making you take a short walk through a few genuine, "untouristy" blocks before landing you smack down in the middle of the Rambla. Or you could simply hop on the metro outside the hotel and go where ever you like. Inside the hotel itself we were greeted by the doorman every time we came or went, and the staff were always very helpful no matter what we asked for. The rooms were meticulously clean and tastefully decorated. Minibar, TV with USB (Just bring what you want to watch on a USB stick, plug it in on the back of the TV and use the remote) and bathtub was standard as was WiFi albeit it was a bit shaky and up and down at times. The breakfast buffet deserves special attention since it was on par with the most exclusive hotels I've visited (see above) although somewhat smaller. Several kinds of bread, including rye and darker breads, eggs, bacon, sausages (worth trying, they were excellent) quiches, juices, yoghurts, fruits, croissantes, and more where aplenty. Worth mentioning for those of you with a sweet tooth is that at each buffet were atleast two kinds of cake and several kinds of doughnuts and muffins. ;-) As for other accommodations worth mentioning one cannot forget the rooftop pool and the astroturf garden / sundeck on the top floor together with the small but clean and well stocked gym also on the top floor located next to the pool. The surrounding decked area is stocked with comfortable lounge chairs and as made for bringing your own beer and taking in the panoramic view over the city. All in all - this hotel gives you the most bang for your buck I've ever come across. Friendly and helpful staff, clean and tasteful rooms, freedom to move around and simply enjoy the city and your accommodation to the fullest. Four stars in the guide - I'd give it Four+ and a half :P Enjoy your stay as much as we did! H. Hanning

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Nice location in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: NYC30s0mething
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in early April - it was my first trip to Barcelona and we (a friend and I) stayed here based on the other trip adviser reviews. The staff was extremely helpful and knowledgeable and I appreciated that they answered each of my many questions. The rooms were a nice size and we had no problems with the size of the bathrooms (I find often American travelers are not used to the size of European hotel bathrooms). The hotel also had a solarium (roof deck) which we took advantage of for some R&R after long days of sightseeing and small locker rooms on the top floor which came in handy since we arrived at the hotel before check-in. Breakfast was included in our room and it was a nice spread with something for everyone (I happen to be a vegetarian). The only negative I found was that I didn't love the location - it was located about 10 minutes from Las Ramblas - a really easy walk during the day when it was light out but a little sketchy and harder to navigate at night (due to the smaller, winding streets). If you are OK taking a taxi or the metro (literally outside the hotel) at night, I would 100% recommended this hotel - the staff was great, the rooms were clean, the price was right and overall it was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, but non-descript, mixed review of staff and not central for walkers.”
Reviews.Author: davidg4242
Reviews.Content: The Barcelona Universal is a non-descript, but modern hotel with the metro stop Para-lell, just outside the front door. I mention this because whether or not you think it is well-located depends upon your attitude toward the metro—since there is not so much by way of sites to walk to near the hotel except, perhaps, the waterfront. However, the hotel is only two or three metro stops from where you want to be and, in another direction two metro stops to the airport bus. On two occasions (in three days) staff members gave us wrong directions and bad information. Our large, very nice 8th floor room was a couple of doors away from rooms being renovated and that got us a bad whiff of whatever glue was being used to and from the elevator. Rooftop swimming pool closed for repairs but too cool to use anyway. On one occasion, we did get an excellent restaurant recommendation just around the corner from the hotel: Elche. No complaints about internet use, which seemed readily available. I’d look somewhere else and make sure the travel agency gave you a more central hotel with a bit of character. A last word: take seriously the warnings about pickpockets on the metro—they work in gangs and have all kinds of tricks. I pulled a guy’s hand out my pocket at the hotel’s metro. A healthy paranoia is all you really need.

Reviews.Title: “Great find - everything we wanted”
Reviews.Author: kittymusing
Reviews.Content: I booked a trip to Barcelona with a friend back in January for a long weekend to escape the end of the English winter. I was responsible for booking the hotel and chose this one off the back of some very good reviews and also because the price was so reasonable for two of us sharing a twin room. We were not disappointed - this place is great. We arrived in Barcelona quite late in the evening and it was so easy to find and the staff were very helpful and directed us to a great cafe where we could get food, just round the corner. The price of our room didn't include breakfast but because so many other reviews raved about it we decided to pay for it on the first morning and it's definitely worth it. Endless, delicious food to set you up for a day of sight seeing. The room was wonderful, clean, comfortable. This hotel wouldn't tick the box if you were specifically after a quirky, individual guest house as it is big, but there's nothing else that I could see that was wrong with it and it's incredibly efficiently run. It's within walking distance of anywhere you want to get to, and right next to the metro anyway.

Reviews.Title: “an excellent find”
Reviews.Author: Jeff2036
Reviews.Content: Well, everything was perfect ! Location is good, next to a metro station, a 10 min walk to La Rambla. Big rooms, quiet (we were on the 8th floor, on the back side of the street), very clean, clear and comfortable. Very good breakfast with fruits, meat, eggs, bread, etc... And a very friendly and helpfull staff. We will recommend it with no reserve and will return for our next trip to Barcelona. And again, big up to the manager, Mr. Perez, who was ready to find a very good solution for us. Many many thanks, our trip to Barcelona was a big sucess. Our four teens loved it !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent find!”
Reviews.Author: Holiday_lover092
Reviews.Content: The location was super, just 10 minutes walk from Las Ramblas. Despite being pretty central the hotel was reasonably quiet. The rooms were very good with everything you'd expect from a four star hotel and the standard of cleanliness was excellent. The most outstanding memory though is the helpfulness of the staff, with (it seemed) no expectation of tips all the time. We'd certainly stay at other hotels chain.

Reviews.Title: “UNBELIEVABLY GOOD”
Reviews.Author: GEORDIE M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Universal for two nights. The rooms were immaculate with very modern bathrooms. All of the staff were helpful and friendly. We payed for breakfast and were not disappointed there was plenty to choosr from and it served buffet style so you can really fill yourself up before a days sight seeing around Barcelona. We had read reveiws complianing about noise from the street outside but our room was at the back of the hotel so were didnt here a thing. Overall we could not fault the hotel and would definetly stay again. Its also cheaper to book through the hotels own website than using alpha rooms etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: guiliette
Reviews.Content: Was a good choice of hotel for our first visit to Barcelona. In a good location, decent value for money, clean and comfortable. Would definitely return

Reviews.Title: “Lovely modern, clean hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: Andy_Edit
Reviews.Content: Stayed in April-10 (late writing this review). 3 lads on a cultural excursion. The triple room was great and just perfect for what we needed. The hotel is modern and tidy, the rooms are spacious and clean, breakfast isn't a lot to write home about, but it sets you up for the day and saves you a few euros from eating out! Good location with a metro station a few yards away, 10 minutes walk to the Ramblas and about 20 down to the port area, tiny swimming pool on the roof with sun beds and a view of the city. Reception staff very helpful and friendly, especially Carlos who went out of his way to engage in conversation and humour. In April-10 they charged €470 for 3 nights over a weekend (breakfast included), with their success in the Trip Advisor rankings (#18 out of 555 as I write), will this go up?

Reviews.Title: “I would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: topbox
Reviews.Content: Stayed from the 30thMarch/3rd April.We knew the area so we walked from the Placa de Catalunya down the ramblas and found the street quite easily.As we walked we thought we are a bit out from the centre,and were a bit wary but when we reached the hotel and got our bearings it is very central.The hotel is fab,from the moment we approched the front desk we knew it felt right and the staff made us actually feel like friends.We have been coming to Barcelona for ten years, sometimes twice a year and have stayed in many good hotels with nice staff but this one comes out tops...I feel biased because we were given a brilliant room on the 9th floor with no neighbours so I can only rate this a 10.The room was massive we had a sitting room with a flat screen tv, from there we had a privare balcony with table/cahirs and loungers.From the sitting room we went into the bedroom also a massive bed and flat screen tv from there into a fab bathroom with a jacuzzi.The breakfasts were the best and the staff were very intentive.Special thanks to Francisco on the front desk,you were lovely and nothing was any trouble.You helped make our break special.I would reccommend this hotel and would stay there again.Thanks again to all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Not my favorite hotel in Barcelona, but it worked...”
Reviews.Author: tjcheerio
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very Americanized - it seemed that everyone staying there was American. The hotel itself is nice and the rooms are nice but the staff was just ridiculous. They were so rude to people. I was sitting in the lobby waiting for my husband and a man came down to request ice because he sprained his ankle or something and they wouldn't help him! A few minutes later a woman arrived with a small child and when the child complained that he had to use the bathroom, the woman at the front desk rolled her eyes and looked at him like he was a menace. When I checked in and asked for a map, you'd think I had asked her for her kidney or something, she was clearly very put out by my request. Overall, the hotel is fine but I'd never stay here again. I also must say that I would have preferred either being on one of the major shopping streets or closer to the water. There are SO many hotels to choose from, you can find one better than this!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the money”
Reviews.Author: QueenVictoriaBoston
Reviews.Content: Two married couples (45 - 50) stayed at the hotel for 3 nights from March 23 - 26th. I booked this hotel through Hotwire based on star rating and location at a total price of $120/per night including tax. The location is fairly close to La Ramblas where all the action is it's a quick 7-8 minute walk so that's definitely a plus. However, if you turn the wrong corner you will end up in a very seedy area with a lot of streetwalkers who are there even in the middle of the day. As for the hotel itself, it wasn't bad. I would rate it more of a 3 1/2 star not a 4. We arrived at 11:00 and our rooms were not available so they told us to leave our luggage and come back at 2:00 pm. The rooms are fairly small but clean. We were on the 2nd floor facing the back of the building (ugly sight of people's laundry hanging and plumbing on the buildings) but we did have a private deck even though the view was quite undesireable so we never went out there. The bathroom was decent size, clean and had marble floors and bidet. Our sink didn't drain well and even though we had reported the problem the first day it was never fixed in the three days we stayed there so it was very annoying for both of us to brush our teeth in the morning as we had to wait about 15 minutes for the sink to drain after each person. There was a hairdryer but it didn't function very well so it took forever to get ready. There is no coffee/tea maker in the room which forses you to go. We did not eat at the restaurant at the hotel (since breakfast was not included in our $120/nt rate) and there are a few little places around where you can have breakfast for a lot less money. Overall, the hotel was OK just because it was fairly close to all the action and we walked there and back saving money on cabs, but not someplace I would choose to stay again next time now that I know my way around Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “PLEASANT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: MARIECONROY
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant stay at the hotel, breakfasts were good and room comfortable. We had a early morning wake up call (7am) with some workmen in the next room but apart from that very good. We would like to warn people about the street cafes though as they are a rip off and charge much more than the prices shown on the menu. When we queried this we were told it was because we eat outside and they have to pay extra tax for having tables outside. I think they should have an outside menu stating those prices and an inside menu if that is the case but then they couldn't rip you off could they? Cafe Espanol is a bad one!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in a very good location”
Reviews.Author: DrS_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights. Took advice from earlier Trip Advisor postings and asked for high floor at the back. In room 821 - excellent. No traffic noise unless window opened. Just little niggles - no tea / coffee making facilities in room (would have been nice early morning) and sink plug broken. Did not have breakfast in our package and reluctant to pay 15 euros each so ate in cafe behind hotel for half the price. Watch menu prices in Las Ramblas. Entice you in with cheap meal menus then load drink prices. 7 euros for a beer and 10 euros for wine!!! We found a really cheap, excellent cafe that you would probably not look twice at down from the hotel near Las Ramblas. 3 courses plus drink ad bread for 9.95 euros. All fresh food and excellent value. Watch

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel with wonderful breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Tibor4500
Reviews.Content: We were there for 3 nights, it is a nicely rebuilt building very close to Para-Lel metro station. This helps a lot with sightseeing, easy access to Barcelona's main attractions. Room was big, clean, nice outlook, we were on the 8th floor. On the roof there is a pool, nice staff. Breakfast was great, wide variety of morning food. There was only two things to mention: if somebody was walking on the foyer, we heard everything in the room. And, the room was very cold until we asked for heating. On the 14-15th March the weather was extremely crazy in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “*** Great value and highly recommended ***”
Reviews.Author: mr_cruiser
Reviews.Content: This must be one of the best value hotels in Barcelona. We stayed here post-cruise in February, the hotel is on the subway line right at Paral-lel stop so you can get to it from just about anywhere in Barcelona. It is also close to the Port area so we just walked to it from the Columbus Monument where the Port shuttle drops you off from the cruise terminal (you can also take the subway from Drassanes). The hotel is also within walking distance to La Rambla, Raval, Barri Gothic and all the interesting area sights, we felt quite safe walking about. When we left we took the subway from Paral-lel to Place Catalunya (3 stops away) to board the Airport bus. Very convenient and very economical. The hotel itself is modern and the staff very friendly and helpful. We arrived early and they stored the luggage for us. The lobby is very spacious and bright, there are free computer facilities there, and if you need anything printed out (like your flight E-pass) they will print it out for you. Our room was on the 6th floor overlooking Paral-lel, the view was fantastic especially at night and it was quiet (double glass windows). Our room was very spacious and clean, lots of storage space, plenty towels, full toiletries and lotions, a safe, flat screen TV and free wireless. We had a king size bed and I must say that it was the most comfortable bed that I slept on for the entire vacation. Buffet breakfast was included and it was very good and plentiful, a wide variety of jams, breads and pasteries, juices, cereals, fruits and coffee, cold cuts and hot foods (eggs, sausages, etc). I was impressed with the hotel, the facilities and amenities, and will definitely stay here again. Great value and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel with great location close to key places”
Reviews.Author: woodenshoe58
Reviews.Content: Clean modern rooms. Front desk really helpful. Had the breakfast buffet ($$); not bad selection. Hotel was clean. WIFI available. When we go back to Barcelona, I would check into this hotel first.

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely be back to the Universal, great hotel with fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: EfaDublin
Reviews.Content: We are just back today after three nights in the Universal. I had high hopes for this hotel from the number of positive reviews on here and we were certainly not disappointed. This was our second time in Barcelona and the first in this hotel. We got a very good rate going direct to the hotel website which included a very nice buffet breakfast. The staff were extremely helpful and courteous from the moment we arrived. Our room was not ready when we arrived but they held our bags until we returned. The room was very big and absolutely spotless. We were thrilled with this particularly the cleanliness of the bathroom. We were in a room at the end of the corridor so got great uninterrupted sleeps for the 3 nights we stayed. The hotel decor overall is very understated and modern. The metro stop Paral-el is directly outside the hotel and is the best way to get around after dark. We used it as much as we could and the 10 journey tickets are extremely convenient. The rooftop solarium and pool would be excellent when the weather is slightly warmer. The hotel bar is very reasonable for drinks and snacks. I will definitely be going back to the Universal when I visit this amazing city again and wouldn't hesitate in recommending it to anyone else. It is a great base for any holiday or business visit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, great location and fantastic staff!”
Reviews.Author: 2Calgarians
Reviews.Content: We would really like to recommend this nice hotel in Barcelona. It's perfectly located and they offer a great services. The rooms are really clean and quite big, for European standards. Thank you kindly,

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, spotless, huge room, lovely staff...what more could you ask for.”
Reviews.Author: carlowtripper
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 night recently and wouldn't hesitate in recommending it to other. The room was immaculate and very large, even had piped radio into the bathroom. The staff were most courteous and helpful. When I enquired as to where we should go for something nice to eat, a beautiful Italian restaurant was recommended to us. Not only that but the staff were so helpful they even printed out a map of the restaurant location. Should I ever visit Barcelona again I shall definitely stay in the Hotel Barcelona Universal or one of it’s sister hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and reasonably well located.”
Reviews.Author: Fordandco
Reviews.Content: We are just packing on out last day in Barcelona. The Universal is a good hotel and is reasonably well located to the centre of Barcelona. A metro station outside the hotel helps but as we preferred to walk everywhere it was about a 10 minute walk to get to Las Ramblas. The only comments I wanted to make were simple. This is advertised as a 4 star hotel but there were some picky things they need to sort out. There were no bathrobes provided in the rooms and no shaving mirror either. This may sound picky but for a 4 star hotel a shaving mirror would have been nice. The edge of the sink and the large bathroom mirror were in different postcodes and, with a myopic tendency, it made shaving a problem. Avoid rooms near the lift as the sound of them discharging drunken guests in the early hours was a little disturbing. Also the sound proofing on out 2nd floor room was not that good. It may be satisfactory for someone from the city but us country folk it was a distraction in the middle if the night. Despite all this we would return to the hotel. It was very clean and the rooms were nice. The roof top pool was out if action but I can imagine in the summer months it would be nice to soak overlooking the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice at a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Limshang
Reviews.Content: For a private trip I stayed for 5 days in Barcelona together with my wife and brother. Based on the good reviews on Tripadvisor as well as the reasonable rate we got (EUR 130 per night) compared with some other hotels, we decided to stay at the Barcelona Universal hotel. We were very happy with our choice. First of all the location is absolutely great. Walking distance to the Rambla and the interesting Ravel district. The subway entrance is right at the entrance of the hotel which makes it very convenient to get to anywhere in the city. We booked a 3person room which was very spacious with lots of storage room, nice and clean bathroom and 4star level design and furniture. Free wifi comes with the room which is a nice plus. Slight disadvantage is the limited amount of English channels on the TV. Breakfast was included in our rate and is nice. The buffet has a decent amount of choices. Food is good but exactly the same every day which makes you become a bit tired after 5 days. Service throughout our stay was good. Staff is very friendly and helpful. I would certainly recommend this hotel both for business and private for any stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Stay...Great Value”
Reviews.Author: truantWestminster_MD
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Barcelona Universal last November, 2010, 3 days prior to a cruise on the Norwegian Jade. I had not been to Barcelona since 1972 (AD), and so the booking was a blind leap of faith. What a delighful surprise it was! The hotel is very, very conveniently located on Avenida Paral-lel, which is very near Las Ramblas. AND, there is Metro stop directly outside the front door. The room was very clean, modern and upscale. The bistro feel of the property really put us in the mood for enjoying the beautiful city of Barcelona, and we even dipped our toes in the rooftop pool. The staff was friendly and helpful, and anticipated our dumb touristy questions. We would love to go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and great value”
Reviews.Author: gpreston24
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was very helpful at all times, and their English was excellent. Good-sized room/bath by European standards. Breakfast was acceptable, but perhaps not up to standards we might expect in the U.S. (You might consider one of the several nearby restaurants on Av. Paral.lel that advertised very reasonably priced American breakfasts, although we didn't try any since we had breakfast included with our room rate.) A major plus was having the Metro stop literally right in front of the hotel. Highly recommend buying a T10 ticket as a moneysaver. Would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: talkeetnaguy
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed here for four nights pre cruise (Jan 23). We had a blast walking to and from La Ramba and we encoutered nothing but good times. Metro is right outside and the front Staff is great with directions on all aspects of travel.(Train, Metro, Bus) We even visited Cava country by metro and train. Very simple. Some great local places too eat and drink cheap near by. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: bookworm87
Reviews.Content: We LOVED this hotel and greatly recommend it. The front desk staff was especially wonderful. They recommended the best restaurants to us, especially Quimet & Quimet (on Carrer del Poeta Cabanyes).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great service and location”
Reviews.Author: SJF89
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, and I would definitely stay here again. The room was very modern, clean and comfortable and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Although other reviews have said that the area is unsafe, we had no problems, however the area does look a bit dodgy! The hotel is located right outside a metro stop so it is very quick to get anywhere in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “"Excellent Hotel, Friendly Staff & Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Beethoven54
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the hotel. First stay was in April 2010. We loved it so much last time, we didn't have to think twice about booking it again this time. Our room was clean and large. It is very close to the Metro station, the Rambla, and Colon. Breakfast was excellent. Lots of choices. Staff was always friendly and eager to help with directions. Two computers in the lobby for internet. Definitely stay here again. Everything was PERFECT!

Reviews.Title: “Service with a smile.”
Reviews.Author: clarajane2
Reviews.Content: I can confirm the positive opinions posted by other travellers. The hotel is in a convenient position, right in front of a metro station with direct lines to the main tourist attractions. The hotel itself has modern bedrooms with large bathrooms (for a city hotel), bar, restaurant, small gym and roof-top pool for warmer months. We booked directly with the hotel and got a marvellous rate for two nights bed and breakfast and a complimentary bottle of Cava served in our room. The staff are a credit to the hotel, especially at reception, where they were always able to give precise indications and excellent recommendations in a friendly manner delivered with a smile. Thank you for making our short stay so enjoyable. We hope to return in the not too distant future.

Reviews.Title: “Would very much like to return.”
Reviews.Author: stinemalling
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights with my 11-year old son, my sister and my father to watch a soccer match between FC Barcelona and Racing Santander. We had very clean, quiet and nice rooms. I had written to the hotel and asked for rooms to the yard and not to the street - I believe these room can be noisy. We had a 20% off special offer including breakfast - very good value for the money indeed! Would like to stay at the hotel in the summer to be able to use the outdoor swimmingpool and terrace on top of the building - magnificent view! On the second floor where our rooms were, you could hear (and feel) the metro driving under the earth, but it was no problem at all. There are rooms up to the 9th floor, so it is possible to stay farther away from the metro. Okay location - the metro right outside the hotel entrance and five minutes walk to the Ramblas. I would very much like to return to the Barcelona Universal Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is perfect and the staff are wonderfully helpful. Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: annesalford
Reviews.Content: Having read excellent reviews on Trip Advisor we chose this hotel - and it was PERFECT. It is ideally situated, being a short taxi ride from the port, convenient for the airport transfers and the city metro system. After our cruise in January 2011 we had to vacate the ship before 9am. The staff welcomed us in spite of the early hour and immediatedly offered early access to our room which was large and spotless with contemporary stylish decor. A real bonus was free internet access in the lobby. The hotel is a short walk from the Rambla and to the waterfront area. Having stayed previously just off the Rambla, I much preferred this location away from noisy nightlife. Can't praise this hotel highly enough. Do not hesitate to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff!”
Reviews.Author: Samdlover
Reviews.Content: We came to Spain for our honeymoon and decided to stay here based on all the great reviews. We were definitely not let down! First off, the staff is the best (especially Christian who was absolutely fabulous) and worked hard to get us into the room we requested - 816 is amazing!! Not only did they give us a lovely bottle of cava to start off our honeymoon, they patiently answered our endless list of questions with a smile. The hotel itself isn't in the nicest of locations but it is literally five steps from the Metro which makes it perfect! Just be smart about your surroundings and use some common sense.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Hotel And Service - Our Stay Here Was Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Ruthinbc
Reviews.Content: We were in Barcelona in December (pre and post a Mediterranean cruise) and stayed at Hotel Barcelona Universal. It was one of the best hotel experiences of my life. Prior to our visit to Barcelona, I connected with hotel manager Pablo Perez. I had seen his feedback left on trip advisor and was impressed that he went out of his way to respond to people. Pablo is exceptional. He not only gave us recommendations for restaurants and helped us to make reservations, he also sent us to links to events and activities that we might enjoy while in Barcelona. He was incredibly proactive – he didn’t just respond to my questions, he went out of his way to share information with us so we would have a great experience there. Before we even got on a plane to go to Barcelona, we felt comfortable in the city and had some great plans. When we arrived—at 8 p.m. on a Saturday night, we were welcomed at the hotel and got into our rooms very quickly. The room rates are reasonable, the hotel is exceptional – great atmosphere, lovely décor, it’s clean and it is a very convenient location (and right at a Metro station). The person at the front desk went out of her way for us – we were going to be a little late for our dinner reservation and she called to let them know. It seemed like making sure we had a pleasant experience was important to her. We felt welcome, which is a big thing. Every interaction we had with the staff at Hotel Barcelona Universal was positive. Everyone that works there was friendly and the front desk staff went out of their way to make our visit to Barcelona a good one. From explaining how to use the metro (in very good English!), to giving us advice on what time to go to specific attractions, to asking us how our day was. It was like a home away from home. Staying at the Hotel Barcelona Universal was one of the best decisions we made on this vacation (and we made a lot of good decisions this trip!). It is a great hotel at a great rate.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in every way”
Reviews.Author: KentheEnchanter
Reviews.Content: We came into Barcelona on Christmas Day. I had some concerns about being able to find an open restaurant on that day, but the hotel told me not to be bothered (they were right. Two words: Arab Quarter). Everything about our stay was wonderful. Location is ideal...right at the Metro (mass transit in Barcelona is exceellent), quick walk to the Rambla, lots of nice Tapas bars (and Turkish/Pakistani/Chinese if you happen to be travelling on Chrismas). The hotel was beautiful, the room well-appointed, clean, and ultra comfortable. The staff was friendly, courteous, and most spoke excellent English (they were, of course, happy when I spoke my limited Catala that's native to the area). They were very helpful when we trvalled to Bilbao and let us leave our luggage with them though we weren't returning to them. We fell in love with Barcelona and are already making plans to return. We'll surely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay, Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dan2002_uk
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a New Years Eve get away. Upon arrival we were greeted by a very friendly concierge who took our bags to the front desk. As we arrived quite early in the day our room was not ready (we figured that would be the case as it states check in is at 15:00pm on their website). The staff were more than helpful and we were able to leave our luggage in a secure room in the hotel. After taking in some of the sights Barcelona had to offer we returned to the hotel, where we were given our room keys where upon arrival of our room where taken back by how spacious and modern it was. We had more than enough room with a spectacular view from the eighth floor. Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel as the amenity's are more than sufficient and it definitely lives up to its 4* rating. The staff are friendly and more than helpful. Getting to Le Ramblas is very easy and if you don't feel like the 10 minute walk then you can get a cab for around €5.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: NJK1234
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, friendly staff very clean. Great location 15 min walk to las ramblas - metro stop on the doorstep . Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Pablo Is The Best”
Reviews.Author: areadchua
Reviews.Content: We booked into Barcelona Universal Hotel in December 2010. A situation arose that had nothing to do with the Hotel. It involved a cruise we were scheduled to go on and airline tickets. Although Pablo, the Reservations and Front Desk Manager really had no obligation to do so he was incredibly helpful in ensuring that we were satisfied. I feel a little bad because I was so so frustrated with everything else that was happening, I had quite a bad temper when I first started dealing with Pablo. He was truly unbelievable and so service oriented. If you want to be sure you get great service in a great place. Book nowhere other than Barcelona Universal Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: rattlesnake_ch
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is very good, it takes only about 7 minutes to walk to the Ramblas even though the neighborhood one has to walk through (El Raval) can be a little dingy at night. But taxis are easy to find and the metro station is right in front of the hotel. The rooms are nice and very clean. The only negative point was that we didn't have a real window in our room, just a window that went into some kind of ventilation tube. Therefore, it was always a little bit gloomy in the room. Better ask for a room with a real window. Staff is very friendly and helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, loved the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Joyce122010
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days before departing on a cruise. Location was great for walking to harbor and La Rambla, felt very safe. Metros and buses right there. Staff at front desk spoke English well and were helpful with questions, and the continental breakfast was good with views out to the streets of Barcelona. Also lovely views from the top floor of the hotel. I loved that they had free internet available; however, I couldn't bring my laptop on the trip and there was often a wait to use the ones in the hotel. The hotel wasn't really fancy, but we were here to sight-see and spent very little time here. All in all, we thought this place was great and would definitely stay here again if we came to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic base to see the City”
Reviews.Author: banner65
Reviews.Content: We stayed over a weekend (fri - sun) first week in dec. Check in very smooth. Rooms are lovely with a modern clean bathroom and the best shower ever!! Staff really helpful and friendly. Its well located - only 20 meters from a L3 line underground station. Numourous bars and places to eat near by - mostly frequented by friendly locals. The only minor drawback is the ambulance sirens when they respond to calls , even with sound proofing , they woken us up at least once a night - suggest asking for a room not at the front of the hotel . Very minor drawback - we didnt request a room change so wasnt that great a problem .Breakfast great and peaceful with a buffet style . Would recommend without hesitation

Reviews.Title: “Just ideal”
Reviews.Author: PeteWrobel
Reviews.Content: The third time I have stayed at the Barcelona Universal. It's just about ideal for business and leisure (mine was a combined trip). Comfortable, modern rooms (but the ones at the front can be noisy...try to get at the back, or as high as possible), free wireless internet everywhere, excellent breakfasts (properly cooked scrambled eggs, lots of choice) though it can get busy at weekends. Location is very good: right by a metro station, and 6 or 7 minutes' walk to the Ramblas. We walked everywhere...Plaza de Catalunya, Barcelonetta Port Vell, etc. But immediately around the hotel stick to the main(ish) roads at night. Excellent value for money, friendly staff, taxis almost always outside. Breakfast apart, we didn't eat in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and great location”
Reviews.Author: Ruperto
Reviews.Content: Five night stay which was comfortable throughout. Location is great next to metro station and short walk to Ramblas, Quarto Gotico, harbour etc. Rooms are best at the back away from traffic noise (sound insulation is not great) and 8th floor up have great views over the city. Beds and facilities are all fine. Dont recommend room service or hotel bar, but there are great cafes and restaurants all around. Breakfast buffet is fine. Staff are all helpful. Wifi works great, as do computers in business centre on 9th floor. Pool (not heated) and gym on roof are tiny, but views spectacular. Only computer with printer access is behind reception but they will set it up for you to use to print boarding passes etc. when its not busy. They coped with guest chaos during air traffic strike very well, but dont have a huge staff for size of hotel. More of a hotel for business and adult vacationers, not much for families here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: FoxyRhino
Reviews.Content: Was in Barcelona for a 3 night mni-break on my own. Found the hotel on one of the popular travel sites as a secret hotel and got 3 nights for the price of 2 (room only). Location was great with the metro entrance right outside the hotel and the next stop on the metro being the bottom end of the Ramblas. Room was spacious and comfortable with a good-sized bath in the bathroom although my room (614) had a window that looked out on the centre of the hotel so there wasn't a large amount of natural light in the room during the day. I had breakfast in the hotel the first morning which was good quality but at 15 euros, was a little expensive and breakfast can be got at one of the cafes within 100 yards of the hotel for half the price. I didn't have dinner in the hotel but it seemed to be reasonably priced (set price for a buffet and a main course). The free wireless internet in the hotel was useful and even though when I was there, they were having problems with their wireless network being picked up by my netbook, the hotel provided a cable to plug into the socket for a small deposit so that I could take advantage of it. The rooftop pool and solarium area looked very nice but the pool is closed in the winter months for obvious reasons.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Location, Nice Rooms, Best Part = Warm & Welcoming Staff”
Reviews.Author: Amy_Krista
Reviews.Content: This is my very first TripAdvisor review - I was inspired to write because the staff at this hotel were really over-the-top fabulous - Francisco, Christian, and Carlos in particular. They answered all of our many questions with charm, kindness, and flair, and had terrific recommendations for us, including to go to a flamenco show just down the street that is apparently the "Best in Barcelona" (two thumbs up for the show, if you are in Barcelona, GO!) What a way to celebrate a birthday! We just stayed at the Hotel Barcelona Universal for 4 days for my mother-in-law's birthday. It was truly a fabulous experience, and the hotel's location and great vibe was a big part of that. The room was comfortable and big. They had free internet for us in the lobby - I think in the rooms, too, though we didn't bring our computers. The hotel is a quick 5 or 10-minute walk over to The Ramblas - just close enough to walk into the action when we wanted, and far enough away to retreat to the relative quiet at night! The subway stops right outside the hotel, and we soon discovered that the Barcelona subway just about puts New York to shame. It is clean and user-friendly, so with the subway and a good map we were able to get all around the city - to all of the Gaudi stuff, the Sagrada Familia, the Ramblas, the Picasso Museum, really everything you'd want to see and more. I love Barcelona, and we will be going back - when we do, we'll be staying at the Hotel Barcelona Universal. Thank you for a wonderful stay and for making my mother-in-law's birthday so special!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good beds, friendly. Location: ok”
Reviews.Author: ErikP69
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel. Good breakfast. Friendly staff. Unfortunately my room had a blinded window looking out into a kind of covered courtyard (room 801). No real fresh air, and definitely no view. I was there for a conference, so no real in-room time anyway, but disappointing. The room itself had all the mod-cons and free wifi (ask the desk, they don't give you the login automatically when you check in (point of improvement???))

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: mimiccr
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights pre-cruise and were delighted with everything about the Barcelona Universal Hotel. We were amazed that we were able to check in at 9 a.m. upon arrival from our early flight from the U.S. The rooms were spotless, including modern bathroom. Hotel staff (esp. Francisco) was very helpful when I had a problem with my credit card in the ATM machines across the street and helped me make a collect call to the company back in U.S. to sort it out. Their advice about nearby restaurants was spot on. We would recommend this hotel to anyone and will definitely stay with them again if and when we return to Barcelona. The walk through to La Rambla was "interesting" but not scary at all. Metro station right outside hotel is a definite plus. In short, our stay was brilliant!!

Reviews.Title: “helpful reception staff!”
Reviews.Author: juneandmike
Reviews.Content: LOvely room, superb breakfast, good location for metro(which is really easy to use) and the most helpful and charming reception staff I have ever met.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Marie2525
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights - upon arrival we were dealt with very efficiently and effectivley. The room was great and like the rest of the hotel was spotless. Breakfast was good. The staff were excellent - will defintley recommend to friends and will prob repeat visit ourselves as there is so muh more to see

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel, friendly staff - excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: carolinemcclean
Reviews.Content: I'm just back from a 3 night break in Barcelona and spent a lot of time on Tripadvisor prior to our trip planning on where to stay, I choose Barcelona Universal and was not disappointed. The hotel is a pleasant 10 mins walk to Las Ramblas, the rooms are extremely clean and spacious and the staff couldn't be more friendly or helpful. We throughly enjoyed our break and would highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Gerdav4074
Reviews.Content: Convenient location, only a short walk to La Rambla and the Metro with plenty of good value eating places nearby. Wooden floor rooms, very clean and modern. Helpful staff. Terrific roof top views but agree with other comments that the pool couldn't be much smaller!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveldizzy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on a good location (Avinguda del Paralel) which heads down towards the sea front. It is also walking distance to the port, acquarium, shops, Ramblas, beach (Barceloneta), restaurants, bars, convenient stores as well as the bustops and metro (underground train) Paral-lel. The hotel staff was kind enough to let us select between 2 rooms as we requested and gave the 10th floor, one of the biggest room. The other was much smaller and compact although our room did not have the view we wanted, but compromised for the size of it. It was big, clean, had walk in wardrobe, nice shower room as well as aircondition unit. Las Ramblas is a nice experience but its just a long street with shops and acts. I would recommend for the Gothic quarter, Gaudi Parc Guell, Olympic, the shopping district (e.g. El Corte Ingles). The market off the Ramblas is nice, our favourite was the refreshing fruit juices, watermelon, orange, coconut, you name it, on a hot day,mmmm. We took an airport transfer bus (outside the terminal) from the airport in a short time we were in the centre shopping district(20-35mins). From here you could get either get a bus, metro or taxi which is about 10-15mins ride to this hotel (if you know your hotel location, then get a bus is about less than 2euros single trip). There is a nice selection of breakfast buffet of course as usual is important. Barcelona city and Universal Barcelona is well recommended for a nice holiday or perhaps a long weekend. Our actual stay is on July 2009.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we expected and more”
Reviews.Author: ncarb
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived we experienced nothing but good things from this hotel. The check-in was seamless. The desk clerks were eager to please and answered every question we had. They provided maps, directions, recommendations for tours and restaurants. The bell hop jumped at the opportunity to help with our bags from the taxi to check-in and our room, which was simply but nicely directed with plenty of room and closet space including a wall-safe. The room was spotlessly clean and the chambermaid immediately responded to my wife;s request for extra blankets. The bathroom was equipped with a wonderful shower, good towels and a bidet. We were fortunate to have a room which faced an alley in the back which was absolutely quiet both during the day and at night for sleeping. Our friends had a room on the same floor which had a nice view of the street, but with the attendant noises. If you want quiet, request a room facing the back. There is a nice, albeit expensive buffet-style restaurant for all three meals; however, there are also several local restaurants on the street which offer american breakfast for 7.50 euros. There is a metro stop in front of the hotel which is convenient for travel to and from the airport and throughout Barcelona. La Ramblas is a 10 minute walk. Ask the desk clerk for the best streets to navigate as some are better than others, Venture onto the wrong street and you will find more ladies of the evening than tourists - even in the morning. Don't miss the Boqeria - a large food market just off La Ramblas. Great selection of fruits, segetables, meats, cheeses, baked goods, etc. We were constantly warned about pickpockets, especially in the metro and crowed streets. Don't wear backpacks or carry valuables in back pockets. The hotel desk clerk will sell you discounted HOHO (get on get off bus) tickets, which I recommend as the best way to see the city unless you take a guided tour, which is unnecessary. There are two bus companies. One has two routes. The other has three. Buy the two-day package. The orange route includes four stops on Montjuic. We spent several hours there at Poble Espanyol, which was built as a recreated midieval community with dozens of restaurants, shops and artisans. There is a small admission, which is surprising since you go there to spend money, but it is wel worth it. If you plan to shop for souvenirs, do it there. The ambience and quality of the merchandise is delightful. Also, plan to have lunch there at one of the alfresco places in the large quadrangle just inside the entrance or at the small restaurant which sports a classical guitarist to the left of the quad.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Marina84036
Reviews.Content: The hotel is next to the metro so is convenient for getting around and only few minutes walk to the marina and Las Ramblas. The staff are pleasant and helpful and all spoke English. The rooms were a good size with a safe and minibar. Unfortunately the windows aren't double glazed so it was a little noisy at night, but then it is a city. The swimming pool is quite small, more like a plunge pool, but it's nice to have the option, although it isn't heated. Didn't have breakfast as very expensive but lots of cafes in road so not a problem. Restaurant was salad buffet with grill, good if you can't be bothered to go out after a long days sight seeing, but not enough variety to eat every night.

Reviews.Title: “Exception Assistance when Cruise Canceled”
Reviews.Author: SteveintheD
Reviews.Content: Pablo and his fellow employees went out of their way to assist my wife and I when our cruise was suddenly canceled one day after departing Barcelona. We were still anchored in Villfrance awaiting further cruise guidance when Pablo provided us assurance that we would hav ea place to stay awaiting our new return flight home to Detroit. The hotel was fantastic, well placed in the heart of al lthings Barcelona, and the staff were exceptional!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location and lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: MrsLena
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel 5 nights in October and it was indeed a pleasant stay. We stayed in the corner rooms which is larger than the ordinary rooms, and think that was well spent money. The staff is very friendly, really service minded and has great knowledge of the city. The hotel is elegant and comfortable, very clean and with a perfect location. There is a subway station right outside the hotel, you can walk to La Ramblas or the harbour in 5-10 minutes. We had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: LawsonsScotland
Reviews.Content: Having booked a 5 night stay here,we were disappointed to get a room where the room looked on to an atrium and you physically had to go outside to see what the weather was like,room 715,when asked of a room change i was told there were no more rooms available as our,s was a triple room.Having spent 1 night in this room i then went down to reception and asked to see the manager but the young lad at reception (very helpful)said he could deal with our problem which he duly did,and when we came back from sightseeing we had a new room as big with 2 windows looking over the city.The hotel is in a good location for visiting Le Rambla,harbour and other sites.The hotel is very clean and rooms were always immaculate when we came home from sightseeing.A very good hotel indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here.”
Reviews.Author: geezereader
Reviews.Content: Spacious rooms, including the bathroom. Metro right outside the front door (lines 2 and 3 the funicular to Mt. Juic). Felt safe to this old single lady. Lots of places to eat around, 2 grocery stores within 2 blocks. Safe, 2 Eng. stations on flat screen TV. Staff spoke English and were very helpful. My phone didn't work and someone came in person to wake me on my last day. 15 minutes walk to La Rambla. The rooms were not soundproof but it was noisy only Fri. and Sat. and not too bad. No coffee maker so I brought my own. I will go back there again, the location was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, 5 minutes from Ramblas and metro outside.”
Reviews.Author: TravelBeaucoup
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really convenient for Las Ramblas, the metro and the train to Montjuïc. But some people warned us that some of the roads from Paral.lel to Ramblas were not that safe, so take advice from the front desk on that one. It's a 15 minute walk to Plaza Espana. The city tour bus stops here too, so yes, excellent location. The hotel is also on the correct (south) side of Barcelona to get to the airport without having to battle through traffic. Free wifi. Yes. We love Barcelona. We hate the smoking rules in Spain. Cough, splutter.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: beachlover2148
Reviews.Content: Terrific hotel in an excellent location. Room & amenities are top notch as is the entire staff. Found the hotel on line and took a chance. I was extremely pleased on my arrival. Right on a major street which my room faced. It was never noisy except when Spain won the World Cup. Being right outside of a major metro stop was very convenient. Also there are busses across the street to take you to many destinations. It was within walking distance of La Rambla and felt very safe walking back and forth. All in all, I would give this hotel an A+ and will recommend it to anyone I know going to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jodie-Crouch_End
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect. Pool is ok but it was a bit crowded on the roof. Our room had quite a small bed and was on the 1st floor next to a busy road so we couldn't open the window as we were overlooked. Ok, reasonably good value as we only paid £90/ night for a double room. Walk in price was €380... ridiculous!

Reviews.Title: “Good Quailty Hotel not far from main attractions.”
Reviews.Author: MB123England
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last week for 4 nights. We arrived on the day of the strikes which wasnt ideal but luckily for us our flight wasnt cancelled and we got a taxi no problem from the airport. Only downside was seeing protestors and riot police clashing on Las Ramblas. Any way.... back to the hotel. Very good hotel. I would range it somewhere between a high class Premier Inn and a 4 star hotel. It had everything we needed. Pool and Solarium were great. Would have been nice if the pool had a poolside bar. The room did have a window but because we were in the middle of the hotel you couldnt see out of it. Didnt bother us though as the room was still very light and airy. The bathroom was massive. Biggest bathroom we have ever had in a hotel. It was the size of some small rooms we have stayed in in the past! The whole hotel was spotless. The breakfast was good, but like others have said, the english cooked breakfast was poor. Eggs tasteless, bacon poor and the little sausage things were definately an aquired taste. Cold meats were great as was the fruits and yogurts. Plenty of choice. Staff couldnt of been more helpful and I wish my spanish was as good as their english. The area the hotel is about a 10 min walk from the port and Las Ramblas. Ive read that the road you have to walk down to get to Las Ramblas is dimly lit and not really an area you would wish to hang around in. We didnt find it threatening at all but I could see as to why some would. Its pretty busy even late at night. Definately keep your bag, purse and wallet out of view though. If your sensible your fine. All in all a great hotel. Next time we are in Barcelona we will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “helpful staff clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: babmacGlasgowUK
Reviews.Content: We 5 ladies of a certain age stayed here last weekend in September. The staff were all excellent. Very helpful and chatty. The rooms are spotless and I even saw the chambermaid vacuuming the curtains. The pool is unheated but I swam because it was warm and sunny. Great breakfast and it even had food for dieters - not me- although the hot food isnt really as there's no hot plate just heated lamos above.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice!”
Reviews.Author: jdmWi
Reviews.Content: Based on TA reviews, we booked a 7 night stay. We were not disappointed. Location was great as we were in walking distance to Las Ramblas and the port area. Since the weather was warm, we enjoyed the small pool. It was a great place to meet fellow travelers and enjoy a glass of wine. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel. We were surprised not to have an alarm clock in the room. The staff was very helpful when we experienced travel difficulty due to the general strike.

Reviews.Title: “It was fine”
Reviews.Author: doomdoom
Reviews.Content: No reason not to choose this hotel. The staff were pleasant and helpful, the location was great for our needs... a few yards from a metro station, 6 or 7 minutes walk from the old port and/or rambla. it's close enough to everything but just a fraction out of the main hustle and bustle. the rooms were clean and modern, (maybe a little bland) and very clean. the beds were comfortable. our room was in the interior of the hotel so we had no outside window, which was a disadvantage.. we looked out into a kind of ventilation shaft, no view. but the room was light enough and airy and didnt feel too enclosed. the small roof pool and terrace is pleasant and definitely a plus point after a tiring day sightseeing. we didnt eat at the hotel, and were slightly disappointed to find the bar shut before 11pm, but just outside the door are a number of nice cafes and bars, so no real problem. What made it for us was the late checkout, at 4pm. We had a night flight home, so being able to keep our room til the afternoon was fantastic, plus they were lovely about letting us carry on using the pool and shower etc after we'd checked out. Slight complaint about the free toiletries - bit basic and meager for a 4 star hotel, so if you are taking hand luggage only and not bothering with all your cosmetics you might struggle. but over all it was a good choice and we would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cassie1Uk
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights beginning of September. Hotel staff very helpful. Room on 8th floor had good view and was very clean, comfortable and spacious. Breakfast was good- fresh fruit, cereal, breads, yoghurt etc. The only downside was the 'cooked' part of it-not like a proper full english. Uncooked streaky bacon, Spanish red sausage or hot dog sausages and tasteless scrambled egg. I particularly enjoyed the swimming pool and solarium on the roof to relax late afternoon after a hard days sightseeing.Overall, very good.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL & LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: janetrg7
Reviews.Content: We loved the convenience, value, and modern style of the Universal. Close to Ramblas, Metro (right outside the door!), great restaurants, and lots of sights. Service, cleanliness, etc., was great. Only one small complaint--there is no place to plug in a hair styling appliance anywhere close to a mirror. They do provide a hairdryer in the bathroom, which only an electric razor can be plugged into. If you want to use a styling iron as I did, you can't do it in front of a mirror! Seems strange that they didn't think of that...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a city break”
Reviews.Author: ibbs21
Reviews.Content: I would really recommend this hotel. It was clean, very comfortable and well located for sightseeing around the city. We stayed in a triple room which was very generous with all the mod cons (not that we used them really-too much to see!). The rooftop pool, although small, is a real bonus. It's not heated so was pretty cold, but was perfect for cooling off after a long day and the views were great. Be sure to check out the solarium too. Staff also v friendly and helpful. Would stay there again no problem.

Reviews.Title: “would not go back again”
Reviews.Author: CAOIMHE999
Reviews.Content: went here for a week with my husband - room ok - location ok - but breakfast was awful one morning we were not even offered coffee- just drank water - overall the hotel was too expensive, but staff very nice & helpful

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic choice!!”
Reviews.Author: Steffy89
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in this hotel for 4nights after being recommended it by a friend..and it did not disappoint!! We had a very early flight out and were not expecting to be able to check in until 3pm, but when we arrived around 1145am they had our room ready which was perfect and was a great start to our holiday! Staff at reception spoke very good english and were very helpful with any of our questions throughout our stay. Our hotel room was clean and modern, and a very good size, aswell as having air conditioning! Bathroom was also a good size, daily maid service throughout our stay, with a pack containing a comb, shaving kit, tissues, dental pack on arrival...incase you forgot any of the essentials! :) Breakfast was lovely with plenty of variety, and we also had a minibar in our room which was very handy if you needed a cold drink! Hotel room comes with a safe which is free of charge - great, as many hotels charge you for this facility! And location was perfect...5-10minute walk to Las Ramblas, with bus stops and metro stations directly outside hotel! I would definitely stay in this hotel again if I were to return to Barcelona :)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: sorhol
Reviews.Content: Simply a fantastic hotel. Great location, service and overall quality. Excellent breakfast - especiallly the coffee, fresh orange juice and the bread was great. We stayed in a suite on the 9th floor - definately worth the money. Amazing view (room 907) over the city

Reviews.Title: “Lovely smart hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sunsearcher101
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights at the Universal end of August. It's a 30euro (tip inc) taxi ride from the airport. Quick check in from helpful staff. Clean room, very smart. WiFi and a couple of laptops in reception for free internet. Rooftop pool is nice but small, only about 15 sunloungers up there too. Only complaint is a bit of road noise during the night but it's not terrible. Didn't eat at the hotel but heard other guests say it was expensive. You're much better off finding a bakery (they are on every street) for a croissant and a coffee which will be about 2euro. If you want 'english' there are 3 places 20yds from the hotel offering this for 4.5euros. Hotel is 5 min from La Rambles and about 8min from the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for sightseeing but not for the beach”
Reviews.Author: Sallybruce
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel: the room was very quiet and comfortable; breakfast good; service good. The rooftop pool was smaller than we thought it would be but obviously there were space limitations. We could not have been any closer to the metro station and the funicular to Montjuic so the hotel was ideally placed for sightseeing. The hotel is not so ideally placed for the beach unless you are prepared for a long walk, public transport or a taxi. We found the public transport good. However, anyone travelling to Barcelona should be aware of the pickpockets and scams both on the streets and the metro. These have certainly put us off returning to Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: colindkavanagh
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel in an excellent location. On arrival we were given a dark room with no natural light as the fogged out window is facing some sort of internal atrium. We went back to the reception and the room was changed to a street facing room on the second floor. The room was a good size, modern, comfortale beds, big wardrobe, safe, mini bar, nice bathroom (great shower), flat screen tv and radio. The air con was good, there is noise from the street but we were used to it as we live in a busy urban area so it didn't stop us from sleeping, it might bother others. The free wifi is fast. The roof area is good, nice solarium, small pool (but wasn't too busy when I used in the evening) and great views of the city. The gym is very bad, not worth using. The bar was never staffed and nobody ever seemed to use it so we didn't bother. Most of the reception staff aren't particularly friendly, they could learn how to smile and be a bit more welcoming. They often seem fed up. The porters seem friendlier. The cleaning was good but we always had to ask for more shower gel and shampoo as they only leave one of those small shower gel / shampoos each day. We also asked for somebody to show us how to use the air con and believe me, we had to wait. The location is great, the metro is outside the door. It is easy walking distance to Las Rambla, Ravel, the port etc. If you do need to get the metro, nothing is paricuarly far away. For breakfast, I would recommend trying the cafes outside the hotel (turn left), we tried two of them and were both good and cheap. I think the hotel breakfast costs something like €15. Overall, great hotel, only thing really letting it down is the receptioin staff which are bit too miserable. Despite that, I would stay here again if in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Well priced and fantastically located hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonCoopster
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for our needs. 10 mins from la rambla and near all tourist thing. Right next to metro station too. The staff were particularly friendly. Whilst pricey, the breakfast was good too... And free internet. Only downsides were very small pool (smaller than in pics), noisy room and curtains that didn't shut so got woken up by the light. But overall, for such a low price it is definitely a winnner.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: finbarrcat
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a 4 night trip to Barcelona with my mum. We stayed in the Universal which was a lovely modern, clean hotel in a good location about 10 min walk from Las Ramblas. We didn't pay for the breakfast at the hotel as it seemed expensive at 15euros per person. There are a number of cafes nearby so it's easy to get breakfast first thing in the morning, and a nice bar round the corner for a drink on the way home in the evening. Great views of the city from the roof top pool - lovely place to relax after a long day sightseeing! Room and bathroom were a good size.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nick053
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellent. From a location standpoint it was just off of La Rambla and pretty much walking distance to every sight in the city. The hotel is also located about 200M from the Metro Station as well. The staff is nice enough as well and will help you with directions to various sights. The hotel was also very clean and the rooms were pretty good in size and there was little to no street noise. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to explore the city, as this hotel is the perfect home base.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value, a few suggestions for improvement”
Reviews.Author: snoju
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights, booked on Expedia. It was a good price, and overall a good value. The staff were helpful, although at the front desk they always seemed to be busy with something in the attached office that they gave the impression they would rather be doing than serving you. Likewise, the bar staff were non-existent, and had to be fetched; the second night when we stopped in for a drink the bar staff disappeared and we couldn't get anything after our first drink. The breakfast was ample, and tasty, with a good selection of healthy and unhealthy alternatives - fruit and granola, along with heavy duty chocolate croissants. The "fitness" facility was pathetic, although I was able to do a bit of cardio on a stair machine. The roof pool area was adequate. Our room was comfortable and spacious, which of course is one of the main things, and it was pretty quiet. The hotel was busy, so other travellers too found the price right. I would say it is stretching to reach four stars, but on a good day I could see it. My advice would be to get the staff to show a bit more initiative - instead of having to look for them (at reception, at the bar, around the pool), it would be great if they looked for you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Barcelona Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KLAMK
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for four nights. In general we were pleased with the stay. It is placed in a rather good location neat the Rambla which is the center of Barcelona. The rooms are fine and good size. The hotel does not have much caracter. The restaurant was ok, however, we only tried it for breakfast. The pool area at the roof is very helpful especially during the hot month of July. We used the afternoons at the roof before enjoying tapas at all the good restaurants in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great facilities”
Reviews.Author: JoanneNorthYorkshire
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good position. It was fairly quiet in terms of noise so it meant a good nights sleep. Breakfast was excellent. There is a nice pool on the roof but it was well used.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Great location. Great amenities. A few dodgy clientele spoiling it for the majority.”
Reviews.Author: withnail69
Reviews.Content: I'm very confused about several reviews on here. I must firstly say that I was out most nights til 1am and didn't see any hint of trouble neither did I feel threatened at any time. The location for me was perfect and I would stay in the area again. It was basically the culinary center with all the cities best restaurants situated between the hotel and las ramblas. With the metro right outside the hotel it was perfect for getting around. The pool was a definite necessity as it was soo hot. This is both a curse and a blessing (I will come to this later). The staff were helpful and the breakfast very good and varied. The rooms were very comfortable although why they need a bed on wheels that moves away from the wall when you sit on it I'll never know. Anyway back to that pool.... Totally out of character with the hotel there was several large male only groups. Who seemed to just want to get paralytic by the pool all day and be loud and obnoxious. I'm sad to say they were all british although there were also some very loud Americans who were very rude to staff and moaned about everything. This is my only complaint really that a load of fat tattooed chavs are able to blast their music out loud by the pool without the hotel staff doing anything.

Reviews.Title: “A lot to offer at a good price, at a convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: gbosquez
Reviews.Content: This modern hotel gave us a great rate ( we stayed 5 days). It included a fantastic breakfast and there was a pool on the roof with great views of the city. (Too bad it closed at 8 PM every day!) The restaurant offers good meals too if you're too tired that first day, as we were. It is a 5 minute walk to Las Ramblas, 10 minutes to the Old City though I wouldnt do it after dark. A metro stop was at the front door, as was the cable car connection to Montjuic, and getting a cab out front is super easy. Very helpful staff (especially Marcos, who waited on us at the restaurant and bar). We enjoyed out stay there while in Barcelona. Would definitely come back! Suggestions to anyone staying here: do ask for a room that's not facing the main street (Paralel) if street noise bothers you.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, but too modern for me”
Reviews.Author: enncle
Reviews.Content: my partner and i had visited barcelona before and had decided to choose this hotel as the complete opposite of last visit. hotel modern clean staff friendly helpful. hotel bar very small, you basically had to watch to see who was leaving then order a drink and get a seat. roof top pool, very small. more than two people in you would have been having bodily contact with strangers. the hotel itself was clean , were you wanted to be and great for people who like the modern look. didnt really matter though because your out and about in barcelona and only sleep at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Mike_Bev_2010
Reviews.Content: Booked direct with hotel months in advance and received an excellent deal - breakfast and late checkout. Front desk staff were very attentive and the room was newly rennovated, well appointed and very comfortable. The hotel itself was in an excellent location for metro (at it's front door), all the tourist sites - we walked to most - and the cruise terminal - literally a 5 minute taxi ride away... We are seasoned independent travellers - this is our third 6 month round the world journey... and this hotel was a very pleasant surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel at good value”
Reviews.Author: Goldenboy75
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right opposite the metro so you can either take a short ride on the tube or walk which would be abot 10 mins its also a walkalble distance to the Port. The rooms were well furnished with all modern amenities.Staff were very helpful and friendly. The hotel has a small pool on the rooftop which wasnt bad. Its good hotel and valu for money.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful honey moon experience”
Reviews.Author: Trankkis
Reviews.Content: We got bumped up to one of the 3 suites having mentioned we were on honey moon. The room was around 60 square meters, with a huge balcony of around 30 square metres watching over Mont Juic and the Madonna concert which was in town. Our bathroom was huge as well, unfortunately the bubble pool didn't work at the time. Breakfast wasn't included, but at 2,20 euro we got a whole pot of coffee including two freshly baked croissants served to the room which we thought was amazing value. The laundry was also cheap and good. The best parts were the experience as a whole, and of course our roof terrace and the (public) swimming pool on the roof. The location is also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Godd hotel with excellent transport links”
Reviews.Author: hlrUk
Reviews.Content: We stayed in March during the week it snowed. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, and we found the service very good. Initially we were given a room at the back of the hotel which was very dark and slightly cramped, we asked to be moved which they did quickly and with no questions and we got a much mopre comfortable room at the front of the hotel. Rooms were immaculately clean and the only problem we had was of traffic noise at night - our fault for moving i guess!!! the location of the metro station made travel around Barcelona very easy, and although I wouldn't choose to walk from Las Ramblas to the hotel at night there were certainly no problems doing that through the day. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice clean hotel, great value in a conveninent location”
Reviews.Author: jimshoe
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very conveniently located. We got there from the airport by taking a bus to Placa d'Espanya and too a 6 euro taxi afterwards. We could have also taken the subway which would have cost us 1.40euros. As stated by other reviewers, the subway is RIGHT in front of the hotel. You can get to La Rambla by going through St-Pau... I would qualify St-Pau as being an "alley way". To get from the hotel to La Rambla is about a 5-10 min walk (look at the map... after turning right twice, you just walk straight until you reach La Rambla). The first time to take this path, you do it should be during the day because it's easy to FEEL unsafe. On the way there, there is a cross-street where there are many prostitutes. That being said, we never had any problems so I would think that it's quite safe up to at LEAST 10pm. If you don't feel safe, it's also possible to get to La Rambla by hopping on the subway. It's 2 or 3 stations away, depending on which part of La Ramba you want to end up on. The hotel is nicely decorated. Rooms are modern and clean. High speed internet is available for free. There is a supermarket close by called Dia where you can buy whatever you need. The only drawback to be aware of is the soundproofing: we could hear people talking in the hallway (or other rooms) and sounds from the exterior are also easily audible. However, we didn't have any problems sleeping. Our next time in Barcelona, we will definitely come back here...

Reviews.Title: “Hotel very comfortable but area not ideal!”
Reviews.Author: Songbird052
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from a short city break to Barcelona, I would sum it up as a place definately to be visited but maybe just once.
