The Universal is a good hotel with pleasant modern rooms, a small bar, 3 lifts, which can get quite cosy and hot, a very small roof-top pool with terrace and an airy restaurant. Staff on reception spoke good English and were helpful but some restaurant staff were rather off handed when particularly busy. The hotel is on the busy main road of La Paral-lel and the area rather dodgy. Don't go out alone at night, carry handbags at the front of you and men, put your money in a money belt and not in your back pocket. Our friend had 90 euros stolen from his!

Reviews.Title: “very nice and modern hotel - great value”
Reviews.Author: rbach
Reviews.Content: The location may not be in the middle of the tourist area, but the subway stop truly is right outside the front door and you are a very short train ride from everything! The hotel is moden, clean, and spacious. If you are looking for a large clean room and a very affordable stay this might be the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “great way to start cruise!!”
Reviews.Author: debatl
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel the night before our cruise. It is a "15 euro" taxi drive from the port. we really could have walked, but EVERYONE advises not to walk down the street with all of your valuables on you. The hotel staff was extremely friendly, recommending a great little place to eat when we got in late that night. And the rooms were very modern and clean. Breakfast was included in the extremely fair price, and it was very filling and tasty. Also, free internet access, and two computers to be used. Located about 15 minute walk from Las Rambles (again, no valuables with you) and noice was not an issue.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: Misty52
Reviews.Content: Prior to our visit I emailed the hotel twice, once to check the cost of breakfast and the second to request a room above 6th floor and to confirm that they would retain our baggage until our flight time. On both occasions the reply was very prompt and informative. Having read trip advisor, I was unsure what to expect, however, we cannot confirm some of the comments as our experience was exemplary. We were on the 7th floor, the lifts were fast and clean. The check in experience was excellent, with some discussion about football and whilst we only had one or two queries, the check in staff were always polite and helpful. We did not eat breakfast in the hotel as I only eat a light breakfast and therefore did not wish to pay 15Euros for this. Found the second cafe as you turn left out of the hotel to be good quality and very friendly and helpful and their croissants were very good! as was their full english breakfast for my husband. We also had an early drink here and were not overcharged as we had been elsewhere. Whilst our room was on the 7th floor at the front, there was indeed some noise evident on the first evening because of the football game: Barcelona won the last game of the season. I think overall the noise was commensurate with any city and whilst we could hear it on the 7th floor it was muted and although I am not the world's best sleeper it did not disturb my sleep. Also, the only sound we heard in our room was occasionally water running when we were not running water and we were quite near to the lifts and did not hear any other noises. We went out to eat in the evening and returned by 11pm. Having read trip advisor, we were concerned about walking to La Rambla which we did two of the evenings but we did not find it as threatening as we had envisaged and we are around 60 years of age. Had very good value lunches at LA BO Tiga in Escudellers just off La Rambla. Found the journey by bus and metro from the airport to hotel was brilliant. The location was excellent being so near to the Metro and 10 minutes walk to La Rambla.

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience”
Reviews.Author: magalia09
Reviews.Content: Overall the quality of this hotel is very good. It is clean with a nice modern decor. I spent three nights there with a friend, and following the advice of other travelers here, we requested a room on a higher floor at the back of the hotel. It was a very nice room, nice clean bathroom, quiet at night and very comfortable bed. It is a fairly good location but as others have noted, there are quite a few streets between the hotel and La Rambla that are quite sketchy and made my friend and me nervous even during daylight hours. Overall we had a very good experience and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bouqueriaman
Reviews.Content: We arrived in a bit of a state after an attempted baggage theft at the Metro station "Arc de Triomfe". You never think it will happen to you, but it did and I was very lucky to get my case back with all our belongings and valuables in it. Another 3 seconds and the thief would have been gone, leaving us with the old man who had distracted us. The hotel reception were sympathetic and helpful. We had upgraded to the Skyline suite for 2 of our 3 nights, but they allowed us to stay in it for all three nights for the same price. the room was superb, with great views and lots of space. The terrace was huge and overlooked the street below, with tables chairs and sun loungers. At £500 for 3 nights, this was a real bargain. The hotel was well kept and staff were always pleasant. Breakfast was fine, the rooftop pool was pleasantly cool and refreshing after long days on the hot beach. It is quite small though. The surrounding area is not as appealing as some areas of the city in terms of architecture and attractions, being mainly businesses and blocks of flats. However it is only a 10 minute walk or 2 tube stations away fron all of the more attractive areas. The tube station directly outside is also a huge bonus. We have been to Barcelona many times and would always recommend it for a great break. Be careful though and aware of strangers when you arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Do not leave bags unattended!!!!”
Reviews.Author: raramay
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a marvellous 3 nights in Barcelona aand stayed at the Universal. The hotel is located a 10 minute walk to Las Ramblas and is functional, its primary target being businessmen staying for a night or so during the week and stag parties at the weekend. The area is on the periphories of the red light district, but doesn't present a problem, as everything is geared towards the Spanish, rather than the tourist. The rear of the hotel is quieter, as mentioned on a previous review, but any of the floors at the rear have a limited view, the best one being from the roof, The room was spotless and the breakfast tremendous, but after retrieving our phones from our room safe, on the last day, we checked out and left our bags in the luggage room as our flight wasn't until the evening. Having collected our bags we went to the airport, and at no time did we leave them unattended. Once at security we only had 2 instead of 3 phones. We phoned the hotel, and E mailed them later, but with a negative response. It would appear that there may well be someone within a position of responsibility at the hotel who is a little less than honest, so beware. It is inevitable that this industry attracts problems in relation to security, but we wouldn't want to see something like this spoil anyone elses visit to this otherwise beautiful and welcoming city.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, nothing exceptionally good”
Reviews.Author: mikkotuominen
Reviews.Content: When we arrived the hotel concierge was kinda rude, other concierges we talked to were much more nicer and helpful. We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights. Location is very good as the metro and funicular are right in front of hotel. Hotel rooms are quite noisy as you can hear if your neighbours are in the shower or using the toilet. I even woke up when someone (not anyone on our room..) snored so loud that I could clearly hear it. Swimming pool on the roof is ok. However you cannot take your own drinks to the pool. And they say that there is WIFI in the rooms. Well, they are right but on 5th floor connection to WIFI was so bad that it was usable most of the time. A view from our room was quite ugly..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel located in a convenient part of the city for tourists.”
Reviews.Author: Lesaxo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here fo 3 nights and found the Hotel Universal to be everything we wanted for a city centre break. The staff were very helpful and friendly (booking restaurants in advance for us), our bedroom was spacious and had greatr views of the city (try to get a room above sixth floor) and the locatuion was ideal for all the main sightseeing areas. Previous reviews have mentioned the fact that the area is unsafe at night - well we had absolutely no problems and wandered around during the day and at night feeling completely safe and unthreatened everywhere we went. There seems to be high police prescence, especially near and along the Ramblas, enabling the tourists to walk around in comparative safety. Obviously you need to be aware of pick-pockets, but that goes for any city. All in all, our experience was 100% positve - Barcelona is a very beautiful and inspiring city and ont not to be missed.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location”
Reviews.Author: Michhar
Reviews.Content: Clean, lovely hotel. Fantastic locotion for the port and the main town. Stayed for 3 nights and the room was clean and lovely. My advice - dont take breakfast expensive compared to what you can get down the road at about a fifth of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: EzzeddinRadaideh
Reviews.Content: First let’s talk about the location. The hotel is located at the Paral-lel street, less than 10 steps from the hotel entrance there is a metro station (called also the Paral-lel station) in which 3 lines meet: L2, L3 and a funicular (a tram that connects between Paral-lel station and Park de Montjuic station). It is advisory to buy a T-10 ticket if you are planning to use the metro for several times. You can buy the ticket from a machine located virtually at all stations. The T10 can also be used by more than one person at a time. (Once you use the ticket to open the gate pass it back to your buddy). And note that you only need to use the ticket to enter the station, but you don’t need to use it again to switch between different lines within any station. Step out of the hotel and turn left, in less than a minute you will reach the famous Bagdad club on your left hand side, and Apollo Club on your right hand across the Paral-lel street. From Bagdad club if you turn left you will reach the famous La Rambla Street in 5 – 7 minutes. My recommendation for a full day plan (might take more than one day) is to visit the Montjuic which is a hill fully loaded with must see attractions such as castles, museums, theatres, parks, a magic fountain and the Poble Espanyol. To reach the Montjuic from the hotel take the funicular from the Paral-lel station to the Parc de Montjuic station, at the roof of the Parc de Montjuic station there is a teleferic (cable car), buy a 2 way ticket, visit the Castell de Montjuic located at the top of the hill, then get back to the Parc de Montjuic station and walk down the remaining of the Montjuic to enjoy the attractions one by one, if you wish to visit everything at the Montjuic you might need more than one day, in fact the Poble Espanyol itself might take a full day if you want to stop at each corner and know about everything while listening to the audio guide. I guess that the above gives a good idea about the hotel location in which you gain an easy access to attractions and at the same time avoid the noise from being at the centre of busy streets such as La Rambla. Regarding the view, our room was located at the rear side with the ugliest view I ever had; however I had no issues with that; since I did not came to Barcelona to stay at the hotel for long times. The 15 Euro breakfast was not that good, especially if you don’t eat pork like me, but there are better and cheaper option outside the hotel and at the La Rambla. The hotel and rooms were clean and quiet. I did not deal with the hotel staff much, but I guess they were fine, when I asked for a map they gave me a map, when I asked for directions they guided me, when I asked for an electric adapter for my cell phone charger they gave me one, they smile at my face and they speak English ….. Fare enough. At the lobby there are 2 computers with internet that you can use for free. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very adequate hotel and a good location”
Reviews.Author: BittenTravelBugs
Reviews.Content: With some time in Spain and a few hotels under our belt we booked this place based on its location through an online website. When booking through a third party website it seems the 'basic rooms' and the ones offered for the lower rates are the least desired within the hotel for a variety of different reasons. To try to avoid getting one of those odd rooms that garner poor reviews we emailed ahead of time and asked for a nice room with a view. The manager replied and when we arrived we had a room on the sixth floor, facing the street, with a spacious clean room. It was great. The subway stop is 10 meters away and The Ramblas is a 10 or 15 minute walk. It was a very pleasant stay. Check out the restaurants along the quiet street just across the main drag outside the hotel and back one block. Good coffees and sandwiches, interesting tapas and beer, and totally cheap compared anything closer to The Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: BUNTU
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel with my husband, got a great deal online including breakfast, perfect location for barcelona, nice and clean hotel also very helpful staff, i would recommend it to anyone whether its family or couples it suites all.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel - good location”
Reviews.Author: SteveSmithUSA
Reviews.Content: I split my Barcelona stay between two hotels, and I wish I had stayed here during my siteseeing portion of the trip as the metro entrance is in the sidewalk right in front of the hotel - literally just a few steps away. The hotel was very clean and modern and the rooms were spacious. Every member of the front desk staff that I dealt with spoke English fluently, which was a plus for me since I don't speak any Spanish at all. I also wish that I would have had warmer weather during my two days at this hotel, as the rooftop pool has a wonderful 360-degree view of all of Barcelona. The neighborhood seemed to be less touristy and more local - less sites to see in the immediate vicinity, but the restaurants were frequented by the locals and the food was wonderful, and everything was less expensive than other areas of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pre-Cruise Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelBug8920
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the end of May for 2 nights to explore the city before embarking on our Mediterranean cruise. It was myself and my mom and enjoyed the hotel very much since it was away from the noisy La Ramblas . The walk to the ramblas was about 5-10 mins as well as to the Christopher Columbus monument (you end up at the south end by the waterfront). The ramblas and la catalonya is the place to be to either eat, shop and take in Spanish culture but not so much to stay since it is constantly bustling no matter the time of day. Our travel agent booked the hotel but do remember getting a quite a good price. The hotel is located right by a subway stop and has quite a few cafes and small restaurants you can eat at for breakfast in the morning. There is also a small bakery on the street behind the hotel where we got croissants to eat. There is wifi in the hotel but didn't seem to work to well when we were there but there are 2 computers in the lobby which guests can use complimentary to access the internet. The rooms are a good size for European standard while the washroom were HUGE! The beds were so so for comfort but managed. As other reviews have said the windows do not keep the sounds from the street out, but once you are asleep its fine (and we were there during the uefa soccer game when Barcelona FC won). The staff were extremely friendly as well as helpful when asking for directions and recommending places to eat and shop. Recommend: Buying a hop on hop off bus pass to see the city (27 Euros for 2 days) and if you are staying here to board a cruise take a taxi! since the actual cruise terminals are quite far from the waterfront in Barcelona (I actually remember seeing people dragging their luggage which seemed like a good hour walk and having to stop along the LONG bridge quite a few times on the short ride there, they must have felt like they were walking in the dessert), but the taxi fare is still fairly cheap. This is a great hotel to explore this wonderful city and we thoroughly enjoyed our short stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for exploring Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: WanderingScott
Reviews.Content: The Barcelona Universal is in an excellent location, with the metro stop right outside the hotel door making it simple to get out and about in Barcelona. Both Ramblas and the seafront is about a 10 minute stroll from the hotel, which is nice as Ramblas is too busy to want an hotel there. The hotel staff are excellent, providing good advice, etc. Rooms are adequate size (small if you're used to American rooms), with great shower / bathrooms. The in room radio is nice. One thing to avoid is a room directly about the front doors, the automatic glass doors are forever opening and closing, so best avoid rooms directly above.

Reviews.Title: “wide and clean triple room”
Reviews.Author: frankfurter29
Reviews.Content: I was planning a short trip to Barcelona with 2 friends of mine. We were not recommended any hotel by anyone, we just booked through internet the first triple room we found available. Good choice! The Hotel Barcelona Universal is well located near Las Ramblas (metro literally in front of the main entrance of the hotel), extremely clean and the room we were given was very good (we use to travel using triple rooms and sometimes the hotels give us a double room with an extra bed that makes a bit difficult our stay, but in this case the room was wide enough for us). Our room had no window facing the street, there was a window facing an inner part of the building, but we were happy anyway because it was not noisy at all. Also, very important, wireless in the room free of charge!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: scarlet_ibis
Reviews.Content: Got a good rate via Hotwire. Nice modern hotel. Spacious and very clean rooms with large comfortable bed and flat screen TV. Free wifi. Helpful reception staff. No information on breakfast given by reception or in room, but we went outside anyway. Very close to metro. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: lovetravel25Surrey
Reviews.Content: Room very average but clean. Bath small. No sockets near a mirror for hairdryer, hair irons etc. Quite noisy - take ear plugs! Breakfast - good Staff very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good All Round Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wilko15
Reviews.Content: Good location, with very helpful staff. Breakfast very adequate with good choice of hot and cold food. Rooms clean and comfortable. Prices good. In a few words, "a good all round hotel" Would definately use again and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: blues1875
Reviews.Content: I booked this for my husbands 50th birthday, email the hotel and they upgraded us to a Suite on the 9th Floor, what a room, massive, jacuzzi bath, big balcolny, could not ask for more, very clean hotel, staff very good, great location 10 minutes walk to marina and Las Ramblas, metro just outside the hotel very good and cheap, easy to use, watch for pick pockets the metro staff tell you to be careful, but nothing to say on this matter as it never happened to us. A very enjoyable 6 days, and a big thankyou to the hotel for such a wonderful room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico !”
Reviews.Author: DPadders
Reviews.Content: What a great place, we arrived early and went to reception to ask if there was somewhere we could leave our luggage only to be told the room was ready and here's your key !! Breakfast deal was great and the food and cleanliness exceptional. I paid Eu 500.00 per night for an equivalent hotel in Rome ! Staff were great and very friendly and helpful. Easy walking distance of the harbour and Las Ramblas. I thoroughly enjoyed my 40th birthday at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, staff very helpfull, great location”
Reviews.Author: eaagle
Reviews.Content: stayed for five nights, forgot charger for phone but staff sorted it out, socket broke in room informed staff and it was fixed by the time we got back from our trip. Subway right out side the hotel, also excellent coffee around the corner and a very plesent pub just behind the hotel. Would definatly go back, Geoff and Martina

Reviews.Title: “Would stay againand again!!”
Reviews.Author: WinkleBerry
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Barcelona Universal for 5 nights at the beginning of March and had a very pleasent stay. The location was just perfect for us. If you are looking for a hotel that is away from the hustle and bustle of tourist areas but not too far in walking distance then this is the one for you, its only a 10-15 minute walk to La Rambla with some restaurants and bars on the way and only a 15-20 minute walk up to Placa d'Espanya, you will also find The Magic Fountain of Montjuic here which is a must see!! There is also a Metro outside the hotel with 2 main lines running from it which will take you to most of the main attractions, but I will add that the best way to see Barcelona is the Hop on Hop off bus tour. We had a top floor room, and a balcony with a good view. The room was very spacious with a great shower and a bath with a jacuzzi. There was also a safe in our room which was very handy. The bed was huge!! And bedding changed every single day. Are room was situated at the front of the hotel, many people tend to be put off by the noise of the traffic but it wasnt a problem for us, you get the odd siren now and again but that is to be expected when staying in the city. We even slept a couple nites with the sliding doors open. Hotel staff were very friendly and very helpful when needed. WiFi was also an added bonus, with 2 computers on our floor and others in the lobby. Everywhere was spotlessly clean!! There are a couple of convienience stores just up the road, i would recommend a quick trip to one of these at the beginning of your visit, just to stock up on water and maybe some nibbles to keep in the room as the mini bar is quite expensive, but again that is to be expected. Cant comment on the breakfast as we didnt eat here, but if the hotel is anything to go by, im sure the food was also tip top! Would definatly stay here again, loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MidlandsWarwickshire
Reviews.Content: Stopped at this hotel for 4 days. Good location.....Very Clean....Good Breakfast ! Would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at great location”
Reviews.Author: JetteDenmark
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Barcelona Universal for three nights on our wonderful visit to Barcelona in the beginning of March 2010. Every day we very much enjoyed the delicious breakfast buffet, the quick access to the city via the metro just outside the door or the short stroll to the Rambla, and when we came home in the evening from a long day of sightseeing we enjoyed returning to our nice and clean room. The service was great. The breakfast left nothing else to wish for, the rooftop terrace was a great place for enjoying the last sunshine of the day or the amazing view of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest places I've ever stayed,the cherry on the cake of the holiday.”
Reviews.Author: lavidamaravillosa
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in a great location. There is literally a metro outside the door of the Hotel, so going between the main shopping districts, the beach and Las Ramblas was really easy. The Hotel was beautifully decorated inside, and the staff were very friendly and helpful. I was staying with my new fiancé and as a complimentary gesture we were upgraded and also brought a bottle of Cava on the house. Our room was fantastic: clean, spacious and bright. I would definetly recommend this hotel and I would stay again. Great value for money given the excellent service and location. My fiancé said he has never stayed anywhere so nice in his life, and I would be inclined to agree!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: toomanyplacesat50
Reviews.Content: The perfect location comment comes partly from the fact that from the time we landed at the airport to being booked into the hotel was 75 minutes. It is 2 stops from Espayna PL & the Hotel is right above Paral-lel tube station. We stayed on the 5th floor & the only unfortunate issue of the whole weekend is that if you have a front facing room the noise from traffic is constant. We would defintely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: Middlehamlad
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Stayed there for 3 nights on a visit to watch Barcelona play. Great location next to the tube station which made trips around the city very easy. Friendly staff and very comfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Superb Service”
Reviews.Author: Ianto999
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Universal after a very pleasant weekend. Without doubt one of the best four star hotels I have ever stayed in. Accommodation, service, attention to detail all absolutely spot on. Asked for a high floor room facing Parallel when booking and got one on floor 8, high enough to know the city was there but not so that it disturbed sleep in any way. Room itself was immaculate, very well decorated, all the amenities one would need and a very comfortable and very large bed. Staff were without exception friendly, informative and knowledgeable. Had a very minor problem with the air con on first night, called reception and a member of staff was on hand less than five minutes later to fix things. Only minor fault was the breakfast, cold table good but the hot food not as high a standard. We had a very good rate which included breakfast, I notice that many rates here do not have this included, in that case I think you would be better served by taking breakfast in any of the very friendly and well priced cafes to the left of the hotel as you exit. Walked to the Ramblas a few times in the day no problem at all but as others have said best travellers stick to the bigger streets, in the evening taxis are permanently on hand and the metro is quick, efficient and cheap, it is literally five seconds walk from the hotel entrance. Very friendly and popular bar just behind the hotel, La Confeteria, exit the hotel to the right walk 50m and look to your right you will see it. Will without doubt return to this hotel and this superb city very soon.

Reviews.Title: “could not have been happier”
Reviews.Author: Diarmuidlfc
Reviews.Content: we arrived in the evening time time to a warm welcome and very helpful staff at the desk. we checked and went to our room and were very pleases. very spacious, great bathroom and the shower/bath is excellent! as we were out sight seeing most of the time there our time in the hotel was limited but was excellent. only a short 10minute walk to las ramblas and the walk is not as dodgy as some make it out we thought with some great we shops on the way there to buy some essentials! we were placed at the front of the hotel on paral-lel and the noise was minimal but there was some noise from other rooms but nothing to complain about!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: vancouver88
Reviews.Content: my wife, my 21 year boy and myself were on a cruise and stayed at Hotel Barcelona Universal for 2 nights pre cruise. Front desk staff are super friendly and helpful; speak GOOD english. Breakfast was wholesome and not an ordinary continental breakfast. Very clean, and roomy. convenient and close to all ameneties. underground Subway is at the doorstep. Free internet. After the cruise unfortunately our passports were stolen while we were doing sightseeing. We went back to this same hotel and staff were most helpful with calling the authorities. We are VERY happy with Hotel Barcelona Universal. On our last day they even packed a good sized breakfast for us. Although our encounter with the loss of our passport was sour we were comforted to have lived in a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: catie2000
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights as a 50th birthday weekend easyjet trip. Paid £65 per night on Expedia. Got the Aerobus to Placa Espanya and metro to Parrallel. Hotel right by the metro. Arrived at 12 noon but allowed to check in. Good service, security on door, bar is small but pleasant staff and not too pricey. Rooms and bathrooms excellent, very clean, great shower. Bit noisy at front but would expect that in city centre. 10 mins walk to Las Ramblas and Gothic quarter. Used the metro and buses to get direct to the seafront, cathedrals and main sites. Some dodgy looking cafes nearby but nice tapas etc if you explore streets towards Montjuic.Walked back one night but felt a bit intimidating, so used the metro the second night. Handy for the fernicular railway and cable car to Montjuic parc. Got a T10 ticket which lasted all weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: cheshirehappy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is kept immaculately. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The room service and maid service was excellent. The restuarant was exceptionally clean and the service was very good. The hotel is situated very close to Las Ramblas and the harbour which has the tourist attractions of the cable car, aquarium and Maritime Museum. These are five minutes walk away. There is a Metro station directly outside the hotel which takes you to the Gaudi catherdral and the Gaudi apartments are a ten minute walk from the cathedral. The hotel is central to all the tourist facilities. However, you do have to be careful of pickpockets. A key theme is that they approach you to ask for a cigarette. Be ready to tell them bluntly, to go away. Wear a money belt and do not have your handbag over your shoulder.

Reviews.Title: “Never stay here, Barcelona has hundreds of better hotels.”
Reviews.Author: Dhitchcock2009
Reviews.Content: The bell-men called my wife a wh*re for smoking a cigarette outside on the sidewalk. They were very rude to her and even made her cry at one point. Then the french manager called the cops on us because she wanted to leave and stay somewhere else. The rooms are small, the staff are rude and are very unhelpful. The staff are verbally abusive to women. We left and stayed at the Hotel Front Maritim and everything was great. Stay away from this hotel if going to the great city of Barcelona. IT is a great city, dont let this terrible hotel ruin your trip like it almost did our's.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and easy.... close to the city but dont expect too much”
Reviews.Author: Demochoi
Reviews.Content: we were out most of the time out sightseeing, so didnt really get to spend time in the hotel...... nice and clean, for the price we for (270 euro for 3 nights), I think it's quit reasonable

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay for a citybreak!”
Reviews.Author: weiss1
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel very much because it was very comfortable, modern and well located (although the neighbourhood behind is not the best one in the city). The staff at the front desk was helpful since our arrival, when they gave us a 2-euro discount for the tourist bus! Also we were surprised when we saw our room because there is a 32" flat TV in the room that is not appearing in any photo when you search the hotel online. We had a room that was not facing the street Parallel, it was not noisy at all. We think that the most important value of this hotel is the cleanliness of the room. Good value for money paid.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast mix up”
Reviews.Author: JB0
Reviews.Content: The desk staff was very professional and the hotel is very classy. Located close to the subway, but in a sketchy area of Barcelona. Free internet connection, but wasn't always working during our stay. Upon checking in, we were told, "Breakfast is not included, but you can have it anyway." This to me means we get a free breakfast with our stay (we stayed 3 nights). Upon checking out we were slammed with a bill for 40 euros for our breakfast (there were 2 of us eating breakfast on one morning). The lady who checked us in happened to be behind the desk so I asked her if she remembered checking us in and telling us breakfast was incuded. She said yes, she did remember us and did remember saying that, but she meant we could PAY for breakfast. This was a very expensive misunderstanding that I feel was NOT our fault. Overall, our stay was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - creepy walk to Las Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: FlyinBee
Reviews.Content: We just had a great stay at the Barcelona Universal - the room was nice and the staff very friendly and helpful. It is quite a new hotel, so it immediately gives a good impression. There were, however, some things in our room that didn't work properly: the floorboards were loose and the wardrobe doors kept shutting itself - just annoying, no real problem. Quite good value, anyhow. No noise to speak of in our room, at least. We did not have breakfast included, so we found a nice place at the nearby square where we had great breakfasts for a fraction of the price the hotel charged. The neighbourhood, in general, is OK, but the walk to Las Ramblas is pretty interesting, so based on previous reviews, we opted for the tube after dark. The tube system is easy to figure out, and it is just a short ride to Las Ramblas. All things considered, I would certainly stay at the Universal again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff, so so location”
Reviews.Author: XtinaY
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. It is a very nice hotel. Very easy to find (just follow the instruction on the website....I took the airport shuttle and metro. The airport shuttle is a bit harder to find...or I should say a little bit confusing there). Lobby is great, trendy and clean. Staff were awesome! We got all the information we need at the reception desk. BTW if you do plan the join those hop-on hop-off tour, get the package from the hotel. You will save 2 euro. However when you are asked if you want a quiet room or not, say you don't need a quiet room. Quiet room is quiet, but you don't get any view at all. You will indeed be looking at someone else's home. So don't say that you want a quiet room. Room is clean and tidy and they did a good job in cleaning. No complain. Wifi doesn't work in the room so you can only do it in the lobby (it's free tho!). There are 2 laptops in the lobby area and there are 2 more at 9th floor. However the computers were very slow and it's a spanish version of windows (somehow they don't have the @ key). The location is a little far from Ramblas. You need to walk like 10-15 minutes and you will be going thru a bit of the hood...it's fun but it gets a bit scary after dark. The restaurant downstairs (on the Paral.lel street, not the one in the hotel) is good. Remember to eat Paella and Grilled Prawns.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, nice staff.”
Reviews.Author: alflandon
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel and I'd stay there again. It's not too expensive, located directly over the metro stop, easy walk to the port, or Las Ramblas and feels very safe. The staff is nice and helpful and the rooms were clean. The only negatives were (1) the beds are very hard and uncomfortable, and (2) the Internet connection is unbearably slow, (3) the walls are pretty thin and it's fairly noisy. I have a feeling negatives #1 and #3 are true all over the city and there are plenty of cafes to get speedier Internet connections nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a few days in BCN”
Reviews.Author: LILABBY1
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel and being outside of the heavily touristy populated area of La Rambla. The view from the roof is amazing and the location (Metro station right out front/Funicular to Montjuic) is perfect. The hotel is clean and modern. Rooms are a bit small, but served their purpose. We were fist given a room that faces the interior and I cannot stand not having sunlight, so we were given a room on the 5th floor facing the street. The noise from the regular traffic wasn't bad....it was the police and ambulances that went by several times a day/night. To some this might be too much, but since I am from NYC, I'm used to the noise and it didn't bother me. I would say that noise is the only con of this hotel. There were some cute little bars/cafes behind the hotel that we didn't know about until our last night there. We also were fine walking through Raval at night. It was a little shady, a few homeless people, but just don't look at them, walk quickly and they will not bother you just like in any other big city.

Reviews.Title: “great weekend!”
Reviews.Author: katsm29
Reviews.Content: This was a really smart and clean hotel with everything you need. I was quite surprised when we arrived because it wasn't expensive so expected the worse but it was lovely. All very modern furnishings and very clean. The food was excellent and you could just help yourself to the great selection on offer for breakfast. Their is a lovely little pool on the roof which I loved, only small but cooled us down when needed. I would definately recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: izzy-sooty
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the parall-lel metro stop the hotel was facing us and looked very impressive. It was my husband's Birthday during our visit and I had e-mailed the hotel before our stay to arrange for a bottle od champagne to be waiting in our room upon arrival. The hotel staff were extremely helpful and arranged this for me with no problems. The hotel staff were always extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms were lovely and clean and spacious. I would recommend this hotel to anyone considering staying in Barcelona. PLease be aware that Barcelona can feel very intimidating at night and somebody did try to pick pocket my husband - unsucessfully. We also spoke with two other English couples who had been pick pocketed and one even had a necklace ripped from their neck!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: regburns
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights here and were very pleased. One incident illustrates the great customer service this hotel provided. My husband had the misfortune of being sprayed from the back of his head to his legs with a brown liquid (turned out to be cold coffee) by a scammer in the upscale neighborhood where Gaudi's Casa Milau is located (not near the hotel). This happened in broad daylight on a pleasant residential street. The perpetrator then offered to help him "clean up," but disappeared when my husband said "no" and walked quickly away. We had to return to the hotel so he could wash his hair and change clothes. We sent the soiled slacks and shirt out to be laundered. When we checked out a few days later and went to settle our bill, we discovered that there was no charge for the laundry service. The front desk people had been sympathetic when the incident occurred, but this was really a nice gesture -- it saved us about 9 euros, or $13-$14. We booked this hotel though Hotwire -- so the price was very reasonable. We did not eat their breakfast, which like most hotel buffets, was very expensive. We ate most mornings at Pepe 2 (there are 4 restaurants owned by Pepe on this block, 2 on each side of the street), where a genial manager named Sam, who once lived in the Bronx, presides. Instead of 15 euros/person, we paid about 8 euros for both. One ordered the full Amer. breakfast, which we shared -- it was enough for 2 -- and the other just a coffee and pastry. The only drawback to this hotel is its location, a good 10-min. walk from Las Ramblas through dark and pretty deserted streets at night. It's on the edge of the Raval district, which is gentrifying but is still a bit dicey. However, if you are watchful and not out till the really wee hours, you should be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Algarvean
Reviews.Content: 2nd visit to this great hotel. Located approx 10 minutes walk to the Ramblas or the Port. Comfortable rooms and free internet available. Be sure to ask to move if you are put in the central rooms that have no window to the outside. One of our group was and the reception oblidged. On slight downside is that one of our rooms was still not available at 15:30 on the arrival day. All in all a great hotel. Some great little bars nearby, try La Confiteria - turn right out of the hotel on the crossing. Also Le Petit Apolo on the road opposite (beer taps on the tables!!).

Reviews.Title: “Only drawback was road noise”
Reviews.Author: Loskie
Reviews.Content: Took 4 night break. Booked direct with hotel as best price. 4 nights including breakfast and bottle of Cava (good Cava too) on arrival was Euro 395 for two. Location fine for city centre and harbour/beach. Metro stop right at front door. I didn't feel uncomfortable walking around the locality at night (but be sensible and don't take risks) and I'm a country boy. We walked a lot and saw most sights on foot. Hotel room as one would expect of modern business class hotel however I am a light sleeper and at time of booking (3 wks before stay) and again on confirmation the day before arrival asked for a quiet room. We were allocated room 406 which faced the busy road at the front where workmen started digging in the road at approx 8am and the traffic including emergency response vehicles was 24/7. I was disturbed most nights but still had a good holiday. My partner can sleep through anything was OK. Staff were efficient and fairly pleasant and breakfast was very good. Roof terrace a nice place to look over the city. Plenty of nearby restaraunts and bars. Only thing stopping Very good rating for me is the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: james4522uk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights during September and had a great time! Check in was fast and efficient, the staff on the front desk were very friendly and informative through out our stay. Our room was amazing, massive corner room. Room was spotlessly clean, serviced daily. Lovely bath and shower. Free safety deposit box in the wardrobe. Small but reasonably priced mini-bar was also available in the room. The location of this hotel is fine if you do not mind the ten minute walk to La Ramblas (the walk will take you to the port end of La Ramblas). The area surrounding the hotel was fine, at no point did we feel unsafe or intimidating. In summary, a really great hotel for a really great price.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel, good efficient service - not great location”
Reviews.Author: Jakearch
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an excellent 3 night break in Barcelona, staying at the Universal. I could not fault the hotel - modern, clean with efficient staff. However I agree with previous reviewers on the location. The hotel is within walking distance to Ramblas and the port area. However, the walk from Las Ramblas through the Raval is intimidating, especially at night, with plenty of prostitutes, pimps and dealers to pass. That said, we never had any trouble - but there was 4 of us, I would not even think about doing this walk if you are going as a couple on your own. Get a taxi!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but the not the best location.”
Reviews.Author: Tisco031
Reviews.Content: I don´t hesitate to recommend this hotel! Clean, great staff, good breakfast buffet, nice skyline view from the roof pool, metro just outside the door. Unfortunately we had an inside room without a window but the room was OK with a free safe deposit box. Maybe 15 minutes walk from the harbour/beach and 5-10 min walk from the Rambla. However, getting to the Rambla the shortest way means you must pass through the Raval. A not so pleasant neighbourhood with a lots of prostitutes and drug dealers.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: osamahin
Reviews.Content: we arrived at this hotelin 29th september2009, the check in took less than a minute and we had this great room ..it was spacious and very clean,the bathroom was fantastic.......and the best thing is that u have the metro station just in front of the hotel...and u can walk to la rambla in less than 10 minutes...

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MiaCatBirmingham
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fantastic trip to Barcelona for my 30th birthday. Very pleased with my choice of Hotel as it was clean, modern, friendly and ideally located with La Ramblas 10m min walk and a metro station just outside hotel. Would recommend using Metro to get to all major sites... so easy to use and so much quicker! My only complaint would be that our room was located at the front of the hotel on a main road, and was unbearably noisy!!! I did boast I can sleep through anything... but this was uncomfortable - all night!! Constant hum of street/traffic noise along with sirens all night! It has been suggested that you can request a room at the back of the hotel which is much quieter....I would next time! Overall had a great time and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC STAY”
Reviews.Author: miamimickey140
Reviews.Content: Part one of my span trip Stayed here from Oct 10 - 13th Room 602 There is a subway station right out front of Hotel...which makes it a big plus. When we walked in, the place is very modern and beautiful. We checked in very quickly. ROOM: We got a great large room with amazing city view. large room and the bathroom was HUGE! We had a tub, a seprate shower, dbl sink and even a built in sound system in the bathroom (seprate from the sound system in the rest of the room and living area) TERRACE: has amazing views of barcelona. Pool looked good. (to cold to get into it) INTERNET: they have wifi, but have laptops downstairs you can use free of charge. This was a great help to check work emails since my blackberry didnt work for some reason! STAFF: Ok this is a topic that ALL hotels in spain have negative reviews about. So if your smart...and put 1 and 1, you can tell this is the way they are. And by they i mean Europe as a whole. I have been to other parts in europe and they are "cold", "rude", or "not helpful". How ever you want to call it. This is how it is. So the best thing you can do is NOT expect Customer Service and you wont get upset. :-) Example: we went to eat and when i got my Credit Card recpt notice no where for a tip. I asked out server (who was dry, cold) where do i put the tip...and he explained that they do not work on tips. They get paid a salary, period. So if you put this puzzle together, it explains everything. And we found this to be the same way in all parts of biz in Spain. So again...let it go...or you will be frustrated ALL day long and loose focus on the beauty that Spain has to offer. AREA: This is another subject on this hotel. YES it borders and area called El RAVAL. This is not the best area and so if you stick on the main avenue the hotel is on...and walk towards the Port....you will run into the Statue of Colon. Thats where Las Ramblas begins. Thats an area of food and shops. Its about 4 big blocks away...but a nice walk. BEDS: Hard as a rock. but all hotels in Europe is this way. So as i said before...its the way of life in Europe and we need to adapt to this while where there. if not...you will have a horrible time. We loved Barcelona. We did the on & off bus which is great to take you to all the tourist locations you need to see. Its a dbl decker bus. MEN: have your wallet in the front pocket of your jeans. Pick-pockets is a major thing there and happens to many. There are many things to do here...so make sure you do your research. Part 2 of my trip was in Madrid oct 13 - 17. (Petit Palace Ducal)

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience”
Reviews.Author: KenYiu
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel I have ever stayed!! Staff quality was terrible! Especially the staff named :Juan My room lock was broken and couldn't double locked from the inside, when I compalin to the recepition, the staff named "Juan S. Blazquee" told me that there were no room for me to change. But after further checking, he again told me that there's only 1 room left but the lock's broken, too. When I asked him "Is it normal that all locks in the rooms of your hotel are broken?" He answered me that" I only work in this hotel and don't personally stay in this hotel, therefore I don't know it is normal or not" What an answer is that??! I later requested to take a look another room and found out the lock worked perfectly normal. I asked him why he lied to me and wasted my time(wasted more than 30 mins and I was in a rush for the soccer match) and we had some arguement in the reception. He was totally rude and competely bad in attitude. He hit on the table, shouted at him loudly and even pointed his finger in my face. I felt totally humiliated. Hotel that allows such kind of staff to exist doesn't worth 4 stars. Even there is a minus point I can choose for the "Service", I will choose minus 1,000. Never stay in this hotel, or if you need to stay, pls try to avoid this "Juan".

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel on the edge of the old city”
Reviews.Author: x_tan
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 night there in September 2009. We got the rooms 219 and 221, which were only 2 out 5 rooms have balcony in this hotel! The rooms are very well design and far better than any 5 star hotels in Australia! The metro station Paral·lelAddress (Line 2 & 3) is right in front of the hotel. So it's very easy to go to all major attraction in Barcelona. As the hotel is on the edge of the old city, the neighbourhood look a bit uneasy at 1st; but the hotel has 24hrs satffing in the front and you are safe ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel but not the best location in the city”
Reviews.Author: Hickster18
Reviews.Content: We booked this on the internet and got an excellent price. We asked for a quiet room and a travel cot and we got both in a superb room on the 9th floor which was almost like a suite. Lovely hotel, efficient check in and out, great facilities (we did not use the restaurant as we like to eat out for breakfast and dinner but it looked nice). Staff were pleasant and we made use of the rooftop pool which was great with our 20 month old son, be warned its cold!!! but the terrace view is worth it. The hotel is superb. One issue is that we found that this part of the city was not as nice as others (it was our first time) and therefore in the evening when coming back we found certain routes back on foot to be a bit uncomfortable when you come back from say the Ramblas and for that reason alone we gave the hotel a 4 rating although there is little they can do about it. On the positive side with regard the location the metro is literally over the road including the funicular up Montjuic hill toward the Olympic stadium and Castle. Barcelona was superb and we can recommend it as a break. If taking a small child bewrae some metro stations do not have lifts and some do. Also recommend buying a T10 metro ticket at the airport (7.70 Euros) as you can travel airport to city as one journey and then have 9 more journeys to use which we did around the city and our return to the airport. Train to airport about 25minutes and the metro was very easy to use.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent hotel for a short break”
Reviews.Author: avonsong
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel on two occasions. Once before our cruise and again after the cruise. I don't often write reviews but I think hotel is worth recommending. The rooms are modern, spacious and equipped with everything you need. If you like a good nights sleep ask for one at the rear of the hotel aa Barcelons is pretty busy whatever time of day or night. The staff here were very helpful. Good English spoken on the front desk and in the restaurant. Lots of eating places close to the hotel but all pretty run of the mill serving the same food. It was ok for breakfasts. We therefore decided to have dinner in the hotel restaurant which was excelent. Lovely salad buffet with big portions of main course grill. Again the staff were very hepful. The hotel has a small pool and sun deck on the roof which is welcome if you have a couple of hours to spare

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and new facilities”
Reviews.Author: Maha-travels
Reviews.Content: The hotel was as good as reviews that I read before making the reservation. Some staff were a bit unfriendly but this maybe true to customer service in Barcelona. The room was clean and relatively large (It would be nice to have a hot water jug). Breakfast selection was good but not extensive (it would be nice to have boiled eggs as a lighter alternative to the scrambled eggs). We had a light meal at the bar one night that we enjoyed. Very close to the Parallel metro station entrance (20 meters from the entrance). We took the airort bus to Plaza de España and walked to the hotel (around 1 mile). The gym needs free weights. Overall I would come again.

Reviews.Title: “Great roof top pool !”
Reviews.Author: KfromLondon
Reviews.Content: me & my boyfriend stayed at the barcelona universal for 3 nights couldn't ask for a better hotel it's sophisticated & modern with a gorgeous roof top pool, The staff are so helpfull and friendly they drew us a map how to get to places and made a diner reservation for us and checked what time a shopping store closed for me, Would deffinatly stay here again! And it's a great location for las ramblas just a 10 min walk away and the olympic port a 10 min cab ride. You have to check out Buddah bar in las ramlas realy funky bar serves great cocktails and the Angles & Kings Club at the ME barcelona hotel is a realy cool club which open's up onto a roof top pool they also have a beautiful spa at ME barcelona and las ramblas is great for shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal!”
Reviews.Author: IsaGatineau
Reviews.Content: I reserved early from Internet, for a third of the regular price, and when we got there we were pleasantly surprised. The Hotel is a little away from all the touristic action, while it's an easy walk to Las Ramblas. A magnificent view of the city from the pool on the roof. The room was cosy and luxurious. We only paid about 112 euros for a night and the service from every staff member was amazing! I'm never going to another hotel in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - great value if you go room only”
Reviews.Author: FJRLee
Reviews.Content: Just back from 3rd stay here, staff are very friendly and helpful. The hotel is new and the rooms are bright and modern. The roof top area with pool, though small, is a pleasant place. Rooms at the back are quieter. Wifi is free. Good location, as it is a short walk (less than 10 minutes) to the Rambla or the harbour. Even better, the metro station (Paralel) is right outside the door, so get an unlimited 3 or 5 day pass (23euro for 5 day) and you can go anywhere on bus/train easily and quickly. Do NOT book breakfast in the hotel, all reports are that it is poor (or worse). Food outside on the street is good and cheap (about 5 euro) and they serve food/drink until after 3 am. Lots to see and do in Barcelona, cheap good food in Les Quinz Nitz in Placa Reial (off Rambla, mid way on rhs going away from harbour) but you always have to queue.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: bichonbabies
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant staff. We stayed with them two nights before our Mediterranean cruise and one night after. They upgraded our room to a suite on the return trip at no extra charge. Roomy storage for bags before check-in and after check-out so we could immediately get out and see Barcelona without having to lug our bags around.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel,Great Rooms&Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Fish1967
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel for 5 days from August 30th.I have to say the rooms we got were'nt actually rooms,but whole suites on the top floor,they were fantastic with views over the whole of the City&with huge Balconies.My tip is if you stay here,e-mail the Hotel a while before your stay& request a smoking room,then you have a better chance of getting one with a Balcony.Anyway the Hotel is very nice& in a great spot,only 5 mins to Las Ramblas&The Marina.I would reccomend you to try this Hotel,we thought it was Excellent!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, friendly staff and good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: ALH57
Reviews.Content: This was my second time at this hotel and I really love it. As others have mentioned it is an excellent location with the metro Line 3 Parallel just outside the door. This line is the one to get to most of the tourist attractions. It is also within 10 mins walk of Las Ramblas. Last time we were given a room without a window which was fine but this time I asked for a window and got a very large balcony. Room 221. I believe rooms 215 - 223 have balconies. I'd certainly stay here again the next time I go to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel in a Central Location”
Reviews.Author: msumengen
Reviews.Content: Hotel Barcelona Universal is located just near the Parallel, Green L3, metro station so it is very easy to reach there from Sants Train Station. It takes 10 minutes to walk to one of the most famous streets of Barcelona, Las Ramblas. However, you can take metro to reach anywhere in a short period of time. So, I can say that location of the hotel is very satisfactory for me. The design of the hotel and rooms are modern. Room is comfortable and clean. Safe box is easy to use. There is free wireless internet and there is a coverage inside of your room. The variety of the breakfast is beyond average. Although the road in front of the hotel is busy, rooms are very quiet. Employees are warm and friendly. They are helpful if you have any question. During check out, they provide you locked room for leaving your baggages and also give you an area to take shower before totally leaving the hotel. In conclusion, in overall I recommend this hotel for staying in Barcelona. The price is affordable however breakfast price could be a bit less. I haven't found a serious drawback for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona Universal, excellent”
Reviews.Author: stemuzzer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally situated outside a metro station so getting around is so easy, we got a 4 day pass for the metro for €20 La ramblas is only a 5 min walk but after a couple of days we got lazy and just rode the metro to it The hotel was spotlessly clean and the staff were always friendly and willing to help Free towels were provided for the swimming pool We were fortunate enough to be upgraded to a suite as it was our honeymoon, the room was awesome with lounge area, bedroom and bathroom with jacuzzi bath and also a walk in shower and our own terrace Braekfast was included in our price but if I stayed here again I probably wouldn't bother with breakfast as there are plenty of cafes nearby The food was ok with plenty of choice The hotel has free Wifi and on our floor there were 4 computers with internet access for anyboby to use Steve & Sarah

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Again! :)”
Reviews.Author: Char8181
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights and the hotel was very clean and modern. The staff were very helpful and friendly. Breakfast was lovely, lots of choice and nice food. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good value, fab pool!”
Reviews.Author: clairerobbo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights at the end of July as part of a group of 13 girls on a hen party. The location was ideal, just 5 mins walk to Las Ramblas and 10mins to the Marina. The hotel is also in an excellent location for the Metro, by sheer luck we managed to come out of the correct exit and the hotel was right in front of us. The pool was small, but ideal for those of us who wanted to spend some time soaking up the Spanish sunshine and lovely to have a cooling dip after a day of sightseeing. Our room was massive, but unfortunately was an inside room with no natural light. This wasn't really an issue as we were only getting ready to go out in there, but if you planned to spend more time in the room it would be worth asking for a room with a view. Overall, excellent value and we all felt very safe walking around at night, although I would recommend sticking to the main roads after dark and not taking short cuts to Las Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great price, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: crazykar
Reviews.Content: went for 5 days with my wife. the hotel is modern with all the amenities you would want. the pool may be small but is refreshing at about 3pm when you have been sightseeing all day. its more for relaxing and taking a cooling dip. the rooms were very clean, the aircon was easy to use and always worked. yes, one could here the noise when sleeping but it wouldn't keep you up. the great location means having to deal with traffic and people, if you want silence, reserve a hotel on the outskirts of the city. the location is perfect, underground station right in front, las ramblas a 10 minute walk. only caution would be the price of alcohol, a jug of sangria was 18 euros, pretty pricey. walked to the supermarket up the street and bought water and sangria for a lot cheaper and would take that to the pool. nice tapas place a few blocks up that was cheap and had an added bonus of having beer taps at the tables you would sit at, cant remember the name but had lots of fun.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel for a short stay.”
Reviews.Author: LYNBY
Reviews.Content: Had five days at the Barcelona Universal in early July 2009. On arrival we asked for a quiet room and they obliged. The staff were very friendly. The room was clean and spacious. The hotel was central for the Ramblas and harbour area and was very close to the Metro. We would definately use it again. There were plenty of cafes across the road for breakfast. Try the Dino pan. For evening meals try the Bella La Napoli on Margarit and La Bodegueta on Carre De Blai very close by in Poble Sec.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: RobboII
Reviews.Content: The good things about this hotel are:- - location - walking distance to Las Ramblas (10 min) - ask for directions and a map from reception (they were very helpful). Just a small point to be careful at night as there are some "adult" locations nearby (esp. walking through the side streets to Las Ramblas). However don't let that put you off as we were approached more than once on Las Ramblas itself - right next to Metro station (Parallel) - though there is more than one exit from this station so as you come out, try to get your bearings - possibly ask in one of the shops as you could start walking away from the hotel without noticing - hotel itself was clean and tidy - I think it is a business hotel in the week - value for money - excellent rates for the centre of Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Clean and safe but not luxury!”
Reviews.Author: k_dawgEngland
Reviews.Content: Positives: -Great Staff, a few receptionists really helped make our trip by recommending restaurants and places to go, they always have time for you and speak very good English. They were very approachable and friendly. -Close walk to Las Ramblas, plus great transport links with the metro station right outside, and taxi ranks next to the hotel and across the road. -Close to lovely patisseries for an inexpensive option of breakfast/lunch. -Rooms well cleaned. -Free Internet use. Negatives: -Pool and gym were misleading-too small to class as a proper pool and a gym which was embarrassing. -Breakfast price is excessive for what you get. -Our first room was a twin, not double so we changed-also did not have window, and was very loud as was on the first floor. After moving rooms to a higher floor noise was quiet. -TV was faulty. -Mini bar was also overpriced, would recommend plenty of water to bring to rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: greffie
Reviews.Content: The hotel and staff were great. I booked on hotwire so the rate was really good too. If you can, try to get a room with a private terrace. Made the stay much better. The room was clean and the service was great. They forgot to replace the toilet paper one day but one call down to the desk and that was corrected. I don't know why anyone would say it's too loud. I couldn't hear a thing. Could be because our room was towards the back of the hotel and not facing the street. There's a great local pizza/burger place next door. The owners were from Toronto, too. Nice surprise. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended for pre - cruisers”
Reviews.Author: balmac
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights before a Mediterranean cruise and would do so again. It is but a short walk to the Ramblas, and (unlike a previous poster) we had absolutely no problem with the staff! It has a particularly nice pool area and the staff are happy to make recommendations for local restaurants - one particularly nice seafood one, 10 mins walk up the Parallel. We got an excellent price deal off their internet site and thought the Universal was perfect for our needs. The hotel room was not the biggest we found in Europe but after all, we were not in there very much and it was certainly modern, and well equpped. Happy to recommend the Universal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - grotty area”
Reviews.Author: Pound_Witch
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was lovely, modern and beautifully furnished. The pool area was lovely - lots of room for deck chairs and the decking was gorgeous. The room was nice and big but wasn't hoovered one day which meant bit of mud that came off our shoes one day were sticking to our feet from the laminated floor for two days. However the area was really grotty and run down. The majority of the restaurants along Paralel were run down and looked dirty - we probably had a jaundiced view since the weather was awful and we could not use the pavement tables which would feel more airy and less smoky and grubby than the tables indoors. Although I would recommend the hotel I would not recommend staying in that area but would recommend staying in the Place Catalunya area as I have done before.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and efficient hotel - with lovely pool area”
Reviews.Author: mand15
Reviews.Content: Hotel is business class, but doesn't prevent leisure travellers being able to enjoy its amenities. It has a decent location, with a metro stop literally at its front door - key for arrival with suitcases. There isn't a lot on Paral-lel, the road on which the hotel is situated. However, it is only a short distance down any number of sidestreets through the El Ravel district to Las Ramblas. I would recommend taking Carrer Nou de la Rambla to walk back home at night though, as its that bit more open and busy. The hotel itself is very clean and efficient. The rooms are open, spacious and airy and the bathroom was particularly nice. We were on the 2nd floor at the front and didn't notice much noise - even though the Tour de France was in town and there was much setting up involved for it. The rooftop pool was a welcome addition to the hotel - unfortunately we only managed to enjoy it once during our stay due to bad weather. It is fairly small, but nice to dip into to cool down whilst looking over the rooftops of the city. There's plenty of sunchairs around however, so I was pleasantly surprised by it. We didn't take breakfast in the hotel as it was much too expensive at 15euro per day - instead I suggest going to La Boqueria market on Las Ramblas where you'll find loads of fruit stalls and coffee bars for a fresh breakfast instead.

Reviews.Title: “Will Be Back”
Reviews.Author: renpen21
Reviews.Content: Just returned after spending 5 nights here, I found the hotel staff great to deal with, We arrived early and was allowed to store our cases till our room was ready, we went for a wonder and when we returned our room was ready for us. The rooms was clean and was cleaned by the staff on a daily basis with fresh towels supplied everyday, I've no complaints about the hotel at all, The roof top pool and area to lounge in were great for a little break during the day to rest our tired feet... Was a little worried about the location as i'd seen a few reviews saying it was in a rough area but we never once felt unsafe, Was 5 minutes from La Rambla and the port and with the underground/tube directly outside was within a few stops of most of the top attrractions...Will definetly stay here again..

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel, not 4 stars.”
Reviews.Author: AnaCaro-CostaRica
Reviews.Content: Wanted more from a 4 star hotel, nothing great. Service was average, asked for scissors from the front desk and had to go down for them... for me this is not 4 star service. Free internet and 2 computer available was a plus. Pool was average, solarium a bit uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel but....”
Reviews.Author: ILAN2008
Reviews.Content: Based on a review of trip advisor we stayed at this hotel for 4 nights with breakfast : 1) This is a really good 4 stars hotel 2) This hotel is centrally located not far from the ramblas and montjuic 3) The staff is very professional 4) The hotel is very clean and the rooms are modern whith a very good air condition and nice bathroom . 5) The breakfast was very good based on a buffet and self service but The rooms have no double glazing windows and for this reason there is no proper isolation from the outside .Especially in all the rooms which are located on the parallel avenue (which is a main boulevard and a very noisy boulevard , day and night ) you can't be isolated from the noise . This is really problematic when You're trying to sleep or rest . When getting to the main spots in barcelona from the hotel by foot ; which are near the hotel , dont try to get there through the little streets in the neighbourhood because You could feel unsecure .

Reviews.Title: “good location, clean and nice”
Reviews.Author: regazzamilano
Reviews.Content: the room was great--- but reception was a little rude and elitist. other than that, the location is great and barcelona is lovely!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location for a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: mikpatty
Reviews.Content: We wanted a clean safe, hotel in a good location for a good price, and that is exactly what we got. The hotel was a brief walk to Las Ramblas and was right on top of the Metro. It is a little louder due to its location on a busy street, however I'm confident comparable hotels in this location would be even louder. The rooftop pool and sundeck with incredible views of the city was a cherry on top, although the pool was really just a soaking pool. The room was pretty small, but the bathroom was big by European standards. If you don't plan on spending all day in your room, this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “very nice! Wonderful views of the city!”
Reviews.Author: LC671
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 5 days with a study abroad program and loved it. It was a central place for all of our site seeing. It was very roomy, and the customer service staff was excellent they went above and beyond in my opinion. Another plus is free internet access if your going to be gone long, Internet cafes are expensive so take advantage of that service. and great resturants and tapas bars right down the street.

Reviews.Title: “spacious, modern, clean, helpful, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: AMWSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an amazing oasis in the midst of busy Barcelona. The rooms are spacious, clean, minimalist in decor (hardwood floors, clean lines), and the bathrooms modern and also spacious. The windows opened (always nice in a modern hotel), but we closed them at night to minimize noise. The hotel is located only a few blocks from La Rambla and immediately across the street from the Metro and funicular to Montjuic. We walked everywhere, did not rent a car and never needed a taxi. The front desk staff were very helpful and we were able to get free internet access on the hotel computers. We didn't have their breakfasts or any food there because there were so many options in Barcelona. After a busy day of sightseeing, eating, and touring, we looked forward to the peace and zen atmosphere of our room. Beds are comfortable too. Bathroom amenities aplenty.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for a city hotel, but pool is pokey and it is very noisy!”
Reviews.Author: ClarissaHampshire_UK
Reviews.Content: We met friends for a birthday celebration and all of us were staying at the hotel. We arrived at 12:00, but were told that our room was not ready, as check-in was 15:00. We went for lunch and then to the poolside to wait for 15:00 hours. At 14:30 we came down, met some other friends checking in, but still our room was not ready. I asked for an alternative room and was told that we could have an inner room and that it would be less noisy, than the one allocated to us. Hmmn... The window looked down onto a storage area for bottles and other service items. At 07:00 on Sunday morning I was woken to Spanish radio, talking and the scraping of tables. I asked reception to see if they could stop this, but was informed that the inner rooms look over other residences that they have no control over, but he would report it to the manager. Monday dawned and so did 7am again, crashing and banging. I overheard reception telling new arrivals that their inner rooms would be quiet. Others in our group changed from inner to outer rooms and said that the street noise was bad! I know it's a city hotel, but don't pretend it isn't! A shame, because the amenities and room itself are good.

Reviews.Title: “good one”
Reviews.Author: AllArroundObserver
Reviews.Content: We were planing very short stay in barcelona , we booked hotel from lastminut.com... nice, moder hotel in the city center, 5 minut to la ramblas, room very clean, good size... breakfast just amazing, everythings we needed.. Very helpfull and polite staff.. good memory, impresion...

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: cyntul2no
Reviews.Content: we stayed here with several other couples. We felt the location was good-not right in the middle of the tourist area, but within walking distance to La Rambla. It was a safe area with restaurants, shops, grocery stores around. The room was kept clean and was nicely decorated. We had good service from the front desk personnel. overall we had a pleasant experience here.

Reviews.Title: “COMPLETELY SAFE AREA AND A VERY GOOD HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: JacNewcastleuponTyne
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the reviews about this hotel I can only say that it is a very good hotel in a good location within walking distance to The Ramblas, the metro and the local bus services. I went with my best friend to treat ourselves for our 40th birthdays and we never felt at risk from being mugged etc and walked back to our hotel after midnight with no problems. The area is very busy with tourists so as long as you treat this city the same as any other and don't put yourself in danger by walking in quiet areas late at night you shouldn't have any problems. The roof top pool at the hotel was brilliant for a relaxing day after all of the walking we did investigating the city and I would recommend taking one of the city bus tours which cover the east and west route to make sure you don't miss seeing anything. All in all a brilliant 3 day break and I would definately go back. Jacqui - Newcastle upon Tybe - UK

Reviews.Title: “Good deal, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: caligirl888
Reviews.Content: My family really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful and spoke English fluently. They gave us rooms in the back so it wasn't noisy at all. The rooms are simple and clean. The bathroom looks modern and for European standards is a good size. Location was good as well as it was walking distance to Las Ramblas and Mercat de Boqueria. There's a metro stop in front of the hotel as well. Overall, very good. I would recommend it to my friends and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Onlywrk2tvl
Reviews.Content: Staff friendly, spoke English happily, and so helpful with maps/info. Place to keep luggage till 3pm check in. Room spacious and very clean. Some complain of noise, but it did not bother us. 10 min walk to hop on hop off bus. Felt safe, loved the views from pool area and rooftop. Truly a marvelous stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: DLHTravelers
Reviews.Content: We were happy to stay in this hotel as it was clean, friendly and at an excellent location. The hotel is just above a Metro stop and not far away from many major attractions. It is also close to the cruise port and not far from the airport. We followed the hotel direction and took a train from the airport to the hotel. It was easy and fast to get to the hotel. I will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean, not spectacular”
Reviews.Author: TravelChica99
Reviews.Content: I decided to book this hotel based on the reviews I had read on this site and I have to say I was not disappointed. The staft were helpful and answered any queries with efficiency. The rooms were spacious and clean and the bathroom was a very good size and well stocked with bathroom essentials, the shower was nice and no problems with hot water. The location was perfect for getting around, there is a metro station (Paral.lel) just seconds away from the hotel and travelling around Barcelona was very easy. I didn't walk to Las Ramblas, but it's just a few stops on the train to Catalunya station where Las Ramblas starts. The breakfast was not included and cost €15, but as I didn't eat there I cannot comment on it. The gymnasium didnt have much equipment in it and the pool was small but ok, a bit cold to swim in it now, but I'm not sure that I would be tempted even in hot weather due to its size. On the whole the hotel was nice, but it's not a hotel that I would repeatedly book. There are places to eat very close by but I wasnt too impressed by the food, but that has nothing to do with the hotel. I found Plaza Reial (Liceu metro station, off Las Ramblas) was a good place to each lunch and dinner. On the whole, very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great on paper but beware of the noise!”
Reviews.Author: buddha007
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable room and super clean but the noise from the street is intolerable; people are out partying and shouting until half five. We did ask to change rooms but we were told to wait the next day at noon. We decided against waiting as we didn't want to waste a day. I have to agree with reviews re the neighbourhood; it's a strange mix and not always the safest. The pool is tiny and the gym consists of two treadmills, two bikes, a bench and that's it.
