Reviews.Title: “OK but poor room with plastic protector and a rough area?”
Reviews.Author: lizclassic54
Reviews.Content: We stayed in another 4 star which was FANTASTIC so this hotel was a a disappointment. The room was Ok but the shower was tatty and our basin cracked. The internet access was very slow Good point were the staff and breakfast. The beds had a PLASTIC covering on the mattress! and we didint have spare pillows. The side streets, walking from Ramblas (what a let down!) back to the hotel at 9.30 pm were rather scary to say the least!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, fabulous location--near cruise boats and Mont Juic”
Reviews.Author: Maggie_Oakshot
Reviews.Content: With crisp sheets and freshly clean rooms, this hotel is great--not just good--value for anyone who wants to be IN Barcelona but is tired of El Cheapo low rent hotels. Centrally located, it is walkable to most things--and a short taxi to a cruise boat (if you are lucky enough to take a cruise from Barcelona.) The staff were mostly friendly and helpful. Only one had a bit of an attitude, but maybe she was having a bad day? Vale!!! Across from a theatre, walking to the basic tourist areas--or subway/tube.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location, great staff. Rooms a bit small though.”
Reviews.Author: chefbar
Reviews.Content: Overall, a good experience. Got a good price via Hotwire so it was well worth it. The hotel and staff are very nice; rooms are super clean and modern. It is centrally located so it’s easy to get anywhere in town and to all the popular sites. Rooms are small and lacking drawers so if you are there for a while with a bit of luggage, storage is a bit of an issue. There is a closet with several shelves and room to hang 12 or so items easily. The front desk staff all spoke (at the least decent) English and were always cordial and very helpful with directions, advice etc. There is no concierge but all the staff were knowledgeable. Or if they weren’t sure of something would find someone who was. The location is great, you can walk to many sites and neighborhoods easily or use the Metro to get almost everywhere in a few minutes. The beds were not the most comfortable we have ever slept on but quite adequate. Bathrooms are also a bit small with 1 sink, but the facilities all worked well with good water pressure and very hot water. Shampoo and soap provided is not great quality so bring your own. We used room service for coffee in the AM only. It was lightening fast to arrive, the coffee strong, really good and plenty of it for 4 euro’s. The hotel is in the center of town so street noise can be a problem; but you will hear the noise in any centrally located hotel. Barcelona is a late night city so the traffic and people are about and carousing until quite late. But when in Rome….we stayed out late as well. If you need to get to sleep early the noise can be loud so be sure to ask for a room not facing the main street. But I am sure you will still hear some noise. The high speed Wi-Fi internet is free but it was not so high speed most of the time. This was not a big issue. There is a pool and fitness center on the roof. The view is fantastic from up there. Though we did not use those facilities they seemed more than adequate if you really need to work out. (Sorry there is just too much to do and see in Barcelona and we got plenty of exercise walking!) There is a transit stop (the Metro) just outside the front door so we were able to get about in a flash, taxis were also abundant. I highly recommend becoming familiar with the “Metro” it is (obviously) cheap and we found that it was as fast (sometimes faster) than the taxis. Also we felt very safe in the Metro at all hours as there are security people always around. There is one day and multi day tickets which are available (and are a good deal) and are good on all the Metro trains and almost all the busses. We are both chefs so we were in seventh heaven in this city. The food is always good. Even the “bad” food was good lol. Great coffee, always and everywhere as well. Though the food prices can be somewhat pricey at some places the drink prices were amazingly low. Most places have Cava’s or other wines for under (sometimes well under) 12 Euros for a BOTTLE! We sampled lots of them and they we all good quality and very drinkable. We love Barcelona!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern, clean and very central hotel. Worth 4* rating.”
Reviews.Author: Travellers2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Universal for 3 nights. First impressions were very good as the hotel lobby was modern and clean. We were unable to check in as we arrived before 3pm, but our luggage was locked away in a secure room. Check in was quick and hassle free, the reception staff were friendly and helpful. For our first night we stayed in a standard room. Whilst the room was very clean and functional, it was very small with not much room spare in the room around the bed. The bathroom was also fairly small. We upgraded for the second and third nights and this was well worth the extra €50 per night. The room was much bigger having a separate dressing room and loads of wardrobe space. The bathroom was also larger and had a window. The room came with the usual facilities; mini bar, TV, good supply of toiletries etc. There was also A/C which could be controlled within the room. Hairdryer was available in the bathroom. The hotel was very central, being only a short walk (5-10 mins) from Las Rambles and a great base for all the sites. There was also a metro stop outside the hotel. Taxis while not expensive compared to some places, were not cheap. A taxi from the airport cost us €25. We didn’t eat in the hotel so I am afraid that we cannot give our opinion on food. We were only in Barcelona for a few days so were out and about for most of the time using the hotel as our base, therefore we didn’t really utilise any of the hotel facilities. The only negative point I would have in relation to this hotel was the beds. They were rock hard and very uncomfortable – so much so that my husband and I found it hard to sleep. Other than that I would have no issues recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stop searching: this is it !”
Reviews.Author: MiquelGroningen
Reviews.Content: Visited Barcelona several times before. First time in this hotel for 4 nights with my wife. Nice price, good location and very good hotel. Clean, spacy and good beds. Tasty breakfast (not included but fair price). Just a 10 minute walk to the Rambla. Metro Paral-lel right in front of the hotel (in case you're tired or just lazy) Next time: without hesitation: same hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and a great location”
Reviews.Author: jtate622
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of its close proximity to La Ramblas. I loved it. It was very modern and very clean. The hotel has to be a four star because I did not have any complaints. It is next to a metro station but we did not use it that much. La Ramblas is only a 5 minute walk and it is about a 10 minute walk to Plaza de Catalunya, a major city center. There are also two computers in the lobby for your usage. I am sure the hotel has other amenities but we did not utilize them during our short stay. The price was great and the staff was great as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean modern rooms, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: tjofg
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights before a cruise from port of barcelona. On arrival, staff was very friendly. Room was clean, new, and lighting & AC worked well. Bathroom was complete with towel warmer and bidet. Location was awesome; such a wonderful walk to Las Ramblas and other attractions. The street the hotel is on is full of great places to eat. Will definitely stay here again when in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!! Cant wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: JulieKG
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at this hotel, only just got back. It started on friday, we checked in at 7pm, check in was quick and easy. We went up to our room (819!!) and were pleased that we had a wonderful view! Within seconds of putting our bags down, there was a knock on the door. The hotel had sent us up a bottle of champagne as we had said it was my boyfriends birthday when booking. We thought this was a lovely gesture and were very happy. The location of the hotel is great - as other reviews have said it is only a 10-15 minute walk to the ramblas and all other sights are in easy reach. Turn left out of the hotel and you are pretty much able to go everywhere! There is a metro stop outdside the hotel which is fast and easy and extremely cheap. We didnt use any other method of transport as this was so good for us. The pool on the top of the hotel is lovely, altho we didnt use it, we were only there for 3 nights and had so much to cram in! It is a lovely place to sit and watch the sun go down which is beautiful. The view is 360 degrees and well worth it! Im already planning my summer evenings for when we return!! We didnt have breakfast in the hotel but if you turn left out of the hotel there are some great cafes which are cheap and do great food. We had breakfast at Pepe's (yellow sign) and for 4.50 euro we had bacon, eggs, toast, fresh orange and a coffee - well worth it! Overall - I would highly recommend this hotel - staff was friendly, rooms were lovely - bathroom was very spacious with the best ever shower!!!. Enjoy your stay!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value; I'll be staying here again during my next visit to Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: robs4219
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel through Hotwire, so got a fantastic deal on what turned out to be a great hotel. First, there is a Metro stop just a few steps from the front door. Very convenient, especially since The Ramblas and Barri Gotic are only a 10 minute walk from the hotel. The room itself was very stylish and trendy, but also spacious and comfortable. The only criticism was that there did not seem to be adequate soundproofing; you could hear everything happening in the hallway and adjacent rooms. The staff were very helpful when it came to giving directions and other advice, as well as letting us use their office printer to print out boarding passes after checking into our departing flight. A minor thing, but just an example of how helpful the staff were. The pool was closed during our visit, so I cannot comment on that. There was free wifi through out the hotel, as well as a business centre and two notebooks with internet access in the lobby for guest use. Very convenient when you need to check Tripadvisor for some advice before heading out for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - shame about the room”
Reviews.Author: islander73
Reviews.Content: This is a really convenient hotel for exploring the city, a very short walking distance to Las Ramblas and the port, and right next to Parallel metro station (direct line to La Sagrada Familia, a must-see in Barcelona). The staff were pleasant and helpful and the room and bathroom were spotlessly, shining clean. There is a small rooftop swimming pool which would be great in the summer - this was February though! Great view of the city from up there on the 10th Floor. We were annoyed that we had booked a double but got two single beds. Also the tiny window overlooked a dark stairwell and the room had no natural light. OK for a weekend but we would have been disappointed had we been staying longer. As we were on a cheap rate through laterooms.com we didn't know whether we should complain or if this is one of the rooms that they keep for people on a budget! Other than that though, very pleased with our choice of hotel but we would ask for a different room.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Treaclemoon
Reviews.Content: Just returned returned from a couple of days in Barcelona. The hotel was lovely. The room was very stylish and clean and the bathroom was equipped with the best shower i have ever used. Staff were friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel is superb -about a 15 minute walk from La Ramblas. Oh and a bonus was a complimentary cocktail which was quite a delight.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal from Reisefeber.no but got a room without window”
Reviews.Author: Reiseglad77
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay as a secret deal during a Norwegian website called reisefeber.no. We were promised at least 4 stars hotel, central location and swimming pool, but we did not know the name of the hotel before booking. The breakfast was not included but it is plenty of restaurants just beside the hotel which offer cheaper breakfast than the hotel does. The hotel is great and mostly what we expected according to the price, but only one negative thing that our room was situated in middle of the hotel and it was without window.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was more like a 3 Star”
Reviews.Author: TravelingKuster
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here last night. Location, Location: Great for Travel, bad for sleep. 10 paces from Paralel Metro stop, about 10 minute walk to La Ramba.The noise from the road below was awful. With the windows shut you can hear horns, ambulances, horses trotting, and everything else. My husband and I kept waking up multiple times through the night. My first impression: Lobby was clean and nice. Reception offered a free drink upon arrival. Check in was late 3pm, but they offered a nice secure luggage hold. Entering the room: The Pros: The room appeared clean. The room also had a mini fridge and a little bowl of candies. There were lots of booklets, menus, and guides .The bathroom was also clean and came with a travel kit. The cons: The room was clean, but smelled like cigarette smoke covered with an obnoxious perfume. The booklets, menus were very worn, and finger printed... if you don't like germs, you won't want to touch these. The key cards they gave us were also used, and dirty with finger prints, and some substance on them. I found this a bit gross. I give this a 3 star because there were small details on cleanliness that a 4 star would have taken care of, and the fact that my husband and I's sleep was greatly reduced from the noise, and the exercise room was pretty skimpy and the machines were almost primitive looking for this day and age. Over all opinion is that I think it is a great stop to get from one place to another, but if you value your sleep I would not recommend this place as it appears all rooms face the same busy street.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel; good value.”
Reviews.Author: txpilgrim
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a residential area that I found to be safe and culturally enriching. There's a small market less than a block away and several decent cafes with inexpensive dinner items. There is a subway station across the street so you're a short ride away from many of the great things the city has to offer. I suggest getting a day pass for unlimited travel. You can walk to Las Ramblas from the hotel and see great architecture along the way but be prepared for a trek. My room was small (typical in Europe) but clean. The towel warmers in the bathroom were a nice amentity to have. The rooftop pool had some great views although the pool is rather small for swimming. All and all the hotel was a great value. Convenient to get around town and nice rooms at an affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel great - Barcelona not so”
Reviews.Author: PIJLondon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great and I completely agree with the good reviews that it has been receiving. We arrived before noon and booked into our room straight away. We stayed over the Christmas period and found it extremely quiet. We ate in the hotel twice, once on Christmas day and Boxing day (as it was tipping down with rain!) The food and service I would say was good and for 19 euros we could get a three course meal (without drinks) The bar is small and probably due to the period we visited wasn't at all busy. Barcelona however was a disappointment. Loads of grafitti, begging and one of the very few cities we've visited on a break like this, that we felt vulnerable walking about. The area where the hotel is situated is not the best and I would not recommend the short cut to La Rambla - In the end we went down towards the sea front then joined La Rambla at the very start. Left out of the hotel to the end of Avda Parallel , past the Marine Museum then left into La Rambla. The Euro/£ exchange also meant a very expensive stay. Would we return ? Well to the hotel we would, but as we were disappointed with Barcelona, probably not!

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Location”
Reviews.Author: live2skide
Reviews.Content: We booked online thru Hotwire and got a great price; 7 months before our trip. We arrived mid morning and were able to store our luggage with the bell captain; and explored part of the city while we waited to check in at 2 pm. We got a great room, quiet, large and very modern. (Our room was 7th floor - on the back side of the hotel). Marble bathroom; bidet; wonderful amenities. Beds were quite comfortable; large roomy closet and plenty of room for 4 pieces of luggage. We stayed 2 nights. We ate "out" which is easy to do in Barcelona. Just in the two blocks on either side of the hotel are many "sidewalk" resturants, with indoor seating that do breakfast. We walked to the Port, to Las Ramblas, and all around the area. It is convenient because of the Metro stop (just outside the hotel lobby). Our best value; a glass of wine at the hotel bar for $3 euro! The desk staff was great, giving excellant directions for our adventures. Bottom line; clean; quiet; helpful, good value and GREAT location.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: angie333pangie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted a quick escape so we booked this hotel for a 3 night getaway. We stayed here as the price was right at just over €83 per night, and we wanted something central to all the tourist things. Straight away the front desk service was very helpful and we received an upgrade to a superior room. The room was clean, bright and very spacious, we even had our own foyer! It was a 4 star hotel, just missing a robe and tea/coffee facilities, but apart from that, it was great. We didn't have breakfast included in our stay so we ordered 2 coffee's via room serice, which every morning arrived with crossiants or a plate of delicious biscuits, and the coffee pot was large enought to get 4 coffee's, all for just €4! The hotel was close to La Rambla which was just a 7 minute walk and loads of eating places are near by. We were on the second floor and although you could hear the street action, it wasn't bad enough to keep you awake. Overall, we had a lovely stay and would stay there again. Oh yeah, the roof top pool is fabulous and has a great view!

Reviews.Title: “great everything”
Reviews.Author: Ethel55
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through Last Minute.com when my other hotel booking was in euros and needed a better deal. This hotel was first class, on arrival at reception got served immediately given all the info I needed with maps and details of trips and buses. room was very clean, the bed was huge, the buffet breakfast was brilliant and catered for every taste. The hotel was a 5 min stroll from the Ramblas and Port, with regular buses and a metro stop outside. Ended up walking everywhere as the sights are not far apart, a brilliant weekend,thanks

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Bacelona Universal pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: stevo1530
Reviews.Content: Very nice clean modern hotel . Great location. Good rates. Front desk staff very freindly and helpful. Would stay there again if I'm ever back to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great location right in front of the Metro stop”
Reviews.Author: aacree
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel on Priceline. The hotel is literally in front of the Metro stop which makes it very easy to get around the city. The hotel lobby and rooms have a modern design which is pretty nice. The room was decent size and the bathroom was also nice. The staff was friendly. There are plenty of restaurants in the vicinity to grab food at.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable - but horrendous beds”
Reviews.Author: Onion2
Reviews.Content: Almost everything has been said about this hotel. The only addition I would make is that I have "never" stayed in any hotel where the beds were so uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Fine but not four star”
Reviews.Author: Yorkies66
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay. We would say it was a decent experience, clean, corporate and three star. We found the staff accommodating and the room ok with a good selection of complimentary toiletries. The Paral.lel is not the greatest area, having previously stayed off the Diagonal. We would definitely recommend ear plugs if you are accustomed to a good nights sleep, as the front of the hotel is a little like sleeping next to the M25. Make sure you have plenty of Euros for your holiday. If you would like a cheap, good breakfast, try the litle place about three doors down on the left as you exit the hotel, with yellow frontage, great coffee and chips with your breakfast, should you desire!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Barbie075
Reviews.Content: I booked for three couples and we all thought it was a great stay. The front desk people were very helpful, pleasant and spoke English very well. The location was great for using the local metro, which we used frequently. Entrance was just outside the front door. Saved a lot of walking. Our room as very nice and all was very clean. Less crowded than the Las Ramblas area. A couple of places to get food and drinks were nearby. The breakfast was very nice and ample food for anyone. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: Denny H
Reviews.Content: We spent a very enjoyable 3 nights at the Barcelona Universal in September. Despite arriving at 2.30am, we had a spacious and well equipped room (not the usual shoebox you get when you arrive so late!). The staff were very friendly and helpful and the location of the hotel (directly beside Parallel metro) was outstanding whether you wanted to walk or get the metro around the city. The only slight downsides were the noise level from the main road (we were on the 2nd floor) and the buffet breakfast (not a lot left if you got there near the end of service). However I would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a comfortable, friendly hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - recommended”
Reviews.Author: plapin
Reviews.Content: Had a pleasant stay for 4 nights in this hotel in early Oct 2008. It is highly recommended for its spacious and very clean room, convenient location (tube is just outside the hotel, waterfront and La Ramblas is in proximity) and very friendly and helpful staff. The dinner 'Buffet Grill' is at good bargain and worth trying.

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault the Hotel Barcelona Universal”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowWendy
Reviews.Content: Arrived at hotel on a rainy Tuesday evening and was immediately uplifted by Francisco at Reception who offered us a free upgrade to a Junior Suite (Room 903). The suite has its own terrace which wraps around two sides of the hotel and the views are fantastic. Room was spotlessly clean, had a well stocked mini bar, lovely big bathroom with jacuzzi bath and loads of cupboard space. There was a safe in the room which was digitalised so no need to pay a deposit for a safe key. We went Bed & Breakfast and can honestly say that after having breakfast (served 7-11am) we did not need to eat again until the evening. Would really recommend this hotel and suggest asking for Room 903.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: dr-owain
Reviews.Content: It would have been a perfect stay in Barcelona exept that the hotel swimming pool was actually closed whilst we were staying there. Everything else about the hotel was great though. Location was fab, with a tube stop right outside the hotel, and within walking distance to the waterfront and shopping areas. Room was fairly large with a super-comfy bed. Bathroom was great too - loved the fact that the radio was tuned in so you could have a relaxing bath! Room was also spotlessly cleaned every day. Overall a great stay for our 5 day trip.

Reviews.Title: “good central hotel, avoid the car park!!”
Reviews.Author: copperKildare
Reviews.Content: stayed in this hotel sept 15 to 18. we flew to girona, and drove down to hotel, 1st problem.... car park is tiny and cramped and at 22 euro a night, certainly took the shine off the cheap rates we paid for this stay (100 euro/night double room) this hotel is central, 10 min walk to las ramblas( you have got to check out the market off las ramblas.....fantastic!!!!!) i was a bit weary from other reviews tha this hotel was in a red light area.... not so. there was a peep show situated 3 blocks from the hotel, but discreet and non intrusive. we certainly did not feel unsafe in this area. staff were friendly and spoke great english. we didnt see a maid entering our room before 10am, and do not disturb signs were respected.rooms were spotless and bed huge, if a little hard. our room was at the front of the hotel on the 2nd floor. now, noise levels.... was apprehensive from other reviews that the noise would be untolerable. yes, it is noisey, but to be fair, the road the hotel is on, parallel.lel, is a 3 lane dual way, in a busy street, so noise was to be expected. we chose to eat in the cafe/bars situated beside the hotel, and the food was great and inexpensive. finally, certainly would recommend this hotel as a touring base for the city, and found it to be good value for money (car park exception), maybe not as a romantic getaway....enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “excellant location”
Reviews.Author: kelly49
Reviews.Content: Could not ask for better location metro right ouitside hotel. The roof top view is breathtaking, ample deck chairs though pool is very cold. I wouldn't reccommend breakfast at 15 euros per person quality and quanity not worth the price. Several cafes outside hotel all serve great breakfasts. Hotel staff very helpful and friendly. Rooms clean and plently of space but very noisy could hear people in next room going to the toilet etc.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK”
Reviews.Author: robandemmet
Reviews.Content: As the title suggests, it was OK, but just that. The hotel is rated 4-star, but as with all star-ratings, you never quite know what you're going to end up with. As locations go it is pretty good. Right next to a metro station, and only 30 mins from the airport (costing 70 cents if you get the 10-journey ticket, amazing value!) Most places are easily accessible by the metro but, as we discovered only 2 days before we left, it's better to get the bus to the beach, a number of which go from directly opposite the hotel and take about 15 mins. As hotels go it is clean and fairly smart looking, but clearly business orientated, indicated not only by the "corporate" feel to it, but the steep price of breakfast (17 Euro) and the lack of drinks facilities in the room, which was a shame. Our first room was a twin, at the front of the hotel. When I called down to be asked to move to a double (which was booked) there were no other rooms left, so the receptionist told us that we would be moved while we were out the following day, a minor inconvenience but acceptable. When we returned to the hotel the following day I was "reprimanded" by the receptionist for not clarifying my request that morning. Sadly, a case of one person saying one thing, and another doing another, an unfortuantely memorable event which could have easily been avoided. Our "double" room, was 2 twins pushed together. The beds were hard and uncomfortable, but thankfully our new room was at the back of the hotel, which was quieter and had better views. Housekeeping at the property is acceptable, but inconsistent. New towels one day, sometimes not the next day, bed made up one day, turned down the next. Although the bathrooms were spotless! Food & Beverage at the hotel should be avoided. The breakfast buffet and other menus are uninspiring, and the bar is so lacking in atmosphere that we only dared have one drink there, and we were the only people we saw all week in there. Much more could be made of both of these outlets as there are few other "nice" places in the area. And a word to the wise: if any restaurant has pictures of the food outside, keep well away. It is definitely the "tourist food"! I suppose overall while the hotel is modern and clean, I left with a feeling that no-one was really prepared to go "the extra mile" for guests, there was a distinct lack of passion. We wouldn't go back there or recommend it because it simply was just average, and we found better places to stay whilst we were there. I

Reviews.Title: “mixed - good but would stay elsewhere next time”
Reviews.Author: royalton
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights early august with a one year old, so we requested a suitable room and were allocated a great sized room with a sliding door between the sofa bed/dressing area and the main bedroom. unfortunately we had no view but looked at the adjacent room on the corner of the building which therefore had 3 windows with views over the street and beyond but a) it wasn't available and b) it was smaller so we stayed put. my family tried to arrange for flowers to be delivered as it was my birthday but unfortunatley there was some confusion and the hotel did not accept the flowers as our room was booked in my partner's surname not mine. the member of staff i spoke to about it was rather abrupt and unhelpful not even apologising. Where in contrast other staff members were very helpful and when one day we told them our room hadn't been cleaned all day (on my birthday!) they offered us complimentary champagne as apology. the rooftop pool was small and crowded but nice for a quick dip or lounge if you could find a spare lounger. the location was OK anout 10-15 mins from the Ramblas but along a rather grubby street with homeless and drunks. there are definatley better locations and next time we'll be staying in port olympic area. this hotel wasn't great for children - although on request they did very quickly provide a cot and a non-slip mat for the bath, but the breakfast room had no highchairs and staff there weren't friendly or helpful. We expected a better choice and varity of breakfast foods for a 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Paulgavin
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed in The Universal for three nights in the middle of August. On arriving to the hotel we noticed that the area that it is situated in looks a small bit dodgey but we soon got over that. The staff at check in were extremely friendly and helpful. No problems there. The rooms themselves were spacious enough and extremely clean with the added bonus of a comfortable bed! The only thing was that we stayed at the back end of the hotel which meant the view wasn't much to write home about, looking out at the back of the flats across the way! The hotel also has a small pool (more like an over sized bath),a solarium and a basic gym. We did'nt get the chance to use any of these amenities. On the first night it rained very heavily which forced us to stay at the hotel bar since we were dressed for the sun, this suited us because we were quite tired. The only thing we found about this was that the bar service was quite slow and infrequent. The girl kept walking away from the bar leaving people with empty glasses, this happened on a few occasions during the two hours that we stayed there. Then as soon as the clock struck 12pm the bar was closed straight away without announcing last call as if it were going to turn into a pumpkin or something! The hotels location was excellent, literally only a five minute walk from Las Ramblas. I would recommend doing the hop on hop off bus tour as we found it the best way to get around. I would also recommend going to Sitches, a small village with a beautiful beach situated just 40 minutes by train outside of Barcelona. Overall our stay in The Barcelona Universal Hotel was an extremely pleasent one!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LucyFM
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. It is right next to the metro station and a short walk from the Ramblas. The hotel is clean and pretty much has anything that one would want in a city. The gym is quite small as is the pool but i guess they serve their purpose. The area directly round the hotel isn't the best although it is easy to find a cheap breakfast on the street (much better value than the hotel). I would recommend to all groups

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: markjacqui
Reviews.Content: Had three nights in this hotel after reading all the reviews and was not disapointed. got the train( renfe) from the airport to Barcelona sants.you then require another ticket for the metro and then got the metro train to paral-lel , Station is right outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Nosus
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel and highly recommended. The hotel, itself is situated about a €23 taxi ride from the airport and this is the only drawback. It is located a 10 min walk from the gorgeous Port Vell and the beginning of Las Ramblas, the main tourist thoroughfare in Barcelona. The area around the hotel is quite run-down and there are many stree-side restaurants, serving 'tourist food' i.e. arroz negro and paella....avoid!!!! The rate for the centre of Barcelona was excellent and was booked through www.booking.com, and on arrival, we were up-graded to a junior suite at no extra charge. This gave us a sitting room and loads of wardrobe space (not that we needed it for 3 days!)The room was spotless and the bathroom was extremely clean with surround sound music, if you wanted it. We didn't use the pool or gym facilities so I can't comment on them and we didn't eat or drink in the hotel. There are plenty little cafes serving whatever you want, on and off Las Ramblas so when a breakfast is €17, I'd rather go out to eat than stay in and be disappointed. On the day we were leaving, we could leave our luggage in a secure room in the hotel, safe in the knowledge that it wasn't going to be stolen. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Barcelona would not be a city that I would be quick to return to, but if I was, I wouldn't hesitate to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Enough - Make Sure You Use The SAFE!”
Reviews.Author: mrshowtime
Reviews.Content: Nice enough hotel, clean and fairly well located. The only problem was that my partner had her necklace stollen from our room, they claimed that it was our fault because we had not put it in the safe provided! We even put the "do not disturb" sign on the door and they still went into the room to clean. Apparently they have to go into every room at least once a day as previously somebody died i a room and went un-noticed for 3 days. Breakfast was a dissapointment and would NOT recommend paying the £15 for it. The swimming pool on the roof is nice enough although very small (a lot smaller than it appears from the photos) and can get very busy as the roof terrace is quite small. Overall not a bad hotel, smart, clean and helpful staff, if you do stay here be sure to lock everything in the safe! They also have security deposit boxes which are in reception, these require 2 keys, one for you and the hotel keep the other and these are big enough for a laptop - I would recommend using them and not leaving anything lying around. Oh and there is free Wi Fi connection which is good.

Reviews.Title: “would recommend this hotel but beware of muggers”
Reviews.Author: shelleyjoan
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a wonderful 3 night stay in The Barcelona Universal. The hotel is clean, modern and the hotel staff very helpful, friendly and attentive. Well placed for sightseeing. An added bonus is the roof top pool and surrounding sunbathing area with chairs and sun lounges (towels provided). A great way to relax after a day of sightseeing. If you are at the front of the hotel it can be noisy of a night but thats to be expected its a busy place. The city is easily accessable by metro at 7.20 euros for a ticket of 10 rides which you can share out it's not by person, this includes to and from the airport. The service is fast and efficient. We did the open top bus for a day (20 euros) we did see the major sights but from a distance. Best to do your homework before you go and do your own thing. A word of warning on the first night we went local for a meal in a well lit and populated road, we were walking back when out of a side road a boy/man ran out and attempted to grab my bag. Before I went out I had shortened the strap and it was across my shoulder held tight under my arm. A struggle took place and my husband was knocked to the ground. I managed to hit the boy several times in the face while trying to hold the bag. My husband got up and came towards him with clenched fists. At this point he decided to run empty handed. The frightening thing is there were lots of people around and no one came to our assistance, it's as though it's an every day occurance, which it is, that they have become used to as part of everyday life. I went into a hotel next to were it happened and asked them to call the police. They asked if anything had been stolen when I said no they said why call the police, did I want t o spend time in the police station filling in forms. It didn't ruin our experience of the city but I wonder how much longer it can go on or to what extent before people stop going to barcelona due to the crime. People we spoke to viewed it as though you haven't experienced Barcelona unless you had been pickpocketed or mugged.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Bed a bit uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: Tymm
Reviews.Content: I'm so appreciative of other people's reviews when I'm researching a trip, so I thought I'd add my two cents about the places I've stayed. I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights after a 7 day mediterranean cruise in 2006. The hotel was only a 5-10 min cab ride from the port and the lobby was very nice. I liked that the hotel was walking distance to Las Ramblas. Maybe there are better hotels in vicinity to Las Ramblas, but I didn't mind the 10 min walk. It didn't seem that long and the weather was nice. While the neighborhood you walk through isn't perfect and pristine, it's fine, the people seem nice. I wouldn't walk alone at night myself, but that's just common sense. I was always with my husband. The room had a very nice appearance. I liked the modern decor. The bathroom was a little small, but no big deal. The worst part for me was the bed not being very comfortable, no spring to it. Our window faced the street and it was a little noisy at night, but I don't mind street noise that much, but that's just me. Overall it was a nice stay. I would stay there again IF the price was right. I think we paid 230 for 2 nights through expedia. Sorry, that's a guess though, it was a while ago.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: Whatelse76
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights and was pretty satisfied with the Hotel. Clean and service oriented staff. The metro stop "Paral'lel" was 50 meters from the hotel. I could not recomend the breakfast at 15 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: axheart
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, with pleasent location. Also very helpfull and frindly staff. Only poor this is that soundproofing is really bad, but that was no problem for me...

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Tami8
Reviews.Content: I had checked on 'Travel Advisor' before booking the hotel and overall this hotel had very good reviews, and I have to say that we were not at all dissapointed. The hotel although not in a very pretty part of town is very modern, and exceptionally clean, the staff were lovely very attentive and nothing was too much trouble. The weather was extremely hot 34 degrees when we were there and we were very pleased with the airconditioning in our room which worked superbly to cool us down after all the sightseeing. The only negative I could find was the pool it is more like a hot tub than a swimming pool I was very dissapointed when we arrived after a long walk from the bus station I was really looking forward to a swim but it was so small and already full of people scambling for space on the roof, I didn't bother so if you are booking the hotel because it has a pool don't! but the roof has some superb views of the city. Don't bother eating breakfast at the hotel unless you have it included in you room price it is very expensive and to be honest we found that 'Pepes' cafe just outside the hotel and turn left a little down the street very reasonable at 4.50 Euros for 2 slices of toast, 2 eggs, 4 rashers of bacon, glass of orange juice and tea or coffee. Please remember that this is a city centre hotel so it is a bit noisy at night we found the ambulances were the most annoying thing thay have an extremely annoying siren! The hotel is literally a 10 minute walk from the 'Rambles' and we found that the taxis were very reasonable in price compared to London. We only had two days of sightseeing but managed to see so much. A visit to 'Guell Park' is a must absolutley fasinating and beautiful park famous for all the 'Gaudi mosaics and buildings and so much more. Also can recommend 'Casa Mila' and 'Casa Batllo' also 'Gaudi' houses very interesting and strange! The 'Segrada Familia' is a must! another lovely place to visit is 'Port Vale' have lunch on a boat and relax looking at the yachts! and then a visit to the 'Aquarium is also worth a look see the sharks! We had a great time in Barcelona and if you are considering a weekend break it is a great city to visit. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: olant
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Universal for eight nights at the end of July . I stayed with a friend in a double room. We payed €100 each per night, which is cheap considering the standard of the hotel. The hotel is situated at the Parallel street, and has a subway stop right next to the entrace, which made getting around town a breeze - La Sagrada Familia is a five minutes subway ride away, and La Rambla is within walking distance. The room was spacious, with comfortable beds. It featured a minibar, tv, and all the essensial stuff. Nothing special in particular, just what you'd expect. The room was thoroughly cleaned every day. But what really makes this hotel stand out is the roof - where you'll find a swimming pool and a sunbathing deck! Perfect if you don't feel like going to the beach. Also, inside the hotel you get _free_ wifi access, which is a rarity these days. There's also a basic gym on the roof, and two computers available on the 9th floor where you can surf the internet - also for free. The receptionists and the concergie were friendly, helpful and most important: they spoke English fluently. All in all, the Universal hotel was a great place to stay, and if you're looking for a classy hotel in Barcelona at a reasonable rate, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: wellsa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights, either side of one night in Perpignan, and were overall very satisfied with the place. The price (EU.101) per night was excellent value for money, compared with many equivalent hotels. The staff were helpful and friendly, the rooms and bathrooms were clean well maintained and it was in short walking distance to Las Ramblas and the main tourist drag. (Limited) Parking is available underneath the hotel. It's a very inconspicuous entrance so don't miss it (like we did...) or you'll end up doing a big loop (like we did...) Parking costs about EU. 21 per night, which is a bit steep but not unexpected, and you will need to check availability first. The view from our first room was ok, 6th floor view onto the main street below. The second room at the back of the hotel was not so good, a decent sized balcony but looking straight into the backs of residential apartments. As we were on a four man boys weekend away, such things didn't really matter, but if I were to have gone with my wife and son, I would probably have asked if another room was available. The swimming pool on the roof is a gem. Only small, but a good place to chill out, and the views of Barcelona are fantastic. We didn't sample the breakfast, so can't comment on the food. Over, I would recommend this as a place to stay if visiting this great city.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, decent location”
Reviews.Author: travelguyandgirl26
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Barcelona Universal Hotel for 3 nights in July. We thought the hotel is great overall.. VERY nice rooms, very spacious (which is pretty surprising, since its Europe). Bathroom was clean. The location was ok, there's a metro station right outside the hotel which proved to be very convenient. The hotel is about a 10 minute walk to La Rambla, but the side roads which you have to take are a little dirty, smelly, and dodgy.. so we took the metro instead. It's just 2 stops away, and the Catalunya Plaza is also on the same metro line. This area has lots of restaurants and shops. Information center was also here (La Rambla). The people at the front desk were not very friendly.. but we noticed this throughout our trip in Spain. We reached the hotel early (around 1030) but were asked to wait until 330 for a room. They let us leave our luggage at the hotel though, until our room was ready. They have a basic gym and a pool, though the pool is extremely small. Free internet facility too, which is normally not occupied. Breakfast was included in our package, and we thought it was pretty good. The hotel is good overall, and we would definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: LEANNIEFFF
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel just what we wanted for our trip to Barcelona. The staff were lovely and extremely helpful. We arrived very late on our first night and were hungry and even though room service had ended ten minutes prior they still did us some food. That set the tone for the entire stay. The room was huge for a central hotel, it was impeccibly clean, particularly the bathroom, which, as frequent travellers know, can often be a source of dirt and disappointment! The communal area on the roof was great. It was small around the pool but you can get steps up to a high solarium area which was equally as good for sunbathing. Overall an incredibly well kept hotel which for £90 a night is amazing value. Just have to tell you as well - just down the road from the hotel on a road called Margrite there is an amazing little Italian restaurant called Bella Napoli. I know you dont go to Spain to eat Italian but this place really deserved a mention! Fantastic food, hillariously entertaining staff and cheap too (about £50 for wine and three courses!). Enjoy your stay at the Universal because it really is a lovely place!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms but poor soundproofing”
Reviews.Author: OxfordJillI
Reviews.Content: OK, the rooms were nice, and the staff were very professional, BUT for two nights in a row I hardly slept. I could hear everything, including the lift, the people above me walking around in their room, the drunks coming in late, the partying continuing in rooms further down the corridor, the other guests coming out to complain etc. Only go there if you want to party late and sleep late, or if you're deaf. Jill Oxford, UK

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Nicki5
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Barcelona Universal Hotel for 3 nights on a trip with my mom and sister. Great for the price as got a good deal with Lastminute.com. We were given rooms next to each other on the 7th floor, didnt have any problems with noise but this is a city. Rooms were very clean, well equiped. We didnt eat or drink in the hotel. The bars and local "cafes" near the hotel offered great value for money and good for watching the world go by and were well used by local people. I would not recommend walking down Sant Pau as a link to La Rambla. The part near the hotel is fine, the bakery loveley but half way down you are in what appeared to be the red light area. Walk down Nou de la Rambla instead. Hotel is in a great location for exploring barcelona, a metro station outside the front door and approx 20 minute walk up to the Place de espayne, 10 minutes to La Rambla and 15 minutes to the port.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, accommodations, service and location!”
Reviews.Author: Swirli
Reviews.Content: We were crossing our fingers that our Hotwire reservation would end up being the Hotel Universal and it was. We spent the last week of our honeymoon here, It was centrally located, convenient to the tour buses, decent restaurants and local attractions. The front desk clerk Juan upgraded us into a lovely spaceous room (even by Amiercan standards) and spent time providing recommendations for local attractions, restaurants and how to get there. All of the staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were very clean, modern, and provided the conveniences of home (including a little toiletries kit). We spent a little more than $200 a night and really felt like it was comparable to what we would get (and even better) in the U.S. (in contrast to what U.S. $200 can buy in other parts of Europe these days--two-star hotels). We had the chance to relax at the rooftop pool with a great view of Barcelona. We truly enjoyed our stay there and would definitely like to return and book this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: Veronlc
Reviews.Content: After booking this hotel on lastminute.com and getting a great deal as it was one of their 'Secret Hotels' I had grave concerns due to some of the ridiculous reviews that it had been given. The hotel itself is in an excellent location, the metro is located virtually on the doorstep. The metro system is great for travelling around town and should you choose to walk la Rambla is a few minutes away. We were upgraded to a suite, there are only 3 in the hotel, unsure why seems we had paid such a low price - guess we just got lucky! The hotel has a small pool which is great for taking a dip, and the views are spectacular, although can get a bit windy up there! The buffet breakfast was great value for money. The overall appearence of the hotel was clean and the staff friendly. Dont believe the hype!, we travelled around Barcelona and took the usual safety precuations, just use your head its a city after all with all the usual pickpockets, beggars etc. We were on our guard due to all the reports back home about pickpocketing , mugging etc!! You just have to be cautious at all times. Sure parts of the town are probably undesirable at night but just use your noddle and dont let this ruin a great city break - hope you enjoy The Universal as much as we did!!

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous stay”
Reviews.Author: CarmeloMalta
Reviews.Content: Hotel Was marvellous and made our stay in Barcellona more pleasant. When we asked for the room to be changed cause outer rooms are more nosy this was done immediately. Breakfast was excellant and the staff were helpful and we had no troubled to communicate in english. I would suggest it to anyone and if i'll return to Barcellona i would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent modern hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Letustrade
Reviews.Content: Hotel turns out to be just as all the previous reviews have said - the goods and the bads. Good location close to but far enough from busy tourist areas, subway station right at door, good restaurants/cafes nearby, noisy main street, modern room and lobby, competitive rates compared with other hotels - good value for money. A laundry shop in the backlane of the hotel washes a bag of your clothes for 10 Euros that opens 9-1 and 4-8. I suspect the hotel itself sends its washings to the shop too - don't quote me on that :)

Reviews.Title: “Meet expectation, good location, nice size room.”
Reviews.Author: Mousers
Reviews.Content: The room was nice size for Europe. The bed was a bit on the hard side. The room and bathroom were clean. TV lack of English channel. In-room safe. The room was a bit noisy as there was a lot of emergency vehicle siren noise from the street. Hotel staffs were friendly. The view from the roof was nice. The gym was real small. The swimming pool was small, but at least they have it. The location was pretty good. Walking distance to La Ramblas (about 10 minutes) and the police station was nearby, it seem pretty safe. Walking distance to the port to catch the double decker tourist bus (highly recommended, very well organized). Subway was right underground. If you want to save some money, there are mini-grocery stores near by for getting bottled water or fresh fruits. and even fresh bakery. I would recommend this hotel to those who likes to be close to La Ramblas, but do not want to be right in the middle of it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Choice”
Reviews.Author: Daize32
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel; very close to Les Ramblas and cruise pier. Rooms were spacious and very clean. Staff were very accomodating and helpful; even suggesting attractions to visit during our stay, May 6th to May 9th, 2008. Excellent breakfast spots next door to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: NorthWalian24
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel was really enjoyable for several reasons. It was well located - with the Metro stop being right outside the main entrance. This usually meant you could get to any of the major attractions within 10 minutes. The Metro in Barcelona is superb, and very reasonably priced. It also meant that if you decide to get the airport bus into Barcelona, the Universal is only two stops from your drop off point. The staff at the hotel were helpful and always polite. They were happy to speak English despite our best efforts to converse in Spanish. The breakfast is quite expensive, so make sure you check to see whether you have already paid for this. It was approximately 21Euros for breakfast, but I much preferred to go to a local cafe ion the morning for a coffee and croissant for 2 Euros. The pool on the roof is very relaxing, and has nice views. Basically, if you want to enjoy yourself in this great city, then the Universal will make you feel completely relaxed and at ease. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with the Barcelona Universal Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KatyLocks
Reviews.Content: I booked two nights in Barcelona for my partners birthday. As it was a present i wanted to stay somewhere nice, and i was really pleased with my choice. The hotel was clean and modern. It was very central, with a tube station on the door step . Our room was an excellent size and the hotel food was nice. The only negative i can give is that the hotel was on a busy main road, and could be noisey at night.

Reviews.Title: “A non-smoking hotel in Spain that actually IS non-smoking!”
Reviews.Author: Archmac
Reviews.Content: This was the best hotel of our two-week trip to Spain. The staff was extraordinarily helpful, the room layout and cleanliness were perfect, and they strictly enforce their non-smoking policy. This was the only hotel that had enough deskspace for a computer, and actually provided enough outlets too (we stayed at two new hotels and one older one...I can understand the old hotel being short on outlets, but there is no reason for our room at the Paseo del Arte in Madrid to only have one free outlet). This hotel also defintely had the best rooftop pool and 'solarium' (open area for sunbathing), with killer views. My only wish would be that it were in closer walking distance to Passeig de Gracia and Las Ramblas, but, with a subway stop just outside the door, and a 10-use subway pass that only costs 10 Euros (and two people can use the same pass one after the other), this wasn't a problem. It was also reasonably close to my new favorite restaurant in Barcelona, Sesamo...organic / vegetarian, but you'll never miss the meat. Breakfast is included, they start serving at 7am (for all of us jet-lagged tourists), and this hotel easily had the tastiest and most varied breakfast of all the hotels we stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ems80
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband for four nights just before Easter. Staff were friendly at check-in, room was spacious and nicely decorated. Location is great - only about 10-15 mins walk from La Ramblas although the street that the hotel is located on isn't one of the nicest and I wouldn't want to be out too late there on my own. All in all, a pleasant stay. If you are a light sleeper, request a room at the back of the hotel as the hotel is situated on quite a busy street and it can get noisy.

Reviews.Title: “universal hotel "great"”
Reviews.Author: VuvsEl
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Universal this month (April) and were delighted with it, the location was great, the rooms are lovely and modern, extremely clean, and comfortable. The amenieties at the hotel are also a bonus, the rooftop area gives stunning views over the city, and although we didnt use the pool and gym, they looked great.. The only down side to our break was the sound of ambulance/police sirens at ALL times of the night , continuously waking us up, but to be fair that is not the hotels fault.. A great place to stay, with polite helpful staff, and the only place ive ever talked on the phone while sitting on the toilet.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel, Pleasant Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Katen2k2
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in this hotel and it was a great experience. The Parallel metro stop is in front of the hotel and connects you to anywhere in the city. 10 minutes walk to Ras Ramblas which is good, because you really do not want to stay close to the crowded Ramlas street. There is a small bakery just round the corner when you turn right into the next street behind the hotel. Very good pastries and also a supermarket next to it which we found to be very handy. The ATM machine is across the main street, if you ask the people in the lobby they will let you know. The rooms were clean and pretty good size by European standards. The staff were very nice, most of them very a bit more friendly than others :) Overall we really enjoyed our stay in this hotel and we will definitely go back if we ever go back to Spain. Just a reminder: watch you bags and belongings in Spain any where. My backpack with all of my travel documents and camera was stolen right at the security gate at the airport. The police didn't make any effort to find it either...very sad.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: c_and_p_CT
Reviews.Content: Much better choice than a hotel on Las Ramblas -- streets not nearly as crowded and loud as the main drag. We recommend asking for an interior room and you're guranteed to have a quiet stay. The staff was nice and helpful. As another reviewer mentioned, the hotel is ten steps from the metro station and ~ 10 minutes from Las Ramblas. The streets in the immediate vicinity might look shady, but they're well lit at night and we walked every night to and from Las Ramblas along open shops and convenience stores even at 2 am. Quite interestingly, the bathroom in our interior room was huge (see pics) which is definitely unusual for an European hotel. If you're looking for the best value for your money, this is the hotel to stay at in Barcelona. It is not the Ritz, but nor is the price.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: coagie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Barcelona Universal on 6 March for 3 nites. It was fantastic. We booked a double room thro Travel Republic and we were given one of the suites (including jacuzzi) on the top floor - what a bonus. The hotel is on a main road but we had no problems with noise as we were located at rear of hotel. We had huge balcony which overlooked Barcelona. There is a tube station just outside hotel and it is a 10/15 minute walk to La Ramblas. We ate at several of the cafes for breakfast which were fine and reasonably priced. Hotel staff were friendly and very efficient and the suite we were given was very clean and modern. The only downside being there was no tea/coffee facility in room and the bar in hotel closed at 11pm (a bit early) but apart from this we had a fantastic stay and would definately recommend the hotel - we would go back.

Reviews.Title: “great deal, great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Aviator26
Reviews.Content: Very nice four-star hotel only a few blocks from the popular Las Ramblas road. Friendly & courteous staff, all English speaking. Room and bathroom were huge by European standards. Had Sky satellite televsion. A bit noisy if you have a street-side room, but with the windows closed the noise is well insulated. Very close to subway stop. A great choice at any price, but was an especially good value with the rate we got. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Waste Your Money”
Reviews.Author: emma123London
Reviews.Content: I am amazed that this hotel has a four star rating. It lacks everthing that a four star hotel should have. The pool is very small and the gymnasium should not be a feature. The noise of traffic is unbearable as it is located on a busy road. There is a very small bar in the reception, but there is no bar staff and if you want a drink the porter has to fetch someone from the restaurant upstairs. The rooms are very small, but clean I have to say. The most dissapointing thing was the staff. Every member of staff was rude and unhelpful. One example, was when we asked for toothpaste which is a little sachet provided at the beginning of the stay. Our request was refused and there was nowhere local to find toothpaste. Were were also charged €63 for car parking in possible the tightest car park in the world!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!- Great location in beautiful Barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: worldismyoyster82
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from a 3 Night stay in Barcelona Universal Hotel and it was fantatstic. It is located on Parallel a short distance from the popular Las Ramblas. The Hotel was situated right outside the Metro station and located on a large busy road which was NOT an issue. A 10 minute stroll left and you were at the beautiful Waterfront. The Hotel is exceptionally clean and spacious and the staff were helpful and friendly. Our room was large, clean and the bathroom was great. We were high up and facing the road at night and YES there are ambulances and police going past at night but this is a CITY and not the countryside and noise is to be expected. I never had trouble sleeping as it was not loud and intrusive. On the contrary I found the views from the hotel window exceptional and overwhelming in a city that never sleeps. Our Room had a large double bed, mini bar and satellite TV however the only English Channel is Sky News!! MTV Deutschland had occasional American TV programmes. The room had complimentary bathroom accessories and maps of the city. The room was cleaned every day and was spotless. The Hotel was also very clean and the rooftop viewing point with swimming pool and mini Gym was amazing you can take some fantastic pictures from up there. We opted for the continental Breakfast and it was well worth it as the city can be expensive to eat and drink in. Bars and Restaurants on La Rambla can be really overpriced and it is often better to choose the cafes and restaurants off the main road for better quality food, price and service if on a budget. La Rambla is really good fun and although quite pricey for food and drinks it is really enjoyable to sit and drink and watch the street performers and the world pass by. On our last night we went to one of the most amazing restaurants in Ravel called Casa Leopoldo. The food and atmosphere was incredible. A true Catalonian experience. All in all Barcelona was a vibrant and exciting city that I long to return to again and again. I would definitely stay in this Hotel again for its immaculate standard and perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Rox09
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very central, very easy to find from the airport with a metro stop just outside the door & just a couple of minutes walk from Las Ramblas. We had a lovely big & comfortable room & bathroom. The staff were helpful & friendly, we didn't eat in the hotel as there are so many places close by. I would highly recommend this hotel as a great place to stay. Barcelona is a super city, well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant, Very Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tdown
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed a lovely pleasant stay for 3 nights mid-week at the Hotel Barcelona Universal. The two issues I had most concerns about before travelling was cleanliness and security but I have to say I would definately stay at the Universal again - the cleanliness was top notch and there was a safe in the room (no ridiculous extra charge either). Regarding Barcelona in general, we had heard a lot about pick-pockets etc but while I am certainly not naive, I didn't encounter or see anything of this sort. Having said keep a good grasp on your belonging at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Barcelona itself a BIG let down!”
Reviews.Author: Shoegal79
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, recently renovated, but very pricey drinks in the bar, breakfast/food & mini bar (I had to pay £7 for 3 little bottles of coke out of the mini bar!!) - the rooms themselves are lovely although very noisy, according to the room info their all soundproofed but they can't be if I could hear the people next door using the toilet! The cleaners are very persistant banging on the doors in the morning and despite the "do not disturb" sign went in and cleaned my room, with the do not disturb sign thrown on the floor when I got back. It would have been nice if they were more courtious about not disturbing people and shouting down the corridors to one another at only 9am in the morning when people have had late nights and/or are trying to get showered to go out. I have to say, apart from the Gaudi interest I really dont see what the appeal is about Barcelona - we were stared at constantly all weekend, the locals were very rude, there were prostitutes at night lingering the streets in intimidating groups, lots of homeless, pick pocketers (a man in our hotel had £300 stolen from his pocket on La Ramblas), the locals forced us into the road off the small pavements because they weren't prepared to compromise or give way and it was VERY expensive and I had 2 men approach me within a five minute period the first one running his fingers down my bare arms and making suggestive comments, when told to leave me alone I was greeted with a mouthful of english swear words, the second one just a few minutes later aimed straight for me trying to kiss me and touch me - both of these men were dirty, unkept, dodgy and very frightening and the unsafe feeling I got stayed with me all weekend. I smiled at everybody I made eye contact with in the streets and not one person smiled back, I met some American girls who said they had been told there was times in the day which are sociably acceptable to look at them and make eye contact, whether or not this is correct I'm not sure but I definately felt like we weren't welcome. There was old women begging everywhere for money and even whilst trying to get money out of the ATM in the bank opposite the hotel there was homeless people sleeping on the floor. The only good thing I have to say is about the Gaudi church which is still being completed, it was lovely, however, I wouldn't recommend Barcelona as a place to anyone and I would NEVER step foot back in this city! I've done some travelling in my lifetime but this has got to be the worst place I have ever been by far! Luckily I was my girly friends and we all made the most of it and really enjoyed each others company, but had I have been on my own there I would have been petrified.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: urmajesty
Reviews.Content: Hotel at a great location, about 10 min. walk to La Ramblas, or to the other side which is Colon (columbus tower). Subway station just outside, close to La Caixa(bank) for foreign curency exchange, never go to las Ramblas, rates are low. Rooms are clean, beds are a bit small, 2 twin beds. Refrigerator in room, wireless internet service in room is FREE! Just ask for an access code. Staff are helpful when asked. Dinner buffet cost 18 euros, additional 4 euros if you like meat(steak, etc) very pricy. Breakfast if not part of your hotel price is 29 euros for 2. Coffee shops, and pharmacy nearby. Safe place to walk late at night. Check-in time at 3pm, they can store your luggage upon arrival in a safe place if room not ready and you are ready to explore Barcelona. Hotel close to all touristy spots.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: colin7629
Reviews.Content: From the fabulous hotel lobby to the roof top pool this hotel is pure class. Loved it and loved that it was a bit away from las ramblas. Only about a 10 minute walk down some residential streets but the walk was fantastic. Subway was literally outside the door and took you wherever you wanted within minutes and very reasonable. Was very easy to use as well. Hotel staff were fantastic, rooms were spacious and clean and extras were reasonably priced. Barcelona itself was brilliant, would thoroughly recommend teh city and will be back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Lock Up Your Valuables!”
Reviews.Author: Labellestar
Reviews.Content: Hotel was OK but noisy traffic all night. Be sure to LOCK UP your stuff!!! I lost a nice pair of earrings tucked down into the bottom of my makeup bag. The management was not helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased with Barcelona Universal”
Reviews.Author: RShimizu
Reviews.Content: We stayed here late November 2007 for 4 nights. Overall, the accommodations were good. The hotel is located literally right in front on the Metro stop Paral.lel so getting around and navigating Barcelona was super simple and convenient. The hotel itself is in an area called El Raval and there are convenient quick stop restaurants around the hotel. There is a charming churros stand near the hotel where we had the BEST churros filled with dulce de leche. Also, Las Ramblas is actually walking distance from the hotel so that was great as well. As far as the room goes, it was clean with modern, minimalist decor and a comfy bed. I found the bathroom to be a bit outdated (florescent lights, ew!) but clean nonetheless. I would definitely recommend this hotel for someone looking for affordable, modern, functional, and clean accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money - Go for it!!!”
Reviews.Author: pkd100
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 2 nights stay at this hotel. We carefully reviewed other users' opinions on this hotel in TripAdvisor and booked directly through the hotel's website. Booking directly is easy and we got instant confirmation. The hotel is right in front of the Metro station (Paral.lel), 10 minutes walk to Las Ramblas and Barri Gotic. Their normal check-in time is 3 PM and we arrived at 11 AM. They asked us to wait till 2 PM b'coz our room was not ready then. They offered to keep our luggage in their cloak room (they gave a receipt of this, so pretty reliable). Staff were courteous and helpful. The hotel has a swimming pool in the terrace, the views of the city from the terrace are good. Rooms were clean, spacious, comfortable and had a safe. The rooms facing the main road were slightly noisy if you were to keep the windows open, but the heavy curtains are easily able to stop those noise from being a nuisance. Moreover, the rooms are air-conditioned, so you don't need to open the windows. The bathroom was clean and big. There was NO tea/coffee making provisions in the room. For a supposedly 4-star hotel, I thought this is a basic must-have in rooms. The minibar was stocked with a variety of snacks, but it was very expensive. The hotel is 10 minutes walk from Las Ramblas, the main touristy place of Barcelona. However, it is in one of the "not-so-good" areas of the city. The hotel's surroundings do not portray the best things about Barcelona. The road from the hotel to Las Ramblas is slightly deserted and not very comfortable to walk by after 11 PM. However, we did not find any issues although we used to walk through these areas to the hotel by 10 PM. The thing to remember is, just be careful of your belongings and people / things around you and you will be fine. The hotel sells tickets for external service providers as well which is very helpful. We booked our tickets for a Flamenco show through the Front Desk in the hotel. They also gave us a city map which was very useful to explore the city. The hotel certainly is value for money. The surprise element is, the VAT amount was not indicated in the room's price in the hotel's website, but it didn't pose any issues as such. They do accept Credit Cards. There are 4 computers for free internet access, useful to check things at the last minute. Overall, a great hotel if you are visiting Barcelona. We'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and spacious, good location and friendly staff. Strongly recommended”
Reviews.Author: snug22
Reviews.Content: I just came back from Barcelona trip and had stayed at Hotel Barcelona Universal for 2 nights. It is located at Av. del Paral.lel, strategic location to explore Barcelona. Near to most of the attraction in Barcelona from the Port Vell (Old Port), Villa Olimpic, to La Rambla and many more. The Paral.lel Metro station just in front of the hotel, thus it is so convenience. The room was spacious and clean, and there is safe in the room. The staffs are nice and friendly and we were given the city map upon check-in which was very useful for us to explore the city. Will stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: report88
Reviews.Content: I can echo what the previous (positive) reviewers have said. Efficient English speaking reception staff. Great big rooms, comfortable bed with sitting area and massive bathrooms with marbled double basins & 2 showers. Immaculately clean. As usual only one English channel on tv :( but who goes to Barcelona to watch TV? the hotel is in the theatre district with Grease and Cabaret on opposite. Don't get a room with a view as ours was very very noisy as the traffic & sirens & crowds are still out at 3am. You also get some rather disturbing views into the appartments opposite - but if voyeurism's your thing you won't be disappointed! I would definitely use this hotel if i were to return to Barcelona, and I am very fussy, but I would ask for an internal room with no view - I think they are cheaper anyway. The metro is superb for getting to places quickly but we also did a huge amount of walking and you do get to know the city very well that way. A straight walk of 10 mins to the centre of the Ramblas. We loved the Ramblas with its constant entertainment & it's market 'pet shops & aviaries'. At night the lower end has all sorts of entertainment from flamenco to michael jackson impersonators & frogs playing the piano. Also a 15 minute walk to the harbour & maritime museum & a 15 minute walk to the montjuic area - we loved the miramar panoramic bar there it's by the entrance to the cable car to the world trade centre. there is also a cable car that funs from the funicular (funicular can be caught from the metro outside the hotel) to the montjuic castle. All metro/funicular fares are 1.25Euro per trip to anywhere within 90 minutes. Another 10-15 minute walk to the placa d'espagne & magic fountain - only make sure it is going to be on before you hang a round for a couple of hours waiting in the dark only to find that it has be cancelled due to a trade fair or whatever! Again as previously said the area that runs directly between the hotel and the Ramblas is slightly run down but not at all threatening even late at night. You will pass quite a few prostitutes but again they are not threatening - you certainly can't miss them as they are very err.. umm ...' oddly' dressed. It also crosses the Halal part of the city but again I didn't find this a safety issue. I also saw no evidence of the pick-pockets that Barcelona is supposedly renowned for. Watch out for doggy dos - the Catalans love their dogs - and rightly so - they are gorgeous!

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly recommend this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: justanothaday
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for three nights in early October 07. Was very impressed, very clean and tidy. Nice rooms which were cleaned daily. The hotel offered a good breakfast with lots of variety. Good location, metro stop (Parallel) right outside and only two stops from Catalunya! A short walk to Las Ramblas. Lots of bars/restaurants nearby to get a drink or something to eat. Yes the area is slightly run down, I'd say the hotel is the best looking building on that part of the street! Don't let that put you off though, myself and my boyfriend didn't have any trouble in the area or anything. Overall, great hotel. Would definitely go again if I was heading to Barcelona! I recommend it. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great break”
Reviews.Author: rmtkol
Reviews.Content: Returned 20th Oct from 5 night stay and would recommend this hotel. Hotel booked from reading other reviews and wasn't disappointed. Very clean, excellent service from all staff. Metro is right outside hotel but Ramblas only a 10 minute walk anyway. Area is a little run down, but ok, plenty of bars and cafe restaurants very closeby for cheap snack and a drink - hotel bar has little atmosphere although service good - hence using bars for night cap or late afternoon drink having walked all day, before returning to hotel. Breakfast was good with plenty of choice of fruit drinks, cereals, bacon, sausage, egg etc, as well as rolls, yogurt, cold meats, fruit, cakes and bread. Used hotel restaurant one night, food was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel both for location and comfort”
Reviews.Author: Katesmcl
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for 4 nights in October. Room and bathroom was spacious and clean. Room was cleaned daily and any bathroom items used replaced. Breakfast was good with a variety of foods available. Gym was not up to much, but then again depends on why you are visiting the hotel!! Nice sun terrace with a smallish poolon the roof with impressive views over the city. As had read reviews about the noise and view being blocked requested a room with a view on a higher floor. Was on floor 8 with a view over towards the center of the town, could also see the outline of the Sagrada Familia, did not hear any street noise as was at back of hotel. Location could not have been better. 5-10 mins walk into the heart of La Rambla and to the port. Metro stop right outside the hotel and only a few stops to sants station where you can transfer for the airport train. Overall very impressed with the hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Give This Hotel a Second Look”
Reviews.Author: jtmr
Reviews.Content: Hotel is not what you expect for a 4 star hotel.
