If you stay in other 4 star hotels in the UK, America, or other places in Europe, I would expect certain items as Tea/Coffee in your room. The only "freebie" you got was internet access and a safe We arrived as a party of 8 on Monday 17th September, and left on Saturday 22nd September. On arrival hotel looked OK but the area is very run down, dirty and very noisy. Yes I agree with others that it's location is great for Las Rambla and the Metro, but I guarantee there are better hotels in a more suitable area than this one The room I stayed in was fine, can't complain too much about it, but 2 of our 3 other rooms had hardly any/no view (except a brick wall), again not great considering the amount of money you spend for a 4 star hotel room On Tuesday night, the toilet continually dripped water into the toilet bowl, told reception the next morning and they said it would be dealt with. Great I thought. Was out until early evening, came back to room and the room was left open. Totally amazed, so much for security. Luckily nothing was taken, informed reception and they were very apologetic. We got a bottle of Champagne "on the house", but only because I asked for something from the hotel The worst was yet to come though. In our party we had 2 special birthdays, 40 and 16. We decided to stay in the hotel for a celebratory evening meal on the Friday -the night before we left. What a mistake!!! The service was dire, food average, the chips were cold. When the champagne was delivered, it was not put into an ice bucket, and not even "poured" by the waitress/waiters. This I hope does not sound snobby in any form, as you get this sort of service in standard restaurants. I asked for the air conditioning to be switched on and the smell from it was vile. It smelt like urine, and these fumes were blowing onto the salad buffet bar. My clothes, by the end of the night, smelt very badly, imagine what the food was like As it was 2 birthday celebrations, we got the hotel to bring out a cake with some candles. They did so, we then asked for a knife to cut the cake. A butcher's carving knife was brought out, and only when I was about to cut the cake, it was noticed, by one of our party, that the knife had blood all over it. It was absolutely disgusting, I could not believe my eyes. Reception was immediately informed, and again were very apologetic, kept the knife for evidence to inform the hotel manager the next morning. We were given some extra champagne as a "sorry", along with a large apple pie. After seeing what their utensils look like, did they think we would eat it? To make matters worse, when I returned to my room, I met 2 other guests who had eaten out and had had a great meal. I told them about the night's events, and they were told by the "man on reception" not to eat at the hotel and to definitely eat out - says it all doesn't it? So the following morning, I expected to see the hotel manager, but he was not due in, even though I was told he was going to be. Instead we saw the duty manager, who again was very apologetic. We did not pay for the meal, our drinks or any of the champagne. I asked the hotel to write to me via e-mail but nothing is yet to arrive. I will be sending this report direct to the hotel as I thought I at least deserved a response from the hotel, but then again, do they care? Would I go back?? Most definitely not. Would I recommend it, again most definitely not. If you want to eat food that is been cut with cross contaminated utensils, then go to this hotel. But if their own staff state not to eat their food, then trust me - Don't Don't get me wrong, the room was very clean, most of the staff were helpful, especially Veronica, but certain members were very snooty and were quite unhelpful So, not a great review for the hotel, I agree, but I believe in honesty. Be very aware and careful where you go

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: abdeslem1
Reviews.Content: we had five days break in this 4star hotel,the hotel was placed near the heart of barcelona we would highly recomend you look at this as your first choice stop. the staff and the facilities were perfect .can hardly wait to come again a s we surely will. J Hall

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: MapChic
Reviews.Content: The Barcelona Universal Hotel is a great choice for a visit to Barcelona . . . the metro is close and it is an easy walk to the Las Ramblas and Barri Gotic areas. We are unsure how to describe the neighborhood . . . it is not quaint, but it is safe and convenient. Staff members were friendly and helpful, and the free computer with internet access was quite a plus for us.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel - (My Mum loved it)”
Reviews.Author: poochy76
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Lastminute.com as one of their Top Secret hotels to get a better rate. Booked a standard Twin/Double. On arrival at the hotel I was disappointed by the location as the road seemed quite run down. The reception was pleasant even though the guy on the front desk was a little snooty (but I came across a few snooty people on my short visit to Barcelona - is this just my bad luck?). Anyway, being a 4 star hotel I expected a reasonably nice room but it was quite small and reminded me of Travel Inn room - cheap duvet, cheap furniture. The whole feel of the room was a disappointment as it felt very worn out and bland. The location was also a let down for me as the streets we had to walk down to get to the tourist areas were very smelly and quite seedy. It takes around 15 mins to get to Las Ramblas. There is a tube stop close by though. The buffet breakfast was nice. There was a small unused heated pool on the roof - which is worth the visit for a panoramic view of the city. After a long day sightseeing we didn't want to have to walk miles looking for a nice restaurant so asked the front desk (which has always worked out well for me on previous holidays) - they recommened the L'Amphere - which was a 10 minute walk away. It turned out to be a 20 minute brisk walk uphill - further along the less than picturesque Avenue Parallel. I'm ashamed to say but once we got to the restaurant it was a huge let down (I had asked for a nice restaurant with good food) - we didn't stay long enough to order food as the place was a dump! We ended up going to Basilica which we passed on our way. This was a beautiful place with great decor and food and was unbelievably half the price! Maybe the receptionists brother owns L'amphere? Who knows!! But generally the hotel is ok - no major gripes - a clean bed to rest your head - my parents and my boyfriend all thought it was good - but I want the hotel to just as much part of the whole experience - a little luxury and comfort away from home - unfortunately The Barcelona Universal is just OK.

Reviews.Title: “Bag a Bargin !”
Reviews.Author: eFord
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the hotel and had a big room for the 3 of us (daughter aged 3), plus a small room for my parents. After lots of communcication with the hotel they upgraded the room from a standard as we required a bed. Be carefull as they try and supply a cot for children under 3. The rooms are clean and beds are comftable. The bathroom is also a 4* standard, I liked the extras that were free, toothpaste, shoe cleaner ETC and towels where changed daily with a towel rail. The bar is useless and we didn't use the restraunt (many choices in the area). We also used the metro and found it easy to commute around with our daughter. The roof top pool was a disapointment as it was smaller than a toddler pool at our local pool (very very small), lucky if you can do a single stroke. We booked 2 rooms on the website for 3 nights for 640EUR. But when checking out they tried to charge 640EUR for each room until luckily I always carry my confirmations and proved otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Glitter-Queen
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location for one that is not on Las Ramblas. A 5 minute walk took you to the Port area or Las Ramblas but for travel round the city the underground train station is at the front door of the hotel- you couldn't get any closer. The rooms were well appointed- nothing luxurious but pleasant if slighly small. The breakfast was very good- I would recommend you book this at time of booking hotel room as works out cheaper and it was a cooked breakfast with eggs, bacon, cereal, fruit, fruit juice, toast, tea, coffee, buns etc. Small pool on roof- more of a plunge pool but sunbathing area as well with small gym- I loved it as you had great views over city and nice to relax and cool down - no its not big but ideal for a city hotel. Lots of nice restaurants in Barcelona- I recommend going just of Las Ramblas for great value and go to the Fairy Bar at the bottom of Las Ramblas beside the wax museum just for the novelty factor. We took the tourist bus round the city and although I would never normally do anything so tacky it was a great idea as limited walking- we got to see al the sights and you can hop on and off as you want- top tip don't board in Place Catalyna as its so busy- we boarded at the Port area- means you get to sit upstairs which is a must. I would definately stay in this hotel again as its a great location and good value for money in Barcelona where many hotels are overpriced and not great.

Reviews.Title: “Can't complain about this place....”
Reviews.Author: Stewartytosh
Reviews.Content: Stayed Monday to Friday last week and thoroughly enjoyed both the hotel & Barcelona. Hotel facilities are very good, lovely rooms, good breakfast, staff were very pleasant and helpful to us. I can certainly recommend this hotel. Go to 'El Glop' in for a lovely meal.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and great location”
Reviews.Author: Jungle_Boogie
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a long weekend at the Barcelona Universal. We found the hotel to meet all our requirements - the beds and pillows were very comfy and the bathroom was lovely. We were on the fourth floor at the back of the hotel which was very quiet. The pool was small with very few sunbeds but we managed to find some floor space to lie on which was ok for a quick half hour rest after a hectic day of siteseeing. This hotel is very conveiently located next to a metro station which we used several times. Its only a 10 minuted walk onto las ramblas and about 20 minuted to the port. We never dined at the hotel but this suited us fine since there were plenty of cafes/bars outside for breakfast, lunch and evening meals. All in all i would recommend this hotel for its comfort and location - staff were not the most helpful but this seems to be the case in large hotels!

Reviews.Title: “wouldn't come back”
Reviews.Author: LfbFrance
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were first glad to arrive at this hotel. Nice location, nice rooms, nice staff. But unfortunately we asked a staff to recommend a good restaurant nearby since it was our first time to Barcelona (or Spain), and we actually dined there. That meal changed our view of the hotel completely. Should've known better when he actually had business cards of that restaurant to give to customers. When we arrived, we noticed that none of the customers(actually only two other tables) were local people (bad sign) 'cause they not only don't look like locals, but nobody was speaking Spanish. We guessed that they were all hotel guests like us. The food was OK. Not the typical Spanish dishes we expected, just steak and fish that you get at any chain restaurant. What was outrageous was the bill. It came to almost 100 euros. We live in Paris(where living costs are usually higher than spain), with 100 euros two people can have a very pleasant meal in a decent restaurant. Plus, on the bill, a liter of sangria was 20+ euros! (as we later found out, you can get the most expensive sangria for 12/liter). Plus, as bread is free and always served at french restaurants, when the bread was served without us asking, we ate it. Then they charged us for that! Water too. All in all, we totally felt we got ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Kateguide
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a girls weekend, there were 7 of us in 4 rooms. The hotel was in a great location, only 10 minutes walk to La Rambla and the harbour. The rooms were clean, Our room faced the main road but noise wasn't a problem. The pool on the roof is more of a plunge pool, however, it was still nice to have a dip after a hard day's sight seeing; the views up there are also pretty good. The staff were helpful and particularly good at getting taxis. We got a good deal that didn't include breafast, this wasn't a problem for us as we weren't getting up early and there were plenty of local cafes offering good food at keen prices. The only bad thing I can remember was that there were no tea & coffee facilities in the room, other than that it was good.

Reviews.Title: “Very unhelpful and unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: pandette
Reviews.Content: Hotel although in an excellent location was full of very unfriendly and unhelpful staff. it was my wife's 50th birthday which we did state before arriving and there was not even a glass of wine waiting for her when we checked in. Incidently if you like to have a view change your room if they give you 615 it has no natural light if you open the window it goes directly on to a brick wall, As said before location right on top of the station 10 mins walk to Las Ramblas and very friendly staff either in cafe opposite or the one with blue seat covers if you turn left outside the hotel Great comfortable base if you want to explore the city - but not if you like the staff to be warm and friendly

Reviews.Title: “Nice location at decent price, but you can find better value in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: cla114
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location (near all the main attractions and near the underground) but the area is not great and the rooms are just ok. Considering that in Barcelona you can find very stilish hotels at good prices I think this is not the best value hotel. Hotel Jazz or Hotel Soho are more stylish, albeit a bit more expensive. Nothing bad about this hotel but the room furniture is very ordinary, and very much like a NH hotel, which is a more downmarket spanish chain. I think NN hotels are supposed to be more upmarket and more stylish, so this one is a bit of a disappointment in this sense. However personnel was very nice and the location is good, my complaints relate only to the furniture.

Reviews.Title: “4* ???”
Reviews.Author: ALTESSE
Reviews.Content: This is a reasonable hotel with a few flaws and most definetly be a 4*..Bar had no beer only wine and closed at 11pm Swimming pool is absolutly tiny.and although close to everything the area is less appealing than other parts of town

Reviews.Title: “Unwilling Management”
Reviews.Author: Corneliadieandere
Reviews.Content: We spent a nice time in barcelona. My husband, my two taughters (12 and 14 years) and our little son (baby). The hotel is nice but there is a lot of traffic noice also during the night. So you must keep the windows closed. The hotel bar is realy bad - sorry for that. The hotel offers a good continental breakfast.. If you make an online reservation, it is impossible to mention that you travel with children. So an adults room price will be charged for them, if they stay in a seperat room. Neither the hotel staff nor the manager was willed to change the fee to a children rate, only the baby is free of charge. That is realy a shame for a hotel with four stars. That's the way a satisfied guest leaves the hotel angry and dissatisfied.

Reviews.Title: “A great weekend”
Reviews.Author: Tommytours
Reviews.Content: We were ten friends (boys) that were on our yearly Christmas-travel. And this year it was Barcelona’s time! Through a local travel agency, and a look on Trip Advisor, we ended up with the Universal hotel. And we did not regret this afterwards. The rooms were spacious, and we all got separate beds like we booked ahead. The location was perfect when we should go out. Even for shopping and nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Great base to explore and get a tan!”
Reviews.Author: adamneil
Reviews.Content: Just back from 4 nights at the Barcelona Universal Hotel. My wife and I visited Barcelona for a few days to explore Barcelona for the first time. Before booking I had read a lot of the reviews posted here. We were in a 4th floor room at the front of the hotel. Before travelling I had tried to get us moved to the back where it would be quieter, but the hotel was fully booked with conference delegates. There was a bit more noise than we would have liked from the traffic and the seemingly endless sirens from emergency vehicles, but both of us are heavy sleepers and this didn't cause us any problems, nor did we experience any problems with noise from within the hotel, although some rooms are located next to the restaurant and the lift shafts and would probably have been noisier. Our room was a typical good business class standard, although tea and coffee facilities were a miss, the mini bar fridge was very useful; we were not discouraged from using it to store our own bottles. The real plus for us was the roof top terrace. After a morning and afternoon of exploring it was great to get back to the hotel to go out and lie in the sun for an hour or two and read a book and lap up the rays before getting ready to go out for dinner. The area around the hotel is not the greatest; a lot of dodgy looking folks hanging around and the ladies of the night were around, although this is really confined to one street between Paral lel and Las Ramblas. However, we made sure that we didn't walk through the streets between Las Ramblas and Paral lel after dark, we used the metro at night. Despite the issues mentioned above, the area around the hotel seems to be undergoing some redevelopment and in the future I think it will improve as the location is really very very good in terms of locality near to the main tourist areas of Las Ramblas, the Marina, the Metro system, etc, etc. Never tried the restaurant in the hotel or the restaurants near by so can't comment on them too much. Breakfast in the hotel was included in our package and was fine, but not worth paying for if not included. No problems with staff, polite and reserved in the main. Ordered a taxi no problem when checking out for getting back to the airport. Room cleaned to a good standard every day and do not disturb signs fully observed. This hotel certainly added to the quality of our trip and I would certainly recommend it to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: irishgirl84
Reviews.Content: We are just back from a short stay in this hotel and it was lovely. It is very well located and within easy reach of everywhere. We were on the 9th floor with an inward view room which was good because there was no noise but bad if you crave natural light! We did not know what the weather was like outside until we went out!!!! HOWEVER, the hotel was spotlessly clean and the staff nice. The room was very big and loads of room for us and our 6 month old. Would recommend it but ask for a room with natural light!

Reviews.Title: “would not stay there again”
Reviews.Author: ChelseaGatineau
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a fantastic location being near Las Ramblas but for a new modern hotel, it is extremely noisy. The rooms are very nice but with hardwood floors, you can hear people walking in the rooms above. The walls must be paper thin, because you can hear people in other rooms talking and we were right beside the elevator and it never stopped - right through the night, that elevator kept going. We put out the do not disturb sign on our door in order to have a well deserved nap in the afternoon but that did not stop the cleaners, while vacuming the hallway, of hitting our door and the walls 4-5 times while cleaning (this happened on both days we were at the hotel). Also, on the morning we left, the hotel staff would not order us a taxi for the airport until after we had checked out. This delayed us by 15 min and it was not appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “liked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: mbyrnefire
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed there 4/16/07 for 4 nights, as did our son and daughter-in-law. Good location, wonderful views from the 10th floor deck. We ended up with a huge handicapped access room. Quiet as long as you keep the window closed. Lovely little pool on the 10th floor deck. Breakfast the usual buffet. Staff very helpful, fluent English.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Bunpo
Reviews.Content: As all the other reviews have advised; the best thing about this hotel is the location. It is beside Paral-lel Metro station and is only 2 stops from La Rambla (Liceu station). We bought a 3 day pass for approx EUR 13 and had unlimited travel around the city for the period. The hotel is very clean and modern but rooms on the street are noisy from 6am onwards with morning traffic (request a room at the back). Reception staff were efficient and courteous. Do not eat on La Rambla as it is very expensive and you will find nicer, less expensive restaurants on the streets leading off here. Have breakfast on the 7-8th floor of El Cortes Ingles glass fronted restaurant to have an excellent view over Placa de Catalunya. Take the cable car from the Port and Montjuic and have a drink at the bar at the top and you will have panoramic views over the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: kirsty10rob
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in perfect location, right next to metro (which takes you everywhere and every 3 mins or so) and walking distance from La Rambla and basically everywhere else. Room was very clean and modern, a little nosy but not so much that you couldnt sleep. Would definately recommend it and will definately be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally loacated, clean, easy and good quality staff”
Reviews.Author: AFMalahide
Reviews.Content: Barcelona Universal is a reasonable four star hotel located close to Las Rambla, the harbour and pretty much anywhere else you want to go, due to the metro station outside the door. I can't really fault the hotel, except perhaps the price, given the fact that I booked three months in advance. That said, hotel prices are nuts in Europe anyway. Its on a busy road, but despite this it retains a quiet internal atmosphere. I was given a room to the front on the third floor. Clean, well presented but lacks facilities such as trouser press, tea/coffee making materials and also a lack of information regarding internet access (in my opinion, it should be "in your face", i.e. a little card or similar near the phone ports etc) and hotel facilities. The pack was presented in a clear plastic container on the desk which I was not too impressed with. I'm used to leather bound etc. I think that makes life easier. I've stayed in four stars all over europe and parts of the world and its fairly standard. All that said, I would recommend the Universal to any would be visitor. Also, its about 500 metres to Las Ramblas from the hotel. Exit left and take the next turn left. Overt your eyes from the establishment on the corner.... its very out of place, also, if you are interested, Grease is playing across the road!!!?

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location with modern decor + Free Fast in-room Internet!”
Reviews.Author: Splodge2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights on a leisure trip from London, BCN airport was a 20 minute taxi ride [EUR 25] Excellent location on Para-lel, 10 minutes walk from Las Ramblas and the Port plus the Metro station is 10 seconds from the front door. Spacious Room, immaculate with modern bathroom. Some noise from street but as expected for its central location. Room has reasonable size digital lock safe. Ask for extra pillows as only 2 supplied as standard! Fast Free Internet in the room, bring a standard RJ45 lan cable or ask reception for one. Be warned that the roof top pool and gym are both very small. Bar suffered from poor service due to lack of staff. Restaurant ok but no atmosphere and has basic menu. Numerous cafes nearby for breakfast. Many good restaurants around the port area make better choices. Touristica Bus Tour well worth while, sit on the top deck right hand side if you can; Pick it up at the port. Be careful around the dimly lit streets off Las Ramblas with the groups of loitering youths looking for "easy pickings". This was the only location where we felt slightly uncomfortable. Some of the open bars along Las Ramblas were expensive so check prices. Have recommended this hotel to the Mother-in-law and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel fine, city not so good!!”
Reviews.Author: aoifembg
Reviews.Content: im a junior travel agent so i did alot of research into my trip to Barcelona and the hotel i would stay in. the hotel Barcelona Universal was good, clean and nice. but only good, i did have a few issues with it, i asked for a room away from the front of the hotel to be away from the noise of the road but we ended up with an internal room, which when stayin for five nights in a four star i didnt find acceptable, i hate internal rooms and frankly having to wake up to look into other peoples rooms wasnt worth the money (which we did pay alot!!) when doing my research, the hotel i really wanted to stay in was the tryp apolo but reviews said it was in a very dangerous area so i chose not to. but to my surprise when i got to barcelona it was located right across the road from the barcelona universal! i do have to admit the area around the hotel did look quiet dodgy but we're were fine at all times. my only advice to give you about the hotel is to order the steak VERY WELL DONE (i ordered mine medium and it was still raw on the inside) and to request by email to the hotel 2 wks before going a room WITH A VIEW!! the shopping is AMAZING in Barcelona but its just as expensive as Irish shops. If i was going away for 5-7nights again i would definitly prefer a resort but Barcelona would still be nice for a short 2-3 night break!

Reviews.Title: “would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: simpsonic80
Reviews.Content: Great position next to metro station and hotel is very clean. However requested a quiet room, we were above the noisy resturant, could hear the lift going up and down all hours, and the rooms dont seem to be sound proofed; could hear every word they said in the room above. One evening at 7.30pm we were disturbed by drilling and banging!. There was a window but no light or view as it looked into an internal area. The swimming pool was taken at a very good angle, you honestly wouldnt get more than 6 people in there and could not do lengths. The gym was also disappointing consisting of only 3 machines. Overall very disappointing for a 4* hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location-really 4* hotel”
Reviews.Author: hariathan
Reviews.Content: I am a trip advisor and i have searched a lot for a hotel near rablas,transportation means,and at list 4* comforts. I have reed all the reports here and at trip advisor's site. My conclusion is that the hotel lays in a perfect place, from which you can go everywhere in barcelona throught the metro station that is just outside the hotel,and by feet of course to ramblas and to the port. The hotel room we stayed is that shown at the site and is really perfect. Very big,with enormous doublebed 2x2 ,with modern furniture and closets very convenient for our luggage. View at monjick hill,quiet at the 8th floor, and with excellent clean service every day. I noticed that all rooms are not alike ,because in the lower floers i was told that there is a lot of noice,and there is a size difference between standard and superior rooms and of course rooms looking back they dont have the best view!!That is shown at the site is the superior and is that i payed 78 euros per night wich is great valey for money. The only disadvantage i noticed is the guality and the variety of the menu you can order at the room. Very few choices and not good quality. I certainly recommend this hotel to anyone who likes the comforts of a really 4 * and the easy access that offers to every destination in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: O'Polo
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for a getaway city-trip with my wife. Modern new hotels. Staff was Ok, but nothing more than that. Impeccable clean room. Everything quite new. No problems whatsoever. Breakfast OK too. Very well situated near metro, and within walking distance (10') from Ramblas. This hotel offers all the modern comfort any reasonable traveller cal expect. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Drin
Reviews.Content: Myself & my friend stayed in the Barcelona Universal Hotel in Jan 07. The hotel is located just off La Ramblas and in the other direction is the Port area, both are approx. 5 - 10 minutes walk. Our hotel room was a good size, the photos on the internet are very accurate. The bathroom was marble and had an excellent array of complimentary toiletries. Our room was cleaned daily, with fresh towels supplied daily. Our packaged included breakfast, which was one of the best we had both come accross. It included, tea/coffee, array of juices, selection of cold and hot meats, pastries, selection of fruit and cereals, cheeses, breads, etc. and even cakes!!! Hotel staff were friendly and had excellent english. The hotel is in a great location. Barcelona is not a city you can walk completely and I would recommend a tour bus whcih costs just €24 for two days, which is a jump on jump off operation. Barcelona Universal Hotel is within walking distance of nice restaurants and shops and the beach. Barcelona is a good choice for a weekend break or a summer sun holiday for those who want more than just the beach/swimming pool. I would highly recommend the Barcelona Universal Hotel. Be careful of scam artists and pick pockets though. We were fortunate not to have any problems but many of the spanish locals warned us when in shops/restaurants so obviously this is a problem. The Rival area of Barcelona is a little bit seedy but appears to be under rejuvenation. The Barcelona Universal Hotel does boarder this area (Le Rival) but I would not let this turn you off.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good location, good selection at breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: jake1964
Reviews.Content: Great location, very central. Walked to port area easily, las ramblas etc only 10 mins walk. Hotel clean, efficient, great selection at breakfast. ask for a quiet room, outlook poor but is quiet !! and worth it if you like your sleep. Only reservation is they do not provide tea and coffee making facilities in room. This was a fairly disappointing factor for two tea loving folk particularly last thing at night. Barcelona itself was lovely and we did not experience any unpleasant incidents, people were friendly, food good, weather particularly kind, efficient transport systems, and of course the sights were best part. hope to return and probably would not hesitate to book at this hotel but hope they review the tea making situation.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Marklar1980
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in July 2006 and it was a great experience. The staff were friendly (but not over friendly, which is good). The hotel was really clean throughout, there always seemed to be someone cleaning something! The room was very nice and a good size. My only negative point about the room is that ours was an inner room so the window faced inwards into the small central atrium which meant we got hardly any natural light. The location was superb, the tube station is practically next to the doors of the hotel and its only a 10 minute walk to la ramblas. I must also add that the 2 bars/restaurants next to the hotel are great for a nightcap when you return from your evenings sightseeing! We thoroughly enjoyed our time in Barcelona and would definitely recommend it to others, for business and pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Handy, Although I'm not mad about Spanish Food”
Reviews.Author: Babyjan
Reviews.Content: Was happy enough with hotel, although was really not in the hotel for much of my time in Barcelona. Really immaculate in terms of cleanliness. Would have to say that bed was OK but back was sore in the morning time after nights sleep. So, really I am only giving it a 3 out of 5 due to bed and lack of time spent there. If you want a good location, no problems with this hotel. Warm and clean, which are very good and important.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: mickey.co
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Universal for four nights in Nov in adjoining rooms with my wife, daughter, son in law and 7 month old grand-daughter. The Hotel is in a good location just a stroll from the sea front and a similar distance from the Ramblas. Rooms are a good size, more like a US hotel .with my daughter's room very spacious and including a comfortable sofa which I guess converts to an additional bed for 3 or 4 person occupancy. Comfortable beds, excellent array of free toiletries, TV with SKY news and plenty cupboard space - regretably no tea or coffee making facilities! Weather was great fot the time of year -Tee shirt during the day and Polo shirt at night - could not understand why the locals had sweaters or jackets!! Highly reccommend both this Hotel and Barcelona for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: simong1
Reviews.Content: Just spent a long weekend staying at the Barcelona Universal. Rooms are clean and modern, with laminated wood floors. Decent bathroom. Our room was at the back of the hotel, and so was nice and quiet. I think the rooms are the front are a little noisier, but our friends did not find this a problem. Good location, 10 minutes walk from Las Ramblas and near a metro station. Did not eat at the hotel, so cannot comment on food. Cafe nearby for breakfast. Staff were friendly and courteous. Barcelona is a great destination for a weekend break. Was nervous about the street crime beforehand but the weekend passed without incident. I think you just need to be sensible, particularly around the crowded central areas.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic weekend”
Reviews.Author: dutch123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Universal for 2 nights as an anniversary celebration. We informed the hotel of this and were given the most fabulous suite, 2 bathrooms, jacuzzi, champange, which we thought was lovely. The hotel is spotless (and I am very fussy). In fact Barcelona as a city is spotlessly clean. The hotel is very modern and the staff were very helpful with suggestions as to where to eat. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel and would love to return both to it and to Barcelona again.

Reviews.Title: “missing possessions”
Reviews.Author: susannk
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Barcelona Universal Hotel for a girls weekend and chose this hotel based on reviews I had read on Tripadvisor. I agree it is in a central location and we had easy access and transport to all of the sites. The hotel is clean with well furnished rooms with a good selection of toiletries in the large bathroom. Unfortunately ,a handbag I bought whilst there went missing from my room. I reported it to the reception but they emailed me on returning home and just stated that the maid did not remember seeing it. I received no apology and would suggest that you use the safes in the rooms and put out of site any purchases you make. In the hotels favour ,however, my daughter in the next room had a pair of pyjamas go missing. These were found in the laundry and returned by post a week later.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Jerseymick
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights for our anniversary I have been booking hotels directly of the internat for the past 10 years and contacting the hotel directly and with a bit of research you can pick the right hotel and save a little money. But one thing to watch for when you do this is they nearly always give you a room next to the lift shaft or right at the end of the corridor next to a staircase and the Universal are no exception. After asking for a room switch that evening we was eventually moved to a quiter room away from the noisy lift shaft the next day. The Hotel in general is in a good location with a tube station directly outside and the room service and bar service was fine. Rooms are modern and spacious with a good sizes shower.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for business - not for pleasure”
Reviews.Author: HRM30
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend in July. The hotel is a generic business hotel but is let down by disinterested and dismissive staff ,(our electronic room key failed to work every time we returned to the hotel and the hotel staff appeared extremely disgruntled at being put out by having to deal with this), and a misleading photograph of the swimming pool (actually the size of a large jacuzzi).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel,but”
Reviews.Author: Jenjess
Reviews.Content: Hotel Barcelona Universal Stayed in the Hotel Barcelona on 22 September for three nights with three friends. A ladies weekend to Barcelona. On arrival at hotel we had a quick check in and were very please with our rooms which were spotless with loads of little extras in the bathroom. No tea and coffee making facilities in the room which I read in another review so I took a travel kettle. Only let down of this hotel was the Breakfast which we had paid extra for and it was absolutely terrible kept running out of food eg bacon then when you had your bacon there’d be no eggs there. Did tell the staff who but they would go off and do another three jobs before going back to the kitchen. Café next door to hotel right as you go out of the door served a lovely looking English Breakfast which we saw on our last day after we’d had another awful breakfast time at hotel. Myself and a friend stayed in a smoking room Room 401 this room had a window but no views only looking out to other windows in a square. Our friends in a Non smoking room Room 217 had a larger room and a large sun terrace but were overlooked by local residents but ok for a late night drink. There were excellent views from the roof top pool area. If you fancied a swim hotel towels were provide by each sun lounger. Beware when you check out that your bill will have VAT added on to it. When in your room you can check your bill on the TV but it does not tell you about the VAT so had a bit of a shock when they give us the bill. Must give a mention of the Queen Vic pub on the way down to the Las Ramblas very friendly atmosphere. Beware on the Ramblas 39 euros for 4 sangrias. Had an excellent Spanish tapas at Mickeys on the Ramblas my first try at tapas not cheap 110 euros for four of us including drinks but excellent. Overall the only complaint we had of the hotel was the breakfast or should I say the lack of it. Would stay at the Barcelona Universal again but would not pay extra for the breakfast would go to the café next door. Belinda, Tina, Maria & Rachel

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Scot32
Reviews.Content: My mum and I stayed at the Barcelona Universal Hotel earlier this month for 5 nights. The hotel was very nice, our room was modern and clean with a large bathroom. The extras provided in the bathroom, toothbrush, shoe shine, etc were useful. The in-room electronic safe deposit box was a great addition and meant our valuables were safe every day. We had breakfast included so we enjoyed a nice continental breakfast each day, although the €13.50 it would have cost otherwise was a bit expensive. The staff at reception were helpful and gave us directions to the Ramblas and advice on walking in the area. They also cashed our Euro travellers cheques which was great as nowhere in Barcelona would take them, we had expected a big city like that to have taken them as cash as is done in the USA. I had some concerns about the area after reading other reviews but he had no problems at all. The street that we used to get to the Ramblas wasn't that nice but we walked down it at approx 10.30pm one night and no-one bothered us. We would recommend the La Quinze Nits restaurant in Placa Reial for a cheap, high quality meal, but be prepared to queue for at least 30 minutes to get in at night. Two 3 course meals with wine and juice was around £25 and the food was delicious. Another nice place to eat was Cafe Moka on the Ramblas, very nice tapas! Do not bother using La Poma restaurant which is attached to the Hotel Royal on the the Ramblas. The food is overpriced and we had bread and olives dumped on our table with no chance to refuse them. Even though they were clearly untouched we had €3 added to our bill for them, we spoke to the manager and after some disagreement with us he eventually removed it from the bill, we did not leave a tip! We used the Metro a lot towards the end of our trip, a day ticket was €5 and when you're getting tired walking around it's very convenient to just jump on a train. Most of the main attractions have a Metro stop beside them but the open top tour bus was also a great way to see the city from above ground. We really enjoyed the fountain show just off Placa Espanya, it was very busy and a great atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Bill05
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, prompt and polite service, very well suited for business travellers. Free internet access both Wired and WIFI, which is usually offered at a surcharge in european hotels at the moment. The rooms are nicely furnished, the view is less than spectacular though, when you have a room at the back of the hotel. The breakfast buffet is truly very nice, everything you expect + quiches, pies, assorted meat, baked mushrooms. The rooftop pool is tiny, maybe 5 meters across, whoever took the website picture, is a master of perspective ;-). It's located about 1 km walking distance from the Barcelona WTC, and slightly less than that from the Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Universal was FAB!”
Reviews.Author: sairbear77
Reviews.Content: We had a 6 night stay in Barcelona for our 1st wedding anniversary and it was fantastic. Barcelona itself is a great city with so much to see and do, but tiring ourselves out all day we were glad to have such a comfortable place to come back to. The people were absolutely lovely and couldnt have done more for us. I advised them of our anniversary when we booked and we received complimentary champagne on arrival which was heavenly once we got to sit and relax. We had some hassles with one of our credit cards and they were a great help to us. Always smiling and wanting to help. The rooms where lovely and clean and spacious enough to sleep or just sit and relax in. The bathroom has everything you need and it was great to be in a place where they think of giving you things like make up remover, shavers and shaving cream and toohbrush and toothpaste. The mini bar is fully stocked but there werent any tea and coffee making facilities and by about day 3 i was hanging for a cup of tea! Down the road are a few adult places so perhaps not a place for a family, although there were a few when we were there and they werent bothered about them. Dont opt for the breakfast as you can get just as good for much cheaper. However ,if you decied to pop in one morning at least you have the option instead of beng locked into it. Its a buffet so you can fill yourself up with as much as you like and there is a great range of things to choose from, but i still dont think 13 Euros worth.....maybe a man could pack a bit more away! The roof top pool is small and tends to feel quite crowded around it however you can cool off and go up another flight of stairs to the solarium if you want to get away from the folk around the pool. Most people forget its there. The beach in Barcelona is disappointing so we were quite happy to have somewhere to go to cool off after exploring during the day. But as it is a small pool this isnt the type of hotel you would choose if you wanted to lay around the pool all day. If you get the metro (the paral-ell stop is right out the front door of the hotel...very handy) up to where the cable car is, on the walk down to it you will pass the public pool and this was the location for the diving and some swimming during the olympics. There is a small entry charge but it will give you so much space to swim about and no crowds, because everyone else is packed onto that awful beach. You also get amazing views of the city from there so take a camera! We had a wonderful steak dinner in the restaurant and if it fits in your budget you should give it a go, but again there are plenty of great places within short walking distances from the hotel. If you do go to Las Ramblas head off the main street for food and drinks as the price will drop dramatically. A 40 Euro bill for 2 sandwiches and 2 beers or a 50 Euro bill for 4 people tapas dinner and drinks, and there are some lovely places just off the beaten track. Also if you fancy a good old burger head straight to the Hard Rock Cafe, not too badly priced and servings so big you will only need a main!! This hotel is in a brilliant location, about a 15-20 min taxi from the airport (15-20 euros), has a metro stop right at its door and you have a lovely stroll down to las rambas. I would definetly return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gotham1
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a family vacation in Spain. This is a pretty nice hotel and we enjoyed our stay here. The rooms are contemporary & modern & well appointed. The beds are a bit firm for me & the pillows a bit flat, but we found that true in other Spain hotels. The baths are well stocked, except for kleenex; towells are big and soft. The pool is small & cold & only open until 8. There isn't alot of deck area or chairs around the pool, but towells are provided and it makes for some nice relaxing after a long day of walking, if you can find a seat. The location is great. It is on a main street and easy acces to taxis and a metro stop in front of hotel. The staff seem to speak some english and are helpful for the most part. We did have trouble getting change one day and were told they couldn't give us change for a 10 euro. Skip the breakfast. It is 13 euro and not very extensive from an American point of veiw for a buffet. You can walk down the street and find a few places on the same block that serve breakfast for around 9 euro. If you are staying with kids, be forewarned that there is a sex shop down the street and a burlesque shop around the corner on the street to Las Rambles. Also, a street off of the street to Las Rambles is a hooker street. We were traveling with teenage boys, so it wasn't a problem for us. If you have to do laundry, there is a laundry on the block behind the hotel and one down the street to Las Rambles. Get there early, all the kids staying in hostals show up mid morning to do there laundry while they eat their breakfast of beer and sandwiches. There was also a problem with our reservation. I had reserved through Secrotel site online and the rate was different than the one the hotel had. They attributed it to the exchange rate, but I'm not sure. Try to make your reservation directly with the hotel. Our stay there was pleasant & Barcelona is a great place to see. Two good places to eat are "La Galina" down by the peir, pricey, but good; and "The Attic" on Las Rambles, gourmet food at a reasonable price. Don't miss the cathedral, La Sagrada Familia, parq Guell, MNAC, Montjuic (castle and Olympic area), Picasso museum, Tibidabo mountain, and the beach. The beach is crowded, topless, and water is cold with a lot of debris, but why go all the way there and not go to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel... Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: thisdogibites
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Barcelona Universal in June 2006 to celebrate my husband's birthday. Our room was lovely, clean and really well presented. The buffet breakfast was great with a good choice and clean restaurant. The room service was good value too. The roof top pool is lovely and gives great views of the city. The hotel is easily accessible with a metro station right outside the front door (Paral Lel). The metro gives you access to all the usual tourist haunts in the city. It is only a five - ten minute walk to Las Rambla. Overall, we would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel to see Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Short 20 Euro cab ride from the airport; Barcelona Universal is situated right in front of underground metro station. Roof top pool is nice plus, and would recommend the breakfast buffet which is convient and priced right. Very clean, helpful staff, great facility and service. Subway up parallel to the fountains and art museum (must see), or down to the harbor (15 minute walk). Actual beach is about 30 minute walk, but main tourist gathering is Las Ramblas. Big street with vendors, restaurants (would not eat on this street) and street performers. Hit the market on Las Ramblas, see a bull fight at Toro Monumental (easy metro ride). And would recommend Fat Tire Bicycle Tour (they have a web-site); which provide 4 hour riding tour of the city with the major sites, great history, and nice lunch stop on the beach. Would visit Barcelona again, and if I did would stay at Barcelona Universal.

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: wellyboot
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel at the recommendation of other Trip Advisor users for a city break in May 2006, and I was not disappointed. We stayed for 3 nights and could not find fault with the hotel. The rooms are attractive, very spacious, clean, light and fully air conditioned. The bed was a very supportive and comfortable super kingsize. There was plenty of wardrobe space, the bathroom was large and spotlessly clean and we found the staff friendly and helpful at all times. The location of the hotel, in my opinion was ideal. Situated partway up the Para.lel road it was only a 5-10 minute stroll down to the lovely Port Vell area and the same distance to La Rambla. There are a wide variety of restaurants all within a couple of kilometres walk from the hotel and examples of stunning contemporary architecture all around; as close as directly across the road from the hotel. The small rooftop swimming pool was really lovely and although the temperature was in the mid thirties when we visited, we were able to swim in relative peace and were also able to find a free sun lounger. The gym (as with all hotel gyms) was pretty basic, but there was enough to keep you occupied for a half hour, though I noted there was no running machine. If we return to Barcelona, we will definitely stay at Hotel Barcelona Universal again and would highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “24 hours missing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In the past I stayed with my husband in this hotel. I was very pleased many aspects of the it, such as the rooms, the staff, the decoration and so on. The big trouble was when I was taking the plain back home and remembered that I had forgotten a sweat-shirt in the hotel bathroom... As soon as I got home I called the hotel...well, the first call of many more that would come...I gave the exact information about the location of the sweat-shirt and even pointed out that was a rather expensive piece of clothing (more expensive that all my stay at the hotel) and also with emotional value. Despite all the calls, the staff was unable (and not willing) to solve the problem, I didn't have the opportunity to speak with the manager, and they revelled an arrogant and not concerned attitude towards my issue. In sum, in less that 24 hours a client's personal article was "lost" and no one ever took any responsibilities for it. This is an intolerable situation in any hotel. So, I don't recommend this hotel to anyone, mainly because it doesn't inspire me any trust. In my case, it was a piece of clothing, in any other case, it could be anything much more valuable. Any person can forget anything in a hotel room, so think about going to this hotel twice. Because I am totally certain that shirt was in the room. Three months later, I'm still waiting for a phone call that never came and never will come. Mafalda Silva, Portugal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and destination for the money”
Reviews.Author: Topians
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Universal for 4 nights in mid March. We found the hotel to be great value for money and would definitely recommend it. Rooms were very clean and modern, there was some noise from the road outside but it's a very small price to pay for such a great central location. The Location of the hotel was excellent; being only a very short walk from the metro station was great. I booked this hotel based entirely on reviews from Trip Advisor and I definitely wasn’t disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights before heading off on cruise. I felt the hotel was clean, functional, and I had no issues with the bedroom facilities itself. However there was no atmosphere outside the bedrooms. Nobody ever used the hotel bar..perhaps because it's right inside the main reception, and lacks privacy and is small...but when we did venture over one evening, we had to go to reception to request bar service....and everytime we wanted a drink...reception would call upstairs for waiter to come down. Breakfast was european...so dont expect hot cooked breakfast. Also, as were tired one evening and decided to eat in the hotel's restaurant. I ordered chicken as a main course, but I received duck...waiter wrote down wrong order...and worse still was I had to pay for the duck....even after I decided I would accept it rather than have a further 15 minutes delay....I didn't want to make a fuss....serves me right. Lastly, location was good....only 5-7 minutes walk to middle of ramblas, but was on noisey street, and route to ramblas was choice at times....just be careful...but that goes for all of barcelona.......there's always hustle and bustle. On a more positive note.......the metro was really good got getting around, and there are 2 metro stops near the hotel. we paid €742 for 4 nights B&B total...including 7% tax. I don't feel we got a bargin.

Reviews.Title: “Brill hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel 12th to 14th May for a long weekend with my husband. Can not rate it highly enough. Spotless and staff great. Excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LauraSC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel from 4-6 May and it was out of this world. We were given an upgrade as it was my boyfriends birithday and the room was beautiful. The service was wonderful and the staff were lovely. I will certainly return to the Universal without any hesitation and can't recommended it enough.

Reviews.Title: “OK...but not a great neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: VegasCanuck
Reviews.Content: This was our first hotel in Barcelona and we ended up checking out after the first night due to the less than pleasant neighborhood. I don't want to alarm anyone as some will find the area acceptable but we chose to move to the nicer L’Eixample area of Barcelona. The hotel itself was fine. Our room was on a high floor and overlooked the street in front. Noise was not an issue even though we faced the street. Our room was clean and modern...see photos. The roof deck has a pool and a great view of the city. I don't think anyone will hate this hotel, I just think that it is important to be in a decent neighborhood when staying in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sasi60
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 7day trip to Barcelona. Having read some of the reviews I was a bit concerned regarding safety and noise. However I am delighted to say that neither where a problem! Our room was on the 7th floor and we didn't hear a sound. The bathroom was especially nice, modern and clean and had a bidet. The rooms are decorated in a very modern minimalist fashion that we found very attractive. The double bed is more like a super size king-sized bed. The receptions goes to the pain and even copies international newspapers in their lounge!! I followed the advice of a previous critic and it is definitely worth telling the hotel if you are celebrating a special occasion, we also had complimentary champagne and strawberries delivered to our room. The room was big enough and modern, lovely decor. The staff are indeed very helpful in answering any enquires you may have. The metro station was right outside the hotel and I personally found it very safe and easy way to see all the sights. We never ate a meal in the hotel, preferring to sample the many cafes and restaurants near to the hotel and elsewhere in the old town. We had the most gorgeous meal in a restaurant called Ra it is just of La Rambla right by the fruit market. I cannot recommend it highly enough. Ask for Judith she is nice and quick and always has a smile for you. The staff at Ra fab. Lunch is at 2 dinner is 9 get there early as its popular, wine and 2 courses 25 euro for two, FANTASTIC FOOD!!! however if Ra is full do not make the mistake of going to the restaurant next door Lupino the staff are RUDE. There are some more good restaurants which we used several times and recommend: one up the Paral.lel towards and near the Place d’Espanya called Rias de Vigo and the other in the Gothic Town called Trobadour. Both good and price worthy. I would say that Barcelona is as safe as any major city . If you go into the area behind the hotel called La Raval you may find it very lively and full of North Africans. But it is ok and extremely interesting. There are many interesting shops and restaurants. Would definitely return to both the city and the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Secret in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This modern hotel was a true surprise! The rooms were very large, extremely clean and the service and friendliness of staff was excellent. Laundry services were inexpensive, they provide free internet services and have a great rooftop view of Barcelona. Location is the only downfall, it is in a bit of a dodgy part of town. With that said, the staff provided us with a map on our first day outlining which streets we should walk on for safety. It was about a 2km walk to the La Ramble district from the hotel. Overall we really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. This hotel is definitely excellent value for $$$.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: merchant
Reviews.Content: Returned yesterday from a few days at this hotel. The staff are very friendly and the rooms are kept spotless. The food and drink on offer are both good value and of a good standard. The hotel is fairly central with a metro station outside the front door. A good choice hotel for anyone who likes quality at an affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Faygelah
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Barcelona Universal for three nights preceding a cruise. We found the hotel on Hotwire and paid just over US$100 per night. The Barcelona Universal is located on a busy street, right next to a metro station. We found the room to be very clean and comfortable, though much smaller than we were accustomed to. The bathroom was especially nice,modern and clean and had a bidet. The rooms are decorated in a very modern minimalist fashion that we found very attractive. Although our room overlooked the street, we were not bothered by street noise. The neighborhood itself is nothing to write home about, but taxis and the metro are very accessible. They serve a very nice buffet breakfast, but It is quite pricey (13,00 euros pp) if it is not included in your room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Universal”
Reviews.Author: lady55
Reviews.Content: I have only good things to say about Universal Hotel, Barcelona, we arrived quite late and were expecting the left over room, however the reception was welcoming and we discovered we had been upgraded to a superior room. It is definatley worth telling the hotel if you are celebrating a special occassion, we also had complimentry champagne delivered to our room.The room was gorgeous, very big and modern, lovely decor.Breakfast in the place 2 doors away is fine. We had the most gorgeous meal in a restaurant called Ra it is just of Rambla right by the fruit market.I cannot recommend it highly enough lunch is at 2 dinner is 9 get there early as its popular, wine and 2 courses 45 euro for two, FANTASTIC FOOD!!! however if Ra is full do not make the mistake of going to the restaurant next door Lupino the staff are RUDE. The staff at Ra fab. A must is the old fairground Tribidabo very romantic and the views are the best you can ever see of Barcelona, try the Funicar to get up there its a breathtaking ride.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Barcelona Universal - Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: lsbcr
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip to Barcelona (September 2005) and we had a wonderful time! We had booked our hotel based on reviews posted on this site, and I want to say how thankful I was that people post their opinions and recommendations here - we were very pleased!. The Hotel Barcelona Universal was a great hotel - very clean, spacious room and closet, very functional A/C in the room, quiet, helpful and attentive staff. Definitely four star in my book. Great location too - subway stop is just outside the main entrance - the doorman will get you a taxi at any time, a few blocks walk to the south is the port area, to the north is downtown - we found everything we wanted to see and do was either an easy walk or a subway trip away, without all the noise and dirtiness of Las Ramblas. I highly recommend it to travellers looking for a great place to stay without paying a fortune.

Reviews.Title: “Great...Highly Recommended!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after our cruise ended in Barcelona. I booked the hotel through hotwire and am so glad that I did! The staff is so friendly, helpful, and nice. The hotel is also very clean with nice wood floors. The bathrooms were very large and even offered a nifty clothes drying device. The tub was kind of a hazard since I almost slipped in it, the towel rack was way too high (you had to stand on the tub to get your towel), and take a high step to get into the tub. The metro is literally right outside of the hotel. It is a good 10-15 minute walk to Las Ramblas through a sketchy street. I booked two rooms; one for me and my husband and another for my parents and we all loved it!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel convenient to the heart of the city!”
Reviews.Author: Suntanbob
Reviews.Content: This a jewel of a hotel in the heart of Barcelona. The hotel is modern with all ammenities including a roof top pool and gymnasium, a wonderful and reasonably priced restaurant, great front desk personnel and convenient to Las Ramblas. We stayed there for 3 nights from August 19-21, 2005. The room was a nice size, the bathroom was very modern and the decor up to date. Breakfast can be included for an additional charge. We felt that the cost was very reasonable given the ammenities and convenience. We highly recommend the hotel to visitors to Barcelona, a great city to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Hands Down!”
Reviews.Author: ChiTravelGal
Reviews.Content: We spent our honeymoon here and we loved the hotel! We read all of the reviews and were a tad weary of staying here initially, but we live in Chicago so we are used to everything that comes with living in a big city. When we arrived they brought us a bottle of Cava and fresh strawberries to accompany the vanilla ice cream. We stayed in room 702. It was huge. It was a corner room with a couch and table and then our bed was in another area that was sectioned off. Ask about this room if you get a chance. It over-looks the front of the hotel. The staff of the hotel is amazing. Our room was spotless everyday. The management gave us some fabulous restaurants to frequent and they were dead on. I don’t know what anyone is talking about with the metro. We took the metro everywhere and used the stop right outside of the hotel daily even at night. If you look like a naive tourist - gym shoes, a camera around your neck, map, purse, you will most likely get targeted. We hid our camera in my husband’s pocket. I never carried a purse. We hardly used the map unless we were in super touristy areas and we were perfectly safe. We read a lot about Barcelona and I had been there before so we were well prepared. Just adhere to the warnings. We walked around the neighborhood a lot and there is a club that is about 2 blocks away that was packed on Monday at around 1 a.m. We went to many modernista restaurants while there. I love the city and the people. A taxi driver even told us to go to dinner at the Crazy Crab right in Port Olympic. The restaurant was amazing. If we go back we would not hesitate staying at this hotel. One bad thing about this hotel is the room service: it is not very good at all. We ordered salmon and chicken. My salmon was not cooked all the way so I could not eat it. I don't know if they were rushed or what, but I was so disappointed. Then we wanted the same ice cream with strawberry's we had the first day we got there and they brought us sorbet, which isn't such a bad thing, but not what we ordered. They need to work on the room service. There is a small restaurant on the corner. We ate breakfast there most mornings. Good stuff!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: hotel is very convenient to metro (subway) which is right outside the front door. the walk over to the Ramblas is sketchy, especially at night, one night on my walk back to the hotel the cops pulled their car over, got out and asked me for my travel documents. i have no idea why i was singled out. perhaps because i didn't fit in with the lowlife looking folks that walk the street. it was very strange. i felt like i was in a communist country instead of Spain. when i told them i left my passport in the hotel safe they were fine with that and left but was still very wierd. hotel has comfortable beds, nice size room, good bathroom. what more could i want.

Reviews.Title: “Good accommodation in central location”
Reviews.Author: Salsakitten
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Barcelona Universal in mid August. We were very satisfied with the hotel and only had some minor niggles. The rooms and public areas looked exactly as they did on the Expedia website. It is a drab building from the outside but modern with contemporary design when you get inside. When we checked in at noon and requested a room on a high floor facing the back, we were told at reception that we could have one if we were prepared to wait until 2 pm. We waited and got room no. 819, which was perfect with regards to noise and view. It was a reasonable size but not exactly spacious. It offered what most travellers look for: a huge bed (a bit hard), safe, clean bathroom, hair dryer, air conditioning and TV with some international channels. The view was great, we could even see the Sagrada Familia! One complaint that I had, was that there was no electrical socket near a mirror, so I had to use my hair straightener using the reflection in the television. Even though it was a busy street, we had no noise in our room at night. However, the cleaners were quite loud in the morning so you could not have a lie-in beyond 9 am. We had a problem with the electricity in our room the morning after arrival, but it was fixed promptly. The breakfast was good and varied (although I missed normal fresh croissants), but expensive if not pre-booked. The small pool and sun deck on the roof were nice and usually very busy. The view was spectacular and we used this area to relax in the early evening on a couple of occasions. In some reviews it was mentioned that the neighbourhood is a bit dodgy. Well, the hotel is on a busy main road, so no safety issues here apart from the traffic. There are so many directions that you could go, that you can avoid walking through El Raval if you want to. I actually quite like this barrio, which has a lot of character with some nice shops, restaurants and bars, and I felt perfectly safe during the day. One observation: there were some prostitutes lined up at Carrer Tigre and on Sunday afternoon families gathered on benches nearby to watch them going about their business. Great free family entertainment for grandparents and their small grandchildren! Anyway, at night we would avoid this area and took a taxi to the hotel. The shortest walk to Las Ramblas was about 10 minutes and the metro was right outside the hotel. (We saw a lot of people jumping over the turnstiles here as the station is unmanned!) Overall, we can recommend this hotel as it offers clean and comfortable accommodation in a convenient location. We also got a very competitive price through Expedia. Good restaurants: Elche (near Hotel), Crema Canela and Bilbao-Berria. The renowned Ca L’Isidre is just behind the hotel, but it was shut for holidays when we were there. I love Barcelona, it’s the second time that I’ve been here for a whole week and I still haven’t seen everything. I can’t wait to come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with good staff”
Reviews.Author: JakesterUK
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel were very pleasant to deal with, and both efficient and friendly. The rooms were a decent size, and a good supply of bathroom toiletries was supplied as standard. 20 tv channels with 3 or 4 in English (BBC World and Sky News to name 2). Free Internet Access was available, but only through network cable (which they supplied). There was also wireless internet available, but this appeared to be chargeable. A wide variety of choises for breakfast was available, and the restaurany had very friendly staff with good English to help those of us with poor Spanish keep up with our coffee intake! About 10 minutes walk to La Rambla, and 20 minutes to other majors sights and points of interest. Metro station very close by (Paral.lel), with easy access to sights such as Sagrada Familia. The one negative comment I have relates to bad or damp smells in the corridor on the 8th floor, but there could have been any reason for this. There were no bad smells in the rooms or anywhere else in the hotel, so I felt this was acceptable as a temporary problem (havent checked any other reviews so don't know if this has cropped up before). Very enjoyable all in all.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, expensive, small rooms..”
Reviews.Author: Powerpuffs
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel sunday at 15.00, and our room was not ready. Ok, fair enough, the hotel asked if we would like them to store our luggage, which we would. We got back two hours later, and had to wait 25 minutes to check in, because the reception was crowded with guests. After this we had to wait another 20 minutes to get our luggage up in our room, and we went down THREE times to ask where it was. We also said that we could bring it up ourselves if they were short of staff. No respond.. I think we got the worst room in the whole hotel. 2nd floor (1st floor is restaurant), tiny room, and our window faced a "backyard", which in fact just was a hollow room inside the hotel. (with a roof.) Our room was extremely noisy, we could hear other guests all night, and the maids startet at 09.00.. We didn't eat at the hotel, and it was clean and elegant, and that's pretty much the positive things that can be said.

Reviews.Title: “Don't listen - the hotel is lovely”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a wonderful 4 day trip to Barcelona and cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. We were unlucky enough to be one of the BA travellers whose flights were cancelled so had to make alternative flight arrangements. On check in the hotel were so sympathetic and helpful. From arrival to check out, we were treated beautifully. I'd arranged the trip as birthday surprise for my boyfriend, and 5 minutes after getting into our room a complimentary bottle of champagne arrived, the lovely Maria who works on reception had arranged this. The hotel is situated perfectly, it's a 15 minute walk to Las Ramblas, so close enough but not right in all the noise. Lots of comments have been written about the road you have to walk down to get to Las Ramblas, to be honest yes it's a shabby road, but you're in the middle of a city, what do you expect. And the main police station is on this road so i wouldn't worry too much. Just be careful like you would anywhere. Yes it's a modern hotel, quite business like and contemporary, so don't book it if you want character, but to be honest if you're spending that much time in your room or hotel, you're in the wrong city. The rooms are a good size, the "double" bed is huge, more king king size. The Bathroom is very nice, good little treats left for you. And it was cleaned every day. We did have breakfast on the last day as a treat and it was very nice. but personally I wouldn't pay the extra for breakfast as there are a couple of restaurants outside which do a great breakfast for 6-10Eu (you'll pay 14EU each in the hotel). The road outside is busy but we honestly didn't take any notice as we spent our time just enjoying the city. We certainly didn't notice the noise as being an issue. The pool is small but nice, and there are great views from the roof. The Metro (Paral-lel) is literally outside the hotel, and reception were so happy to advise on everything from which stations you needed to get to all the sights to good local restaurants. We were given a map of the city and Metro on check in, which was very useful. Buy a 2 or 3 pass for the Metro. the 2 day one cost 8EU and you can use it on Buses and Trains I'd book this hotel for the treatment we received alone. Tips - Obviously visit Sangrada de Familia, beautiful, But DO NOT miss Park Guell, amazing examples of Gaudi, but beware the walk from Metro is LONG. Try The Quinzenity, on Placa Reial, off Las Ramblas, you queue but foods great & reasonably priced £32 for 3 course meal with one of the most expensive bottles of wine. It’s big tourist spot but nice place to people watch. However, take a walk in Barri Gotic to find some great tapas bars , they display tapas on the bar held together with cocktail sticks, you help yourself, you’re charged according to how many sticks used. All in all a fantastic trip, I can't wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from an 8 day summer holiday in Barcelona and had a great stay at this hotel. Our room (top, back, requested by e-mail 10 days before travelling - thanks for the advice!) was excellent. The staff were always friendly and helpful. The area is great for getting around - it's not the most scenic location we never felt unsafe. Even the swimming pool (small but well done) and the gym (also small but 4 good machines) had their uses on occasion. The business centre was also very useful (and free!) If visiting Barcelona again I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: thefinns
Reviews.Content: I have yesterday returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel, and felt I should post this review immediately. After reading earlier reviews I was a bit worried about the noise and surrounding area. However, neither turned out to be a problem. On arrival, the staff were very helpful and had allocated the room exactly as I had requested (double bed, high floor, front elevation). The room on the eighth flor was excellent, spotless, air conditioned and noiseless (with the windows shut!). The surrouinding area was abit seedy, but not appreciably worse than most other parts of the city. I did not encounter any problems. This is one of the better hotels I have stayed in and would recommend it to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel lots of hen and stag do's”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went to Barcelona 3 years ago and never seen any hen or stag nights so when my friends and i went over last week i was very suprised. The hotel is a lovely hotel but would say if you are going with a family to maybe think somewhere else i did'nt hear anything (think it was something to do with the drink!!) but my friend went home early one night said it was like a nightclub, people in and out of rooms lots of laughing and talking etc etc. But overall i thought it was a great hotel, friendly staff, very clean, and very central. Although i would not stay there with my husband and daughter.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: lstpelican
Reviews.Content: I know there are some out there who have complained about this hotel's noise problem. I am here to tell you there was no noise proble here! We stayed in the front room the 1st night we were there and the back the second night there. No problem sleeping either room. The staff was great, they went out of there way to make our stay perfect. If I ever go again I will stay here!! Good job Universal Hotel ! JT

Reviews.Title: “A great place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the hotel and on the whole it was great. The rooms were comfortable and modern. The pool area is located on the roof and gives a fantastic view of the city. The only problem was the lack of sun loungers. It is only a small area and a little cramped, Although the beach is located just 10 minutes walk from the hotel. There are many bars and restaurants nearby and the port is only a short walk away. It was very busy here and the night life was excellent. Every taste is catered for. A lovely market was also here. We did not see any street crime during our stay in the city but we were warned a couple of times about leaving our bags on the table. Barcelona is a beautiful place with plenty of culture. The best for me was visiting the architecture of Gaudi. The Sagrada Familia is breath taking but amazingly no where near finished after 120 years since it was started. My personel favorite was Gaudis Casa Mila built in 1906. It was a residential apartment block and one of the apartments is preserved. If you like Art Nouveau this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean, bad neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff were wonderful and professional, but the hotel is located on a busy street and a not so nice neighbourhood. We had to walk pass 3 blocks of narrow streets and red light district to get back to the hotel from La Rambla. We stayed at the hotel for 2 night after our cruise to the Mediterranean. The hotel is only a short taxi ride from the cruiseship terminal. We had a room on the 7th floor facing the main road, which is a busy street with lots of traffic. We could hear the traffic from the street passed midnight and the wall was thin. I could hear other guests on the same floor chatting away.
