The room was too cold even after we adjusted the temperature, so it kept us up all night. On our first night we ordered room service and the food was just fabulous, great value and great taste! I heard so much about Barcelona being a great city, but I was disappointed to find that people were not friendly to tourist. Nobody would go out of their way to help others (except for the hotel staff, they are exceptional!). We didn't feel safe in that city and we were always on guard as we heard so much about the crime in Barcelona. Metro is right outside of the hotel but we dare not to try. Restaurants on La Rambla was overpriced but their food was not great. What a shame! We will never go back to Barcelona. So glad to be back in Vancouver, we are enjoying great seafood, fair price, friendly people, our spectacular waterfront and majestic mountains!

Reviews.Title: “its ok”
Reviews.Author: momo9978
Reviews.Content: the hotel is clean, but you have to walk through a pretty dirty street to get the main street. the wall is thin and you can hear noises all night long. the roof top pool is pretty small... not for swimming and can only hold like 4 ppl at a time. the best part of the hotel is that they have a business center and internet access is free. and the ppl there are helpful and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Babbly66
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a city break in Barcelona - what a fantastic city. Hotel: We had a room on the main road but on the 4th floor which we were very happy with, but unfortunately the toilet did not work at all so we were moved to the 1st floor which was a bit noisier. The rooms are lovely, cool, nice bathroom with little nick nacks etc. The traffic was a bit noisy but hey you are right on the main road so what else can you expect! We walked down the Nou de la Rambla (turn left out of hotel )and never had any problems. City: We did witnesss a young boy trying to rob a lady sitting behind us in a cafe on La Rambla. It was quite an experience. You will see lots of kids walking around with just a sheet of paper and their line is 'so you want to buy a paper' and whilst doing this they will put the paper down on your table, you would probably reply no and they just walk away with the newspaper and whatever item was underneath it...in this case the lady's mobile phone. The waiters/waitresses do keep an eye out for you - in this case the boy was confronted and chased away empty handed. Tip - do not leave anything sitting on the table and always carry your bag etc in front of you. The thieves are very cunning...we were buying some bus tickets from a stall when a guy came right up from behind me and stared right in my bag as I was getting money out. If you use common sense and are aware that there are thieves out there then you shouldn't have any problems. Other than these minor issues we absolutely loved Barcelona...take comfy shoes as you will do a lot of walking. It was very hot when we were there - 38degrees one day - take plenty of sunscreen. Food: What can I say! Wonderful..although if you head off La Rambla you will find some lovely restaurants at half the price! We also ate at Port Vell overlooking all the yaghts - lovely! All in all a fantastic city - would love to go back again!

Reviews.Title: “It's a real shame”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having just had 4 days in Barcelona I am sorry to have to say that we will not be going back to the Barcelona Universal which is a great shame for the hotel because it could not be faulted. The rooms, standard of cleanliness and facilities (although the hotel were a little generous in their description of the pool as a 'swimming' pool) were everything and more a 4* hotel should be and the staff were some of the nicest and most professional we have met in our travels. Leaving the hotel we always used the first street to the left to walk to La Rambla area and although there was a distinctly seedy feel to the place, we felt relatively safe due to the police station and numerous police in the area - the sheer number on view must say something about the nature of the area. The last reviewer remarked on the ease of travel using the Metro system. Our trip to Barcelona was one of a medical matter rather than a holiday and on the last but one day, we needed to cross the city and decided to take the metro from the Paral.lel stop which is immediately outside the hotel to avoid the huge traffic jams. Here we were physically attacked when getting on the train by two men of Arab appearance and my husband lost his wallet and contents but thankfully suffered no injuries. Within 5 minutes of the attack, large purchases totalling nearly £2000 had been run up on his credit card which seems to indicate that a very professional operation is being run with regard to stolen credit cards. We do speak Spanish and thankfully were able to cancel the cards within 15 minutes to prevent further loss, I was told when making a report at the police station that this area, and this station in particular, is one of the worst (ie dangerous), if not the worst, in Barcelona and when my husband explained to his dental surgeon why he had arrived late, the surgeon was horrified to hear that we were staying anywhere near the Raval District and, in particular, had ventured onto the Metro there. The hotel staff were great and pulled out all stops to get us the help we needed and were as sickened by the attack as we were shocked. We are really sorry that we don't feel able to risk another visit to this great hotel. The 5 rating I have given relates purely to the hotel, staff and facilities within. The only positive rating I would give for the area would be for proximity to main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Your search for a hotel stops here! Do not hesitate in making a reservation at this place... we cannot fault it at all. My boyfriend and I stayed here for 4 nights at the beginning of the month. We were only on the 3rd floor and overlooked the street and the traffic didn't bother us at all so I can't understand how people on the 8th floor were troubled by 'noise'. Ok, so it was a busy street but I didn't think it was that bad... some morning's we even slept through until 11 having tired ourselves out the previous day exploring what Barcelona has to offer. Admitedly there always seemed to be police/ambulance sirens going off but working in the centre of London from Monday to Friday, it's something you become immune to and so it didn't affect us. The hotel itself was amazing - our first impression was that we'd walked into the wrong place as it seemed so grand for our 'budget city break'. The rooms are very spacious with great air conditioning and facilities. We tried breakfast at the hotel one morning but as someone else has mentioned EUR13 was relatively steep for what you got. In a cafe just a few doors along to the left you could have an 'american' comprising of 2 fried eggs, sausage, 2 bacon, toast, tea or coffee and freshly squeezed orange juice for EUR8... that kept our stomach's full well into the day. Regardless of where you go exploring, there's plenty of mini supermarkets and bakeries so if ever we felt peckish at lunchtime we simply popped into those for a freshly baked french stick and cheese. Right outside the hotel doors is the entrance for Paral.lel station which offers great links to almost anywhere. Their train maps are very clear so you'll never get lost. Go one stop to Drassanes and you'll find yourself down by the port and Mare Magnum shopping centre, where there's plenty of restaurants on offer. If you are a fish lover, one of our faves was Emperadors where a three course dinner with wine, water and coffee for two cost us £45. Another, situated actually within the shopping centre, was Mandongo, an oriental-come-spanish mix where, again, the food and staff were delightful. We didn't even bother with cabs to and from the airport. A 5/10 minute walk from the terminal along a signposted route brings you to the train station where a journey of 20 mins costing EUR2.5 takes you to Sants station, which in turn is only a few stops on the underground to Paral.lel. Their underground is also airconditioned (unlike London) so travelling around on that is great, especially if you want to escape from the daytime heat. We didn't bother with tour buses or anything as our 5day Barcelona Card for EUR30 got us literally everywhere. We purchased our card once we reached Sants station. It entitles you to discounts and free entry to many attractions so it's a great money saver. We hopped on and off (normal) buses and trains to our hearts content and explored so much. All in all, we'd say Barcelona is a top place for a city break. Plenty to see and do and for a reasonable price if you plan wisely. There's plenty of websites with constantly changing deals on hotels (we booked through hotels.com) plus flights with Easyjet lower your overall cost too (we got return flights for £90 each). Don't hesitate in booking this hotel.... it's well worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “What a great city!”
Reviews.Author: EilyV
Reviews.Content: Since I’ve used this sight to pick my hotel, I felt I should write and tell other visitors what I thought. Like other reviews wrote, there is a side street (Carrer Nou de Ramble) but it’s not scary. There is a lapdancing club on the corner but it’s not offense. In fact, the street is quite interesting with small shops and plenty of people. Don’t let that put you off. The hotel is less than 100 metres from a metro station, which will connect you to the whole city. We didn’t use the tourist buses at all but instead bought a 3 day travel ticket which can be used on the metro, trains, buses etc. This was much better value (€12.50) as opposed to €21 for two days on the tourist bus. So if you enjoy getting to know an underground system, this is the way to go. Should the scary street put you off… go two stops on the metro and you’re in the middle of all the action. There is no iron available so bring a travel iron cos there’s a charge of about €4 per item to have them pressed. Don’t waste your money eating on La Ramblas. It’s over priced because of the tourist element and the food will just disappoint anyone who likes a good dish. Instead just have a drink and go people watching. We didn’t eat in the hotel at all but had breakfast in one of the numerous cafes outside the hotel. They are cheap and you’re eating outside which is always nice. The staff have very good english but we didn’t require any assistance during our stay. We got a room on the 8th floor which was very clean and well serviced. The noise from the street did wake us every morning so an alarm clock is not required. Perhaps a room at the back would have been quieter. The AC was a great bonus cos the weather was so hot. It's a clean, modern hotel and a very good location to everything worth doing. The must see things that we did were the “Magic fountains” by night, Parc Guell (the 24 bus will bring you from the hotel straight to the park), Nou Camp for soccer fans, Arc de Triomf and just get lost in the back streets of the Gothic Quarter. Great city and will go back. Bring comfortable shoes as we did loads of walking and exploring. Didn’t have any issues with pickets but do be careful cos you hear some horror stories. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Blooming
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had wanted to visit Barcelona for years so when we finally booked our trip we researched the hotels really well and chose this one as it looked to be in a good location, nice and modern and clean and good value (if you book early enough)- and it was! We had 4 nights here in May and we would definitely stay here again. We read the other reviews about the dodgy side streets but we didn't have any problems at all, in fact we thought it was in a great location for both the town and the port and also for the beach in Barceloneta, which we could easily walk to. We walked everywhere from the hotel or caught the metro right outside. We didn't try the restaurant and unfortunately the pool was shut during most of our stay, but we had a look up there and thought it was a nice extra. Oh and yes we too asked for a room on the upper floors at the back and it was lovely and quiet. We emailed the hotel before we arrived to request this room and it was available when we checked in.

Reviews.Title: “5 out of 5 - a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Skells
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights: May 6th-9th inclusive, and were overly impressed by its standard. Clean, bright, modern and friendly are some of the words I'd use to describe our experience. True enough, we had a room on the 6th floor at the front of the hotel and did find the traffic a little noisy from first light. We couldn't fault the breakfast either, and in the evening time, we dined out - our choice - and stumbled upon some absolutely wonderful restaurants off the main thoroughfare. Sure, the side street next to the hotel is quiet enough but it's not dodgy - as a previous review hints (get out there and explore the nooks & crannies of the world!). In a nutshell, the advice is...it's a great hotel. A room at the back of the hotel is preferred but not essential. Bon voyage!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Clean, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had 2 double rooms at this hotel for 4 nights in March and were really pleased with what we found. My main priority is cleanliness and this hotel was spotless. The front desk staff were friendly, spoke great English, and the hotel sits just across from a metro station so getting into town was never a problem. The only 2 potential drawbacks is that the hotel sits on a busy street and come morning the traffic noise really picks up. Second there really isn't a comfortable bar area and if you like to have a few drinks before hitting the town this really isn't the best hotel to do that in. I would however recommend the hotel restaurant - although never busy while we were there the dinner we had one night was fantastic! If you're looking for a place just to lay your head down so you can get out and see the sights then this is a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Bad Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Barcelona Airport on 1st May 2005 for a 4 day trip. It took a while for our baggage to come through but once we had it we decided to take a taxi to the hotel. Loads of Yellow & Black taxi's just outside the airport which cost around 25 euros to the hotel. Took the advice of the people on the website and asked for a room on one of the higher floors. It did mean us waiting for another hour past the booking in time, but well worth it. We had a room on the eigth floor (no.811) and were upgraded to a superior. The room was very spacious, very clean and modern. However we were at the front of the building which did get a lot of loud traffic noise - but not unbearable. Whist we were there the restuarant was closed for refurbishment, but they still did breakfast and room service. Both of which I would stongly recommend not having. The room service meal was quick to reach us but cold, and I didn't think it was much better then what you would get in a fast food restuarant. The breakfast was OK but massivly overpriced at 13 euros each. If you turn left outside the hotel and walk about 100 metres along you will see a cafe which is just as good but half the price. I strongly recommend the Bus Tours, you can buy a ticket on the bus or at the ticket box at Port Vell, just outside one of the bus stops. It cost 17 euros for a one day ticket but you can buy a two day one. It is a great way to see the city and find your bearings. You can get on and off the buses as often as you like and there are loads of bus stops scattered around the city, they will provide you with a map and more details about what you can do when you buy the ticket. The Sagrida Familia and the Nou Camp are amazing and not to be missed. If you like a bit of home comfort then there is a great Irish pub down La Ramblas - just down a side road past Burker King, called Flaherty's. They do great pub food with a good atmosphere. All the staff are Irish (which was a nice touch) and really friendly. Take the advice on the website and don't take the side street just outside the hotel on the left to La Ramblas. It is a bit seedy and didn't look to safe. Take the longer route past the Maritime Museum. Be aware of pick pockets, I had an over the shoulder bag that I kept in front of me the whole time. Just take the same caution as you would in the centre of London. There were some beggers down La Ramblas, oftern women with babies that come up to you whilst you in one of the outside cafe's eating. We only saw one or two and if you ignore them they do go quietly. In conclusion we could not fault the hotel staff or room on the whole trip. The location was the problem for me and although you are close to nearby attractions it would put me off staying at this hotel again. The road itself that the hotel was on did make me feel uneasy especially at night. The fact that there was no decent food within the hotel was also disappointing. I personally would prefer to stay in the Eixample district near Plaza Catalunya, it seemed a much nicer area. I would say that Barcelona is a great city with so may amazing things to see, and would love to go back there one day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: footballjunky
Reviews.Content: Like previous reviews I can not speak highly enough about the hotel. It is in a nice location within easy walking distance of most sites. The hotel is really clean and up to date. We had a room on a high floor at the back of the hotel (requested on booking). It was clean and pretty spacious had a nice view of the hills behind the city a nice bathroom, we also did not hear any traffic noise from outside. The hotel staff were amazingly helpful. They made every effort to book tables at the resturants we requested and where they were unavilable they recommended some which were out of this world. I would recommend this hotel to any one who wants a great base for their holiday in barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: ezh70
Reviews.Content: Lovely modern hotel. Room on 8th floor very spacious with sitting area, bedroom, changing room and bathroom. Lovely toiletries, only complaint is they were not replenished every day. Staff on reception very helpful. When walking to Las Ramblas, go out of the hotel and turn left and walk down Carrier Nu del Rambla which is busier and better lit than the roads on the other side of the hotel. About 10 minute walk to Las Ramblas. Recommend eating at Biblioteca (C/Junta de Comerc) and the Neri Hotel Resturant (expensive but excellent). Take the bus tour on your first day and then visit the sights at leisure after that. Park Guelle and Miro Museum as well as Sagrida Familia are sights not to be missed.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel”
Reviews.Author: Titianm0de
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Universal for 3 nights on 19th April. The room was spotless, bed very large, and the bathroom excellant. Ask for a higher floor, and you may get a good view over the city. The staff are very helpful, and attentative (we were given a bottle of Champagne for our anniversary, which was a very pleasant suprise) The Taxi transfer to the airport was around 25 euros each way, takes about 15 mins. We used the Metro underground until about 9pm, (7 euros for a 10 trip ticket.)which was very handy as it was right outside. If you are walking to the hotel, avoid walking through the backstreets behind, as they are frequented by seedier types, and is not safe. We tended to walk round the bottom by the Maritime Museum. If you want to chill out, the Parc La Ciutadella is nice, and we also enjoyed looking around the Boqueria Market off la Ramblas, very colourful.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: linzi134
Reviews.Content: the barcelona universal was really nice, great location very clean modern simple style rooms and very nice staff. the hotel is in walking distance of most things and the metro station right outside the hotel takes you to the rest. (£7 for 2day pass) i went for 3nights and didnt get time to do everything. i loved barcelona, we visited the olympic port, aquarium, nou camp, las ramblas, cathedral, the zoo and the sargadia familia which was the most impressive though, that is a must to see, i wasnt expecting it to be so big and impressive, you have to go to the top too. :-) found the hotel to be really good price and was great for the amount of time we actually were there. There is a great chinese on las ramblas, not the most attractive but great food and good price we had about 5 dishes and drinks and was about £25 in total. also the little bars are perfect for a quiet drink we went to an australian one on las ramblas and an irish one on the road back to the hotel. The road back to the hotel isnt great at night, i wouldnt have felt comfortable if wasnt with a guy, walk fast and keep head down. (one night had a girl playing a flute wanting money). overall-a good hotel in a great city would definetly go back to both.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, wonderful staff, amazing customer care”
Reviews.Author: suebsongs
Reviews.Content: What a WONDERFUL, WONDERFUL HOTEL ... the rooms were fabulously clean, spacious, airy and tastefully decorated while the staff & management's customer care abilities were out of this world. As it was our 25th Anniversary weekend, we were surprised with a complimentary superior room and cannot thank the hotel enough for making our stay so memorable. The friends who went with us thought their room was fabulous, too. Nothing was too much trouble for any member of staff ... they are so, so helpful. Room service was quick and friendly - we enjoyed some delicious cold meats, salad and bread smothered in tomato & garlic. Excellent. And, while we never actually ventured downstairs for breakfast we did have a tasty, inviting continental breakfast tray in our rooms.... which included freshly squeezed orange juice, fresh melon, pineapple, grapes, meats, cheese, yoghurts, gorgeous pastries and croissants, and mounds of other stuff. It was only a 6/7minutes walk to La Ramblas and all the small cafes and bars dotted around close to the hotel were extremely welcoming and friendly. In amongst the many winding local streets you can find some quite cute shops, too. Computer access (on the ninth fooor) was instant and 24/7. The rooftop pool was lovely and the views are truly spectacular. All in all, Barcelona is a beautiful, welcoming, buzzing city - and the Barcelona Universal Hotel is the PERFECT HOTEL to stay while you're there...

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Universal Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself and the wife stayed at the Universal Barcelona for three nights in April and found it great value for money. The room was of a very high standard.The staff were also very helpful with enquiries and were also there when you needed them. Used the metro twice going to the nou camp staduim and to gaudis sandria familia unfinished cathedral. These two being a must when in barcelona and also felt safe on the metro as it was during the day.The open top bus tours are also great value for money and a great way of getting a tan. I would highly reccommend this hotel to stay while in Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Very Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: I_Mallon
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with my fiance over Easter. Hotel is spotless, with a nice pool on the roof with good views, which would have been nice in the Summer. Metro is right outside the door. The harbour is about 400yards away. Its a five minute walk to the Rambla, however dont take the side street up from the hotel, its a bit dodgey with few tourists on it. Its safer to head to the bottom of the road then over onto the Rambla. Overall, a very reasonable hotel, friendly staff and in a good location, i would certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “will definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: mrswilky
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews on this hotel I was looking forward to seeing if the place lived up to it's reputation. I was certainly not disappointed. Just returned from a 2 night stay with friends and was very pleased with this hotel. The first thing that strikes you when you walk into the rooms is how clean they are. Everywhere is spotless and the decor stylish and modern. The hotel staff are very friendly and they will give you advice on where to go in the city of you ask them. They all speak very good English too. We had a room on the 3rd floor and 2 of our rooms were overlooking those shabby looking apartments (my advice would be to just keep the curtains closed as you'll not be in your hotel room for long!). Our other friends room was one of those with an internal view (facing the air shaft). It did make the room a little stuffy as there was no natural light but there is air conditioning. We didn't bother trying to change the rooms as we arrived late and the hotel was full so we figured it just wasn't worth the hassle. If you think this would bother you, I would suggest trying to get there early so you can ask to be moved. Seriously though, if it's a clean, modern, reasonably priced and ideally loacted hotel you are after, then this place is for you. (We booked our hotel through EasyJet and got a mega discount! £76 each for 2 nights) We didn't bother with the Metro after reading all the scary stuff on here and we just got taxi's (very reasonable - around 25 euro from the airport to the hotel) and used the tour bus (10 minute walk from hotel...just ask the staff and they will point you in the right direction) to get around the city. A day's ticket for unlimited use on the tour bus was (I think) 17 euros and I'd say it was well worth it. Try and get on the top open air deck though as it's a totally different experience! You get to see all the wonderful architecture around the city, you really won't believe your eyes. We didn't see half the sights we wanted to as we were stuck for time but the highlights for us were the breathtakingly beautiful La Sagrada Familia and Nou Camp (even if you don't like football, this place is pretty special!). Be careful on your way to La Rambla (10 minutes walk from hotel). There is a street with a dodgy peep show type place on the corner and this street takes you to La Rambla. We went down there fairly early in the evening and stuck together but we saw some very dodgy looking characters hanging around here. I would advise either taking the main road or just jumping in a taxi. We went to the Port Olimpic for our night out and there are lots of bars and night clubs there staying open till around 5am! Don't bother getting there till at least 11.00pm as you'll never last the distance! Barcelona is a fantastic place and the Barcelona Universal Hotel is definitely a fab place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an excellent break at the Barcelona Universal. Hotel is modern in decor spotlessly clean and the staff are very helpful. Having read previous reviews we had requested a room on a high floor at the back of the hotel. Well worth the request as we had a room on 7th floor with a fantastic view over the city, could lay in bed and see spires of the famous sites, lower floors look over tenament blocks. Again noted previous comments and did not breakfast at the hotel but in the cafe of the hotel left as you come out the hotel 4,00EUR for a good continental breakfast 7.00EUR for an American breakfast. We did however eat in the hotel twice during our stay at night and found it to be very reasonable and very good, nice touches were complimentary tapas prior to the starter, coffee served with petit fours everything we had was beautifully presented and very good total for 2 with a bottle of wine under 40 EUROS. For getting around Barcelona hotel is ideally situated with the metro just outside. Do be careful on the metro and take No valuables cards etc leave them locked in free hotel safe, we were sitting in reception and a couple came in having lost their bag with all their credit cards money etc we observed the staff were very efficient helping them. We think we were followed from hotel onto metro as we got on the train a guy bent down and pulled the front of my husbands trousers the chap behind was trying to get his wallet but was prevented by other brave passengers who stopped him. So be careful I wouldn't use it late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: SarahWexford
Reviews.Content: Myself and a group of friends stayed at the Barcelona Universal and it is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed. THe facilities are top class, the food is great and the staff were so helpful and friendly with excellent English. The rooms were spacious and the bathrooms lovely. Room service was not too expensive. A metro stop is just outside the hotel which was great for getting around Overall we were very pleased with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Decent City Center hotel”
Reviews.Author: Holidaymaker_london
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Barcelona universal with my boyfriend for a long weekend and thought it was a good (but not great!) city center hotel. Very clean and modern. It is excellently located for sightseeing as the metro stop is literally outside the door. There is a nice lobby bar which is very reasonably priced by hotel standards howver we often had to wait ages to get service as nobody seemed to actually work in it!!! The only minor problem I had was that there was no mirror in the bedroom (only the bathroom!). Probably sounds petty to most visitors but with my array of hair straightening implements it proved a bit tricky!! I would recommend to friends for convenince but if you want a hotel with atmosphere try elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful with only a few downers...”
Reviews.Author: Flash-London
Reviews.Content: Went to Barcelona for Valentines weekend and it emerged to be a wonderful weeked with the hotel to thank for mcuh of it. Upon arrival, we did have to wait a few hours for check in as the rooms weren't ready (we did arrive at 11am!). La Ramblas is 5 mins walk away as is local conveniences and KFC! Staff were very helpful in everything they were asked. Initally asked for a room on the 7/8th floor as other reviewers has stated. We were on the 4th floor -not a single problem with noise and certainly didn't hear neighbours doing anything. View was of shabby apartments on the back but seeing as we were out most of the day seeing sights of going for leisurely walks this was not a major problem. BEd was huge but only because it was two twin beds joined together. Bathroom is basic but pretty decent and goes well with the room. Ample storage space and pulg points for essentials such as mobile phone charge, girlfrineds hairdrier, girlfriends hair straightener and girlfrinds iron!!!! Pool is small as is the gym - one cardio machine of each type! But you must venture to floor 10 as the views are breath taking...from Sagraga Familia to the Olympic Stadium and from the Columbus Statue to the cruiseliners and yachts out at sea. Never had breakfast as is pricey and not great variety but do use the cafe on the left under the neighbouring hotel - excellenct food (all day american breaksfast!) and service! Staff was some of the most helpful staff. I had researched the restaurants prior to travelling and had decided to book a table at Barcelona's top rstaurant - and the staff took over and booked me a table at Tragaluz. Amazing food at a cost - but certainly worth it. All in all the Hotel cater's for everyone's needs. But do be careful with the back streets as they are not safe. I didn't even feel safe walking down them with my girlfriend and I am a martial arts expert. Do keep personal belongings safe when walking in the immediate area - there seem to be a lot of foreigners who just look at you and 'eye up' what possessions you have in your hands. In-room safe in hotel provides great peace of mind as passports and other items were totally safe there. Would I recommend it? YEs - but to those who don't mind walking a bit to the key sites. The metro is excellently located and can take you direct to Catalonia Square and Sagrada Familia without changing lines. Hotel is worth staying at alone ust for the service levels at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Barcelona Universal Hotel, and I highly recommend it. The hotel is conveniently located (only meters from a subway stop), modern, the rooms are well equipped and maintained, and the staff friendly and helpful. The free high speed internet access from the room (using your own laptop) is great if you need it. If it is atmosphere and character you are after, though, this is not the place for you. It is a modern hotel on a bustling business street, devoid of charm.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms and staff but avoid the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a 3 night stay at the Universal. The hotel is great, nice large rooms that are well serviced. The staff were incredibly helpful and spoke excellent English. The Universal is 5 mins from Las Ramblas... and perfect for the Metro. I'll definitely stay there again. Now for the bad news. We had the breakfast on our second day. The food was good but I was shocked to see staff members chasing customers down the corridor because they had left the breakfast room with an apple! I think it is fair enough that you aren't allowed to make a packed lunch courtesy of the breakfast buffet but they weren't even allowing a dry roll to leave the room. Take the advice of having breakfast at the hotel to the left... much better, a quarter of the price and a nice atmosphere. One last point. One of our friends uses a wheelchair and so had a specially equipped room. These rooms are all internal...no choice about that, also they only have twin beds (not much use for couples). Make sure you are on a higher floor as the lower floors get a lot of kitchen noise and my friends had to move floors to get some sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but noisy”
Reviews.Author: DouglasR
Reviews.Content: The Barcelona Universal has an excellent location 20 metres from the Parral.lel subway station. Its a 10 minute walk to the foot of Las Ramblas, the same to the Gothic Quarter and 20 minutes to Port Vell. The staff speak excellent English and are very helpfull. The Hotel is only 3 years old. The rooms are well designed, very clean and spacious enough. The only problem is the wooden floors and lack of sound proofing. We were woken on a few occasins by people above us either talking loudly (not shouting) or worse, taking a leak ! God forbid if the person above you has high heels and starts walking around at 03:00 in the morning. If it wasn't for this I would have given this hotel a 4 rating. A couple of things to note: 1. As mentioned by others, this hotel has interior rooms with no window. We asked for a room at the back of the hotel with a window and were accomodated (we wanted a higher floor with a room facing Avenida Parrallel, but there were none left). 2. The hotel pool is more od a plunge pool, not a swimming pool. 3. Dont bother with the hotel breakfast. Walk outside, turn left, proceed 50 metres and go into the cafe that sits under the hotel next door. Good service, coffee and reasonable breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: wkdhels22
Reviews.Content: I took my boyfriend to Barcelona for his birthday this February. When we arrived we were very pleased with the hotel. From the outside it looks very modern and this continued inside. Reception were friendly and were always happy to help. Our room was on the 8th floor and had a magnificent view over Barcelona. The room itself was perfect, it was very clean and modern and a great size - the bed was huge. There is a metro just outside the hotel and La Rambla is just a 5-10 minute walk from the hotel however, it is down a back road which is quite lit up but even so I wouldn't recommend walking there on your own just to be safe. I would definitely recommend this hotel, it was good value for money and definitely worth its 4 stars. Barcelona was lovely and I would highly recommend visiting the fountains at the Olympic Village on a Friday or Saturday night and I would also recommend using the tour buses which stop at all the main tourist attractions and save a lot of leg ache!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for our 1st year anniversary. We choose it because of the reviews from this website. The hotel was very very nice, the staff are excellent. It is a very modem hotel in a good loctaion. We mailed the hotel and asked for a nice room, which they gave us with a brillinat view.

Reviews.Title: “Very good.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Took my girlfriend there in December, slight problem when we got there in that there was no room ready so we had to wait for about 40 mins. Doesnt sound a long time but after a flight, a coach journey and cab to the hotel it was a touch annoying but once we got our room it was fine. Large room, huge bed (!) and a very good view. Bear in mind that breakfast is not included but is very nice. Try and get a room high up. We had no problems with noise. There is a swimming pool but its not very big. Wasnt too impressed with dinner but thats probably my English taste buds! This probably sounds too critical and i did enjoy my stay. Lonely travellers should be wary of cutting through the back streets from the Ramblas back to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Top Class”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Universal in June 2004. On arrival we found our room had been upgraded. It was exactly as the pictures portrayed and more. Spotlessley clean, spacious, relaxing lobby and very helpful and friendly staff. Idealy located right next to the Metro and walking distance to Las Ramblas.We have just recommended the hotel to friends visiting Barcelona in July this year.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in december fot 5 days. The staff is very helpfull. Nice clean rooms en ver y good situated if you want to go to Barcelona. To our surprise dinner was als good as well (lovely steak)!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with very nice people”
Reviews.Author: TechRoadWarrior
Reviews.Content: My family had two rooms for four nights from December 17-21. We all had a wonderful time. The staff is very nice and helpful and the hotel is well located. The rooms were quite nice and we had enough space to be comfortable. Despite being on vacation, I needed to work part of the time and was delighted to find free high speed internet access in our rooms. The hotel also has two complimentary PC's available (for free) in their business area that is always open. One of them was equipped with a color printer as well which was great for printing maps and directions to the subsequent locations. As other reviewers mentioned, the back of the hotel is very quiet, and the front of the hotel is on a main street that can get noisy. All four of us would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, good quality, lovely design”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed here for 3 nights on 12-15th of November. We loved the hotel and had a very pleasant stay. The staff is lovely, they are helpful and give great tips for tapa restaurants (cannot judge their english as I spoke Spanish with them), the hotel is very good situated, with good acces to public transport. The subway entrance is just in front of the door. Make sure you have a room on the higher floor to overcome street and subway noise. If you are used to live in a city, floor 3 should do already. If you come from a village, you will always be annoyed by noise I suppose. People who complain about noise in this hotel are just not used to any sound while going to sleep. The area around is very safe, with the same city/village comment as for noise. We had a great room (702, yes, seventh floor (out of 10)), the biggest of the floor (which was clearly shown on the escape route map) and were offered a splendidu bottle of cava (for those who don't know, cava is similar to champagne, but only available in Spain as it comes from a different region) on the house because while booking I wrote our stay was part of our honeymoon. I also requested a room on the higher floors, so they indeed took my remarks into consideration. The bedroom was L-shaped and very large, having an extra sofa and table in the lower part of the L. The bathroom was large too, equipped with two sinks, a bidet, a toilet, a shower and a bath tub. Having this marvellous bathroom including a loungey music system from the hotel, we enjoyed a bath while having the cava. If they offer you a room with only a view of the shaft, do refuse it. And if they cannot give you another room, then they should at least lower the price (see below what I paid) as rooms are not equal. Indeed there are no alarm clocks, but any soul with a mobile phone should be able to overcome this 'problem'. I did not notice any air conditioning so maybe in summer it can get hot in the rooms. In that case, opening a window would indeed add noise if you stay at the front side of the hotel as the traffic goes on all night. The breakfast is good (but not the coffee!), but defenitely not worth 13 euros. For this price you can have dinner in a tapas bar! So, go outside, walk 50 steps, sit on a terrace and have a breakfast in the sun, not only 70% cheaper, but also including personal service and fresh *good* coffee/espresso. I booked this hotel based on the comments of this website. It did meet up the expectations very well. Oh yeah, the rooftop swimming pool is indeed nice, but not heated, so in November no chance to swim! I booked a month in advance, paid 145 euro for both friday and saturday night and 115 euro for sunday night (excluding taxes). For business I have stayed in similar hotels but usually for higher prices, especially if you take into account the location and size of city... Thumbs up, would defenitely stay again. Sjoerd

Reviews.Title: “lovely accommodation”
Reviews.Author: maisymeg
Reviews.Content: We have recently stayed here for 2 nights. The hotel is in an excellent situation with easy transport links. The rooms are very modern, comfortable and clean - all furnished and decorated to a high standard. Staff, especially reception were very helpful. The buffet breakfast was good quality but there was a long wait to get glasses, cups and tea/coffee both mornings - these were served rather than on the buffet table. Lovely rooftop swimming pool and sunbeds.

Reviews.Title: “Universal Approval!”
Reviews.Author: RoadLite
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a fantastic 3 night stay at The Universal. The accommodation is contemporary in design and still enjoys that nice feeling of "brand new cleanliness". The roof top pool is a funky bonus, that surely gives this stylish, well located, affordable hotel, the edge over its competition. I agree that the rooms at the front of the hotel suffer from some street noise. However our request to move to a (very peaceful) room at the rear was met with the friendliness & efficiency that the staff showed throughout our stay. After reading some of the earlier reviewers comments concerning the immediate locality of the hotel, you might be expecting the walk to La Rambla to be a 10 minute dash past muggers & druggies - this couldn't be much further from the truth! Directly outside the Universal are a couple of relaxed pavement cafes where you can enjoy a beer, whilst the road (C/Nou de la Rambla) to La Rambla is busy, perfectly well lit and features bars, restaurants, mini-markets and even a police station!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but noisy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: OCT 10TH 2004 JUST BACK AFTER 3 GREAT NIGHTS IN BARCELONA.Please request a room at the back of the hotel. the view isn't great but it was much quieter than the noisy rooms to the front. We had to listen to busy traffic all night.

Reviews.Title: “Just the Ticket for a Short Break”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked Using Expedia.co.uk for a short break between the 14th and 19th September 04 Hotel was easy to get to from the Airport (via Airport bus and Metro) and the staff were friendly and welcoming. Checked into our room on the 2nd floor facing the road... good room but very noisy (I like me sleep!) asked to be moved and got a room on the 8th floor with nice views over the City - staff were very helpful and accomodating plus this room had free slippers! (well the other half was happy!) Nice little pool (not heated but warm in the sun) and terrance on the roof for the sun and to read a book and free internet access on the 9th floor (nice to get local information and print it out) - didn't use the resturant for breakfast, but went up the road for Churros and Chocolate (how nice is that) etc... cheap and just the ticket (why don't they sell churros and chocolate in the uk?). Hotel is right next to a well connected metro station and a good place to explore from, you can walk to lots of the city direct from the Hotel. The Hotel and Barcelona was a great little break from the grey and misery of England! Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Cute little inexpensive hotel, EXCELLENT location great for the price”
Reviews.Author: jules470
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine that I visited in Barcelona found and booked the Hotel Universal for me. It is only a couple of blocks away from Casa Batillo, and you can walk right to the Ramblas. It is in a VERY nice neighborhood, very odd for a budget hotel, far away from some of the seediness on the lower Ramblas. There is a huge and cheap internet cafe across the street, so beware the temptation of wasting your time in this great city sending email! (you can do that when you get home) This was in one of the nicer areas I spent time in Barcelona, VERY safe. I had lost my passport, and had to stay extra days over the weekend until I could get it replaced, and even though they were booked past the one night I planned to stay, the staff was very nice about finding me other accomodations. (With the help of my Catalan speaking friend) All the staff member's English is not %100, trust me Make a request that you do NOT have a room on the first floor....That was my original spot, and although clean enough, it was microscopic even by European standards, had no balcony, and was pretty depressing. During my day at the beach, without my knowledge, they switched me to a room upstairs (I found this out when I walked in and saw a staff member carrying all my clothes, suitcases & toiletries up the steps) The new room was GREAT! spotless room and bathroom, wonderful balcony that opened out to the front of the hotel, I loved it, and I was thrilled when they had a cancellation, and I didn't have to switch hotels It was pretty cheap too, this was Sept of 2003, so it's hard to remember, but I think a single was 50 euro a night. The only drawback is that you it's one of those deals where they buzz you in so I had to wake up the clerk from his slumber on a cot in the Lobby to let me in and give me the key to my room (you have to check your key at the lobby when you leave) But, he was REALLY sweet about it! Also, no company upstairs, particularly of the opposite sex, so if you meet that "special someone" you're gonna have to go to their place.... All in all, a great experience I would recommend it clean, cheap, not a better location to be had for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff ,very efficient and most concern especially after a theft!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just celebrated our 23rd.wedding anniversary in Barcelona. Our trip started quiet smoothly until we arrived at the Metro Paralel. A chap dropped his battery on purpose at the escalator causing a commotion and the other people were jammed behind one another, unable to get off.At this instant my husband lost his wallet,ID card,credit card and some foreign currencies, the chap was a professional "Pick-Pocket".The ladies at the reception were quick to react when they heard what happened and offered us help instantly. They were very helpful and spoke very good English. To our surprise, after our unplesant schock, they upgraded our room and offered us a very spacious room with a view. All our disappointment on our first trip to Spain vanished, we did enjoy our weekend in Barcelona. The people at the hotel made a "BIG" difference! I can recommend this hotel and shall definitely return! Just a word of warning travel light and be very cautious when travelling on the Metro.

Reviews.Title: “A little bobby dazzler....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We came here for a 4 day city break, and were very happy with the hotel. Location - pretty good, about 10 mins walk to La Rambla. Hotel - a bit of a big bland box from outside, but very modern, clean, and stylish inside. There's a very very small pool on the roof with areas to sunbathe in - very nice after a day on your feet. Free internet access on level 9. Staff - fine, no problems. Room - clean, modern, powerful and quiet A/C, lovely complimentary soaps, daily change of linen and general tidying. Breakfast - very good, extensive choice, with fruit, cereals, ham, cheese, bacon, sausages, omelette, juices, and chocolate cake! Coffee was pretty ropey, though. Would stay here again. Top tips for Barcelona - go see Gaudi's park, eat in the Placa Reial in the evening, & get a taxi to and from the airport (27 euro)

Reviews.Title: “Fab”
Reviews.Author: ThomasCroydon
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a 4 day (18 - 21 July 04) stay with my partner who was celebrating his birthday. The hotel was fantastic, we did have a bit of a wait when we arrived but was very pleased to see they had a locked room for our luggage and a very helpful concierge. The staff at the desk were very helpful and got out a map and showed us places to go to eat while we were waiting for our room. Once we got to the room I was pleasantly surprised on how big the room was, unfortunately we got the short straw and had a room with no view but it didn't spoil anything. The room was very clean, and well maintained. There was everything that you needed a mini bar, a free safe (very easy to use) little accessories in the bathroom. We went to the outdoor pool which is on the roof WHAT A VIEW!! The location is great with La Ramblas only about 10 minutes walk and the metro outside. It was can a bit confussing coming back from La Ramblas because you can end on roads that tourist shouldn't go. I had one small problem which was the Satellite TV which was all in Spainish (I speak no Spanish apart from Thank you). Overall had a fabulous time, I would recommend this is a great place to stay.
